Manager Response: We appreciate your response and are glad our location made your Disneyland trip an easy experience. We look forward to seeing you again.

Summary: I loved how the staff was so on top of everything. They even called me to see what time we’d be checking in, because it was getting late. Amazing location. We will stay again the next time we go to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for this great review! We appreciate you staying with us and glad you enjoyed your stay. We will pass along your comments to our staff and look forward to seeing you the next time you visit.

Summary: We stayed at the Desert Inn for 5 nights recently, it was our 4th stay here. As usual it was a pleasant experience.   We stayed in the back of the hotel, I like staying back here best because it seems much more peaceful than the front of the hotel.   The pool is indoors and small but we don't go to Disneyland to use the pools. When we want to be at a hotel a lot we stay on Disney property, we were in the park pretty much the whole time.  We had two adults and three kids in a standard room and had enough room, if we were going to be at the hotel more we would have rented one of the larger suites at the hotel. The rooms have a refrigerator, microwave, and space for food up above the microwave as well.   The only minor gripe was the housekeepers. We went back to our room a few
Manager Response: We appreciate your response and are glad you had a pleasant experience with us. We apologize for the confusion with housekeeping and will pass along your comments to the head housekeeper. We hope to see you again in the future.

Summary: We've stayed here 3 or 4 times now. Mostly stay here because of proximity to the parks (one of the closest good neighbor hotels).    Continental breakfast isn't anything too exciting. Hard boiled eggs a & oatmeal daily. Fresh fruit & toast.  Every other day they alternate between bagels and muffins/danishes.  We arrived (we drove) around noon and this trip we brought a computer and were surprised to find that they did not allow for checking bags at the front desk. They do have lockers ($1.50 each) that we were able to store the devices in, but had we flown with our suitcases we would have been stuck for a couple hours waiting for check-in as the suitcases would not have fit in the lockers.  Parking was difficult bc of all the furniture deliveries. That said we had one of the
Manager Response: We appreciate you staying us. In regards to your concern about large luggage and suitcases we do have a storage room available to hold those.We do apologize for the inconvenience with parking due to our deliveries as well as the issues with your bed. Thank you for your response, we will share you comments with our staff and hope you give us another chance in the future.

Summary: We always stay here. Its super close to the Parks and the kids enjoy the pool. While mommy and daddy relax after long hours of being on our feet. Thanks to the staff all our visits have been pleasant.
Manager Response: We appreciate you staying with us and are glad you enjoyed our pool. Thank you for your response and we hope to see you in the future.

Summary Heading: A wonder outing with my family
Summary: We all had fun. That was the kids first time to LA Disneyland. So the stay was great for them and they had fun running up and down the stairs playing. Then the pool topped it off on the fun meter. Then we have a wonderful time at Disneyland, so much to when we came back to the room they crashed out like nobody business.  Lol. Thank you for a great time.
Manager Response: Thank you for your response. We appreciate you staying with us and glad you and your family had such a great time. We hope to see you in the future.

Summary Heading: Perfect for families on a budget
Summary: There is nothing fancy about this hotel but it is an excellent value and you can't beat the walk to Disneyland. The staff was always friendly and helpful. My kids loved the pool and spend hours there. We loved that we could get a bigger than standard room for less than most standard rooms in the area. If we come back with our family again, we would stay here in a heartbeat.
Manager Response: We appreciate you staying with us and glad you enjoyed our pool and that our rooms were able to comfortably fit your family. We will pass along your comments to our staff and we do hope to see you in the future.

Summary: This hotel is literally right across the street from Disneyland. The price was unbelievable for the location. It was clean and the breakfast was decent. It was very loud when the fireworks went off at the parks but not surprising since it is so close. We will definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: We are glad you had a pleasant stay at our hotel and appreciate your response. We look forward to seeing you in the future.

Summary: We stay here a few times a year when we come to Disneyland. The location is right at the crosswalk that leads into the park, the Dennys is very close, and the rooms are comfortable. They have several room designs that would satisfy just about any size family, and the prices are very reasonable.
Manager Response: We appreciate your response and your loyalty with coming back to stay with us. We are glad you find our rooms comfortable and look forward to seeing you again in the future.

Summary: I enjoy my stay I like my room it was nice The staff was helpful. They clean my room well. I enjoy the breakfast. I would come back to this hotel and also recommend it to my family and friends My family also enjoy their stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for recommending us to your friends and family. We are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay and we will pass along your comments to our staff. We hope to see you in the future.

Summary: I had a wonderful time again this year. I liked the updated furniture and overall feel of the room. I love being in the heart of the Anaheim Resort area, as it is close to my friends, family and all the things that I want to do. The valets were quick and I never waited more than a couple of minutes for my vehicle. I can't wait to come back again.
Manager Response: We appreciate your comments and are happy to hear you enjoyed our updated furniture and our central location. We will pass along your comments to the valets and we look forward to seeing you in the future,

Summary: All this hotel has going for it, is it’s location. Rooms are run down, old. Beds were very uncomfortable, you could visually see the indents in the mattress where past people have slept. Pool was discussing.
Manager Response: We appreciate your feedback and apologize for the bad experience you had at our hotel. We will share your comments with our staff and hope you give us another chance in the future.

Summary: very convenient and safe especially if you explore the Disneyland and California adventure, perfect for family and friends, cheaper than other hotel . staff are very helpful. a lot of restaurant nearby. rooms are affordable ,
Manager Response: We appreciate your comments and glad you enjoyed your stay with us. We are happy to hear you had a pleasant Disneyland vacation and we will share your comments with our staff. We hope to see you again in the future.

Summary Heading: Overpriced for a low class hotel
Summary: Too expensive ($200+/night) for something you can see at a Holiday Inn or a truck stop hotel. Nothing special. Old linens, no amenities, continental breakfast was a couple muffins, fruit and coffee. I would never choose to stay here again. They need to do a complete remodel. Also the beds were very uncomfortable, basically a foam board. And I didn't care to walk barefoot in my own room due to the old, overused carpet.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, thank you for your valuable feedback. We apologize that our hotel did not meet your expectations and we will share your comments with our staff in attempt to improve our facilities and services. We hope you give us another chance in the future.

Summary: Hotel is right across the street from Disney's entrance.  Staff is friendly.  Rooms are clean - but bed mattresses are horrific.  If you need something even mildly comfortable to sleep on, this isn't for you.  Continental breakfast is good.  Outdoor pool would be nice.
Manager Response: Thank you for response. We are glad you enjoyed our friendly staff and will pass along your comments to them. We apologize that our bed quality was not up to your standards and will pass along your comments to housekeeping.  We hope to see you again in the future.

Summary: 3 sets of our family were all able to stay there.So convenient right across from Disneyland .Will stay there again.Very clean quiet.Denneys coffee shop right next door.Had scooter rentals if you needed them.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We appreciate your comments and are happy to hear you and your family had a great stay. We look forward to seeing you the next time you visit!

Summary: This hotel is a great location—right across the street from Disneyland entrance.  The rooms are cleaned every day very well and are comfortable too.   A big thank you and shout out to the front desk personnel: Tyler and Dana! We felt tired and a bit frazzled when we were checking in and they helped out SO much and took care of everything!  We will definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review! We are happy to hear you had an amazing stay and glad are front desk staff were able to assist you. We look forward to seeing you again in the future!

Summary: This was my 2nd time staying here and was great. Location was excellent and hubby and kids (teens) had a ball in the pool and spa. Housekeeping was excellent as was the free breakfast. Bonus was once again being next to Denny’s! Would recommend this hotel to everyone
Manager Response: Thank you for your response. We are happy to hear your family had a great stay and was able to enjoy our free breakfast, pool, and spa. We appreciate your recommendation and hope to see you again in the future!

Summary: We stayed in an executive family suite which is really just two rooms with an adjoining interior door.  It’s pretty basic.  The location is fabulous - just a 10 minute walk to the Park gate.  Much easier than riding the team from the parking structure!!  The hotel is noisy- we were on the second floor and could hear the people in the room above us.  And because of the motel type set up- you hear people outside coming and going from their rooms.   The breakfast is very basic- but included, so it is one less meal to pay for in the park.   The best part is location- the rest is very basic.  But if you are going to D-land, you will hardly be in your room.
Manager Response: We appreciate your response and glad you enjoyed our proximity to Disneyland. We apologize your stay did not live up to your expectations but will share your comments with our staff and hope you give us another chance in the future.

Summary: This hotel is right across the street from Disneyland's entrance. We got a corner room so it was quite spacious.   We didn't have any problems with noise but we always bring our sound machine when we stay at hotels. Overall, we would consider this hotel again next time we go to Disneyland. Great location and great price.
Manager Response: Thank you for your response. We are happy to hear you enjoyed our hotel and had a pleasant stay. We look forward to seeing you again in the future.

Summary: This place is great because not only is it affordable but it is so close to Disney! Friendly staff and love the top deck to watch fireworks. Clean and will be staying here again. We stayed in a con joining room and it was perfect for my family.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is literally across the street from Disneyland’s main entrance. Rooms are descent and clean. We’ve stayed there in a double connecting room and in a standard room. Both were great. Refrigerator and microwave in each room is nice. We stayed on bottom floor near elevator which can be loud due to conversations and the bell of the elevator...otherwise ok. You can watch the fireworks from the 5th floor which was fabulous!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is amazing in terms of proximity to the entrance to Disneyland. Just an intersection away from the entrance. The rooms are clean and quite spacious compared to other rooms I've seen. The continental breakfast is nothing to go crazy about, but it does give you something to eat (bagels with jam and cream cheese, cereal, hard boiled eggs, and fruit. Very lacking in protein). The noise from families getting up in the early morning seemed to echo and amplify down the hallway. It sounded as if we had a handful of yelling children and stomping feet right outside our door the whole time. And if your room is anywhere near the noisy ice machine, you'll be woken up often. But I would visit this hotel again. And the pool and hottub are very very nice (and also inside).
Manager Response: none

Summary: The indoor pool and jacuzzi are the best. They have a rooftop deck to watch the fireworks from. Their beds are comfortable and clean. I left my car there the whole time and walk to Disney it's right across the street very convenient.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I had an issue with a smell in the room I was assigned due to the new furniture upgrade. I informed the front desk and they were very apologetic about the issue. They upgraded my room at no additional charge. They were very nice and friendly about the situation. The staff is one of the many reasons I return to this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We really enjoy staying at the desert inn. The kids love the indoor pool. My feet love how close it is located to Disneyland. I have stayed at the hotel many times and only had great experience with the staff.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is my favorite of all of the nearby Disneyland hotels! The staff are friendly and courteous. They truly care about their guests. It is nice to have the continental breakfast available as some of the others offer a “bagged” breakfast that consists of an apple, cheese stick and a donut or bagel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nice place to stay when going to Disneyland. Right across the street from the Park & 24 hour restaurants on either side of the hotel. The towels were a bit scratchy and the pillows need replacing but overall, a good hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Each experience we have had good results. We really love the location, but staff is friendly and willing to assist me in scheduling my next trip out to the area. We continue to enjoy out stay's and recommend our family and friends.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is always the first place we check when going to Disneyland because it's proximity to the parks can't be beat. At check in, I was able to upgrade our room to a larger suite (c2) for a little extra and it was VERY worth it with our 4 kids. 2 full bathrooms, 4 queen  beds and a pull out bed were enough for everyone to have space. Breakfast is simple, muffins or bagels, danishes, fruit, and hard boiled eggs, cereal, juice, milk, coffee. We had some REALLY noisy upstairs neighbors, so after 3 nights of them sounding like hippos on pogo sticks, we asked if there was anything they could move us to. We were super lucky they had something available and we were able to move. No noise problems after that. Great view of the fireworks. We will be returning. This is our favorite place
Manager Response: Hi Annonnowhere,  It was awesome having you stay with us, apologize for the noise issue but glad that you enjoyed your stay overall. We'll see you next time.  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Rooms were clean and the two bedroom suite was perfect for our party of 5. The price was very fair. I think the staff did a great job. Aside from the WiFi being intermittent and weak the coffee in the breakfast room was bad. Way too WEAK! If the coffee was good it would have made the breakfast darn good for a continental offering.
Manager Response: Hi lchirschi,  I appreciate your feedback, thank you for staying with us and we'll look into the area of concern mentioned.  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: This place is in a great location if you are staying for several night at Disneyland. When we need to take a rest or nap, we can walk right across the street. Rooms are clean and enough space for a family of 4 or 5. Would stay here again.
Manager Response: jl5hernandez,  A nap definitely helps when you are at the parks for daylong adventures and being just a cross the street, is definitely a plus. We appreciate your review and will be an honor to have you stay with us again soon!  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We like to stay here because of the location and the price.  It's a basic breakfast but it gives you the necessary things to go on with your day.  The pool is indoor so you can go swimming throughout the year.  I always check if this hotel is available first before looking anywhere else!
Manager Response: Hi Lyndsey S,  Thank you very much for making us your first choice when booking for the Disneyland Resort, we thank you for your continued visits and look forward to many more visits in the future.  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We enjoy staying here because of the location. The main issues we have are the mattresses and the interior needs some updating. Signs set out for quiet time around 11 pm would be awesome too....it’s extremely noisy at all hours of the night. I’m not picky, I just think setting quiet hours would help a little with the noise. We usually stay for long periods of time.
Manager Response: Hello parriscd,  I appreciate you staying with us and sharing some very valuable feedback. We are currently in the process of replacing all in-room furniture and should be done in a couple more days, in regards to noise, we do have staff 24/7 that can assist in bringing noise levels down, I also do appreciate your suggestion and will bring this up on our next meeting.  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Valet person was wonderful. Loved the 1st night in the suite but wasn't thrilled about the knowledge of the person I talked to about the shower chair, so not helpful. Had a wonderful breakfast. Loved the location.
Manager Response: Hello dpablo142,  It was a pleasure having you and your family stay with us once again, I apologize for any misunderstandings you might have come across while a guest at our hotel, thank you for being a loyal guest.  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Our bathroom had very little water pressure in our shower and sink. We also had to have someone fix our toilet when we got in our room. The service is great. The breakfast is mediocre. The location is unbeatable for the price. All staff were friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: Hi KamBrown,  I appreciate you staying and letting me know about your concerns while you stayed with us. Our staff were able to take immediate action and fix the water issue reported. Our complimentary continental breakfast provides a quick fix for an early entry to the parks. Thank you for staying with us and we hope to see you again soon.  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We were 7 adults and 3 small children in the largest suite.  The area was a little smaller than the photo of the floor plan leads one to believe; but it still was adequate and was so great to be so close to Disneyland!  Breakfast was mediocre at best--cheap, unhealthy choices.  Next time we will bring more of our own breakfast foods to eat in the room.   Just like realtors say are the three most important features of a property--Location Location Location--this hotel has all three!  :)
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great hotel! Will return for future visits! Absolutely love the services! Staff was very friendly! Rooms were very clean! Parking was very convenient for our trip! Love that we were able to walk to Disneyland
Manager Response: Thank you for your awesome review and for staying with us, see you real soon!!  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: good will stay there again next time we go to Disney they need to move the ice machine or pad it so it isnt so loud next to the rooms. rooms were big and spaces and close to Disneyland and very clean cant wait to go again
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have been coming here to this hotel since the mid 90s and it still remains to be my favorite place to stay anytime I travel to Disneyland. The staff is outstanding and anytime there is an issue it is taken care of quickly. Marissa always greets me with a smile and a welcome back.  I greatly appreciate the friendly staff, including Tio. Looking forward to my next visit!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Can't beat the price or location. A few things drag it down a bit. Thin walls make for noisy neighbours and lumpy beds make for a poor nights sleep after a long day at Disneyland. Staff is helpful, nice.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A week at Disneyland end of Feb 2018
Summary: The location of this hotel is great!  you simply can not get much closer to the gates of Disneyland/DCA.  this is not a high end hotel, but that was no surprise considering it's value pricing.  The beds were very comfortable, Wi-Fi was pretty good, TV's were new.  I would have liked it more if the breakfast was a bit more substantial and longer lasting. but it was okay if you like things like toast, cereal, and danishes.  Also I wish they had fresh brewed coffee in the lobby.  I would consider staying there again
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Reservation was cancelled due to ineptitude
Summary: I arrived with my entire family to check in and to my surprise my reservation had been cancelled. The excuse I was given was that they could not confirm payment two days prior (my credit card had been changed by my bank). I was told the travel agency, AAA, had not provided them with my phone number or email. Funny how they wouldn’t have that information but they would have my credit card.   I called AAA and they told me the hotel should’ve at least had my email address.   Hotel management said they tried to call AAA and the 1-800 number they had was no good. I find it hard to believe they couldn’t find it by doing a simple online search.   Management simply didn’t care to try to appropriately reach out to me as a large conference was taking place at the same time so they could
Manager Response: I apologize for the inconvenience, however we did try to reach out to you on the two days prior to your stay, we were unable to keep your reservation due to your credit card declining for the first nights' amount. We recommend that reservations are made directly through the property to minimize any issues. Thank you for your feedback.  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: I have stayed here a number of times and always enjoy myself. The hotel is across the street from the park and plenty of places to eat. The only issue I have is that they do not provide the courtesy of holding your bags for you. They have a small room with some lockers you need to put quarters in.
Manager Response: Hi tracyfish20,  It is always a pleasure having you stay with us, due to our limited storage space, we do provide coin operated lockers for our guests if the rooms are not ready as a convenience and we do store bigger pieces in a storage area free of charge, thank you for your feedback and see you soon.  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Convenient location but be prepared for lots of noise early each morning.
Summary: The location is great for anyone planning a trip to Disneyland. The hotel is conveniently located within easy walking distance even after a long day at the park. The value is also pretty good for what you get. My only complaint is in the noise level at early hours. With all the families trying to leave early to beat the crowds headed to the parks there is extreme levels of noise in the hallways that easily filter into the rooms. You can easily tell which children are excited and running too far ahead of their parents by all the shouts in the hallways in the mornings. But as long as you too plan to get up early and join in the festivities it is all worth getting t for the outstanding location and good value for the money.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family stayed here for 6 nights while on a Disney vacation. The hotel is directly across the street from the main entrance from Disneyland and California Adventure. If location within a reasonable price is what you are looking for, this is the place to stay. The hotel is clean, and appealing. The rooms are large and clean as well. The beds are comfortable and the bathrooms are clean. Yes it is true the breakfast isnt the best, but for the price savings you can use some of the savings and head over to Denny's or Ihop. The staff was friendly  upon  check in and during the entire stay. This may be our Disney hotel choice for my family when we return again soon.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Pictures of rooms on internet do not represent actual thing. Run down, out of date and n need of repair. Swimming pool was indoor, small, and also needed cleaning. Continental breakfast was poor, little selection and same thing every day. Despite what I’ve said about the rooms I have to say they were kept clean.  Location only good thing, straight across street from gates of Disneyland and two doors away from IHOP, and Tony Roma’s.  Would certainly pay more for better quality next time.
Manager Response: Hello,  I apologize for your experience, please know that furniture has been updated in most of our rooms, we would appreciate you giving us another opportunity to host your next visit to the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We would definitely stay here again due to the price and proximity to Disneyland and California Adventure.  The rooms aren't anything special, but are fine for a place to sleep.  The hotel is old, but the rooms were clean and the maid service was exceptional.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed right across the street from Disneyland, so there were no worries about parking or traffic. We just got up and walked across the street! Talk about easy...  Valet parking was available, so we never had an issue related to our vehicle. The free breakfast was not attractive at all, so we went to a local restaurant each morning for breakfast instead. However, by eating only two meals a day, we saved money anyway. The hair dryer in the room was broken, but someone came to fix it immediately, so kudos to the hotel for having a quick response time! We loved having a hotel so close where we could simply walk across the street and take a nap in the middle of the afternoon when we were hot and tired! The front desk was very helpful in answering our questions and helping us with
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: You can't get any closer to Disneyland!
Summary: Just got home from a week at Disneyland with my daughter-in-law and 2 grand kids and I am so glad we chose to stay at the Desert Inn and Suites. The crosswalk is very close to the hotel and Disneyland is right across the street. We loved not having to unpack the stroller and fold it up to get into a tram or shuttle, especially at night when the kids had fallen asleep in the stroller. There is a Denny's to one side and an IHOP on the other side in case you miss the included breakfast or decide to eat somewhere besides the park during the day. The hotel itself is definitely no frills, but the beds were comfortable, the room was clean, the breakfast was satisfying, and the mini fridge and microwave in the room were very convenient.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Just got off the phone with hotel after seeing I was charged a one night no-show fee. I called direct and canceled, and was told a cancellation number would be emailed to me. It never came. They will not refund me my money without a cancellation number!! How I am suppose to give them a number if it was never sent! Obviously there was a mistake on their end, and they are unwilling to right it! Thanks for stealing my hard earned money!!
Manager Response: Hi gouchie321,  We have a very step specific cancellation process to avoid any type of misunderstandings and in your case it does seem that the reservation was never cancelled. We do apologize, however our policies are fully enforced.  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Great place to stay if you have little ones or people with disabilities as it's across the street from Disneyland in case anyone in your party needs a break.  Large suites accommodates big families and again for people with disabilities, so that staff can supervise more easily.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your awesome review and we hope to see you again soon!  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: The breakfast was ok, oranges were excellent!  Beds were ok, the room was big enough for 4.  We noticed no noise that disturbed us. Bathroom had slight mold smell, but appeared very clean.  The maid service was excellent, especially considering we are pretty sloppy people.  The parking was easy, and the pool was nice, but on the small side.  The 5 min walk to the park gates was AMAZING at the end of a long day.  I will be returning again soon and feel comfortable with the decision to stay there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Love to stay here,we have stayed here many times. The staff are very friendly, great location across the street from Disneyland. Very convenient to go back and forth to the park I would recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was our first stay since they remodeled the breakfast room. It was very clean and week stocked. This is an improvement over the little store that used to be there. Breakfast was good but I would like to see them add a waffle maker like the ones in alot of other hotels with this type of breakfast. Liked that they added hard boiled eggs too. Rooms were nice and spacious with mini fridges and coffee makers. Plenty of room to put your belongings too. We had 2 queens and a sofa bed with a round kitchen table and two chairs. A table in front of the sofa would have been nice. We did not use the pool as we were in Disneyland most of the day. Would stay again for sure
Manager Response: Hi travelerAZ2,  I'm glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay and that you were able to take advantage of our continental breakfast. See you on your next trip to the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Had been going to this hotel over 15 years and always go back. Located across the street from the Disneyland Resort and in walking distance from the parks and dining outside as well. They have valet parking and will help you any way possible. They also have a nice indoor pool to come back to during the day when it gets crowded in the parks.
Manager Response: Hi Anthony O,  It is always a pleasure to have you stay with us, thank you very much for your continued patronage and see you next time.  Teo Huerta Anaheim desert Inn

Summary: Loved the rooms... great customer service will go back  soon will recommend it to anyone nice and  clean great food ...my daughter loved the pool and jacuzzi great Parking really close to Disneyland love everything
Manager Response: Fannyluu,  We appreciate your awesome review, see you real soon.  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: This is a good hotel right opposite the entry into Disneyland.  The rooms are well maintained and quiet and the staff are pleasant. But if you need wifi it didn't work in our room. We had time to outside and stand in Carpark which is a bit inconvenient. Sometimes even in Carpark it didn't work.
Manager Response: Hi rabcat4u,  We appreciate you staying with us and I apologize about our internet issues, this has been fixed and is up and running through out the whole property. Thank you for your feedback.  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: I was very nervous about staying here due to an issue with Communication before we left home, but they fixed the problem and helped us out. This hotel is fantastic it is everything you need when spending time at Disneyland, easy access (being walking distance) for us to rest in the middle of the day from Disneyland with our children. Breakfast was all we needed in the morning and enough to get us through till lunchtime. The under cover pool which I thought was going to be a problem actually turned out to be a great relief from the hot afternoon sun. Would I stay again absolutely the rooms were big enough for our family of 5 we all had a little bit of rest in the afternoon which meant we could hit the fireworks at Disney at night time
Manager Response: Hi abbeymay0,  Thank you very much for your awesome review and for staying with us, we will be honored to have you stay with us on your next trip to Anaheim.  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: This hotel is across the street from Disney and is in a perfect location - stay here, pay to park, and then just walk across the street to disney (you can even come back to the hotel for a nap if you are tired from all the walking).  We arrived early in the morning and paid to park, and did a "pre-check in", and then went across to Disney for the day.  We came back mid afternoon and got our room key and had a nap (we had flown across the pacific and arrived that morning so were tired and had jetlag).  There is a free breakfast, although we went next door to Denny's. They sent up another unit the same night that worked excellent for the remainder of our stay. The housekeeping was great and even did nice towel folds. The parking is a bit of an issue. I managed to self park on the second night and got a new ding in my door. I really can't blame the hotel for this. Disneyland will attract children and SUV's with big doors. I had valet handle the parking after that and had no more issues. You pay for the parking and valet was no extra

Manager Response: Dear Oneil12,  Thank you for your review, we apologize that we fell short of your expectations on your recent visit, reviews like yours help us improve our training to ensure our guests have a great visit.

Summary: The staff was VERY friendly and helpful. I am glad that we were able to park our car there all day before we actually got the keys to our room. Definitely helps parkgoers when it comes to convienence and price!
Manager Response: Dear kristenuzeey,  Thank you for your review! We are glad you enjoyed your stay with us, we look forward to hosting your next stay with us!

Summary: So my only issue was that the hotel was under construction and no one let me know when I was making my reservation. Also, my reservation was LOST 3 days prior to my arrival. Very stressful. I had issues with my account after our trip as well. The woman who checked me in and took my payment said that everything was pulled out of my account and after arriving back home my account was overdrawn?!!! So upsetting. We did however enjoy the hotel very much as far as location, very nice employees and the rooms were awesome.
Manager Response: Dear alexandral342017,  Thank you for your review, we apologize that we fell short of your expectations on your recent visit, we will work hard to ensure these issues are taken care of quickly.

Summary: The room was ok.  The two queen beds were comfortable.  One of the reasons we got the parlor room was for the extra bed (the sofa bed).  The sofa bed however was borderline unusable as a bed and needs to be replaced.  We had brought with us an air mattress that we ended up using on top of the sofa bed mattress.  I would not have paid extra for the parlor room if I knew we were going to have to use our own mattress anyway.  That is my only complaint.  Otherwise it was a good stay and I would probably recommend this hotel to others.
Manager Response: Dear alosee,  Thank you for your review, we are glad you enjoyed your stay with us! We look forward to hosting your next trip to Disneyland!

Summary: Was a great place to stay. I always try to stay here when we go on vacation. Room was very spacious and clean. Love how it's walking distance from Disney entrance. I would highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear julierap,  Thank you for your review! We are glad to hear that we exceeded your expectations on your recent stay and look forward to hosting your next Disneyland trip!

Summary: You cannot get closer to Disneyland.  For large groups, this property can't be beat.  Large rooms and great prices.  Roof top viewing is great for fireworks watching.  IF you are traveling w/ large groups, you can't get a better deal.
Manager Response: Dear paiabay,  Thank you for your review! We are glad to hear that we exceeded your expectations on your recent stay and look forward to hosting your next Disneyland trip!

Summary: Location, location, location. IF you're going to Disney. This hotel is all about your Disney trip and if you are ok with a no frills, non flashy hotel experience. Great prices and you are literally directly across the street from the main gates to both parks. For the price and locale you really can't beat it. Closer then the Disneyland Hotel! The only thing the resort hotels have on this are nicer grounds and bigger, more appealing pools. Maybe you need that if traveling abroad or out of state for 3x the price per night. Not me. We had a nice big room where you could see the fireworks, but best of all you could come and go from this place bc it is that close! Don't have to bring a big overstuffed back pack to carry around all day. Pack light and come back to your room to get
Manager Response: Dear Jason D,   Thank you for your review! We are glad you enjoyed your stay with us and we look forward to hosting your next visit to Disneyland!

Summary: the hotel is close to Disney land, it made so easy to walk there. the free continental breakfast was a very easy way to get a quick bite before going to the park. the room was very spacious. the parking was very easy no hassle.
Manager Response: Dear nelnkt,  Thank you for your review! We are glad we exceeded your expectations, many of our guests love our continental breakfast and we are glad you did too! We look forward to hosting your next visit to Disneyland!

Summary: For the price of rooms and location across the street  From main entrance to California adventure park and Disneyland  Property can not be beat staff is helpfully and friendly the rooms clean ,parking a breeze can even see fireworks from rooftop balcony  Available to all guests
Manager Response: Dear rramage74,  Thank you for your review! we are so glad you enjoyed your recent stay with us, we look forward to hosting your next visit to Disneyland!

Summary: This hotel is no frills, clean, cheaper, and very conveniently located. Very happy with our stay and plan on staying there again next time. This hotel is literally just across the street from the Disney resort entrance.
Manager Response: Dear alikae86754,  Thank you for your review! we are so glad you enjoyed your recent stay with us, we look forward to hosting your next visit to Disneyland!

Summary: We had a nice stay.  The room worked well for us and the location to Disneyland was great.  The walk back to the hotel after a long day in the park was perfect.  Also good access to some breakfast and Ice cream in the evening.
Manager Response: Dear caseyw738,  Thank you for your review! we are so glad you enjoyed your recent stay with us, we look forward to hosting your next visit to Disneyland!

Summary Heading: Best place to stay and walk to Disneyland
Summary: Great room. Great people working at the front desk and parking. We have been staying at this hotel every 2 years for our trip to Disneyland for about 10 years now. They have recently been doing many upgrades to the rooms. The room we had was in new condition.
Manager Response: Dear CrokeG,  Thank you for your review! we are so glad you enjoyed your recent stay with us, We are constantly updating and upgrading rooms as quickly as possible! We look forward to hosting your next visit to Disneyland!

Summary Heading: Fantastic place to stay when in Disney
Summary: Location Location Location, and Clean Clean Clean.  Right across from main entrance which is so convenient to go in and out of park.  It was very clean and everyone the staff was very helpful.  For the money we felt it was well worth it.  Some of the furniture was older but it was all clean and usuable.  The parking is pretty tough and you are charged but it seems like they all are doing that now.
Manager Response: Dear j49ero,  Thank you for your review! we are so glad you enjoyed your recent stay with us, Parking in Anaheim is extremely tight! we look forward to hosting your next visit to Disneyland!

Summary: I stay here a couple times a year. It's clean and right across the street from Disney. Great for taking breaks. Restaurants next store that are cheaper than in park. Good for groups.  I'm an annual pass holder so it works well for us.
Manager Response: Dear bbrownnascar,  Thank you for your review! we are so glad you enjoyed your recent stay with us, we look forward to hosting your next visit to Disneyland!

Summary: very nice place. No problems at all, would stay there again. Rooms where very clean. The people that work there was very nice and helpful. The only thing I didn't care for was that the cost to dry clothes was to expensive.  Love that it was walking distant to Disneyland
Manager Response: Dear fea4,  Thank you for your review! we are so glad you enjoyed your recent stay with us, we look forward to hosting your next visit to Disneyland!

Summary: We knew going in that the main plus of this hotel is its location.  It is a 5 - 7 minute walk to the main entrance of Disneyland, which is hard to beat.  That is likely the reason for the high price--at least we considered it high relative to the quality of the rooms.   We stayed in the suite that contains a separate living space, whose sofa folds out into a bed.  We didn't need to use it, as we the two queens were enough for everyone.  We expected things to be average, and they were.  Housekeeping was mostly on top of things, but we noticed they never replenished the cups(plastic or styrofoam) even after they were all out.   Our main complaint, and what kept this from being four star, is that there was a minor gnat problem.  We noticed it immediately upon checking in.  It
Manager Response: Dear STEPHEN N,  Thank you for your review! Fruit flies and knats are a county wide issue at this time due to heavy rains in southern California. We have taken all measures possible to combat them. We look forward to hosting your next visit to Disneyland!

Summary: Steve was an absolute delight to speak to. He was very interactive when speaking to him. I enjoyed speaking with him so much he will be my to go person.  The location was perfect all we had to do was walk from our room to Disney.
Manager Response: Dear d3perez77,  Thank you for your review! we are so glad you enjoyed your recent stay with us, Steve just joined the team recently in January 2017 and we are glad to have his Disney expertise! We look forward to hosting your next visit to Disneyland!

Summary: Great location for Disneyland. Quiet rooms but the beds are seriously soft and could use an update. Nothing fancy about the room but it was clean and quiet. It was nice to have a refrigerator in the room.
Manager Response: Dear katana2017,  Thank you for your review! we are so glad you enjoyed your recent stay with us, we look forward to hosting your next visit to Disneyland!

Summary: Great place to stay. The breakfast is a continental style. I wish it was more of a full breakfast. The hotel is within walking distance from the happiest place on earth Disneyland! :) I would like to see a hook or shelf placed in the bathroom so that one could place ones clothes, instead of using the toilet seat cover. Also, the soaps that are provided need to be changed. They are very harsh on the skin.
Manager Response: Dear Doris A,  Thank you for your review! we are so glad you enjoyed your recent stay with us, we look forward to hosting your next visit to Disneyland!

Summary: I really loved staying here, so near from Disneyland,  such a great kind and quick service! our room was so full of space, so clean, everything was on place,  the Valet  parking were so nice and quick!!  Great job from the staff each day!!!
Manager Response: Dear adirosas,  Thank you for your review! we are so glad you enjoyed your recent stay with us, we look forward to hosting your next visit to Disneyland!

Summary: The location of this property was great, located across the street from Disneyland. The breakfast included was not the greatest, there was pastry, cereal, toast, apples, juice and coffee... I have had better selection elsewhere. Room was clean and decent size.
Manager Response: Dear jamiea96822,  Thank you for your review! we are so glad you enjoyed your recent stay with us, our continental breakfast is meant for a quick grab and go approach, full american breakfasts are available at denny's next door. We look forward to hosting your next visit to Disneyland!

Summary: Thank you so much! We had such a wonderful time and our family was so pleased that we could all be in one suite together. It made traveling back and forth effortless. Well done! Clean suite. Regular housekeeping services. Delicious continental breakfast.
Manager Response: Dear hostetlerpatricia,  Thank you for your review! we are so glad you enjoyed your recent stay with us, we look forward to hosting your next visit to Disneyland!

Summary: We love this hotel! Although it's becoming aged....for the price and location, we will continue to patronize it! The entire staff is very professional and friendly. The morning continental breakfast is a definite plus and very helpful when you are in a hurry to get into Disneyland early!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good Value and Close to Disneyland!
Summary: I've stayed at a few other hotels across the street from Disneyland and this one is great! Very close, clean and I found the bed extremely comfortable. The breakfast was what you expect from a continental breakfast.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Dirty.  Damp. Smelly. Old.  Not worth the money & they over charged us. 1-800 number said they'd give us a room with seperate bedroom (i asked twice), got there and said "we dont have that type of room". Was so disappointed.  Had to get 2 rooms & they over charged us. It was run down & dirty.
Manager Response: Dear Tarahenry,  We apologize that our hotel did not exceed your expectations during your recent stay. We have looked through our recent records and do not see the issues you are explaining in your review. Please contact us so we can get additional details of your stay at 714-772-5050. Thank you

Summary Heading: This place is very close to main gate after a long day at Disneyland
Summary: The rooms here are nice, and I appreciate the close proximity to main gate Disneyland.  After a long day at Disneyland, it's great to know that you walk across the street from main gate and you are at the hotel. No need to jump on a tram, get to your designated parking lot, and get to your car.   Overnight parking and resort fees are much more reasonable than other hotels in the area. When you are booking a hotel near Disneyland always pay attention to what resort fees and parking fees a hotel is charging because there are some big differences.
Manager Response: Dear msalemme,  Thank you for your review! We appreciate your kind words and look forward to hosting your next visit to Disneyland!

Summary: We came with another family and we all agreed that while the location is great, the rooms are marginal, the beds are very uncomfortable, and the "included breakfast" was not much to brag about.  When we checked in, I ask if the included breakfast was both cold and hot, and the gal said yes.  We also agreed that the toast was the only qualifying "hot" item.  We we also missing some blankets and after call the front desk four times, and with no answer, I walked all the way back to request the blankets. Also, if you're parking your car here, you'll need to add another $12+ per night.
Manager Response: Dear Debbi M,  Thank you for your review! Our daily Continental breakfast consists of Muffins, Danish, Apples, Oranges, Cereals, Toast, Bagels, Hot Oatmeal, Coffee, Juice and Milk. The breakfast is continental not american, this means that NO HOT ITEMS  are served. We will conduct additional training to ensure this doesn't occur again.

Summary: I have now stayed at this property several times now. I love the location as it's right across the street from Disneyland. It seems there service is getting better every time I stay.  One of my complaints before was they would not give you a room before 3pm even if one was clean and ready?  I would think it would make it easier on the staff if they were consistent in trying to do that. This time that almost happened again but Steve Mccormick stepped in and my room was made available. I know Steve from when he worked at Carousel and love that they brought him aboard! He is a great asset to them.  The staff was also friendly. However,the rooms need to be updated as the beds are not the best and the pillows not great either. I also noticed just a blanket on the beds and not a nice
Manager Response: Dear Candi374,  Thank you for your review! We are glad to hear that our staff exceeded your expectations on your recent visit and we look forward to hosting your next trip to Disneyland!

Summary Heading: Handy location but better choices a few steps further
Summary: I phoned the hotel directly to make sure we booked the right type of rooms to meet our needs. Booked 2 rooms and 1 suite for a week online to capture the best rate, upon checkin we received 2 rooms and another 2 rooms with an adjoining door, not what we booked. Front desk apologized for their error but said they couldn't do anything about it.  The hotel location is good but very noisy, parking is extremely congested, breakfast is so-so and the hot tub was very dirty! But those were not the worst issues////////  On day four we returned to our rooms from Disneyland at 3:30pm to take a breather and not one of the 4 rooms were cleaned. When we left at 4:30pm I phoned the front desk and they assured me the rooms would be taken care of. When we returned at 9:00pm 2 of the rooms were
Manager Response: Dear rafilko,  Thank you for your review, Our management team was in contact with you regarding the above issues during your recent stay, you were compensated. All items that you did bring to hotel management were addressed in a timely manner.

Summary: We booked this place via their website because it's got the best price that includes breakfast and one of the closer hotels to Disneyland/DCA. We didn't experience any service issues from booking to checking in and out.  We arrived late at night, and one of the two concierge greeted us with a smile. He was quite friendly and helpful. He checked us in, gave us our keys, pointed us to our rooms, and told us where and what time breakfast is going to be, and what's on the menu, and away we go.  The room (127) is pretty clean and includes two queen beds with two pillows each and two extra pillows stored away, an alarm clock, a 32" flat screen, a small table with two chairs, a medium sized fridge and a small microwave, a coffee maker, a small safe, a hairdryer, an iron and ironing
Manager Response: Dear Xbox_Dad,  Thank you for your review, we apologize we did not meet your expectations during your recent visit and are working hard to fix the issues your experienced.

Summary: Good place to stay close to Disneyland!  The parking is bad , but at least they have valet also. Check in is simple.  Close to Denny's Restaurent when tired of park food.... and they give you coupons upon check in.
Manager Response: Dear clk505,  Thank you for your review! Spring break time does place a strain on all of Anaheim's infrastructure, especially parking. We apologize that we fell short of your expectations and hope you will give us a second chance on your next visit to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Great location but with a price-noise
Summary: This is our third stay at The Anaheim Desert Inn and Suites.   The pluses:  1. Great location for a short walk to Disneyland.  It's even closer than the resort properties of the Disneyland Hotel and Paradise Pier to the front gates of Disneyland and California Adventure.  2. Staff are very helpful and efficient.  3. Parking attendants are helpful.  4. Continental breakfast is provided to start the day.  5. Clean but dated rooms. The minuses:  1. Noise level is a bit high especially when kids are running down the walkway and people are walking/jumping on the floor above.  2. Challenging to park your own car ($11/day), during busy times, the valet must be used.  3. Paid $199/night for a parlor suite (bedroom/bath/small extra room with a sofa sleeper/tv/coffee table.  4. inside
Manager Response: Dear Joanne O,  Thank you for your review! We are glad that our staff provided great guest service and you enjoyed our continental breakfast. In regards to not offering a AAA rate, Our lowest rates are always on our website, not 3rd party sites like booking or expedia

Summary: Can't get any closer to the Disney Parks! Gave us the ability to take a break without feeling like taking too much out of the day. Continental breakfast was not very good but at least the coffee and apples got us started on our day. Beds were comfortable.
Manager Response: Dear Marylizb1,  Thank you for your review! We are glad you enjoyed our property and apologize that our FREE Continental Breakfast did not meet your needs. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: The Desert Inn and Suites is very close to Disneyland. We walked to the park and came back for an afternoon nap, then returned for the parade and fireworks. The room are clean and not a lot of noise. If you have a suite and more than one vehicle to park be sure to let them know prior to your arrival. Parking is $11.00 per day.
Manager Response: Dear 302bert32,  Thank you for your review! We are glad you enjoyed your stay with us! Suites B1, B2, C1, and C2 are allowed 2 vehicles at $11 each per day plus tax. All other room types are only allowed one vehicle at $11 plus tax per day. Hope this helps.

Summary: The room is always clean when we stay there. The beds are comfortable and amenities are great. The shower heads are pretty low for taller guests. Maids are friendly. Could use more disabled parking spots.
Manager Response: Dear robertsV2285HI,  Thank you for your review! We are glad to see you enjoyed your recent stay with us and that our room condition exceeded your expectations! We hope to host your next stay to Disneyland!

Summary: across the street from Disneyland entrance on Harbor Blvd. can see the fireworks from the roof. pool is clean, hot tub relaxing, front desk prompt and courteous. breakfast ok. rooms are clean, have stayed here before.
Manager Response: Dear Bonnie R,  Thank you for your review! We are glad to see we exceeded your expectations and that you enjoyed our hot tub. We look forward to hosting your next visit to Disneyland!

Summary Heading: desert inn Disneyland close to Disney and a decent hotel experience
Summary: Great experience. Great location. Staff were helpful and pleasant. Breakfast was pretty good for a continental breakfast. Fairly quiet and so close to park we could walk over easily and go back for lunch and breaks.
Manager Response: Dear julzh7,  Thank you for your review! We are glad to hear that our staff exceeded your expectations and that you enjoyed our free daily Continental breakfast. We look forward to hosting your next trip to Disneyland!

Summary: This is our 4th or 5th stay at this place and it's always been a great experience, until this time. The people above us were insanely noisy.  They did allow us to move rooms, after saying we were going to check out, and that helped as we were finally able to sleep but this was after 5 nights of it.  I think the people above us were letting the kids run from one end of the room to the other...for hours.  When we did move we had to remove all of our stuff and then wait a few hours for a new room instead of just moving over to a new room. And one front desk staff questioned whether they should give us the room right away or wait to give it to us (while we were standing there).  While I usually rave about this place and recommend it to people, I don't think that'll be happening
Manager Response: Dear 11sindya,  Thank you for your review! We apologize for the level of service you received during your stay, please be assured we are in the process of re-training and adding additional talent to our team as we speak. I truly hope you will give us another chance on your next trip to Disneyland.

Summary: Everything was clean in the room and neat. The only thing was the drain in the bath tub was clogged and it took too long for the dirty water to drain. Also the front desk team was not very friendly. Lasty I am still waiting for my funds to be released. I checked out on 3/17.
Manager Response: Dear thelv311,  Thank you for your review! We have forwarded your concerns to our Maintenance Team and apologize for any inconveniences during your stay. In regards to service we are working hard to improve the guest service level here at the hotel. Funds, if on a debit card can take up to 7-10 business days to reflect back into an account, hope that helps.

Summary Heading: Clean, close to Disneyland, not luxury but good for sleeping.  Pool needs updating.
Summary: My family of 4 has stayed here there separate times.  It is really close to the entrance to Disneyland. It is fine for a place to sleep. Rooms are clean. There is no breakfast offered.  The indoor pool is small and usually crowded.
Manager Response: Dear kappahteacher,  Thank you for your review, We do offer a free daily continental breakfast for all guests from 7:00 am-9:30 am. We are sorry to hear the pool was crowded, the awesome weather we get here in Anaheim usually make our pool a popular destination.

Summary: Just like many reviewers have said, choose this hotel for the location.  The rooms are basic but were clean and comfortable.  Water pressure wasn't great but it sufficed.  There's a basic continental breakfast (danishes, cereal, muffins) but it gets busy at certain times.  The Denny's next door was a great way to have breakfast.  The quick walk to Disneyland can't be beat.  Parking is limited but they will valet for no additional charge which was very nice.  I would stay here again if visiting Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear gjames80,  Thank you for your review! We are glad you enjoyed our central location and our free daily continental breakfast! We hope to host your next stay to Disneyland!

Summary: This is the second time I stayed here and I have no disappointments. Great location. Great service. Great rooms. Great accommodations. I would highly recommend this hotel to all. I will definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: Dear Markpalakiko,  Thank you for your review! We are glad to hear you enjoyed our central location and excellent guest service. We look forward to hosting your next trip to Disneyland!

Summary: People were friendly at the hotel.  Rooms were okay.  Wifi was very slow so hard to use computers especially since this was a school trip and students had to take tests.  Location of the hotel was awesome.  Walking distance to Disneyland which made it very convenient.  Parking attendants were awesome!!
Manager Response: Dear gwenyuki,  Thank you for your review! We are glad to see you enjoyed your stay and apologize that the wifi bandwith was limited. We look forward to hosting your next visit to Disneyland!

Summary: Basic room, no complaints, location is awesome, right across from Disney. By the pictures we thought the pool was bigger and the location of the pool was not very good. Anyone walking in the parking lot or driving in the parking lot can see every thing through the windows, so our bathing suits remained in our suitcase.
Manager Response: Dear kimbo-travels,  Thank you for your review! We are glad to see you enjoyed your stay and that our hotels located exceeded your expectations! We look forward to hosting your next visit to Disneyland!

Summary: We reserved 20 rooms for a marching band trip.  I had concerns about a few things:  1) hotel's ability to accommodate 80 teenagers at breakfast, 2) placement of rooms together 3) access points for charter buses.  I am afraid I annoyed the heck out of the hotel staff calling pretty regularly to confirm details.  They patiently advised me that they deal with large groups all of the time, and they were correct.  Everything worked very smoothly.  The valet parking staff were really awesome managing the buses in and out, plus our equipment trailer.  The rooms hold 6 people and we maxed out every room.  I was pleasantly surprised that each room was well stocked with towels (often, you have to ask for extras).  The rooms were basic but clean, and the location, right across from the
Manager Response: Dear gardengnomes,  Thank you for your review! We are glad to see you enjoyed your stay and that our staff exceeded your expectations with your group booking and that our housekeeping staff kept your rooms well stocked! We look forward to hosting your next visit to Disneyland!

Summary: The staff was very accommodating 4 families, one who also needed a handicap room. The check in went really well & the other family members were able to get rooms right next to us. This was great ! The children went from room to room 👍
Manager Response: Dear inezbustos,  Thank you for your review!We are glad to see you enjoyed your stay and that our staff exceeded your expectations! We look forward to hosting your next visit to Disneyland!

Summary Heading: Great location, nothing fancy but just what we needed
Summary: My family just returned from our trip to disneyland. We loved the location of this hotel and would definitely stay again. The breakfast is nothing fancy but perfect for what we needed to start the day. The room cleaning service arranged my daughters stuffed animals on her bed in a different way each day and she loved that. We stayed in a family parlor suite with 5 people and had lots of sleeping space. Only one shower though, so that's a bit of a challenge. Pool is indoor so that may bother some people, but we had lots of outside time at the parks so didn't matter so much to us.
Manager Response: Dear mom3301,  Thank you for your review!We are glad to see you enjoyed your stay and that our housekeeping staff exceeded your expectations! We look forward to hosting your next visit to Disneyland!

Summary: This hotel is right across the street from Disneyland. Closest and most convenient I've experienced.  We shared a 2 room suite with my brother's family and there were no locks on the bedroom doors which I found inconvenient. The hotel has limited parking but free valet. It wasn't luxurious but all we needed was a place to sleep and a quick trip to the entrance to Disneyland  so we will be staying here again in the future.
Manager Response: Dear Kacreed,  Thank you for your review! We are glad you enjoyed your stay and our convenient amenities, we look forward to hosting your next visit to Disneyland!

Summary: This hotel was very convenient for myself and young adult children visiting Disneyland. The mini suite was comfortable for the 3 nights. Conveniently located within walking distance from the entrance of Disneyland.  Complimentary breakfast. Located right next door to Dennys. Walking distance from IHOP, McDonald's, & Coldstone Creamery Ice Cream.  Will stay there again with family.
Manager Response: Dear Liviaof4,  Thank you for your review, our staff prides themselves on excellent guest service and providing excellent hospitality to all our guests! We look forward to hosting your next visit to Disneyland!

Summary Heading: Within Walking distance to Disney Parks
Summary: This is my favorite place to stay when going to the Disney Parks. The staff is friendly and willing to assist with places to eat or alternate attractions to visit. The continental breakfast is great and plentiful.  They have a good variety of items to choose from and something for everyone.  There is also a observation deck where you can view the fireworks without fighting the crowds.
Manager Response: Dear RosemaryA728,  Thank you for your review, our staff prides themselves on excellent guest service and providing excellent hospitality to all our guests! Our guests love our free continental breakfast and we are glad to hear you discovered our rooftop viewing deck for the Disneyland fireworks! We look forward to hosting your next visit to Disneyland!

Summary: Our reservation was for five nights but we checked out after two. The convenience of location does not justify staying here. Our room's furnishings were in poor almost tacky condition. The hide a bed in the parlor was unusable due to its age and condition. Every spring made its self know to my son as he tried to sleep on it. The parlor has no ventilation, heat or air conditioning so when the door is closed it is stuffy, hot or cold. There is a hole cut into the connecting wall with a very noisy, small fan to try and help with this problem. Due to the age of the hotel it lacks adequate soundproofing so be prepared to hear noise from above and on both sides. Also since it has outside entrances, other guests walking by your room are very audible. Prices for the rooms very greatly
Manager Response: Dear Zinnia6,  We are sorry to hear that we fell short of your expectations. In terms of the service and attention you received is not within our standards and we are working to remedy the issues you experienced.

Summary: We stay here every time we visit Disneyland because you can't get any closer! It is so perfect and convenient and we'll definitely be back! The continental breakfast is quick and easy, and the staff in the office and friendly and helpful. Thank you, Desert Inn!
Manager Response: Dear ericka_xoxo,  Thank you for your review, our staff prides themselves on excellent guest service and providing excellent hospitality to all our guests! Our guests love our free daily continental breakfast! We look forward to hosting your next visit to Disneyland!

Summary: An amazing hotel right across the road from disneyland this hotel has everything you need, great for family staff were amazing very friendly and helpful great pool to cool down. rooms are good xxx  would highly recommend and would stay here again
Manager Response: Dear Becky J,  Thank you for your review, our staff prides themselves on excellent guest service and providing excellent hospitality to all our guests! We look forward to hosting your next visit to Disneyland!

Summary: The reason for choosing your property was convenience and proximity. I thought that this choice was well justified. One note about the room which was provided to us, room 198 had only a seemingly outdated air conditioning unit and no provision for heating the room. As we visited your property in the week of Feb 27 to Mar 4, at least one of the nights was rather cool and we needed to request an additional blanket in order to compensate for the lack of a heating unit in the room.
Manager Response: Dear pop5084,  We are sorry to hear that we fell short of your expectations. In terms of the amenities that were not working properly your concerns have been forwarded to our Maintenance team. Please know that this is not within our standards and we are working to remedy the issues you experienced.

Summary: This hotel has a excellent location. It's closer then almost ALL hotels to Disneyland. Easy walk across the street to main entrance. Breakfast and indoor pool are huge plus. They also have an rooftop patio for firework viewing.
Manager Response: Dear Kingsfanz,  Thank you for your review, our staff prides themselves on excellent guest service and providing excellent hospitality to all our guests! We look forward to hosting your next visit to Disneyland!

Teo and staff warmly greeted us when we arrived as well as the valet staff. We have stayed there multiple times so we are familiar faces when we visit. And the welcome we get never changes. Technically our home away from home when we are in town.  Many thanks to Teo and staff for accomodating my family when we visit.

Suggest bringing slippers if you care to not have gray-ish dirty feet after walking barefoot on the carpet.  Maids will service your room every day if you don't put a door hanger on stating you don't want to be disturbed.  Pool is enclosed with glass panels/windows, but outside air still flows through the gaps above and below the glass.

Pros:  -location (10 min walk) -breakfast (cold hard boiled eggs, bread/bagels with toaster, danish, cereal and milk, and fruit) -clean rooms, sheets and towels Cons: -too expensive for quality of room (paying for location) -old, outdated rooms -loud depending on who is above you and next to you (you can hear water going on, people walking above, toilets next to you

Summary: This was my second stay at the Anaheim Desert Inn & Suites.  The location - directly across from the entrance to Disneyland - is definitely its best feature. Beginning at 7am or 8am, there were families bustling about, doors opening & closing, and tons of hotel carts making noise (housekeeping carts).  The noise continued throughout the day, so even coming back mid-day for a quick nap was not relaxing.  In addition, the amenities were shoddy.  The towels were small and rough, the soap was little, and I don't even recall there being shampoo and conditioner.  And the coffee maker only
