Summary: Our family of 4 really enjoyed our 3 night stay in November of 2016.  The location of this property can not be beat.  It took us 8 minutes to walk from our hotel room to the entrance of Disneyland.  I think it would take longer than that if you stayed at the Disneyland Hotel.  Being able to skip the wait for a tram to get to Disneyland is invaluable.  If you have children still in strollers, stay here!  You can walk right across the street for nap time half way through your Disney trip.....perfect!  Our was surprised by how clean our room was.  I guess my expectations were low based on how much we paid for our room.  Great deal!  Highly recommend the Desert Inn.  We'll be back!
Manager Response: Dear KJ_in_CA,  Thank you for taking the time to review our property. We strive to provide our guests an outstanding experience, We are centrally located which provides our guests excellent and exciting shopping and dining options within walking distance and a quick 5 minute walk to Disneyland or Disney California Adventure.  We look forward to hosting your next visit to the Anaheim Resort

Summary: We have stayed here as much as multiple times in a year for over 15-18 years now and anytime we had any problem at all, it was responded to immediately.  We love the room we've had 3 times in a row now.  People at front desk have only improved over the years.  Only thing we would change would be a larger room to store our baggage when we check out or check in.  Location is perfect for us two older folks in walking to the park.  Our only complaint is sometimes we leave a note to leave more coffee or creamer and it isn't always adhered to.  Most often it is.
Manager Response: Dear nanarobin1,  Thanks for taking the time to review our property.   Extra coffee is also available by dialing "0" from your in room phone and we will ensure additional coffee and fixings are delivered to your room promptly.  We are glad you enjoyed your visit with us. We look forward to hosting your next visit to the Anaheim Resort.

Summary Heading: Great location across street from Disneyland
Summary: Motel style in that you climb stairs to get to floors.  There are elevators about halfway down the above ground parking area near the building.  Underground parking available, but very tight and both lots are constantly full.  Sometimes hard to find a spot when returning in the evening from a non-Disney day.  Close to restaurants such a Mimi's Cafe on the long strip.  About a 20-30 minute walk to Anaheim garden walk with more dining options.  Basic standard rooms with Queen beds, bathroom, flat screen tv, mini fridge, microwave, closet, and bathroom accessories such as hair dryer.  Staff was friendly upon arrival and departure.  Pool is indoor and adjacent to above ground parking.  You can buy your park tix here since it's a Disney good neighbour hotel.  Saves you standing in
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to review our property. We strive to provide our guests an outstanding experience, We are centrally located which provides our guests excellent and exciting shopping and dining options within walking distance. We are glad you saved time by purchasing Disney tickets at our front desk.  We look forward to hosting your next visit to the Anaheim Resort

Summary: We have stayed several times at a hotel just to the north of here several times. They were booked so we tried Desert Inn. The rooms were clean. The bed was actually very comfortable. I did not try the pool area but my kids had fun enough after a day in Disneyland. It is indoors so that was nice. The rooms are average. Nothing to write home about but as mentioned they are clean. The continental breakfast is fairly bare bones. You can fill up if you like hard boiled eggs and toast or pastry. They have apples, oranges and cereal. I was OK. My wife not as much. My kids were in the middle. That is the area that could use an upgrade. Parking is pretty tight. If you don't get there early they valet park your vehicle underground. That may actually be good but it's less convenient. The
Manager Response: Dear Rob D,  Thanks for taking the time to review our property. We are glad you enjoyed your visit with us. For future trips we do accept and hold food deliveries from Vons to accomodate guests that are looking to supplement our Continental Breakfast offerings. We look forward to hosting your next visit to the Anaheim Resort.

Summary: This hotel is in the perfect spot for a disney holiday - right across the road. Hotel is clean and the staff are very helpful. Surrounded by all the places you could possibly want to eat at.  would deffinatly recomend staying here and will stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear setterclan,  Thanks for taking the time to review our property.   We are glad you enjoyed your visit with us. We look forward to hosting your next visit to the Anaheim Resort.

Summary Heading: Great place with great access to Disney!
Summary: The rooms were spacious and had everything that we needed.  (More than one pk of coffee per room of 4 would have been good, but I am sure we could have asked for more.) Everything was clean and well kept for an older motel type setting.  Breakfast was well done, fresh and easy. I would definitely stay again.
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to review our property.   We are glad you enjoyed your visit with us.  We offer extra coffee at no charge just call the Front desk and they will send more to you.  We look forward to hosting your next visit to the Anaheim Resort.

Summary Heading: Bargain across the street from Disneyland.
Summary: We had a clean, comfortable room. Our room had two queen beds and a pull out couch in a separate room. The couch was not comfortable - if a child were sleeping on it, would probably be ok but with any normal adult weight, the springs and metal frame were felt. If I had known this in advance, we would have brought an airbed to put on top of it or something. Someone dropped out in our group so we didn't need to use the bed at the last minute. (We thought we would use it so we had privacy but the bed wasn't comfortable so we didn't)  The maid service was good and there were plenty of clean towels and washcloths each day.   The Continental Breakfast is STRICTLY a continental breakfast. There were danish, toast, cold cereal and fruit available. There was juice, coffee and tea
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to review our property. We are glad you enjoyed your visit with us.   Your concerns for the Sofa have been sent to the proper management team.   Next time you will have to try relaxing in the jacuzzi after a long day on your feet at the parks!  We look forward to hosting your next visit to the Anaheim Resort.

Summary: We always stay at the Desert inn as it has a variety of room sizes to accommodate our large family. It is also located next to IHOP and Denny's for easy eating or bringing back to the hotel. The breakfast at the Desert inn is terrific and filling. Having the hotel right across the street from the parks is the main reason to stay there! On the other hand, parking is expensive and only one per ROOM even if we have a two bedroom suite and the internet connections are non existant. We had to go to a restaurant to connect so the kids could do homework. I complained and they acted like I was the only one but I spoke with other guests who had the same complaint. We pay a tax to stay there and it includes access to the internet.
Manager Response: Dear mka1021,  Thanks for taking the time to review our property. We are glad you enjoyed your visit with us. For future stays, Two bedroom Suites C1 and higher are allowed 2 vehicles, we apologize if there was any confusion.   In regards to the WiFi connection we apologize if there was any disruption, we always have the business center computer in the lobby free of charge with printing available.  We look forward to hosting your next visit to the Anaheim Resort.

Summary Heading: Enjoyed our stay despite some hiccups in our travel
Summary: Desert Inn is a favorite in our family. I grew up coming here as a teenager and now I bring my own family here when we plan Disneyland trips. We greatly appreciate the location and the price. The continental breakfast is another great perk, too! The rooms are clean, the service is great, the beds are comfortable. Our only hiccup with our recent trip was that the refrigerator froze all our food (despite being on the lowest setting). That was a little disappointing as we bought a lot of food to make our own lunches to bring to the park. Other than that, we were very pleased with our stay and will still continue to chose Desert Inn for all our future trips to Disneyland!  (We also thoroughly enjoyed our view - we stayed in room 529. We got to watch the Disney fireworks show from
Manager Response: Dear MarcieG,  Thanks for taking the time to review our property. We are glad you enjoyed your visit with us.   Your concerns for the fridge have been sent to the proper management team.   We look forward to hosting your next visit to the Anaheim Resort.

Summary: We stayed here on our recent trip - 12 people in 2 B2 executive suites (basically four rooms).  For the price we paid it was excellent.  The location is perfect - 20 steps from the crosswalk into the Disneyland area.  Could not really get any closer.  The free breakfast was great - I wasn't expecting much but it was a lot better than what I expected.  Tea, coffee, juice, cereal, oranges, apples, hard boiled eggs, pastries, toat each morning and then bagels alternating. Great start to each morning and easy for us to go to breakfast seperately before we started our day. Parking was fine, car always arrived quickly when we requested it. I had seen people complain about being at the back of the hotel and having a long walk to the front - no issue at all - really not far no matter
Manager Response: Dear jaymcee,  Thanks for taking the time to review our property.  We are glad you enjoyed your visit with us. Many of our guests love our free continental breakfast with its great variety and flavors.  We look forward to hosting your next visit to the Anaheim Resort.

Summary: We chose this place for its unbeatable location.  It is closer than the official Disneyland hotels and very convenient.  It was clean and the beds were comfortable.  So we got everything we really expected/needed.  Service at front desk was very nice, as well.   The wifi was spotty at best on my PC.  Seemed to work fine on my table, so?   We didn't eat any breakfast food but found the coffee, on the one time we tried it, undrinkable.  However, the in-room coffee was quite good.  There was some noise from other guests and from the garbage truck.  However, we're always up early to get to the parks early so it wasn't a problem.  We were very satisfied with the price-location-cleanliness matrix.
Manager Response: Dear LindainPortlandOr,  Thanks for taking the time to review our property.   We will forward your feedback to our management team in regards to the quality of the coffee and apologize for your disappointment.  We are glad you enjoyed your visit with us. We look forward to hosting your next visit to the Anaheim Resort.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel for Disney with Family
Summary: Close to Disney (across the street), clean, and affordable. This hotel has it all is it perfect and the most glamorous hotel, no but it's great for budget friendly trips and for families. Rooms are clean and well kept.
Manager Response: Dear Krystin R,  Thanks for taking the time to review our property.   We are glad you enjoyed your visit with us.   We look forward to hosting your next visit to the Anaheim Resort.

Summary: Have stayed there several times and while it is close to Disneyland the mattress are not comfortable at all.  Parking also leaves a lot to be desired. Also close to Dennys for good quick meals. Breakfast offered by the hotel was fair.
Manager Response: Dear timrice44,  Thanks for taking the time to review our property.   We will forward your feedback to our management team in regards to the quality of the room amenities, parking and continental breakfast. Please accept our apolgy for your disappointment.

Summary Heading: Perfect for a budget and location
Summary: My overall charge for the night was $124, which included a parking fee. I was able to walk across the street to DisneyLand /California Adventure/ Downtown Disney. Restaurants nearby. Room was ok, clean, but needs some updates. Overall good experience
Manager Response: Dear yianni316,  Thanks for taking the time to review our property.   We will forward your feedback to our management team in regards to the quality of the room amenities.  We are glad you enjoyed your visit with us.   We look forward to hosting your next visit to the Anaheim Resort.

Summary: This hotel has a great location, and clean rooms all at a good price.  Are they 5 start rooms and amenities?  No.  Are they just what you need to enjoy a trip to the Disney Parks? Yes.   We stayed in their Parlor Room 2 which has a great layout for those who want to be together but still have some separation between sleeping areas.  Rooms were clean with adequate amenities (nice sized fridge), if a bit dated and worn décor. The free breakfast is minimal but will get something in your stomach.  We would absolutely stay there again--it was clean and close with a friendly staff at a  fair price.
Manager Response: Dear BeverlyBeverly,  Thanks for taking the time to review our property. Our staff prides themselves on the attention to detail when cleaning rooms and maintaining them, Uprgades to the rooms, common areas are always ongoing.  We are glad you enjoyed your visit with us.   We look forward to hosting your next visit to the Anaheim Resort.

Summary: We chose this hotel because it was across the street from the Disney Resort not knowing what to expect. I say that because the hotel is considerably cheaper than every other hotel in the area. When we arrived at the hotel we were met with very friendly service and the staff was very well dressed, professional and courteous. When we arrived to our room it was clean and the beds were comfortable. We enjoyed our stay even though it rained the entirety of our time in Southern California. We definitely will stay at The Desert Inn and Suites and you should too!
Manager Response: Dear tditz1,  Thanks for taking the time to review our property.   Our team is always ready to exceed our guests expectations and it looks like we did it again!   We are glad you enjoyed your visit with us.   We look forward to hosting your next visit to the Anaheim Resort.

Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights for our holiday at Disneyland and California Adventure parks. Having an indoor pool for my sons was fabulous, especially when the outdoor temperatures were cooler in the evenings.  However, the hot tub spa was disappointing: someone must have put shampoo or some kind of soap in it. Once the jets were turned on, it foamed up horribly.  It would have been nice to soak in a hot tub after walking around the parks all day. The rooms were dated yet clean and basic, which met our needs. Having a 4-cup coffee maker in the room was wonderful.  Our room had a safe for our important documents.  Note: there was no hair conditioner or lotion provided, only shampoo and handsoap. The complimentary breakfast was really nice to have.  The breakfast items were basic
Manager Response: Dear MoochieLa-La,  Thanks for taking the time to review our property.   We will forward your feedback to our management team and apologize for any inconvenience during your stay   We are glad you enjoyed your visit with us.  We look forward to hosting your next visit to the Anaheim Resort.

Summary: Truly enjoyed my stay, some information regarding payments before the reservation was not mentioned over the phone that made me uncomfortable when i got there, but overall, great stay.   The pool and breakfast were awesome!
Manager Response: Dear Ascendancy G,  Thanks for taking the time to review our property.   Our reservations policies are as follows 48 hours to arrival 1 nights room and tax will be authorized to a valid credit card to guarantee the room for arrival. If the payment is unsuccessful we will call 2 times and leave voicemails if able, then an email to the address on file.  Additional nights and fees are then authorized at check in for the remaining stay. We apologize for any confusion this may have caused.  We look forward to hosting your next visit to the Anaheim Resort.

Summary: Loved the service here this is my third time staying here and loved it the only complaint was the hot tub was not hot at all. My kids loved the extra room and space was lovely. I will definetly stay here agian
Manager Response: Dear Nclay1222  Thanks for taking the time to review our property.   We will forward your feedback to our management team in regards to the quality of the Spa temperature.   Please accept our apology for your disappointment.

Summary: Right across the street from Disneyland - perfect location!!  We have stayed here a couple times now and its always been neat and clean, and has a great complimentary breakfast to start the day.  Can't beat the price either!!  We will definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear 1hnorth1,  Thanks for taking the time to review our property.   We are glad you enjoyed your stay with us and we look forward to hosting your next visit to the Anaheim Resort.

Summary: My wife and I stayed here for one of Disneyland's race weekends. I booked this hotel because it was a great price and an even better location.  We just had to walk a short distance on Harbor Blvd to the crosswalk that leads into the security checkpoint to the parks.  I attached a picture of the sign at the front of the building, and you can see Space Mountain in the background.   The room looked like it could use an update, but honestly, it was clean and comfortable, which are top of my list of requirements. There were a decent sized refrigerator, microwave, and a small coffee maker in the room. They also provided a hair dryer.   There is an indoor heated pool, but it still felt a little cool so we didn't go in. We did, however, take advantage of the hot tub next to the pool.
Manager Response: Dear Whattwack,  Thanks for taking the time to review our property. Our staff prides themselves on the attention to detail when cleaning rooms and maintaining them, Uprgrades to the rooms, common areas are always ongoing.  We are glad you enjoyed your visit with us.   We look forward to hosting your next visit to the Anaheim Resort.

Summary Heading: Great location close to Disneyland Park
Summary: We have stayed here a few times with family. The family suites are great. Separate living room with TV is nice after kids have gone to bed. Basic motel, but always clean and staff very friendly. Breakfast included which is a bonus. The proximity to the park after a long day or to bring kids back for naps is awesome! Indoor pool with hot tub - nice in winter season at the end of the day in the park. Valet parking attendants very friendly and helpful. Dennys next door and you get a 10% discount coupon from the hotel. Can watch fireworks from roof deck.
Manager Response: Dear 444snowbird,  We would like to thank you for reviewing our property. We pride ourselves on our clean rooms, great rates and free continental breakfast. We are glad you enjoyed our amenities and that you made use of our fireworks deck, its a great secret spot here in the Anaheim Resort! We hope to host your next visit to the Anaheim Resort!

Summary Heading: Our 3rd visit... we love Anaheim Desert Inn
Summary: We were over there recently for the NAMM Show from Australia. This was the 3rd time we stayed. We had room 131 this time with the wheelchair accessible bathroom and 2 beds as we had our 24yo son come with us this time. We love this place.. it is so central to Disney and the Convention Center, you can always be guaranteed a good feed too with Denny's and IHOP on either side.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We like to stay here when we do a 2-day park hopper trip every other year or so. It's location can't be better (right across from the entrance to Disneyland). Prices are always reasonable compared to other hotels. The indoor pool and Jacuzzi are good for winter trips (our usual timing as crowds are lower in February). We also get a suite so that our daughter gets her own "room" with a TV and sofa bed. Once we even had a larger 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom suite that we shared with our friend, giving our daughter the living room between the bedrooms, and saving ourselves some money. I think they even have rooms with hot tubs. There is a buffet continental breakfast (toast, hardboiled eggs, pastries, juice, cereal, etc.), but also a Denny's next door. For a cheaper dinner, get some
Manager Response: none

Summary: This property was very clean and comfortable.  The staff was very helpful and friendly.   We had a parlor suite which has two beds and TV in one room and a sofa bed and TV in front room. GREAT location for Disneyland.  It was close enough to walk back to the room and eat or rest.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We booked a suite and loved having everyone safe and close. There's no better place to stay if you're going to Disneyland. It's right across the street from the entrance.  There's a simple breakfast provided and there is a Denny's and IHOP next door. You can literally just park your car and walk to everywhere you want to go!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Always a great place to stay!
Summary: I stay here every time in in Anaheim it's always the most convenient and clean! The atmosphere is always great. The valet parking is on point. I will be staying there again in April I've stayed at other places nearby and none of them compare!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Love this hotel. This is the only place we will stay at when going to Disneyland . You walk across the street and right into Disney. It is clean and the staff is very friendly and helpful especially the front desk.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Positive: This hotel is in a great location to Disneyland, walk right across the street into the parks.  It was clean. The breakfast room is nice and big.  Non-Positive: I reserved a family suite, which turned out to be 2 connecting rooms, not what I expected and really wasn't convenient.  I got three different sets of key, as the gave us the wrong room 2 times.  The outside door did not meet up with the door frame causing a large gap which allowed cold air and rain to get into the room.  The mattresses need to be updated but your so tired after being at Disneyland all day you really did not care. Breakfast has no hot food, toast and cereal only, it was a real let down.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This little hotel is not fancy, or luxurious.  But it IS close to the park entrance and reasonably priced.  My wife, two friends and I recently visited.  It's a bit run down and out of date, but it's clean, offers an adaquit breakfast selection and has lots of amenities near by.  They are very strict on their check in time of 3:00 pm, but they are also very "up front" about that.  So you just have to plan accordingly.  We just parked the car there and walked to the park to begin our vacation. We shared a family suite with our friends and it was a great set up and helped keep the costs down.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The positives for this hotel are proximity to Disney, service and smiles from front desk and valet staff, cleanliness and free breakfast.  The negatives were the need to rent a locker to store smaller luggage at check in, the grumpy lady who helped us and the size of the breakfast room for the number of guests.  The two issues everyone will face in this hotel is the noise (pipework inside the rooms,  the surface outside which makes luggage sound like a landing jet plane and footsteps in the room above which reminded me of Poltergeist the movie) and the fact that it is a few years past it's sell by date.  The deciding factor for the rating was the fact that after a long day at disney we returned to the room to find the door open, presumably since maid service earlier in the day.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our location was not the best, but our suite was awesome!!! Love the separation of the rooms and TV's in both. So much room!! Everyone is pleasant. We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast. The valet service was great they were so polite and friendly
Manager Response: none

Summary: Rooms are clean you could go up to the roof top and see the fireworks, the staff is very friendly willing to help you meet your needs. But the best of all it's closed to the park and Restaurants! Over all we Love this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Conchita0316,  We want to start by thanking you for taking the time to complete this review for TripAdvisor.  We are delighted that we were able to meet your needs while you were here.  Our location is perfect for our guests for Disneyland and other nearby activities!  Thank you for choosing the Anaheim Desert Inn & Suites for your stay!

Summary: ... really economic place. 5 min walk to Disney. Every room got its own A/C (little loud, we did not need it in the winter, but could not open a window). Breakfast small but ok. Price/location perfect. Place itself could use some work. Staff friendly.
Manager Response: Dear Ralf G.,  Thank you for taking the time to complete this review for TripAdvisor.  Customer reviews have become such an integral part of research in the traveling industry.  We truly appreciate the feedback you have provided us and our future hotel guests.  We can only improve when we hear of our shortcomings from our guests.  This information will help us in our problem areas and help to improve on the product and service we provide.  Thank you for choosing the Anaheim Desert Inn & Suites for your stay!

Summary: A big hotel, with clean and excellent rooms... Great service and staff really helpful and kind... It's right across the street from Disney and there are restaurants and malls at walking distance... Parking gets kid of crowded but definitely worth it...
Manager Response: Dear Elvia M,  Thank you for your time and this review you completed on TripAdvisor.  We are delighted in the fact you thoroughly enjoyed your stay with us and we hope to see you again really soon!  Thank you for choosing the Anaheim Desert Inn & Suites for your stay!

Summary: The service was fantastic. We had trouble with our safe and they sent someone up immediately to fix it.   The rooms were clean. Nothing special. But we spent most of the time in the parks, so they were perfectly fine for sleeping.   The WiFi was spotty. Luckily for us we had strong cellular signal.
Manager Response: Dear Steve K,  Let us start by thanking you for taking the time to complete this review for TripAdvisor.  We appreciate the positive feedback and hope hope to improve on our shortcomings.  We are updating our hotel constantly and always making changes to our rooms.  We do hope you stay with us again really soon!  Thank you for choosing the Anaheim Desert Inn & Suites for your stay and hopefully for your future stays!

Summary Heading: Location to Disneyland is the only draw
Summary: Pros: Hotel's location to Disneyland is the best feature. It's literally across the street from the main gate. Even the official Disneyland Resorts Hotels are further than this hotel. The housekeeping is excellent. Very clean rooms. Comparable prices to other nearby hotels --which are all old and outdated. Spacious room.   Cons: Paper thin walls. Very small pool. Wake up Alarms going off in other rooms and we could hear them loudly ALL NIGHT, even after calling the front desk. Small selection at breakfast--hard boiled eggs, muffins, toast and a little fruit. (But breakfast is free so can't really complain).  Self parking was full so had to use valet parking. Next time I'd splurge on the nearby Marriott for a good night's rest.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A budget hotel, convenient and economical.
Summary: If you are looking for stylish and updated decor and amenities, this isn't the place for you.  However, if you are looking for a basic and affordable place to stay while visiting Disneyland this might be the right choice for you.  It's right across from the main gate, so you can book an airport shuttle from LAX (Los Angeles Airport) and not have a car while you are here.  (We booked our shuttle through Viator.com and it worked out great).  I was travelling with my daughter and two grandkids (boy & girl, 9 and 8 years).    We booked a suite with a small "living room" that had a pull out couch plus the TV, fridge, coffee table, and a small dresser.  It worked out well for us.  However, be prepared:  the furnishings are spartan and the wood is showing wear marks. The decor
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Very Convenient Location, Nice Folks, Needs Work
Summary: This is a VERY conveniently located motel and, as such, is heavily booked and used. The price point is also very competitive. That being said, we will pay a little more next time and stay at a different property.  The upside is the valets are just the best. Always quick and friendly and they take great car of your car. The front desk staff and housekeeping staff are helpful and, again, the location is fantastic.  The downside is this place is beat up from the heavy use and lack of reinvestment in keeping it nice. It is extremely noisy between rooms and outside. (See pics for examples.) There was a huge gap under our door so you know where the outside noise is coming from and the furniture is heavily scuffed and chipped. Beds are not very comfortable and the pillows will make you
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed at hotel for 3 nights, pretty much no wifi the whole time. Location good, clean rooms, front desk staff not very helpful and no follow up on wifi issues. Outside staff good. Basic hotel in concrete box.
Manager Response: Hi Joy255115,  We appreciate you bringing these problems to our attention, we can only improve when we learn of our shortcomings from our guests.  This information helps us to address our problem areas and improve on the product and service we provide.  We sincerely hope that you will give us another opportunity to serve you during your next visit to the area.   Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Excellent location... right across from Disneyland maingate
Summary: Ok here's my breakdown on this place...  The good: 1) This place was clean.  2) The staff was courteous and helpful.   3) We stayed in a two bedroom, two shower suite.  There were 7 in our party.  It was plenty of room for our group.   4) The location right across from the entrance to Disneyland was amazing.  We were able to easily walk back to the hotel during the day and take a nap or take a soak in the hot tub.  I did both of these on over our 6-night stay.  :-) 5) Our room had microwave ovens and refrigerators in the bedrooms.  The bad: 1) It's expensive for what you get. (but what isn't around Disneyland, right?) 2) The breakfast wasn't amazing.  I actually ended up going next door to Denny's twice instead.  Overall my family enjoyed our stay and would stay here again.  In
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: The only place i stay when going to D Land.
Summary: Great staff, nice large, clean rooms. Love the two joining rooms. Parking staff is very friendly despite some people getting rude with them. The amount of car they handle and the spaces, they do a good job.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Read the small print before booking this place.  Bill is at least one third more in fees.
Summary: We felt ripped off - that is all there is to it.  Not a good impression.  We went there because it advertised on line their bill board saying, "Discount tickets to Disneyland".  Well that did not materialize!  Instead, he gave us a card referring us to a discount ticket seller down the block but that still did not provide any discount for disneyland unless you planned on attending three days or more.  Then, when we went to check out, the bill was padded with several extra fees that no one else in California or Oregon charged:  Room rate, plus tax, THEN PLUS, PLUS PLUS:  fee for parking, Tourism improvement district fee, resort fee, Parking tax, Resort Fee tax, Parking Fee TIDA, Resort TIDA fee.  What in the world is that?  Ironically, this was no resort!  It was the equivalent
Manager Response: Hi converge77,  Thank you for staying with us and I apologize for all the shortcomings you experienced while you stayed with us. All of our costs are given to our guests upfront either over the phone and specially when you book online.  Your comments and feedback are truly appreciated.  This information helps us to address our problem areas and improve on the product and service we provide.  Thank you,  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: we stayed for 4 nights, went to the Disney park for 2 days, and Lego land for 1 day  cant ask for a better place to stay when visiting Disneyland, right across the street from the park, very clean and spacious room, very friendly staff. We will for sure come back and stay again, will also recommend it to our family and friends!! thank you!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Desert Inn is a primo location for visiting Disneyland. It's literally across the street. It was perfect for our family's two night trip. Our only complaint was the breakfast, which was pretty bare bones. Other than that, we were happy. The staff were friendly, it was clean, and once again, location, location, location.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was very impressed with the Anaheim Desert Inn.  It was clean and the staff was accomadating and friendly. There is a nice little breakfast in the morning with a tray in our room so I could bring food up for my little sleepy heads. I really  liked how close it is to Disneyland, not too much of  a walk for our little ones. There is also a Great view for the fireworks up on the roof.
Manager Response: Hi r104e410,  I'm glad to hear that we have met your expectations and that you enjoyed your stay at the Anaheim Desert Inn.  We hope that you'll stay with us again in the near future.  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We are a budget minded family of 6. Anaheim Desert Inn & Suites was exactly as advertised and better then we even expected. Location is literally as close as you can get without staying on Disneyland property. It's a couple minute walk to the security enterance and just past that is the Disney enterance. We used all the amenities from breakfast to the pool, hot tub, and laundry facilities. It was all clean, well stocked, and easy to use. Whatever you do DO NOT buy your tickets at Disneyland! Buy them at the hotel or in our case the hotel was out of the 3 day park hopper tickets so they sent us a couple doors down to Discount Tours and we got our 3 day passes for $10 off each ticket so it saved us $60! The ticket lines at the park are ridiculous and would be a total waste time &

Summary: Spent 6 nights here over Christmas. Room was clean, everything worked. Some of the furniture is dated and damaged. Needs a Reno.  Free breakfast was nice, consisted of fruit, danish,toast,hard boiled eggs etc. It's a family hotel with lots of small children. People yelling at 5:30am kids running everywhere banging on doors. Staff was friendly.
Manager Response: Dear Rayjac74,  Thank you for taking the time to complete this review for TripAdvisor.  We are happy that you are delighted with our staff and the cleanliness of our hotel.  We can only improve when we learn of our shortcomings from our guests.  This information helps us to address our problem areas and improve on the product and service we provide.  Thank you for choosing the Anaheim Desert Inn & Suites for your stay!

Summary: We stayed for 3 weeks (yes, 3!) early December 2016.   Noisiest. Hotel. Ever.   I've been to DL approx 8/9 times and have always stayed on Sth Harbor Blvd opp DL and have never had this level of noise.   I was sleeping on the fold out sofa in the front room of the Parlor Suites.   Guests were (as another reviewer noted) the rudest.   I honestly don't think they meant to be but really, when you come home from DL at midnight or leave at 5.00am do you really need to yell and talk to your friends at above normal speaking level and let your kids run and scream down the aisles??!!!!  Now I do realise that the hotel is not responsible for these people but some signage suggesting quiet times might be appropriate.   Large gap under the door, carpet needs to be vacuumed thoroughly in the

Consumer reviews have become such an important part of traveler’s research and we truly appreciate the positive feedback you are providing future hotel guests. Summary: You cannot beat the location -- this place is actually nearer to the Disneyland parks entrance than the Disneyland Hotel! Just walk out of the hotel, turn right, then take the nearest pedestrian crosswalk and you have arrived at the Disneyland Resort. Accommodations are very basic but clean and comfortable. Breakfast is toast/bagel, and cereal with overly sweet juice (orange and apple, both from concentrate). If your main goal is to save money so you can spend it at Disneyland, this is a great place to stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Pros: 1. Great location across the street from the parks 2. Offers a free continental breakfast, typical items but it's included with your stay 3. Stayed in a junior suite, perfect for large families (I have 4 kids) 4. Room rate was totally reasonable compared to other hotels in the area Cons: 1. Unlike other hotels we weren't allowed to check in early (understandable if totally booked but at least check) 2. You can valet or self park both cost, but if you self park it is a nightmare especially if you drive a large SUV 3. Rooms are a bit dated and worn but clean  In the end I would stay again. Not great but definitely decent.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Group of 37, rugby team coaches and Parents
Summary: Awesome place, ideally situated great rates. Easy to deal with. Pool great. Dennys next door with value for money for the boys. Breakfast OK. Recommended to anyone on a budget. Recommend VIP tour of Disney expensive but totally worth it.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had a great stay for 4 nights. Our room was way down at the end of the property, which is the only reason I'm giving this 4 stars instead of 5.  It's a long walk after a day at Disney!  The breakfast isn't much, and is very carb heavy, but it's enough to make it to lunch. The room was big and beds were comfortable. Not much water pressure, but at least it stays hot. This is our go to Disney hotel based on price and location.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed for one night in December with spouse. I would not stay here again. I am an avid reviewer on this site and believe I provide fair and honest reviews. I wish I could rate this place higher, but I just can't.   The GOOD:  Location. Very close to Disneyland literally across the street. Incredibly convenient.   Price. I was out the door for one night with parking, all fees, etc. for $147.00 during a peak season. That is a good price.   Clean. Rooms are old, but appeared clean, had the minimal amenities expected.   Pool and hot tub. Are indoors!! That's hard to find in Anaheim.   The BAD: Staff. Desk staff don't want to be there and it shows. Guests are an inconvenience. The parking/valet staff, on the other hand, were polite and happy to help! Did not interact with maids.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a great hotel, it's so close to Disneyland main gate! If the kids are tired you can go back for a rest without a lot Ng walk. It's a good price and the rooms are big. There is a good breakfast included.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel has very convenient access to Disneyland.  You can walk to the park, plenty of food close by.  An adequate not fantastic breakfast is provided to get you on your way.  The hot tub is very cold and you are paying a resort fee and parking fee for the privilege of staying at the hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Chose this for price and location and very happy with both.  Reception staff were helpful and friendly from the get-go.  The room was clean and enormous.  The breakfast was fine.  Would more than happily stay here again and recommend to others.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Excellent location, well-maintained motel, can be good value
Summary: My wife and I stayed one night at Desert Inn and Suites motel (1600 S. Harbor Blvd., Anaheim, CA 92802) during December 2016. We have stayed here many times (more than a dozen) over the years, always while visiting Disneyland. The motel has been kept up well. It is in an excellent location. The entrance to the motel is less than 200 feet south on Harbor Boulevard from the traffic light where you cross Harbor to walk into the street entrance to the Disneyland Resort (you have a walk of a very long block from there due west to get to the security checkpoint, ticket booths, and entry gates to the Magic Kingdom and California Adventure). The motel itself extends a very long block due east from Harbor. Most of the rooms are in a four-story high structure (with elevators). There is a
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: OK Hotel, Great Price, Excellent Location, Good Value
Summary: It's just an OK hotel.    The good:  Excellent location--I think it is a closer walk than the Disneyland and Paradise Pier Hotels.  Perhaps 7 minutes to the Disneyland gates.  Great overall price if you are traveling with family.  You can get an array of suites that fit your needs.  Super close to a number of restaurants--Denny's, IHOP, Coldstone, Panera.  (FYI, IHOP had a free kids meal with the purchase of adult meal after 4pm.  We used that twice coming out of the park).    Cool little fridge and microwave came with the room.  The so/so to bad:  Loud.  We had the second floor, to the back, on the right.  We could hear cars parking, people getting in and out, and even stuff going on in front of the hotel next door.  Was it insane?  No.  But on the bad side.  One night some car

Your comments and feedback are truly appreciated.  This information helps us to address our problem areas and improve on the product and service we provide. Summary Heading: Great front desk staff helped with my reservation mistake!
Summary: With the help of Peter and Samantha at the front desk, we were able to resolve the reservation problem I had created. It was late and we were tired from driving when we discovered my mistake. They were so professional and 'made it work'. Our room was clean and comfy. We grabbed a boiled egg from the buffet and walked the short stroll to the park. What a great location.
Manager Response: none

Summary: basic hotel, across the street from the walking path to Disneyland.  we were on the 1st floor, which could be loud with people walking by (early and late)  and carts being pushed by staff (early).  imagine 2nd floor was quieter.  basic accommodations and breakfast, but we chose the hotel based on location and it did not disappoint.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: You sure could use a few more luggage trollys.
Summary: I had a reservation for two suites with a military discount.  I had to cancel one suite but I wanted to keep the second suite. Somehow BOTH suites were canceled. I just happened to call the hotel, to let them know that my sister (and gave her name) would be checking in before I would arrive. That's when I found out that BOTH suites were cancled and I didn't have a reservation at all. The sweet girl at the desk (? Melissia ?) reinstated the suite I needed but did not give me back the military discount. Upon checkout I asked about it and was told that needed to be done when making the reservation. Speaking to the Manager on duty, he said he would give me a 30% voucher for the next time I stayed at Anaheim Desert Inn. I did not realize until we were on the freeway headed home, that
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great trip to Disneyland with a toddler
Summary: The rooms are nothing special but are adequate. We like the small suite - the extra room in front with door offers a buffer to noise. We were able to come back to the room due to the proximity to the room for our 2-yr old to nap and then easily head back in for a nice evening. The fireworks are visible form the rooftop which is nice except when people smoke up there. Breakfast is not that great - very basic and the juice is not very good.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed in a C3 family suite with a sofa bed (room 305). We could not use the sofa bed for the kids because it would not support the weight of the 6 year old . Paid for a C3 suite but could only use it as a C2 suite. The rest of the experience was fantastic though.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This location was spot on for Disneyland. The staff was experienced, helpful, and overall just wonderful.  We had 10 in our party, we stayed in the Family suite, it had plenty of space, a master suite, with 2 queens, the living area has 2 queens, and a queen sleeper.  room was clean.  room is close to the road so you hear early morning traffic, but it didn't bother us at all.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: friendly, across the street from disney entrance, recommended property
Summary: Our room had two double beds -  with mini fridge and microwave.  Hotel offers breakfast which has a variety of fruit - cereals including oatmeal pasteries and hard boiled eggs. Rooms as very spacious.   Hotel  has an indoor pool with whirlpool - but it was not very hot which is good for the kids.  Laundry facilities are available at a cost at the hotel.  I would stay here again and recommend this to future travellors.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I appreciate the cleanliness of my room and the comfort of my bed.  Room was equipped with iron, ironing board, microwave, mini fridge and coffee pot!  The parking per day is only $9.00 - much cheaper than parking at Disneyland!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great stay and view of the fireworks!!!
Summary: We were at the hotel on a rainy night and still had a great time , very close to Disneyland, only across the street, nice continental breakfast, great time would stay again , check in was at 3pm and got in on time, room was great for the family of 5. They have a indoor pool that we did not use this time but have before. The parking is tight and did have a car parked in the way when we were going to leave but it was easy to get a bellman to move it.
Manager Response: We appreciate taking the time to provide us with your feedback about your stay, we are glad that you enjoyed our amenities and our convenient location. We look forward to your next stay.  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Every 6 months we go to Disneyland and this is the ONLY place we stay, not only is it convenient it's clean the staff are friendly and we've been going here for years. The breakfast is good, it's a little more than continental but its enough to get your day going. The Williams family recommends this hotel highly!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Just steps away from Disneyland. Plenty of room. Fairly quiet, except for a loud elevator. Clean rooms and comfortable beds. Parking was kind of a mess. Pool is tiny with a view of the parking lot. Stay here if you are spending all of your time at Disneyland and a super close place to crash.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is perfect if you are going to Disneyland, just a quick 5 minute walk and you are at the gates.  It is very clean and has everything you need to make your trip more enjoyable.  Grab a quick continental breakfast which is included, and you are on your way to Disney.  The room we stayed in had  2 queen beds and a sofa sleeper, which was perfect for a family of 5.  We loved it and would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This property is a great alternative to staying at the high-priced hotel on Disney's property.  Rooms are clean, several off-park dining choices are available, and the Parks, including Downtown Disney are right across the street.  There's no ambiance - Its just a hotel, parking lot and an indoor pool -- but all the attractions are across the street.  In my opinion, this is the best of the properties across the street.  Over the decades, I've stayed in almost all the properties that surround Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Very competitive prices, close to Disneyland.
Summary: We've stayed here since 2002 whenever we go to Disneyland. Convenient location very affordable compared to other motels in the area. The only negative is that you can only park one car per room, including the larger suites.
Manager Response: Hi Nita L,  Thank you for your continued patronage throughout the years and for taking the time to share your feedback. We do limit parking on our smaller rooms, however our bigger suites can park up to two vehicles each due to our limited space in parking. Thank you again for your visit and we hope to see you soon again.  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: A great place to stay close to the main gate of Disneyland
Summary: We love the closeness to the main entrance of Disneyland.  The rooms and air are very clean, good for people with respiratory allergies.  The people at the front desk are pleasant and excellently helpful.  The mattresses could be more comfortable.  The breakfast is minimal but ok.
Manager Response: Hello bbdn796,  Thank you for staying with us recently and for your awesome feedback. We are all glad that you enjoyed your stay and our comfortable beds. Give us a ring when you are ready to book your next trip to the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: This is the second time we've used this hotel. We love the closeness to Disneyland, and the rooms are clean and comfortable. The staff is generally helpful, anytime we have interacted with them. We were able to park a little early before check in. I have no hesitation recommending this hotel for anyone going to Disney.
Manager Response: Hello derrickbright,  We are glad that you stay with us a second time and that your experience was awesome enough to recommend to family and friends for their stays. Thank you very much for your patronage and we look forward to your next visit.  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Nice location and in the end that is what you are paying for.  Hotel needs updating and new beds as they were really hard.  Pool area was really small and not a great location.  Breakfast was okay but could use a better selection.  In the end our stay was just okay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Always enjoy our stay at the Desert Inn and Suites. Beds are a bit tough but rooms are clean and the front desk is always helpful. Can not beat the location!! I was a little disappointed that I had booked this room 10 months in advance and had asked for a quiet room option as we have little ones that sleep late and come back to the room for naps...the room they gave me was directly in front of the elevator and an ice machine! I realize they can not guarantee anything but I would consider this to be the exact opposite of what I asked for. It was a bit of a let down especially since I had booked and made the request so far in advance. We have stayed here mutliple times and already have future stay booked with them...hoping for a little better room choice.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The rooms were nice and clean, comfortable...and a great location to Disneyland park, Breakfast could be improved upon somewhat...but other than that loved staying there!  Loved how you can get adjoining rooms with family to share.  This worked well with our big group...

Summary: Literally across the street from Disneyland. You can't beat that. Plus, at the time I booked, it had the best price of all the hotels around there.  I would recommend this hotel because the location is fantastic.

Summary: We chose a Parlor suite (essentially two adjoining rooms) for our family of five and my parents - 7 people in the room. It was definitely fine. But the hide-a-bed in the sofa was HORRENDOUS. Not that they are usually lovely, but....   In the Parlor suite, these is only one fridge/microwave. If you were to get two rooms without the adjoining door, you'd have two of each.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel is somewhat dated and the free breakfast is average (a few pastries, muffins, bread, apples, oranges, cereal, and hard boiled eggs), but the price for the location is great.  It took less than 6 minutes to get from our hotel door to the security check at Disneyland.  My kids loved the pool, although the hot tub wasn't working the second night we tried to use it.  The maid took our towels and forgot to replace them the last night.  Had it not been 4:30 a.m., we would have called to get towels, but we were in a hurry to beat the traffic out of L.A., so we just used the hand towels.  Otherwise, the housekeeper did a great job cleaning around all our clutter.  We stayed on the second floor towards the end of the parking lot, and we had no problems with noise.  Overall, I

Summary: Everything about our stay here went well.  The staff were friendly, the room was spacious and clean, and the location is marvelously close to Disneyland.  At the end of a 12-hour day at the parks, it truly makes a difference to walk across the street and go to bed rather than mess with shuttles or walk down the block.  We watched the fireworks from our window and didn't even need to go to the viewing deck.  It was incredibly quiet despite being booked at full capacity, and the beds/pillows were very comfortable.  They have lockers available for $1.50, which were a blessing when our plane arrived four hours before check-in.  Breakfast was somewhat lacking (boiled eggs, toast, cereal, and pastries) and check-in was a bit chaotic with everyone arriving at once, but overall
Manager Response: Dear Sarah R,  Thank you for taking the time to complete this review for TripAdvisor.  We are happy to hear that you enjoyed our hotel and accommodations. Summary: We travel quite a bit and have frequently stayed at the Desert Inn for almost two decades! The staff is top notch! Rooms are clean and the complimentary breakfast is great! We usually get a scooter if my Mother travels with us and the front desk staff, especially Alexis, is always making sure all is well with any rentals and asks for updates on how our stay is going. Management, Teo, runs a sharp ship and we appreciate it. Over
Manager Response: Dear Yesterdays50s,  Let us start by thanking you for taking the time to complete this review for TripAdvisor. Summary: stayed at the hotel since it it across the street from disneyland. was able to go back and forth from disneyland and hotel without issues and rest for a while. staff were very friendly. hotel was clean.

Other than scratchy sheets I've always been pleased with the location, cleanliness and affordability. Unfortunately the room I got was opposite the stairwell and elevator so it was incredibly noisy unlike any noise I've ever experienced on any trips anywhere. To make matters worse we were also right above the breakfast room do more noise and then the garbage trucks came sat morning at 6:15am making more noise for an hour. If you don't want this noise avoid room 201 at all costs. Had I known this I would not have requested a room up close. Would
Manager Response: Hi MomLovesDisney,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. Should you decide to stay with us again, we would take that opportunity to be of better service to you and your family.  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: I need to sleep at night so I can enjoy Disneyland with my family. This hotel has comfortable and clean rooms. We have stayed here every year for many years! We had fun and the breakfast was good. The gift shop had everything and the parking crew were excellent!
Manager Response: Dear Ojedahouse,  Thank you so much for your review here on TripAdvisor.  We appreciate your time and positive feedback.  We are glad that we could accommodate you and your family!  We hope to have you again really soon!  Thank you for choosing the Anaheim Desert Inn & Suites for your stay and all your stays here in Anaheim!

Summary: We make an annual group trip to Disneyland for the holidays and always stay at the Anaheim Desert Inn and Suites. Due to are larger party (usually 7-9 people) it is the perfect set up. We usually get a family suite and it fits us all comfortably. This time we noticed that there have been some upgrades as far as bedding and shower curtains, etc. - all added to the experience. Everyone from front desk staff to valet and housekeeping are very friendly and helpful. Honestly, you can't beat the location either. Directly across the street which makes it easy to come back to rest for a bit before heading back to the parks. Highly recommend this hotel, especially for larger groups or families. We'll definitely be back!
Manager Response: Dear Crystal P,  Thank you for taking the time to complete this TripAdvisor review.  We are delighted to hear that you always choose us for your Anaheim trips.  Our staff works around the clock to ensure our guests are satisfied with their stay.  We hope to see you again really soon!  Thank you for choosing the Anaheim Desert Inn & Suites for your stays!

Summary: We stay at Desert Inn and Suites three or four times a year.  It is right across the street for the main entrance to Disneyland, so it is just a short walk to get there.  The rooms are clean and have plenty of room.  They have enlarged the breakfast room fairly recently, and it is much nicer and roomier than before. The parking lot is small, but they offer valet parking that works pretty well.
Manager Response: Dear Diane L,  Thank you for your time it took you to complete this TripAdvisor review.  We are delighted that you enjoy staying with us as we enjoy having you!  Our location is very convenient for our guests, especially after a long day at the park.  We hope to have you again really soon!  Thank you for choosing the Anaheim Desert Inn & Suites for your stay and all your future stays!

Summary: This is a clean hotel that is directly across the street from Disneyland.  We stay here 3-4 times per year.  There is a free continental breakfast ( hard boiled eggs, bagels, toast, cereal and oatmeal)  in the morning which is nice before your Disney day.  This hotel isn't fancy but we are always happy with the price and location.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for completing this review for TripAdvisor and we appreciate your time and positive feedback.  We are happy that you enjoy our location and the cleanliness of our establishment!  We hope to have you back again really soon!  Thank you for choosing the Anaheim Desert Inn & Suites for your stay and all your future stays!

Summary: We have stayed here for many years. Since the early 90's. It really is our home away from home. The staff is warm, caring, welcoming. The rooms very clean. The breakfast is perfect. With a nice selection to choice from.
Manager Response: Dear Teddybearhi1999,  Let us begin by thanking you for taking time out to complete this review for TripAdvisor.  We are delighted to be your second home and that you truly enjoy your experience here at our hotel!  We hope to have you back again really soon!  Thank you for choosing the Anaheim Desert Inn & Suites for your stay and to be your second home!!!

Summary: Right across street from main entrance to park. Staff was great and very polite. Room was spacious, clean, and quiet. Walking distance from park was a plus. Great price for t 2 room suite. View from room was great being on top floor.
Manager Response: Dear Mario G,  Thank you for taking the time to complete this review for TripAdvisor.  We appreciate your positive feedback.  Our staff works around the clock to ensure our guests are satisfied with their experience.  We are delighted that you found our establishment to your liking and do hope to have you back again really soon!  Thank you for choosing the Anaheim Desert Inn & Suites for your stay!

Summary: This hotel couldn't be in a better place. My friend recommended it as she often stays here when she goes to Disneyland, and I was very happy with it. We didn't get in until late, and we left early, so I can't say much in detail, but I also have no complaints. The valet parking is easy and inexpensive compared to some other places nearby. The only negative thing I can say is that while the shutters look nice, but they don't block out as much light, so the hall lights were shining right in.
Manager Response: Dear Ejstorm,  Thank you for taking the time to complete this review for TripAdvisor.  We appreciate the feedback you are providing our guests and staff.  We will make sure to address the issue with the shutters as soon as possible.  We are delighted that you loved our location and do hope to have you again really soon!  Thank you for choosing the Anaheim Desert Inn & Suites for your stay!

Summary Heading: The hotel was perfectly located to walk over to Downtown Disney and the Parks.
Summary: Our Room was a standard Double Queen Room.  The beds were hard and the sheets were rough.  We had to ask for more pillows and blankets because one bed didn't have any blanket on it and the pillows were too flat for us.  It was nice to have a Microwave and Refrigerator in the room.  The hair dryer was not working properly so I'm glad that I brought my own.  The Valet/Parking Staff was Amazing. they always greeted us as we came back from Dinner or the Parks with a very warm "Welcome Back".  They were very eager to help with loading our cars, etc.
Manager Response: Dear JSFaulkner,  Thank you for taking the time to complete a TripAdvisor review! Summary: My family and I spent 4 nights in October during the Halloween parties. I actually planned the dates around what was available at the Desert Inn and Suites.  We had a Family Suite for 7 people and were very comfortable.  The rooms were clean and the housekeeping staff kept our supply of towels, pillows,coffee etc full...even delivering late at night when we requested extra supplies. We didn't take advantage of the breakfast room but we did look in and found it to well stocked with basic breakfast items. The Desert Inn and Suites will always be my first choice in hotels when I come to the parks.  Staff is the best! and always willing to do what they can to make our stay amazing.  Already have another stay booked.  Also a great view of the fireworks from the roof area. Thanks to

We hope to see you again really soon!  Thank you For choosing the Anaheim Desert Inn & Suites for your stay and future stays!

Summary: Room was spacious and very clean! Love the clean shutters on the windows instead of dirty curtains!  Located directly across the street from the main entrance, and next to a 24 hour Denny's restaurant, makes this hotel extremely convenient! Would recommend this hotel to everyone!
Manager Response: Dear Guest   Thank you for completing a TripAdvisor review. Your feedback is truly appreciated and we are glad you enjoyed your stay!   Thank you for choosing Anaheim Desert Inn! Management Team

Summary: Great price, great location, very clean rooms, friendly staff and a decent free breakfast. There wasn't enough parking so they offered a free valet service. Staff was all very helpful and fast. We had a great experience and plan to make this our go-to Disneyland hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Stephanie S  Thank you for your kind words here on TripAdvisor. We are glad you found your stay quite well. We hope you found a vacation home for your Disney Trips here at the Anaheim Desert Inn. Valet service and our staff is always working hard to make sure you enjoy your stay with us.   Hope to see you soon! Management Team

Summary: The room was great, beds were big and comfortable, clean, the bathroom was good size. There was to my surprise a small refrigerator, microwave, and a room safe. The location is right across the street from Disneyland, excellent!! The price was very reasonable, and the staff were very friendly. The only thing that I didn't like was the parking, there wasn't enough, but they do make up for it and offer free valet parking.
Manager Response: Dear Suzanne  Let me begin by thanking you for taking the time to complete a TripAdvisor review. We are glad you enjoyed your stay and enjoyed the ammenites we offer here at Anaheim Desert Inn.  Our Front desk works very hard to ensure our guests with great service from the moment you walk in, so I will forward your kind words to our staff. We hope to see you again for your next Disney trip! Management Team

Summary: You can't get any closer to the Disneyland Parks. The rooms are clean and quiet.  The beds were very comfortable,  We choose a two room suite with a bath and a half.  The vanities and sinks were separate from the toilets and that worked well for us.
Manager Response: Dear Jad1230  Thank you for your kind words here on TripAdvisor. We are glad that you enjoyed your stay with us.   We hope to see you again soon for your next Disney trip!  Management Team

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disneyland vacation
Summary: I love that this hotel is right across the street from Disneyland. This hotel is clean, well kept, with comfortable beds and reasonable pricing. They also served a good continental breakfast (cold cereals, milk, juice, fruit, toast, hard boiled eggs, mini muffins, danish or bagel). They were willing to store our luggage when we arrived before check-in time, so that we could go to the park that day.
Manager Response: Dear Shanna,  Thank you for sharing your positive experience here on TripAdvisor. We appreciate your kind words.  We hope to see you again for your next Disney trip!  -Management team

Summary: Basic Hotel, but Peter is always very helpful.  Good prices.    thanks for taking care of us peter.  Comes with daily breakfast which is nice.  Super close to the Disney park, so it is really convenient.  Like like this place.
Manager Response: Dear Rajnish  Thank you for your wonderful comments. I will forward your kind words to Peter.  We are glad you choose us for your Disney getaway.   -Management Team

Summary: The location really is perfect. Directly across from the main park entrance. And all the staff, especially the parking staff, was so incredibly nice and really helpful. It's not a 5 star hotel by any means so my criticism isn't because it's out dated.  Our only complaints were just that the room wasn't as clean as we have liked, especially the second day. It seemed like the bed was sort of made and new soap was put in the room but that was it. Not a huge deal to us but other people may want the room cleaned more thoroughly.  The biggest issue for us was the pillows, the worst pillows we've ever had in a hotel. If you're driving (we did) then bring your own pillow and the problem is solved.  We'll stay again but bring our pillows from home ;)

This information helps us to address our problem areas and improve our product and service.  Thank you for choosing the Anaheim Desert Inn and hope to see you in the near future.  -Management Team

Summary: This property is just across the road from the entrance to Disneyland - it was so convenient we could easily pop back for a short time to rest the littlies then go back for more fun!!  We had access to both parks so the days were very long 8am till midnight and the convenience was fantastic.

Summary Heading: Terrific value and right across the street
Summary: I think we got a great value. Our room was clean with plenty of supplies to meet our needs. We got free breakfast each morning. The price for all of this was low compared to staying at our usual (Candy Cane Inn) and the location cannot be beat. When we were exhausted after a long day at the park, we didn't have to wait for a packed shuttle or walk another mile. Just walked across the street.

Summary: Solid 4 stars. I requested a quiet room and was accommodated with an upgrade at no extra charge. Location is as good as it gets. Service was good. Only missing the 5th star because the property is somewhat dated. Still the furnishings were adequate and clean. With a complete overhaul of the furnishings, this is a 5 star property. Location and price easily make up for that though.

Summary: The best place to be which is next door to Disneyland! Very convenient. Room is spacious! We got spoiled with our room and everything in it. Very family oriented. Staff is helpful and very friendly especially the Valet service for parking is excellent!

Summary: Anaheim Desert Inn and Suites is our #1 hotel we stay out whenever we go to Disneyland. Teo Huerta (Manager) and staff always greets with a smile and warm welcome. check in and check out is a breeze. if there is an issue.. the staff will make sure it is addressed in a timely matter.  Rooms are clean, neat and comfortable.   although we spend most of our day at Disney, ADIS is just across the street from the main walkway and entrance to disney. great food places around it as well. the breakfast items are basic and simple but cant complain..its delicious!  we look forward to staying at ADIS again. see you in February 2017!

Summary Heading: A convenient and location to Disneyland
Summary: It is a great location to for Naptime from Disneyland.  Nothing overly AMAZING about this hotel, but the fact the it is reasonably priced, can house my large family in a parlor suite and is a convenient location from the Happiest Place on Earth makes it out GO-TO hotel when visiting Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Our favorite place to stay when we go to Disneyland!
Summary: Friendly hotel right across the street from Disneyland. We have stayed here multiple times and will stay here again. Family friendly and walking distance to Disneyland is great. Having a fridge and a microwave in your room is also a plus. Parking can be crowded on the upper level but that didn't matter with the free valet parking in the garage's lower level.

Summary Heading: Great Option VERY close to Disneyland!
Summary: We stayed in a Parlor Suite for 7 nights at the end of October. Overall we were pleased with our stay and Desert Inn will remain on our list of hotels to price check for future Disneyland visits. On our visit our party consisted of 4 - Mom & Dad, 5 year old & 2 year old. Parking is $9 extra per night (plus taxes) and parking is VERY limited for the number of rooms. There is a valet option if there are no spaces.  Cribs are an additional $10 per night plus taxes. The cribs are not "Standard" size cribs (smaller than your crib at home, but slightly bigger than a pack n play).  You may want to bring a breathable bumper if you have a baby who likes to put their feet through the slats.    I know I've read reviews about hotels adding these extra fees on top of room rates, but in my
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good price for the location, right across from main gate
Summary: First of all, I feel like we need to mention that this hotel emailed me to ask if we liked the hotel.  When you click yes, it takes you to tripadvisor to leave a review but, when you click no it takes you to a separate form that I'm assuming would go straight to the hotel.  Smart marketing but I can see how it would mess with accurate reviews on the property for those who wanted to make a warning or a complaint.  Anyway, my real review.  The location was unbeatable which was awesome for our family that has kids with special needs.  We knew we would be back and forth and waiting for a shuttle or walking farther would be too much for them. We didn't use the indoor pool or hot tub. . No time. Breakfast was good. The closeness of Disneyland was incredible. I will definitely stay here again.

Summary: The staff at the front desk upon check in & the valet were very nice. The gal at the front desk upon check out didn't look or act like she was happy to be there, but 1 out of 3 wasn't bad I guess.  I notice my son's feet would get black underneath after walking barefoot on the carpet after a while so I told him to always use his slippers because it was kind of gross. The water pressure for the shower sucked.   But otherwise, the stay was enjoyable. We usually stay at the Park Vue in & wasnt able to because we tried to make reservations too late. We'll no doubt go to Park Vue again the next time but this hotel is a great backup if needed.

Manager Response: Hello  nikerbokers,  All of us at the Anaheim Desert Inn take your comments very seriously and are disappointed that we did not meet your expectations. Summary: This is our favorite place to stay. The proximity to the parks is wonderful! The rooms are clean and spacious, although soundproofing could be better. Summary Heading: Cheap place for families to stay right across the street from Disneyland
Summary: This is not a luxury hotel, the rooms are dated, the mattresses aren't the best, and the breakfast is toast, boiled eggs, off brand cereal and tang.   That said, we stay here every time we visit Disney. They are literally right across the street. They have tons of rooms that accommodate families larger than 4 at great prices. They have a fridge in the room. They have a pool and hot (well warm at least) tub. Have I mentioned they are right across the street from Disneyland?

Summary: The rooms are very clean and we love the room the suites have!  Fridge and Microwave in rooms make having take out very esay. Walking to the park is so quick, you are right across the the road! Breakfast is very simple but it worked for my family of 7!

Summary: The location is great for visiting Disneyland, and our room was very quiet; however, the front desk staff were not very welcoming, and the free breakfast is not very good.  We really did not care for the parking situation.  On our last day at the hotel, we were coming back from breakfast to checkout, and there was a car parked directly behind ours.  If they had not been unloading their vehicle or if we had been just a few minutes later, we would have been stuck there until they decided to return.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I would say that the hotel falls between 3 and 4 stars.   The hotel was adequate for our 4-night stay and I would likely return on future visits to Disneyland. We so appreciated the proximity to the park, especially when we were tired at the end of each day. Front desk staff were responsive in person and on the phone; when housekeeping failed to replenish tissues and towels one day, they sent someone up within 10 minutes of our request. Housekeeping otherwise did a good job. Beds were okay, but my sleep was occasionally disturbed by footsteps from above, sounds of running pipes, and voices from outside. The noise wasn't excessive, but don't expect blissful silence either.   Qute obviously, the hotel was packed with families and children. The hotel was full when we stayed, and we
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to leave a review here on TripAdvisor. Summary: Stayed here in a group of 5 for Disneyland's Halloween party event, recently.   We stayed in one of the family parlor suites, with 2 rooms and 2 bathrooms. The breakfast was nothing special (cereal, muffins, hard boiled eggs, toast), but we appreciated that it was included   Can't beat the location to the parks...right across the street.   My only complaint is that the front desk staff could have been a bit friendlier.   Everyone there seemed to be really harried both when I checked in and checked out...basically, they performed their functions efficiently, but weren't particularly welcoming. Summary: Stayed in a a Family suite.  Room is basic with plenty of room.  Beds are average at best.  Room was clean when we arrived and cleaned very well daily.  Hotel is basic and perfect for families that are not going to be in the room anyway!  The best thing about this hotel is the location.  It is right across the street from the entrance to Disneyland.  There are a lot of places to eat in the area also.  The only draw back is the noise.  A lot of families with kids and delivery trucks in the morning.  Run the AC while you sleep, it helps drown out the noise.  In all, a great place to stay for the price.  I would stay again.

Since check out is 11am, they have no way to get an update from housekeeping until almost 4 hours later??? So I asked to call me when the room was ready.  So, I went to lunch and came back and tried again. Got the same answer. So, went to wait/rest in the car until 3pm. No call, so at 245pm, I go back to the lobby.  And lo and behold...there's a huge line of
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very convenient and easy walk to Gates of Disneyland.  If you just want a place to lay your head, this is it.  If you are looking for other activities.....you might find a nicer place to stay, but you will have to pay the $$ for it.

Summary: Room was clean and comfortable.  Had family suite for 8 people, three of which were under 7 yrs old.  Nice and close to disneyland which makes it super easy with young kids.We stay there every other year for our family trip.
