At first I resented the fact that we were located on the top floor (5th) but I quickly learned the reason why, it was less noisy for those smaller groups on the lower floors who wanted peace and quiet. The next thing was the view we got the next day as we woke up to a day of exploring Disneyland, it was a nice view of the
Manager Response: Hello Ernesto A,  I appreciate you choosing our hotel as your home away from home while you stopped and enjoyed the Disneyland Parks. I'm glad to hear that our hotel met your needs and the room was well suited for your family. Thank you for all your kind words and praises and we hope that you enjoy your journey exploring the rest of the US of A.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: The location of this hotel can not be beat for a trip to Disneyland. Room was clean bed were okay (I had a foam mattress pad for the bed). Breakfast is basic (pastry, apple, orange, bread, bagel, cereal, juice, coffee) but included in the room charge.
Manager Response: Hi DisneyChrista,  I want to first of all thank you for staying with us and for sharing your feedback with us. I'm happy to hear that you had a great stay and we hope to see you again in the near future.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: It was very nice to be so close to Disneyland. The main draw of this hotel was how quickly we could get to the park. The rooms were clean, overall. There was a weird mildew-y smell in one of the rooms (we stayed in a parlor suite) but it wouldn't keep us from coming back. My family enjoyed the breakfast. We could hear people making their way back to their rooms when the park closed, but it wasn't as bad as I thought it would be. My biggest complaint is that the trash trucks were in very early in the morning (6:30a) and made A LOT of noise sporadically for about an hour. It woke us up every day, but since we were anxious to get to the park we didn't mind too much. We would stay here again and would recommend it to our friends who want a basic motel close to the park that includes
Manager Response: Hi mmrbci,  Thank you for your kind words and for staying with us. I would appreciate if you could contact us and provide us more information about your room as this was not reported while you were staying with us, we would like to take immediate action on the smell. Anaheim Waste Management trucks come in after 7:30am every morning, they are a little loud and the noise last for 15 minutes tops, but if you can provide further information on your experience, it would be of great help as we can forward that complaint to the City. We sure hope to see you very soon again.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: My family, with two girls and wife, enjoyed our stay in the parlor suite with the sofa bed in a second room. The room was large and roomy. It was close to Disneyland, which made it very nice to be able to come back for a couple hours and rest before going back to the park.Though we didn't use it, it was nice that there was a rooftop view of the fireworks at Disney.
Manager Response: Hi derrickbright,  I really appreciate you sharing your experience with us. It's awesome to hear that our rooms and our location makes all the difference in the world when walking all day inside the parks. On your next visit, please visit our viewing deck and the fireworks show.  Best,  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland, Clean and Functional
Summary: Shortest walk from the park we have ever had.  We could easily walk back for a short nap mid day every day.  We stayed in room 318 a double queen room.  Room was clean and pretty quiet.  Bathroom was clean.  Carpet was clean and vacuumed but could have used a good edging.  (I am very particular about cleanliness and I was satisfied with this room at least.)  Water pressure was a bit low but still ok.  Furniture was fine except top drawer of dresser was broken and hard to open.  Beds are basic hotel beds and not as comfortable as I would have liked, my granddaughter slept fine however.  I travel with my own sheets which I just slip over the existing bedding, but next time I will ask housekeeping for a could of extra blankets to put under them.  Curtains are wood slats and so the
Manager Response: Hi Carol I,  We appreciate very much for staying with us and for sharing your in debt review of your stay. I'm glad to hear that our services and amenities were to your liking and will look into your suggestions so that we can improve our guest experience, thank you again and we hope to see you again very soon.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Nothing fancy but clean and functional
Summary: None of the hotels in the block directly across from Disneyland are amazing but it came as the most commonly recommended. I felt the hotel was clean and quiet which is all we really needed. We were able to come back and rest mid day every day of our Disney adventure and didn't have any major hiccups with the hotel. We were not allowed to park our second vehicle in the lot so it was a bit of a pain having to shuttle our other party members to and from their car. The morning breakfast alternated between toast and bagels with hard boiled eggs and a few cereal options. My biggest complaint was I didn't like how beat up the furniture was. It looked like it was purchased at a garage sale. The couch and carpet had a few stains on it but I did feel like it was at least clean and smelled
Manager Response: Hello Rebecca B,  We appreciate the time you took to share your stay feedback with us and the TripAdvisor community. Parking is a bit tight due to our property location and we do limit parking to one vehicle for the smaller units so that we can provide and guarantee one parking space to all of our guests. Our furniture is one of the hotel areas where we are looking into improving very soon. Thank you for staying with us and we hope that you'll stay with us again in the future.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We are always happy here for the convenience of staying across the street from the parks. Rooms are always clean, staff friendly. The parking is the only challenge. But they are always willing to do free valet when their lot is full, which is usual. But at least they jeep your car safe and don't try to charge for this.
Manager Response: Hello Karin A,  We want to thank you for choosing the Anaheim Desert Inn on your last visit to the Disneyland Resort. We are pleased to hear that your stay was great and we hope to welcome you again soon.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: The closest I've ever stayed to Disneyland.  I've been coming out to Anahiem every year for the past 15 years and was very impressed to find this hotel was so affordable for the location.  I spend most my time at the park so I don't want to pay a lot for my room.  The room was clean and very pleasant.  The staff was very helpful and friendly as well.  This will definitely be my go to in the future!
Manager Response: Greetings Trish S,  We are thrilled to know that you enjoyed your stay very much and for choosing us over the multiple other hotel choices out there. Our staff is happy to hear that cleanliness is and friendliness is appreciated by our guests and that it's a couple of the reasons why our guests keep coming back to us. Thank you for your kind words and we hope to see you soon again.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Overall a great value, very close to maingate at Disneyland. After a long day at Disneyland it's great to see the hotel right as you walk out of the park. No buses, cabs, or shuttles to take. Denny's and Ihop are right next store if you get hungry after a long day.
Manager Response: Hi Mike,  Thank you for paying the Anaheim Desert Inn a visit recently. We are happy to hear that your stay was great and our location made our park visits a breeze. We look forward to welcoming you back soon.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: The best thing about Desert Inn is the location. This trip my daughter and I had a parlor suite (upgraded), which was nice.  However the walls were VERY thin and we could hear the couple next door fussing with their rambunctious kids in the morning and at night, which was very annoying.  The year before we stayed in a C1 suite (room 199 to be exact) with our whole family. That room was wonderful. It is the first room overlooking the front entrance and was very quiet even though it faced the street.  It also took us 6 minutes to walk from the exit gate of Disneyland park to the door of our room.  If you have a large group I would request that room. With the sofa bed it sleeps up to 10.   We were on the 5th floor this time and it was right near the fireworks viewing deck.  That
Manager Response: Hi Jaynell D,  We are glad to hear that your stay was great and that our Family Deluxe Suite was to your liking. Our viewing deck will give you an awesome view of the Disneyland fireworks on the days that you do not want to be in the middle of the crowds. Thank you for your kind comments and we will definitely see you on your next trip to the Disneyland Resort.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: I was able to get a good last minute deal on this hotel so I wasn't sure what to expect.  I was very pleasantly surprised with this establishment.  We were given a room in the back courtyard area which was extra nice and quiet.  The decor of the property is well kept and maintained and the plantation shutter are a nice touch.  Having the Disneyland entrance just across the street is the best part.  I was inside of California Adventure in the evening and was able to run to get my jacket in our hotel room and was able to be back to my friends in 20 minutes.
Manager Response: Hi Joe R,  We are pleased to hear that we exceeded your expectations on your last stay with us. Your feedback is welcomed as it inspire our staff to aim for higher standards and an overall performance.   Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: This hotel was very accommodating for a very large school group we brought. It's in a great location and the rooms were clean. The water pressure is low and the shower heads are short. The continental breakfast is basically bread, apples and oranges. Overall it's a good place for a decent price.
Manager Response: Hi Tabbatha,  It was a pleasure working with you and your group. We are happy to hear that our hotel met your needs and we hope to see you again next year.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: small rooms but clean and comfy and perfect for families that just want a clean room to shower and sleep after spending all day at Disneyland. I've stayed at the more expensive hotels with all the extras and you are so tired from being in the park you never really get to enjoy the extras you are paying for. This has been my experience when my family goes to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Hi San F,  Our hotel is definitely family oriented as we have a wide variety of rooms and suites that accommodate up to 10 guests. We are happy that our hotel and location make your daily visits to the parks a breeze. Thank you and we hope to get the opportunity to host your vacation on your next trip to the Disneyland Resort.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for the price
Summary: Very clean and comfortable. Great location to Disneyland. Good eating spots such as Tony Romas, Denny's and IHOP located next door. Short walk to Disneyland, California Adventure and Downtown Disney with its shops and restaurants.
Manager Response: Hi Michael A,  Thank you for staying with us and I am glad to hear that our location was to your convenience and hope to see you again when your travels bring you back to the area.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Pro:  great location close to Disneyland, clean room, reasonably well updated for an older property  Con:  paper thin walls, uncomfortable beds, people under 4' 6" will appreciate the placement of the showerhead - others not so much, minimal continental breakfast, spotty Wi-Fi although it is free  Compared to others in the area, this is a solid choice if you are going to Disneyland and are on a budget, so 4 stars instead of 3.
Manager Response: Hi rbh0123,  Thank you for staying with us and for sharing your experience. Our guests' feedback is very important to us and will bring your concerns to a discussion with our management team so that we can find ways of improving our guests' experience. We hope to see you again soon.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Obviously it's close proximity to Disneyland is great. The room was clean, and the employees were very friendly and nice - the best hotel employee experience I've had in a long time. The beds weren't very comfortable, and the shower water pressure was horrible along with a shower head height built for children. I'm giving it four stars because of the cleanliness and friendliness of the staff.
Manager Response: hi JohnnyKai,  Thank you for your review  and for trying our hotel. I'm glad to hear that your stay was great. We will use your review to help us provide a better experience for our future guests. Thank you and I sure hope that you would give us another opportunity to serve you.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: I wanted to love this place. On paper, it's great! Super close to Disneyland, free breakfast, indoor pool, family sized rooms, etc. however, there were multiple things that bothered me. We stayed in a parlor family suite, which is basically 2 connecting rooms, with no door leading out of one. We arrived at 3:45 and along with others, had to wait until exactly 4 to get our room. I'm not sure how all the rooms are magically ready at exactly 4, but so be it. I was annoyed that they charge $10 per night for a crib, as well. Internet is slow and breakfast is just a fruit, hard boiled egg and bread. We had to supplement with our own food. We really enjoyed the pool and location. No complaints there! We did have bees in our room. We were able to kill them and didn't see them again, my
Manager Response: Hello Natalie P,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. Please except my apologies if you experienced anything less than exceptional. Your experience was unique and does not reflect the overall quality of the Desert Inn. Should you decide to stay with us again, we would take that opportunity to be of better service to you and your family.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: this is my second time staying here and i love the place. right across from the street from Disneyland. Rooms are clean with great house keeping. Friendly staff! nice continental breakfast with plenty of choices.
Manager Response: Hi tcsmith81,  I'm glad to hear that your stay was awesome on this second time around, we sure hope that you'll come back to us each time you return to the Disneyland Resort.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Very close to Disneyland, it was a quick walk. Employees were friendly. Room was clean and well kept but not fancy. If you plan to spend your time at Disneyland this is a good choice. Free Breakfast is just cereal and toast with coffee /juice. Rooms have both refrigerator and microwave
Manager Response: Hi Nancy H,  I'm happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay and that we met your expectations. I appreciate your kind words and we will see you on your next visit to Disneyland.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: I've stayed at the Desert Inn for years (5-10 times per year) and have never had a bad experience.  They are super close to the parks, clean and friendly.  This most recent trip included two families with a toddler so we had a family suite.  Plenty of room for playing and a great view of the fireworks show!   I always recommend this hotel to my friends and expect to stay many more times this year and in years to come!
Manager Response: Hi iamgoofete,  Thank you for your awesome review, we are glad to hear that you've enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for being a loyal customer and see you again soon when you visit the parks at the Disneyland Resort.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Comfortable, spacious for the family Disney trip
Summary: We had the C2 parlor family suite.  It was very spacious, which made it comfortable for the whole family, and cheaper then getting two regular rooms.  Location of the hotel can't be beat, just cross the street and you're at Disneyland!  Being comfortable and close to Disneyland made it easy to go back for an afternoon nap and rest time before heading back to Disneyland at night.  We've stayed at the Anabella previously, and to compare, the rooms there are nicer there but if given a choice I would go with Desert Inn for its location.  It is motel style, so you do hear people (and exited kids) walking by outside.  Breakfast is very basic: hard-boiled eggs, toast, oranges, apples, and cereal.  The pool is small and indoors (Anabella beats Desert Inn for the pool).  However, we did
Manager Response: Hi RaiTaku,  I'm glad you enjoyed one of our spacious suites, finding a big suite that will handle a good sized family is hard in Anaheim, specially being conveniently located across the street from Disneyland's main gate. Thank you for your kind words and we hope to see you again soon.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Maybe not a place to come and hang out in your room, but as a place to sleep in between your Disney adventures, who cares?  The location is about as near to the Disneyland and California Adventure main gates as you can get, which makes this a no brainer.  Combine that with a reasonable rate, and there is not doubt we would stay here again.  The room was clean, with two queens, a fridge, micro, etc.  The breakfast isn't great, but it suffices, and there are other options near by.
Manager Response: Hi Cathy S,  Thank you for sharing your awesome review with us. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and hope to see you when you again come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: So close to Disneyland! This place makes going back and forth a breeze. Some nights were a little crazy crossing the street with all the people that hang out on the corner, but that's nothing to do with the hotel. The price you pay here is fair for what you get. Older motel rooms that are kept clean. It is a little noisy, and having ajoining room doors doesn't help with that (next time I'd request a room that doesn't have one) We had one of the rooms with the sitting room where you can close the door. That helped block some noise from the walkway. Front desk staff was very nice and helpful. Very easy check-in and check-out. They have pay lockers for your bags if you'll be stay for the parks on your check-out day. Breakfast is not a plus here. Very generic/cheap breads, sliced
Manager Response: Hi travelsmiles4us,  I'm happy to hear that your stay was great and that you enjoyed our location, cleanliness, service and many other amenities that we provide. We thank you for your review and we cannot wait for your next stay!  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Rooms are comfortable and location cannot be beat!  parking can be a bit of a problem especially with larger vehicles.  The beds are comfortable.  The breakfast is not that great. There is an IHOP and Denny's right out the door. The location is one of he best in Anaheim for Disneyland.
Manager Response: Hi Ann T,  Thank you for your stay and for rating our hotel. Our parking can get busy, but our valet parking attendants will assist once self parking gets full. Our free continental breakfast is great if you want to stop by for a quick bite prior to heading to the parks. We thank you for giving us a try and we hope to see you again in the near future.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We've been staying at this motel since the early nineties. It's always clean and comfortable, and the prices are very good. The staff is very helpful and there is a pool on site. Ample parking. Many different places to eat , a movie theater and a nice mall located within easy walking distance
Manager Response: Denniswh73,  We appreciate you choosing our hotel as your home away from home when visiting the Disneyland Resort. I'm happy to hear that our accommodations and amenities are up to par and we look forward to many future stays.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Nice updates since I was here last. The bed seemed a little hard at first but I slept great on it. Loved quality of the sheets and new shutter window coverings. One thing that would make a nicer stay is better/healthier breakfast options. Can't get a better location. I'll be back!
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words, we are happy to hear that you loved our sheets and our window shutters. I appreciate your feedback on our breakfast and we hope to see you soon on your next trip to the Disneyland Resort.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Our Place To Stay at Disneyland
Summary: Of the hotels on Harbor this has been the most consistent for price and quality.  In the 10 years we have been bringing the kids to Disney, the Desert Inn has never failed to meet expectations. Sure, there are newer properties, there are cheaper places to stay (but not by much), and better equipped. We have tried them but always end up back here, it's just comfortable. There's never any problem they can't fix, the rooms are huge and can sleep up to 10, which we did one year, comfortably. Parking can be tight, but valet will take care of your car if you can't get a space. Breakfast is adequate, and the space is larger than other properties. The pool and hot tub are indoors, a bonus when traveling off season.  Only two problems I had this trip, they seem to have adopted the
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing The Desert Inn over the many hotels on Harbor Blvd. for the last 10 years. I'm ecstatic to hear that your stay have always been great. We appreciate the feedback and will use it to fine tune our operations, thank you again and we hope to see you soon.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: As always... Desert Inn and Suites never disappoints... we have always stayed here each time we come to visit Disneyland... Teo Huerta and staff are friendly and accomodating.. we have trips booked out the rest of the year to Disney and have reserved rooms with Desert Inn...our most recent stay 04.28.16 to 05.01.16..we checked out but then decided to stay another night...Teo was able to accomodate us and got us a room without any issues...will be back there in August!  Thanks TEO and Staff!
Manager Response: Hello Josh,  We do aspire to deliver a quality product and exceptional friendly service to each and every guest that stays with us. We look forward to having you stay with us again and thank you in advance for being a repeat guest. Kind regards!  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Decent hotel. Three stars max. Was under construction which it desperately needed. Protestors out front set a gloomy vibe. However, the renovated room was great, spacious and clean. Was a good jaunt to the Disneyland gates but do-able. If I could get a decent price at this hotel I would stay again.
Manager Response: Helloo Kayceea2016,  Thank you for your feedback, however I think you might have gotten the wrong property as we have not been under construction and we've never had protesters at our property. We invite you to stay with us when you come back to the Disneyland Resort so that your Disney experience is not tainted by such inconveniences.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Room was clean.service was good.location right across from Disney park was great.close to restaurants.Family friendly.Valet parking.pool and hot tub areas clean.Laundry on site.continental breakfast substantial.Thoroughly enjoyed our stay would definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: Your feedback is appreciated and thank you for staying with us. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and hope to see you when you again come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: This hotel was clean, the desk staff was friendly, and the location for Disneyland parks would be hard to beat.  Doors are open to the outside rather than a hallway, and if you are assigned a room toward the back of the hotel, you have to essentially walk through the parking lot to get to the appropriate elevator/staircase.  Apparently, there is also rooftop space for viewing the Disney fireworks, but the area around the hotel is generally not scenic.
Manager Response: We are happy to hear you found your room pleasant and that our staff made you feel welcome. I would highly recommend that you experience the Disneyland Fireworks from our viewing deck upon your next visit. We sure hope to see you again soon.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: The room was very nice. The bathroom left a bit to be desired. The number one thing missing was hot water in the sink. I had to wash my face with cold water or get hot water from the bathtub. I spoke to a person at the front desk after the first day but nothing was done to correct the situation.
Manager Response: Hello Pamela K,  Thank you for your valuable feedback. I appreciate you sharing your concern with us as this gives us an opportunity to fix any flaws. Our maintenance staff was able to fix the issue with no problems, but we do hope that you can give us another opportunity upon your return to the Disneyland Resort.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Close to disney and affordable. Enjoy the fireworks from the roof top!! Check in process was really quick. Indoor pool which unfortunately we didn't get around to using. Only negative was they allowed someone to park behind us and didn't have them leave their keys, we needed to wait 30 minutes before they moved their car.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I appreciate your kind comments and your observations. Our rooftop is definitely you cannot miss when staying with us, as it gives you an amazing view of the Disneyland Firesworks. Your parking concern has been shared with our parking manager for proper service enhancements, thank you and we'll see you soon.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Great hotel located directly opposite entrance to Disneyland. Perfect and convenient. Large room with two double beds. Shower and toilet good size with plenty of room and a bonus the vanity unit was outside shower/toilet so could be used independently which was great when two people are getting ready at the same time. Continental breakfast was included but was basic so went to Denny's which is right next door. Bus stop for shuttle to Citadel Outlets only a very short walk away. Only minus was rooms not serviced until very late in afternoon. Not good if you want to come back for a break for a while before heading back to Disneyland. Make up room sign requested but did not make a difference.
Manager Response: Hello Corrie P,  Thank you for staying with us recently and for your kind feedback. We are happy to hear that your stay was great and that you found our location and amenities convenient. See you when you again come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: The trip was wonderful...all things considered.  The hotel was very convenient    Almost directly across from Main Entrance. Liked that they had continental breakfast and didn't have to drive over to park and pay to park But the hotel is very dated. Old, scarred furniture, not decorated cheerfully, not generous with toiletries, coffee or even double ply toilet tissue. We had the suite directly under the "fireworks viewing deck". Omg. Everyone obviously needed to drag their furniture before and after the show across our ceiling! Wow. Wished I would have known that! Still, the convenience and inexpensive price helped cope with the other. But not sure if we will stay there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had a great room in the back on the ground floor.  Valet parking was so easy and we really enjoyed the quiet in our room.  It is very convenient to Disneyland.  The staff was very helpful and friendly.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have come to Disneyland almost every year for the last 10-12 years. We usually stay at Candy Cane Inn but have also stayed at the Disneyland Hotel, and the nearby Fairfield Inn. I saw Desert Inn and Suites online last year when I was booking my trip. When I saw you could get a C2 suite (which is really two hotel rooms with a door seperating them) for the price they were asking I thought it was a steal. Combine that with the location right across the street I wanted to love this place.   It was fine. It was clean, the staff was nice and friendly and since we weren't in the room much it did the job. There were just a couple things that bugged me...some of which were within the hotel's control and some that weren't. For example, the water coming out of the vanity sink was VERY
Manager Response: none

Summary: Just stayed 4 nights for Disney trip for our family including 2 grandchildren. We usually stay at the candy cane, but wanted to try a place directly across the street from the Disneyland main entrance. This Inn was fine, very basic but very very clean, which was what mattered the most to us. The housekeeping staff did a nice job every day and was prompt. I would definitely stay here again if I wanted to walk back and forth and not need a shuttle. Pool is indoor and small, but we spent all of our time at the park. Loved the big C2 suite (2 bedrooms, 2 full baths, small sitting room), was a really good price for 8 of us. Stop at target and buy bottled water as Disney and vending machines at the inn all want $3 per bottle. It was nice having refrigerator in room with water.
Manager Response: I'm glad that you enjoyed your stay with us and I appreciate you trying us out. I will pass your kind words to our housekeeping staff and I'm sure they'll be happy to hear your praises. Let us know when you are ready to come back to the Desert Inn.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Best location of Good Neighbor hotels
Summary: We are annual pass holders, and always stay here or the Tropicana. Desert Inn has morning continental breakfast as a plus.  Clean rooms, GREAT staff.  Right across street from Disney main gate... Much more convenient and faster than Disney parking.
Manager Response: I appreciate you choosing us as your home away from home when you visit the parks. Thank you for your kind words and look forward to seeing you again.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: This is my 3rd stay at the Anaheim Desert Inn & Suites - and while the location and price make it really attractive, unfortunately the soundproofing between rooms is awful.  We stayed 3 nights and every night/morning we could hear everything from parents scolding the kids, to kids crying/whining to coughing/sneezing.   I don't recall the rooms being this noisy during our previous stays - so perhaps it was due to the fact we had a room that could be an "adjoining room"...however in the future I will most likely stay at another hotel that is just as close and meets our budget.
Manager Response: Hi Trista A,  I appreciate your continued support over the years. I understand that you had an issue with noise due to a connecting door. Upon your next booking, please mention that you want a non-adjoining room so that you stay can be a little quieter. Thank you for choosing us and we hope to see you soon.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Another great stay at a motel that is very close to Disneyland's entrance.  Indoor pool, wifi, laundry facilities ($) and continental breakfast...you just can't go wrong here!  The staff was very friendly as well.
Manager Response: Hi tsig,  I appreciate your awesome response and you staying with us once again. Let us know when you are ready to come down the Desert Inn again.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We have stayed here before this place is nice and clean, continental breakfast is served, close/walking distance to Disneyland, we were able to leave our car before check in time and didn't have to move it right at check out
Manager Response: I appreciate you staying with us over the years and am glad to hear that you took advantage of our Free Continental Breakfast before heading to the parks. Can't wait to have you stay with us again!  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: good location, nice rooms, a little expensive
Summary: We like this hotel because it is so close to the entrance to the park. Rooms are clean and well kept. They are expensive but I think overall they are worth the price. Continental breakfast is also a nice touch.
Manager Response: Hi Lynn  B,  Thank you for your kind words, we hope that you'll stay with us in the future again. Please feel free to call us when you are ready to book on your next trip to Disneyland.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Great location, right across from the park. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Love the indoor heated pool. The hot tub is great to relax your sore muscles after a day at the parks!! I would suggest you arrive early to pre-register and get a parking permit or else you may need to come back after noon. I got stuck having to pay for parking at the theme park because even the valet parking was full!!
Manager Response: Hello mosquedachristina,  Our indoor heated pool and spa do come in handy after a long day of walking at the Disneyland Resort. We thank you for your review and we cannot wait for your next stay!  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: The location is great for Disneyland and the breakfast and pool facilities were good. The rooms are a little dated but adequate for the price and the staff were always helpful. Wifi coverage is not great and there are better hotels but we found this one good value and would return again.
Manager Response: Hi Craig5045,  We appreciate you staying with us and sharing your feedback with us. Also, thank you for sharing your concerns about our internet, I have sharing this information with our IT department and are looking into it. We do hope that you'll stay with us again in the future.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Room was clean and good space for the price. Staff was friendly and helpful.Hotel is close right across the street from Disneyland which was the point of us picking this hotel. We've already booked this hotel again for our next trip in May.
Manager Response: Hi Robert N,  I'm glad to hear that you liked our hotel's location, the price and our staff. We look forward to having you with us again in May.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We stayed at the Desert Inn for six nights on a Disneyland holiday and it was a very pleasant surprise.    We were a group of six - my family and my parents - and we chose the C2 family room.  I was nervous because (1) on a previous trip to disneyland we had stayed at the Grand Californian Villas which was very comfortable and (2) my mother suffers from Chronic Motel Aversion Disorder and I was not convinced I could get her into this place.  We were all very pleasantly surprised by the Desert Inn.     First:  the location.  This hotel is directly across from The Crosswalk, the main entrance to disneyland.  It was a four - six minute walk to the main gate.  the hotel might as well be IN the park it`s so close.   It is sandwiched between an ihop and a Dennys both of which were
Manager Response: Hi familyonthego128,  I appreciate very much your candid and very detailed review of our hotel. I'm glad that you made good use of our breakfast, indoor heated pool area and hotel central location.  We cannot be more ecstatic by such an awesome experience and review. We appreciate your kindness and sure hope that you'll stay with us again in the future.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: I could have given this hotel an even better review if not for the inconvenience of having no air conditioning when we arrived and it was very hot. I requested  another room but was answered that someone is coming to fix the air conditioner. So we settle in and wait for the person to fix it . When he arrived he couldn't fix it  and needed help to get it working from another man who finally diagnosed the problem after 45 minutes . We are very tired and couldn't even lie on the bed while they are fixing the air con.  They should have tested everything is working well before they assign guest of  a room not this way inconveniencing  guest that came from far places only to find they have to wait a little longer to rest.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review and thank you for staying with us recently. I apologize for the AC issue you had on your check in day, I have stressed the importance of verifying that all items in the room are in working condition before releasing to our guests. I understand that you were inconvenienced while our staff tried to figure out what the problem and we apologize. Your patronage is valued here at the Desert Inn and I would love the opportunity to make a more memorable experience for you and your family in the future.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: The front counter staff were friendly and helpful.  Location excellent for Disneyland, right across the road.  Restaurants close by. Bus stop close by as well. Room with roll in shower had great access with wheelchair
Manager Response: Hi Cherie B,  I'm glad that you stayed with us and that our accessible rooms, premises and hotel location was of your convenience. Nothing is more important to us than our relationship with our guests. We thank you for your review and we cannot wait for your next stay!  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Our family stayed here for the first time and we were very please.  Enjoyed the easy access to Disneyland.  The rooms were clean and surprisingly quiet.   All the staff were very helpful.  The first night we arrived we watched the Disneyland fireworks from our window.
Manager Response: Hi LSorkin,  I'm glad to hear that you were pleased with our hotel after you decided to try us out. I'm sure that you enjoyed the fireworks from the viewing deck as the rooftop area provides an awesome view. We hope to see you again when visit the Disneyland Resort.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Right across street from Disneyland entrance! Has larger rooms for families and larger groups which is great in the disneyland area, instead of having to rent 2 or 3 rooms and pay all the extra taxes, fees etc, our room came with 4 queen beds, 2 bathrooms, lots of room! The wifi was free, the breakfast was simple but it was free so you can't complain. Parking is a bit tight, but its right across the street to the main gates to Disneyland, a 1 minute walk and you are in Mouseland.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I appreciate your kind comments and your observations.   One of the awesome features of our hotel are our family suites, which can sleep up to 10 guests and that way large families can stay together rather than in separate rooms.  Again, we thank you for your review and we cannot wait for your next stay!  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Right across the street from Disneyland/CA Adventure entrances making it an easy walk without the hassle of the tram. Clean and quiet. The only issue was worst water pressure I have ever experienced, could not wash my hair and water was not hot enough.
Manager Response: Hello Kelly F,  Thank you very much for staying with us and for sharing your feedback. Per your email, my staff was able to fix the water pressure and temperature issue you experienced in your room. As a reminder, we do have staff 24/7 that can always assist you with any in-room issues so that we can minimize any inconvenience. Thank you for the opportunity and we hope to see you again soon.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: I've stayed at Desert inn & Suites with my family several times now.  Stayed last week for 7 nights.  Still pleased with location - can't beat the convenient location right across the street from main Disneyland entrance.  Clean place, plenty of towels, several room options to choose from (we usually get the largest room which is the C2 Parlor Suite).  Roof-top deck to lounge or see nightly fireworks if you aren't in the park, vending machines, etc.  Called us a cab when we needed one to get back to airport.  Only complaints I have is that their sheets are quite scratchy (I brought my own this time so I could sleep better).  And the male hotel clerks could use better phone manners...although they were helpful, they really didn't seem very friendly...ended the phone calls I made
Manager Response: Hi MomLovesDisney,  Thank you for your continued stays with us. I have forwarded your concerns about the sheets to our housekeeping department for proper handling and I've also talked to our Front Desk Staff emphasizing customer service and phone etiquette. Thank you for bringing your concerns to our attention and we hope that you'll stay with us again when  you visit the Disneyland Resort again.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Great time at Disneyland, made better by having clean, comfortable, and very close accommodations at the Anaheim Desert Inn and Suites.  The room rate was great for such a large suite and free WiFi.  Room had a small microwave and a medium size fridge that worked great!  Breakfast was simple but good, something for everyone.  This hotel is super close to the Disneyland main gates.  It is within very easy walking distance with the entire walk being safe and well lit. Staff was friendly and helpful.  This is a great place to stay when going to Disneyland.  I will definitely come back.
Manager Response: Thank you for your awesome review, we pride ourselves on great customer service and as evidenced by most of our reviews we do offer fantastic accommodations, service and rates. I'm happy to hear that our amenities and proximity to Disneyland were of your liking. We look forward to having you stay with us again.  Kind regards!  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: It's basically across the street from Disney, which is what you want after walking the park all day. Believe me, those last few steps at the end of the night can be unbearable. The breakfast is just toast, pastries and hard boiled eggs but it's free, quick and easy. The pool and Jacuzzi are indoors and a little small but they're clean. The rooftop patio is a nice size and you can definitely see the fireworks from there. I asked for a room at the back of the hotel because I heard it was quieter and we weren't woken up at all. The AC wasn't loud, the bathroom was a decent size, the beds felt a little cheap but they weren't awful. Valet was easy. We got there before the park opened and they valeted for us. I forgot a ton of stuff in the car and they had no problem giving me the
Manager Response: Thank you very much for staying with us recently and thank you for your candid review. I'm glad to hear that our hotel met your expectations and we look forward to having you stay with us in the future.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We have stayed at this hotel 8 times over the years. It has been consistently a clean and very close property to stay at while visiting Disneyland. As far as the location this hotel really can't be beat. Just get up in the morning and walk right across the street and avoid the mess of buses and shuttles. The rooms are very basic with outdoor hallways. The free breakfast in the morning is very plain but it is free so you can't complain at this price. We are only ever in our room to sleep and get ready for the day, if this is how you travel then this place is for you. If your looking for more modern and luxurious accommodations then look elsewhere. We plan on continuing to stay here on a regular basis when we visit.
Manager Response: We appreciate your kind review and your continued support over the years. I'm happy to hear that our rooms serve your purpose and that you've taken advantage of our complementary continental breakfast. Thank you again and we hope to see you on your next visit.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Very reasonably priced (low : ) The room even has a coffee maker! Our room was at the front but very quiet. The valet parking is very reasonable and makes arrival and departures a snap! Very helpful staff from counter to valet. Right next to Denny's and Tony Roma's (which were both excellent in service and food!) We got a late checkout (noon) and the staff was very pleasant. Will stay there AGAIN!
Manager Response: Hello gsgarcia2010,  I'm glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and that our prices met your budget.  I'll forward your kind regards to our staff and we hope to see you again when you visit Southern California.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: The main reason this place is a 4 star is because it is right across the street from the main entrance, otherwise it would be a 2. At the end of a long day at the parks, saving a block or two of walking is very important! The fact that cheap eating options are right next door is also a bonus.   We had a parlor suite with two bedrooms (two beds in each room) with 1.5 bathrooms, but it's really like two adjoining rooms with one room lacking a shower. It's listed as sleeping 8, but really it was just spacious enough for the 5 of us. There was no living room or sitting area other than the two bedrooms. The beds were not comfortable and sunk down in the middle with uncomfortable pillows. The decor was dark, but otherwise clean. There was a fridge and microwave which we hardly used.
Manager Response: Hello amc347,  Thank you for sharing your input, we apologize for the concerns you have about your experience at this hotel. On behalf of our entire staff here at the Desert Inn & Suite we apologize for the concerns you have about your experience with us. Please be assured that I we'll be discussing your concerns with our management team and hope that upon your next visit, we can meet or exceed your expectations.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Overall, the room was clean, however, the bedspread was stained and the furniture is quite outdated, worn, scratched, etc. TV didn't work but was repaired (or replaced) after I told the front desk. Parking is TERRIBLE! There is underground free valet parking, however, the first two nights I stayed there, there were three trucks/SUVs parked in the middle of the regular parking lot, blocking at least four cars each. Good thing people don't come and go much when staying at this location. Garbage was piled next to the garbage cans near the main elevator and the lighting in the elevator/stair corridor is very bad . . . really needs to be lit better for safety reasons if nothing else. Thank goodness there are fans in the room or the noise from the other guests would have kept us up at
Manager Response: Hello k3suebug,  I appreciate you sharing your feedback with us. We are currently looking into updating our furniture  and we hope to have that done this year. Our valet staff are very good at assisting whenever self parking is not available. I appreciate you mentioning the lighting on our staircase,  and we'll definitely be looking into your concerns and find proper solutions. Thank you for being a loyal customer and we hope to see you again soon.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: The room accommodated my power wheelchair well. There was ample room to maneuver every where. For those with disabilities, just be careful using the padded shower bench--throw a couple towels over it to keep from slipping. The staff and management was more than helpful--so very kind and attentive. I will stay here again!
Manager Response: Hello Barb,  Thank you for staying with us, we are glad that the accessible room met your needs. We look forward to having you stay with us again and thank you in advance for being a repeat guest. Kind regards!  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: The fact that this hotel is right across the street from the Disneyland entrance is its main selling point, and a huge advantage. Nice fireworks view from the roof if you're too tired to hang out late in the park. Wifi was frustratingly spotty--worked about 15% of the time for me; the rest of the time it couldn't connect. Pool wasn't particularly appealing--located inside but right by parking lot--but we didn't go to Disneyland to swim. Breakfast was fine: fruit, cereal, pastries, toast, bagels. I was really aware of the waste, though, and wish the utensils had been compostable and that they hadn't used styrofoam. Staff was pleasant. We'll probably stay here again.
Manager Response: Hi vegdeb,  Thank you for your review. I am happy to hear that your stay was great, thank you for letting me know about your concerns. We do listen to our guests and their valuable feedback assists us in making operational modifications and service enhancements. Thank you for choosing us and we'll see you on your next trip to Anaheim.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Hotel was clean and roomy, water pressure poor. The pool was not too desirable. I felt like it was over chlorinated, our kids got sick after swimming in it. But it is a great location for a Disneyland trip and the floor plan of our suite was nice.
Manager Response: Your feedback is much appreciated. Our maintenance staff keeps chlorine at required levels, however we'll relate your concern to their department head. i appreciate you staying with us and let us know if we can be of service in the near future.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Cheap and close to Disneyland, that's it!
Summary: I've already mentioned the good, it's cheap and close to Disneyland. That's basically all the good I can tell you about this place.  Everything else was mediocre at best. It's obvious that the rooms haven't been upgraded in some time. The carpet, furniture, and decor were as tired as I was after trying to sleep on the cheap piece of foam they tried to pawn off as a bed. I'm not exaggerating, it was a 6-8" piece of foam.  Then there's the shutters by the window. They have shutters, nothing else. They do a nice job of keeping the room fairly well lit at night. It's perfect for those that don't want to sleep in a dark room.  My last issue is out of the hotels hands, but  deserves to be mentioned for those considering a stay at this hotel. Beware of noisy families and excited
Manager Response: Hi W203PPchrisf,   I appreciate you taking the time to complete a survey regarding your recent stay with us. On behalf of our entire staff here at the Desert Inn & Suites we apologize for the concerns you have about your experience at this hotel. , I would like to see what can be done to regain your loyalty. Please let me know the best way to communicate with you as you are a valued patron.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We asked for a room in the back so we wouldn't hear the traffic on Disney way and were told that there were 35 rooms full of teenagers back there so we were better off in the front of hotel. We accepted the room, as it seemed  ok when we inspected it.   What they didn't tell us is that the free continental breakfast is served from 7:30 am RIGHT OUTSIDE OUR ROOM!  So here were all these people yakking, screaming, whooping at the crack of dawn.    in addition, the garbage pick up had already started at 6:45 and lasted a half hour, with the back up beep going off every few seconds, and the bins banging and clanging.    Then at 8:00 am, a compressor was started up and walkway washing commenced right outside our room.  We had hoped to sleep In a little, but that was not possible.
Manager Response: Hi Marshall K,  We are extremely sorry about your unsatisfactory experience. Unfortunately, there are certain things that we cannot predict but please be assured that all of your comments have been taken seriously and addressed accordingly. Thank you for staying with us.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: This is as others have said perfect for trips to Disney. We stayed here for a week and it was perfect for our needs. It was spotlessly clean with very comfortable beds, although our tap in the sink didn't work when turned to hot. The breakfast was basic but it's free so didn't expect much. The valet were great and were very helpful. A great stay thank you Dessert Inn.
Manager Response: Heloo Tashajayne,  Thank you for your feedback and for staying with us recently. I'm happy to hear that our hotel met your needs and that you enjoyed your stay. We hope to see you again soon.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Great, clean rooms and friendly staff
Summary: Even though the elevator near our room was broken, we enjoyed our stay. The staff was all helpful and friendly. Location was great! Rooms were clean. The indoor pool was awesome. It is heated by solar panels so it wasn't as warm after a few overcast days.
Manager Response: Hi lisa0mer,  I appreciate your feedback, our elevator was indeed under renovation and it's up and running as we speak. I'm glad you enjoyed our heated indoor pool, rooms and that our location was to your liking. Give us a call when you are ready to visit Southern California again.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We spent 7 nights and were happy with the price, nothing fancy but right across the street from the main entrance. Clean, nice people running it. IHOP and Denny's next door. Pool was ok, the temp was a bit cool . The breakfast was ok but wished for some hot waffles or sausage and eggs, after 7 mornings you get tired of the same thing.The packaged in room coffee was not good, better in the breakfast room.  Shuttle from and to LAX dropped at the door. Our shuttles to Universal and Medieval Dinner dropped off and picked up right next door. A very convenient place to stay if you are not after the frills. We will stay again.
Manager Response: Hello dcgrin,  Thank you for staying with us recently, our location is definitely a plus when visiting the Disneyland Resort. I see that you took advantage of our complimentary continental breakfast before heading to the parks  and we'll bring your recommendations to our next management meeting. Thank you again.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Gave it a 2nd chance, won't get a 3rd
Summary: I've stayed here twice within the past year.  This review will be based on the weekend I just spent there.  The front office staff was not friendly and not very helpful-there were no smiles and although questions were answered, they made us feel that it was painful for them to assist us.  We checked in early, before rooms were available, and then headed to the parks.  When we returned after park closing, we were given our room keys and found we were probably given the worst room in the place (thought we had the worst one last time but I was wrong).  There were 4 of us and the bathroom was very small.  The room has blinds that don't close enough to block the outdoor lighting so the room stays pretty light and is especially bad for the bed closest to the window.  There was no door
Manager Response: Hi pakeyb,  I'm sorry to hear that your experiences have not being as expected while staying with us. Good customer service is one of the most important reasons why guests come back to us and I have personally met with all Front Desk employees to stress it's importance. I understand that the bathroom was too small for all of you to get ready at the same time, please know that we have suite options with two separate bathrooms that will make it getting ready every morning a breeze. We thank you for giving trying us and let us know should you decide to stay with us in the future.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Great hotel for family vacation to Disneyland
Summary: Hotel is very convenient.  Directly across the street from Disneyland.  Many restaurants near by.  Hotel was clean and neat.  Service was excellent.  Staff was friendly and helpful. Beds were a little uncomfortable, other than that room was great.
Manager Response: Hello Marlo O,  Thank you very much for your candid review, we appreciate your feedback and let us know when you are ready to visit the Disneyland Resort in the near future.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: I loved how close this location was to Disneyland. I also love that it had a continental breakfast and WiFi included in the price. The staff seemed helpful. It was noisy at times because our room was by an elevator and you could hear the people outside. I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Hi AaronLisa T,  Thank you for your kind review. I'm glad to hear that you enjoyed the continental breakfast, the WiFi and our convenience location. We look forward to having you stay with us again when you visit the Disneyland Resort.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We stayed in room 520, top floor. Hotel right across  the street from disneyland  main entrance.  Hotel was clean , safe, and had a perfect location. Ihop on one side and Dennys on  the other. The hotel had everything we needed anxiety more. Will go back when we have time.
Manager Response: Hi lagartist,  I'm happy to hear that our hotel met your expectations and that our location was a plus for you and your family. Thank you for sharing your feedback with us and we will see you on your next visit.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Location can't be beat for Disney family vacation!
Summary: This hotel has the perfect location for a family Disneyland vacation, and that is what you are paying for-- it sits directly across from the main Disneyland crosswalk.  You can easily walk back to your room in middle of day for naps or non-Disney lunches (options nearby include McDonalds, Panera and IHOP.)  We have stayed at the Quality Inn up the street on previous trips, but for the price you pay on the strip, we would choose Desert Inn and Suites again--- it really has the best location.  The staff is great-- housekeeping was remarkable and always had our room cleaned by the time we came back in mid-day.  Property is older but very well maintained.  The Parlour suites are terrific for a family, since they have two beds,two flat screen tvs, a pull-out sofa, microwave and
Manager Response: Hi Bonnie B,  Thank you very much for staying with us and for sharing your feedback on TripAdvisor. I'm glad to hear that our staff, from housekeeping to front desk and valet were up to your standards. Our fireworks viewing deck is something you definitely do not want to miss when staying with us. I'm sorry to hear that our beds and pillows were not to your liking and we'll be discussing your concern on our next staff meeting. We hope to see you in hte near future.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: I traveling with a group of high school students visiting Disneyland.  You are right across the street from the main entrance providing easy access to Disney.  Even better, when you need a break from the crowds, it's an easy walk back for napping or changing clothes if one gets drenched on some of the rides.  The rooms seem to be recently renovated and comfortable.  It came equipped with a refrigerator and microwave.  The rooms are spacious.  The downside is that all the rooms are walk-ups.  There are no interior hallways, but I never felt uneasy about safety.  A standard continental breakfast including breakfast breads, pastries, hardboiled eggs and cereal are provided.  For folks who want more, there is a Denny's next door.  There is a pool, self service laundry and a nice
Manager Response: Hi DKHNL,  I'm glad that you and your group enjoyed your stay and that our amenities were up to par. Our location cannot be beat and our rates are very reasonable for a hotel this close to the main entrance to Disneyland. Our breakfast room has got a variety of breakfast items, enough to get you started and ready for a long day at he parks. Thank you for your review and we hope to see you again in the near future.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: This hotel was a very pleasant surprise!  The large rooms are definitely a plus, as was the fridge and microwave.  Everything was clean and even though it is an older hotel, you could see that they really try to stay on top of the maintenance.  The parking is definitely the only downfall, but they do offer free valet service, which we opted to use.  The valet staff were quick and friendly.  We loved that the pool and hot tub were indoors, so the kids could swim even though the weather was cool in the evenings.  Be aware though the pool is definitely kept on the chilly side.  The continental breakfast was always kept well stocked and the area was clean.  They offered bagels, toast, boiled eggs, mini muffins, pastries, apples, oranges, oatmeal, cold cereal, coffee and juices.
Manager Response: Hello Linnie59,  Thank you for your feedback and for staying with us. Our staff thanks you for your kind words. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and hope to see you when you again come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: The location is hard to beat, the staff always friendly, professional, and willing to help. The facilites are well kept, free wifi, free breakfast includes fresh fruit, toast, bagels, boiled eggs, oatmeal, dry cereal, milk, juice, coffee, and tea, not fancy but sufficient.  This trip, I did notice the carpet might need changing and the pull out bed has seen better days.The staff was more than willing to fix the bed and apologized for the inconvenience. We will return to stay on our next trip to Disneyland and continue to recommend Desert Inn to our friends and family.
Manager Response: Hello CSOishi,  I thank you for staying with us and I appreciate your kind comments and your observations. If you have a moment and are willing to share any specifics on these items it would greatly increase my ability to better assess and attempt to remedy these concerns. Thank you and I sure hope that you would give us another opportunity to serve you.  Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Price, location, friendly staff, clean, good shower, free breakfast, micro/fridge/safe all in the room. Other reviews mention a poor breakfast, however there is no other hotel closer to Disney that offers free breakfast(it's just enough to fill you until your next meal in the park) and all parking in this area is tight, so be reasonable with your expectations. Perfect location for families with little kids, we came back and took a nap every day. After trying multiple hotels in this area 1-2 blocks from the park, this is our top choice.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is our second time staying here & will likely stay again. They offer a great location, decent continental breakfast and all the staff is very friendly and helpful. I agree the rooms are a little dark, but honestly we didn't spend a lot of time in our room anyways.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is directly across from the entrance to Disneyland which made it so convenient to leave the park during the day for a break and then return again later.  I'm not sure that I would stay anywhere else for this reason alone!  I also loved the ability to watch the fireworks with the kids in their pajamas from the rooftop viewing area.  Yes, the pool is small, but it was perfect for our two to have a bit of cool-off time in the middle of the day.  Rooms were clean, service was excellent!  We were also very pleased with the complimentary computer service that allowed us to print needed tickets without a cost.  Definitely recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My wife and I attempted to stay here when we came to Disneyland since our normal hotel  (Candy Cane Inn) was booked. When we arrived we were not able to check in till after 3pm and there was no budging on the time. They also said the only place we can put our luggage was in a paid locker. So we paid just so we could get into the park. Once our room was finally ready we grabbed our stuff and went to the room. Once in the room we found it to be extremely small and the bathroom was just the same. The shower it self was a corner shower so if you were a larger guy you'd not fit in it as it was the size of one you'd find inside an RV. We dropped off our stuff and went back to the park, we used nothing in the room and you will find out why I say this later. Once back in the room from a
Manager Response: none

Summary: It's clean, comfortable, and It's right across the street from the park (a must when traveling with little ones; come back for a nap in the afternoon). It's one of the most affordable options given it's location and the staff is extremely helpful. Desert Inn is right next door to a handful of different food options and many of the restaurants deliver to your hotel room. There is a Target about 2-minutes away in case you forget anything. Indoor, heated pool, in-room refrigerator and microwave (we bring some food with us to save a little on meals). Free valet parking; just give them a 10-minute warning and they'll have your car ready for you when you come down from your room. I've tried a few different options in the area; I keep coming back to Desert Inn.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Price is great, rooms were fair-a little dark and could use some updating and better bedding and towels. Continental breakfast is poor, pool is small and indoors. They did valet park our car for free and the staff went above and beyond to assist and were very friendly and always smiling. Would still stay there again though, especially for price and proximity to Disneyland-that part was awesome!
Manager Response: none

Summary: For us our stay was a return "home" having stayed many times in the last 15 years. Standard of service, cleaning, etc remain high. Miss the little store but there are others nearby. A new feature was being able to arrange rental of a mobility scooter for our entire visit with made it possible for me to really cover and enjoy both parks. Always recommend the Desert Inn and will return again one day. Phyllis
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was my first time staying here and I was a little uncertain after reading some of the reviews. There were some glowing reviews, and some not very nice reviews, so I really had no idea what our experience would be. I'm very pleased to say, it was great!   Upon check in, we were originally put in a room near the back of the hotel. There were some small issues with that room, so I spoke to the front desk and they were extremely helpful. They moved us to a room closer to the front with out any issues at all.  The room and bathroom were very clean. The beds were actually comfy. I slept better here than I did when I stayed at the Grand Californian hotel! Yes, the furniture in the rooms could use an upgrade. They are showing a bit of wear and tear, but everything worked and, as I
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good, basic hotel within walking distance of the park
Summary: We stayed here as a family in one of the two room suites.  We had 3 children and 6 adults.  The rooms were quiet and the beds were comfortable.  It is directly across the street from Disneyland so walking, even with little children was a breeze.  The rooms are dated and we did have an issue with one tub not draining but the staff took care of that quickly.  We didn't spend much time in the hotel anyway.  We slept there and the kids took naps there.  They have an indoor pool so the kids could swim even though it was December.  They have a continental breakfast with boiled eggs and cereal and yogurt.  It is enough to give you a good start on the day and not have to purchase breakfast in the park.  The rooms have mini-fridges which made it great for storing snacks and things for
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have stayed here a few times over the years.  The rooms are clean and the staff is always pleasant.  The kids love this hotel as it's a short walk back after a long day at the park, when their feet are hurting and they're ready for bed!  They ask to stay at this hotel now.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very roomy, clean and easy access. Also great parking. Right across from the park and close to everything. Definitely recommended for families looking for a great place and great value. All staff is very helpful and nice as well.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have stayed here previous years back to 2007 and they are always a wonderful place to stay at.  This trip we were able to leave a day early and even though online they showed no available rooms, we called about 3 hours out to see if they had 'any' rooms available, we got one and were able to stay on property instead of driving from hotel to hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great location right across the street from Disney entrance which is why I chose this hotel.  Updated rooms which was a nice surprise.  Would definitely stay here again.    Thought the room rate was on the high side for the type of hotel this is.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Walking distance  to disneyland.  I'm not even sure the on site hotels are closer. Roof deck is nice to watch fireworks.  The place did look tired and parking was crazy. Don't count on a breakfast, the options are pretty limited. But there is an IHOP and Dennys  right next door.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: My favorite place to stay for Disneyland
Summary: Desert Inn and Suites is a basic hotel, with some huge pluses.      Location. It is one of the closest places you can stay to the Disneyland Parks entrance, and the variety of room layouts is very helpful for families.      Room Layout. I love the little sitting area with couch and TV, AND a door you can close, so little ones, or anyone, can nap in quiet.      Indoor pool. Summary: This was our second time in staying here.    The location is one of the best for closeness to Disneyland.    Check in was fast and the guy was friendly. I had first reserved just a double room as that was all that was available.   Kept checking online and an executive room opened up, switched to that one for $10 more a night for the couch in the room.   Upon check in (we arrived at about 7:00PM) our room was way in the back of the property.   They had a parlor suite available closer up so we took that one for another $10 a night.    The suite is really nice.  The separate room with the couch and second TV was really great.   We had two teen boys with us so they spent their time in the couch room.    My sons friend slept on the sleeper couch.  He said the mattress was not very
Manager Response: none

Summary: Location to Disneyland is excellent, cleanliness of rooms - great - prompt help when we had a minor problem.  We had the C1 option with 2 rooms and 1.5 bathrooms - heaps of room to move and comfortable beds.  Breakfast included but basic toast, muffins, pastries, hard boiled eggs, apples & oranges, cereals and drinks provided but after a week this becomes very boring, lucky Denny's is next door.  Staff friendly and helpful.  I will stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: One of our favorite places to,stay for,Disneyland
Summary: We have stayed here at least a dozen times, they are very reasonably priced very nice rooms And they have a very nice continental style breakfast they even let you take food back to your room if you would like.   They are directly across the street from the main entrance to Disneyland and California adventure.  Out of all the times we have stayed we have been 100% happy with our stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Spent 4 nights with the kids for Disneyland.  Fast checkin and friendly service.  Rooms were ok and seemed to have been updated.  Great location Overall - great value and we enjoyed our stay ..............
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place to stay with a family
Summary: Love the 2 room suites.  Location across from main Disney entry is a huge plus.  The continental breakfast is nice so you can get a quick bite to eat before entering the park.  The rooms are clean and very spacious.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Location of hotel - Excellent, cleanliness of rooms - good, but they are not thorough, dust along the floorboards has been there awhile.  Bathrooms are clean though.  The hotel offers all the amenities, but definitely on the cheap, styrofoam coffee cups, plastic water cups, thin walls and ceilings are most prevelant!  If you want to here your neighbors and your new friends eating at Denny's, don't stay here.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We usually stay at the Paradise Pier. There's just something about staying in the Disney bubble. HOWEVER, I just can't justify spending $400 a night. Not every time we go. We have stayed on every hotel on Harbor within walking distance (except the Best Western) and we LOVE it here! Plenty of room. Parlor suites have a closing door, so younger kids can nap, while the others can still talk/watch tv. Everything was clean, check in was smooth. The breakfast was fine. Juice, cereal, muffins, toast, bagels, hard boiled eggs. Plenty to get you going in the parks. Only "bad" things are: the walls are a little thin. Not a deal breaker. I don't like that you have to use valet. I want to park my own car.   Waited forever for the elevators. Took the stairs many times. Very minor things.
Manager Response: Hello Disneynut35,  I thank you for staying with us and for loving the Desert Inn. We do have several rooms and suites that can accommodate most families large and small and I'm glad that you'll keep staying with us on future Disneyland visits. Let us know when you are ready to book again with us.  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: We will be back, great location & price!
Summary: The staff was very friendly here, and it’s right across from Disneyland.  You walk out of the hotel, and to the right about ½ block and the crosswalk is there to the entrance for Disneyland.  The breakfast that was included is VERY busy and mostly carbs, but it is free.  There is a Denny’s and Ihop right next door so if you don’t want a solid meal you can go there.  But the rooms were clean, beds were average, staff was very nice and it’s in a great place.  Would stay there again if we go back to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for giving us such great ratings in all areas. Our continental breakfast is a great way to start your day and gets you ready for those long days at the parks. We hope that we'll be able to have you stay here again.  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Very close walking distance to Disneyland! Clean rooms. The bed weren't terrible but definitely not luxurious. Breakfast could use a revamp too. The swimming pool is inside and heated which was great for out December visit.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback and for giving us high ratings on cleanliness and service. Our continental breakfast is a great way to start off a day full of adventure at Disneyland and California Adventure. We appreciate sharing your experience and let us know when you are ready to come back to the Anaheim Desert Inn.  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We stayed here for 5 nights on our recent trip to Disneyland. Clean rooms, comfy beds & all the staff was wonderful. Basically across the street from the entrance to Disneyland which is awesome. Denny's, IHOP, Cold Stone Creamery & a Tony Romas next door so you have a few options. The breakfast was okay-cereal,toast, boiled eggs,apple,oranges and danishes. You could view the fireworks from the roof which was nice! We would stay here again.
Manager Response: We appreciate you sharing your experience and praising our hotel. I'm happy to hear that our location, amenities and service were to your standards. Feel free to contact me directly upon your next visit so that I can personally assist you with your booking.  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disneyland
Summary: Our family had another great stay here during our visit to Disneyland. The location can't be beat--it is right across the street from the parks. They accommodated our request to clean our room early each day so our kids could nap in the afternoon. They have a breakfast each morning that includes fruit, cereal, oatmeal, hard boiled eggs, bread, bagels and danishes.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and for providing such valuable feedback. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and hope to see you when you again come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: My family and I stayed here for 3 nights on our recent trip to Disneyland.The hotel is very close to Disneyland,it was about a 5 minute walk.Its located in between a Denny's and a Cold Stone Creamery.There was also an IHOP very close to the hotel. Pros-Location. -The wifi worked well. -The rooms were nice and clean and included a microwave and a mini fridge. Cons-The free breakfast could have been better.It included a variety of cereals,hard boiled eggs,various pastries and muffins,toast and fruits but it wasn't very good. -The beds were a little too firm. -The parking was $9 a day and it was difficult to find parking at times. -The noise-we had a room right next to the elevator and the ice machine and the constant sound of both could be heard throughout the night.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I booked a family suite as my daughter and I were travelling with friends.  The location was perfect - literally metres from the entrance, which was directly opposite the Hotel.  The rooms were spotlessly clean, spacious, and the shower was fantastic.  Don't book this hotel if you're after a buffet brekky though 😉 Would definitely recommend a stay here if you're planning a few days at Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. Our hotel is great in many ways and one of them is our location, you are within a four minute walk to the parks. Thank you for recommending us and we'll see you soon.  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Nice Stay at Desert Inn and Suites
Summary: It was a very nice stay at this hotel. First time for me and my party. I'm annual pass holder and I stay at many of the Anaheim area hotels.   I liked the rooms. Spacious. Comfortable beds and pillows. Walls are little thin could year our neighbors talking. Some kids running around. We could hear the maid's  vacuum the day we checked in and trying to rest. Room was clean. One of my only complaints was the toilet. The shower was great. Hot water for all the showers taken. Very clean but the toilet was awful!!! It took 3-4 times to flush, well, you know. Low flowing. Often left well, some stuff behind.     We didn't use the pool facilities but it looked very nice. The breakfast was a standard breakfast. Cereals, fruits, and coffee. Danishes and toast.   Best part was the distance
Manager Response: Thank you sharing your stay input Maria. On behalf of our entire staff we would like to thank you for your kind words and hope to see you again when your travels bring you back to the area.  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Certainty close in. Breakfast is limited in choices & is pretty much the same every day. Parking is interesting with the need to valet your vehicle(It is added to your bill automatically.) Hot tub small and had so may bubbles, it was more like a bubble bath. Pool indoor, but very small. Walls are thin. Ended up with a noisy neighbor upstairs that let their kids run around. Pull out sofa helpful. Did have 1 day housekeeping left our door open. Nothing happened thankfully and they apologized.
Manager Response: On behalf of our entire staff, we apologize for the concerns you have about your experience at this hotel. We appreciate the feedback and will use it to fine tune our operations in the hope that upon your next visit, we can meet or exceed your expectations. Please call me directly so that I can help you with your booking when you come back to us.  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We stayed here from December 8-14. The location was great. Getting to Disneyland was so easy. Just walk across the street. Our room was clean, no funky smells.
