This  was our first time at this hotel and not our last. We will be booking here for our future Disneyland trips. The staff was friendly. The viewing deck was great for watching the fireworks.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are happy that your stay was great. Our goal is to provide great customer service and a clean and comfortable place to stay, and I'm glad that we are meeting it. We hope to see you soon when you come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Close to Disneyland/California Adventures which is very important. Continental breakfast if you get there early enough you may be lucky to get something. I would suggest going to Denny's or IHOP extra early so that you can get into the parks when you want too.  Staff at this hotel are helpful and very nice. I will be staying again. I do suggest that if you have a disability like I do that you request a room closer to the street.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and hope to see you when you again come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: The best selling point for this hotel is that is within a ten minute walk of Disneyland. Although you have a ten dollar per day for parking you do not have the hassle of parking at Disney. The customer service is outstanding and the continental breakfast is good but only the usual type continental. Because of the location the price we paid was very good. They did have an indoor swimming pool which we did not use but seemed to be enjoyed by other families. Our room was clean and seemed to be well taken care of. We would highly recommend this hotel largely because of location and reasonable price!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback about your stay with us. We do aspire to deliver a quality product and exceptional friendly service to each and every guest that stays with us. We look forward to having you stay with us again.  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We stayed at the desert inn and suites for 4 nights during our visit to Disneyland . The location couldn't be any better it's directly across street from Disney . The rooms are are spacious and clean . They also have a rooftop where you can watch fireworks from
Manager Response: Thank you for your review about your amazing stay with us. Our fireworks viewing deck will give you a really nice and unique view of the Disneyland Fireworks. Let us know if we can be of further help in the future.  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: This hotel is one of the closest hotels to Disneyland.  It is not a 5 star hotel and we knew that when we made the reservation  We stayed at this hotel from November 30, 2014 to December 6, 2014.  We had one of the larger suites and had 9 adults and children in our party.  The hotel was very quiet considering everyone there had children all excited for Disneyland.  On our previous visit we had stayed at the hotel right next door and found it to be very noisy.  We decided to stay here on this trip and it was much quieter.  We could hear kids if they were jumping around upstairs, which only happened twice that I recall.  I never lost sleep because of noise.  The carpet needed a good cleaning as our granddaughter walked around with white socks the first night and they were no
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I appreciate your kind comments and your observations. We do listen to our guests and their valuable feedback assists us in making operational modifications and service enhancements. Please contact me directly so that I can assist you with your next reservation.  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: The hotel is right across from the Disneyland entrance. Free continental breakfast is delicious and indoor pool is great year round. This is always my first choice hotel when planning a Disney vacation!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great location, customer service needs training!
Summary: The location is the best! Literally right across from the gates of Disney. We arrived after a six hour drive from San Francisco, and we were tired. We brought our bags in with us to check in. We stood at the counter, while two men tried to ignore me. I didn't say anything because they looked busy. They did not greet me, but rather acted like I was a nuisance. The man asked me if we had a car and I said yes. He never asked me for any car info, come to find out he should have taken down our vehicle info and we ended up with a sticker on our window saying we should have given our info.  I honestly have never been treated so poorly just arriving at a hotel before.       The room was fine, no complaints there.        There was a nice man with braces that did check us out though. The
Manager Response: I appreciate you taking the time and sharing your experience with us. Location is definitely a big plus when you stay at the Anaheim Desert Inn as well as customer service. I will definitely talk add retrain my staff as customer service is a big part of who we are. I thank you again and feel free to contact me directly upon your next visit so that I can assist you with your booking.  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: I cannot say enough about our stay.  We were there 7 nights in a parlor suite, not one complaint the entire time.  It was clean, comfortable and quiet.  By quiet I mean no loud music, parties, running up and down outside the door.  Any noise was at completely acceptable levels and did not last long.  Loved the continental breakfast, it was enough to last until lunch.  The couple of days we wanted a full breakfast there was Denny;s (don't forget your AARP discount) on one side and iHop on the other - good for lunch or dinner too. Other restaurants within walking distance.  Parking was a little tight, but we always found an empty slot.  The best thing was the fact it was right across the street from Disneyland.  We could see the fireworks from our room.  When we left Disneyland
Manager Response: Thank you for your awesome feedback M V, our hotel is definitely a good choice if you want to stay right by the main gate to Disneyland and our rates are very competitive indeed. Thank you again and I hope to see you again at the Desert Inn in the near future.  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: This was our 3rd stay and we will always choose to stay here. Always excellent. Can't beat the location or the size of the rooms. Very comfortable for 4 adults and 3 kids! Staff is always friendly. No complaints.
Manager Response: We always appreciate you coming back to us when you visit the Disneyland Resort. Thank you on behalf of our staff and we sure hope to have you stay with us for years to come.  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Great hotel - right across from the main entrance to Disneyland.  No hassle looking for parking and close to several places to eat - all within walking distance.  Rooms were huge with 2 queen beds and a fold out couch - perfect for families.  A nice breakfast is included too.  Heated pool and hot tub to relax in at the end of the day.  Would give this hotel an excellent rating and would recommend it to everyone looking for a nice hotel in a great location.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback and recommendations. I'm glad that our family suite was a nice fit for your family and that you found our hotel convenient. Our continental breakfast is a great way to start your day and our indoor heated pool and spa are definitely a big help after a long day at the parks. Give us a call when you are ready to come back to the Desert Inn.  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: This hotel is very reasonable, wonderful location, clean rooms with lots of options for rooms. Breakfast was ok for a snack, it is a true continental breakfast. I loved my Parlor Suite.  I would absolutely come back.
Manager Response: On behalf of our entire staff we would like to thank you for your kind words and hope to see you again when your travels bring you back to the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Stayed 4 nights. Great location literally opposite the entrance to Disneyland. Rooms are good size we had an Executive Room. Staff are friendly and rooms clean. They have coin laundry on site and some lockers. Breakfast included was cereal and toast with hard boil eggs fruit and pastries. ok to start the day. There is also a rooftop viewing area to watch the fireworks. Only complain was the in room coffee came with powder creamer. Would prefer long life sachets but we went to a little convenience store nearby and bought a small milk to keep in the refrigerator. This is our second time at this hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I appreciate your kind comments and your observations. We do offer a wide variety of rooms and suites that can accommodate most families at reasonable prices.  We do listen to our guests and their valuable feedback assists us in making operational modifications and service enhancements. Kind regards!	  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights with our 3yr old & 7mth old during our visit to Disneyland. Excellent location, literally across the road from Disneyland entrance. Really reasonably priced. Room was clean and large with a separate loungeroom. We stayed on the top floor which had a great view of the park. Included breakfast was decent. Friendly staff. Good facilities. Ihop next door was handy. Will definitely stay again.
Manager Response: I thank you for your outstanding review of our hotel. We do take pride in our customer service, cleanliness and location. We will be delighted to have you stay with us again in the near future.  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Very friendly, Great location and very nice rooms
Summary: This is the only hotel we stay at when we come to Disneyland. Rooms are very clean and comfortable. Great location, cheap rates. We will definitely stay here every time we come to Disneyland. You dont have to wonder if your getting the best deal they will automatically give you the lowest price. They will also give you all the choices of rooms that are available to choose from to accommodate you. Very very pleased with this hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback and for such high marks. We appreciate you come back to the Desert Inn year after year. We definitely offer fantastic accommodations and very competitive rates. Thank you again and feel free to give me a call directly to help you with your booking when get ready to come down to the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We spent two nights at the Desert Inn and Suites and had a very nice stay.  You can't beat it's location right across the street from the Esplanade.  Also, the rooms were clean and the beds were very comfortable.  The free continental breakfast was very convenient, and had everything my kids like.  I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Best place to stay near Disneyland
Summary: We always prefer to stay at Desert Inn when we visit Disneyland.  It is convenient, clean, and the service is always great.  The front desk people are always ready with a smile.  There is a taxi stand right across the street.  The breakfast is a great quick snack, we have hard boiled egg, pastry, and juice and coffee.  This is always are first choice for a hotel in this area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here for 10 days, group of two adults 4 kids, heated pool after long days out was great, breakfast was ok to grab something quick before jumping on coach or heading to theme parks, room was cleaned everyday, will stay here again
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our family have gone to Disneyland for Thanksgiving for the last 4 years and this was one of the best places for all of us to stay together.  The rooms were clean, service was awesome.  We can in 3 separte cars and all could park at the same place.  They had wifi so all this kids were happy.  Being right across from the park was great!  Is someone wanted to go back early there wasn't a problem.  We are planning on staying there again next year.
Manager Response: none

Summary: we spent 14 nights at desert inn and suites and could not fault the consistent high level of service afforded us. would without hesitation stay here again. location was, of course, a great bonus.disney park, cab rank and buses servicing the resort area and beyond. so many advantages to consider. a no-brainer really for families and couples.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good value, clean hotel, right across the street from Disney
Summary: Stayed on the Friday and Saturday after Thanksgiving. The room was very clean, as was the pool area and viewing deck upstairs. Given the proximity, cleanliness and costs this was a very good value. Highly recommend the Desert Inn. Right across the street from Disneyland, 5 minutes to the entrance.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Location, location, location!  Walking distance to the Disneyland resort is perfect!  Continental Breakfast is OK, hours are from 7am-9am.  If they opened earlier, timing would be perfect before entrance for Magic Morning.  Choices of 2 types of fresh fruit, boiled egg, danish, toast, cold and hot cereals, juices, coffee, tea and milk.  Floors in the room were a bit untidy upon check-in.  Refrigerator and Microwave is an added bonus for stocking up on essential beverages and food.  Restaurants are within walking distance.  Coupons for dining is an added bonus.  Free wi-fi.  Suites are a nice fit for a family of 10.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The bed and pillows are a bit stiff but overall a good experience. The location could not be beat and the continental breakfast was convenient before racing off to disneyland. We didn't have much interaction with the staff but the few times we did they seemed to be helpful. Thanks again and we'll see you guys next year.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our family of 4 just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel.  The location can't be beat!  Directly outside of the main entrance to Disneyland, across a crosswalk, and hang a right to your little home for a few days.  This is a budget hotel; don't expect frills.  We stayed in a 5th floor Parlor Suite as I had requested.  The glamorized wording describes a budget hotel room with an extra sleeper sofa so it can technically sleep six.   Occasionally we had to wait for the elevator when we were too tired to take the stairs up.  To save time, we often avoided the elevator  when coming down.  The lock to our room worked well, we used the in-room safe for valuables, and we felt safe and comfortable overall.  The microwave was small, but worked.  The refrigerator worked well and had
Manager Response: none

Summary: You can't beat the location of this hotel if you are visiting Disney.  We stayed for a week again this year and had another good experience.  We did have a few maintenance issues but they were resolved quickly.  The rooms were clean.  There are only 2 pillows on each bed which was an issue for us and there weren't any sheets in the room for the pull out sofa.  We do love their family suites which are ideal for larger families (ours had 4 queen beds, a pull out sofa, two separate bedrooms and a tiny front sitting room and 2 full bathrooms). Parking is very tight however and often you have to use the valet.  Both times we have stayed there have been elevator issues which meant either waiting forever for an elevator since only one was working or taking the stairs which is a
Manager Response: none

Summary: Location is amazing! The location of this property is the main draw. Their price is really compelling. Breakfast is pretty limited, but not the deal breaker. Our family is five people strong, that being said, one of our kids ( teenager) was in the hide away bed, which was a little skippy in the mattress portion. This would not be as big of deal if little kids are sleeping in it. Once your tribe is in the park(s) all day, and your feet are at their end of service; it sure is a welcomed site to see your hotel right across the street.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Perfect location we were right outside the gate which made walking all day and night amazing! We didn't have to find parking but the resort fees and taxes for everything do tack on additional price than just the room.. But all in all I would definitely stay again. The rooms were clean and decent staff was nice and helpful. Definitely would recommend to people on a budget that want to be close to the park ...;)
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good location, but hotel staff kept/stole my Ugg boots!!!!
Summary: I actually enjoyed the stay here  since it was so close to Disneyland but I am extremely dissapointed with the staff. I left my Ugg boots in the room and when I called to get them back, they informed me they weren't found. I wish I would have stayed elsewhere where the employees have morals and ethics!!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Our go to when visiting the happiest place on earth.
Summary: We love staying at the Desert Inn & Suites! We are Annual Pass holders although we live out of state, and we will always stay here.  Our only con is the water pressure. Other than that we love the staff, the property, EVERYTHING!  I do wish they had a frequent visitor reward program or an annual pass discount.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Front desk service was ok,  but felt more like you were at an Auto repair shop or something vs a front desk of a Motel. The free Valet service was good and very helpful and careful with the cars. They have very limited self Parking, so usually what you will have to go with as most parking is underground. But there was pretty easy access to your car if you needed something from it ect.  The free Continental Breakfast in thier breakfast area near the Lobby was pretty basic, consisting of Hard boiled eggs, make your own toast, pastries, a few kinds of cereal and milk, Orange Juice, Apple Juice, whole oranges ect.  Very close though to the DIsneyland Main entrance and a short about 7 min walk from the Motel across the street through the Disneyland Main entrance and to the Turnstiles
Manager Response: none

Summary: The rooms were clean but dated and old furniture. Surprised there wasn't a DVD player in our suite.    One afternoon I brought my young kids back to the room to nap. Housekeeping came in and tried to clean while we were sleeping. When I asked them to leave so we could sleep they started calling every 5 minutes to see if they could come clean, so much for naptime!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great hotel right across the road from Disneyland which is VERY important when you've had a full day of trekking the park!! Clean, big comfortable and well decorated rooms as well as professional friendly staff! I've stayed here a number of times and the staff have always accommodated my request for room 122 at the end of the hotel, away from the noise of S Harbour Blvd. I highly recommend the Desert Inn and suites.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Im happy i made a good choice! spacious enough room and the best! 5 MIN WALKING TO DISNEYLAND PARK!! believe me in the morning you are all exciting, BUT at night coming back walking to the hotel its just great very closet.and they gave me my room quickly.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Another great stay! Choose elsewhere if you need wifi though!
Summary: We stayed in a C1 suite this time (4 kids plus my sister and brother-in-law). It was VERY clean, baby's feet were minimally dirty after being barefoot (we can't get her to keep shoes on, or socks). Bathrooms were very clean. Wifi is terrible. Don't stay here if you need it. Breakfast is minimal but ok for our family. Toast, 3 kinds of generic cereal, bagels and cream cheese, some little debbie type cinnamon rolls, little muffins, and rubbery hard boiled eggs. There was juice and milk as well and apples and oranges.  Again, the elevators are SO SLOW, take the stairs if you can. Parking is a pain, but they do have free valet if they are full. Thankfully since we had the box on the van we had to be parked up top. The garbage truck came SUPER early (about 6:30-6:45) and is VERY
Manager Response: none

Summary: Right next to Disneyland, clean room, comfortable bed, and we had adjoining rooms, which was perfect for large group. Continental breakfast was nothing special, but that's okay. We didn't select the place based on free breakfast (nor did we use it); our goal was to stay close to the park and you can't get closer than this place! Fast elevator and nice people at the front desk. What's not to like? Give it a try.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Spent 5 nights at this property while at Disneyland to run the Avengers Half Marathon.  Requested a quiet executive room on the top floor as had read about the excited children running back & forth creating noise.  When we arrived we were put on the 2nd floor.     I politely enquired about a room on the top floor to which Alex advised us that the room type we had reserved was not available on the 5th floor.   Alex was very nice and enquired with his boss about an upgraded room on the 5th floor.  PERFECT!  Our adult son was joining us and this upgraded room had a separate room with a hide abed and a TV to provide some privacy.  The room are older and not plush but were clean and functional.  Nothing fancy but practical.   Fridge, microwave and a coffee maker.  Only provided with
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed in the parlor suite for 2 nights with 4 adults and 4 children. The parlor suite is 2 rooms connected with 2 beds and a full bath on each side and worked perfectly for us. It has a separate sitting room with a tv also. We walked right across the street to get into Disneyland and we were able to come back during the day, give our grandchildren a nap and go back in later for the Christmas parade and fireworks.  We ate Denny's right next door and also munched off the hotels continental breakfast. It was just so nice not having to drive the 2 days we stayed here. Beds were very comfy and the crib was in the room when we arrived. We loved the location!! It's not far from the airport' I think it was 13 miles from John Wayne Airport.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place to stay when visiting Disneyland with your family.
Summary: We enjoyed our stay at the hotel. The only thing that could have been better was the hot tub. The temperature was a little on the cooler side. Not what I needed after a long day of walking. Kind of disappointed with that but overall it is a great place to stay.
Manager Response: We appreciate you staying with us recently and thank you for your kind review. Our spa does work on a timer, however I will look deeper into this issue. Thank you for letting me know and we'll see you again when you come back to the Desert Inn.  Teo Huerta Manager

Summary: This is the second time my family has stayed at this hotel for a Disneyland vacation, and it worked for what we wanted. It has all the bare necessities, without many extras.  One of the TV's didn't work, but for this trip, that wasn't a problem, so I never mentioned it to management until we were checking out.  You'll get a bar of soap, and some 2-in-1 shampoo/conditioner, and that's about it - but again, that's really all we needed.  The room was clean and safe, and had a sofa-sleeper in the separate "living room," as well as a coffee maker.  The continental breakfast is not very exciting at all, but it was enough to get us going in the morning - barely.  However, all-in-all, for the price we paid, we were content with the hotel, because staying here allowed us to have a suite
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide your valuable feedback. We appreciate you coming to the Desert Inn & Suites and for pointing out our room cleanliness and our awesome location just across from Disneylands' main entrance. Let us know when you are ready come back and we'll assist you with your booking needs.  Teo Huerta Management

Summary Heading: Very good for the price. Great location!
Summary: Desert Inn is just across the street from the entrance to Disneyland. The parlor suite rooms are enormous and had plenty of room for six of us...including two bathrooms. If you don't need a fancy name brand hotel with all the extras and expenses that come along with it, this place is for you. Simply put, it's a safe and clean place to stay for the few hours that you need to rest up before you spend the day in the parks.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your kind words about your recent stay at the Desert Inn. We do have a wide variety of rooms and suites at reasonable prices and i'm glad that you were able to take the advantage of these features.  Feel free to give me a call so that I can personally help you with any future reservations.  Teo Huerta Manager

Summary: We have stayed here and at many other area lodgings on 25-30 visits to Disneyland over the past 14 years. Now that the kids are 11 and 13, more than two beds, good location, and superior value are our priorities. Anaheim Desert Inn and Suites rocks in all areas. In fact, the upgrade in hospitality, modernization, and cleanliness over the past 14 tears is truly impressive to me. Thanks for another great stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review and I'm glad that our location and value were to your liking. We really appreciate your continued business throughout the years and we can't wait for your next visit.  Teo Huerta Manager

Summary Heading: Perfect location, nice amenities at the right price
Summary: Cannot beat the location of this hotel, right across the street from disneyland!  The room was clean and roomy and maid service did an awesome job.  The breakfast was ok, muffins, danishes, hard boiled eggs(not sure how you can go wrong with eggs but they did not taste right) toast and apples and oranges(you would think for being in california they would have good fruit, but they were not edible.)  Inside pool was nice but hot tub could have been hotter.  Check in staff was friendly and helpful.  Overall, would definitely stay again!
Manager Response: Hello Beth,  Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to give us your feedback. We are happy that your stay was great. We are not perfect but we work very hard at providing great customer service and a clean and comfortable place to stay. We hope to see you soon.  Teo Huerta Manager

Summary Heading: Great location for Disney Family Vaca
Summary: We've stayed here many times for our family vacation trips to Disneyland.  Very convenient and very close proximity to Disneyland that we love avoiding shuttle rides and parking.  The kids love the indoor pool as well!  The rooms allow you to bring your own food and make things that save on expensive food in the park.  We will always make this our second home when visiting Disney.
Manager Response: Thank you for your truly awesome comments regarding our hotel, it is a great pleasure to have you stay with us and that you enjoy our hotel amenities and service. Thank you again and we'll see you in the near future.  Teo Huerta Manager

Summary: The main reason this hotel was selected was for the close proximity to Disneyland and the Anaheim Convention Center. We could walk to Disneyland in less than 5 minutes. The rooms were descent and nothing fancy. We were rarely in the room except to sleep and get ready for the day so that was fine for us. The rooms were clean and maid service was great. Parking is $9 a day which was good compared to the Disney parking prices. The free continental breakfast was ok but mainly lots of bread and carbs. Overall I would stay again for the price and proximity.
Manager Response: Hello phase81,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are happy to hear that our rooms were to your liking and that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you again and we'll see you soon.  Carlos Padilla Manager

Summary: This was our first trip to Disney - and only for a few days as we have a toddler. This was the perfect hotel for our situation. It was so close that we did not have to move our car once from the time we arrived because we walked everywhere. It was convenient in the  middle of the day when the baby needed a nap and break from stimulation because it was right there and required no shuttles or busses. The hotel was inexpensive (half to a third of staying on a Disney property). Our only complaints were about the noise level in our room from people talking outside while we tried to sleep; the continental breakfast was very slim-picking so we only tried it our first day and decided to pick something up elsewhere the other days; the pillows were very flat and hard. Overall, I would
Manager Response: Hello Kelly P,  Thank you for staying with us,  I am delighted to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us. We do strive to provide an exceptional product and deliver friendly service while being mindful of families traveling on a budget.   Carlos Padilla Manager

Summary: we stayed in the 2 room family suites. they were nice and spacious. 2 king beds (a bit firm) in each room. fridge, microwave and coffee maker. a little table to sit and eat at and a sofa w coffee table. do not expect to sleep in- lots of kids up early and running and yelling w excitement. there is a small pool (indoor) and a room with some arcade games. with in walking distance are restaurants and a sparsely stocked convenience store, but no real grocery store. no starbucks nearby, but there are 2 over at Disney area.  There is a rooftop viewing area to see the fireworks at disney opens about 9:00pm
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and for providing valuable feedback. We are one of the few hotels that offer suites spacious enough for families and we are glad that our hotel met your needs. We hope to see you again soon and let us know when you are ready to come back to the Desert Inn.  Carlos Padilla Manager

Summary: Great location about 1/2 mile from Disneyland.  The room was very spacious and it had a microwave and a mini fridge.  The pool and spa area was very convenient.  It was a great value for the price!  Definitely enjoyed our stay there.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback about your stay at the Anaheim Desert Inn. It was a pleasure to be of service and call us when you are ready to come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Carlos Padilla Manager

Summary: This hotel was amazingly priced, considering its proximity to the Disneyland main entrance. Less than five minute walk to the parks, easy to go back to the hotel if needed. The room was very clean, and the bathroom was quite large — we could watch the fireworks show from the bathroom window! The value can't be beat, I'd never stay anywhere else!!
Manager Response: hank you for staying with us and I am pleased that you enjoyed your appointed room. Our hotel location will definitely be of big help while spending a long day at the parks. Thank you for your continued support and we'll see you soon.  Teo Huerta Manager

Summary Heading: Staying again and again and again
Summary: I loved it. My son and I, along with my daughter and her husband, stayed  in a two room 4 queen bed, sofa bed, 2 bathroom and one shower.  The price was worth it.  Great location.  Not so good complimentary breakfast but, we loved the pastry and boiled eggs.  We took our pastry and drink to go.  The pool was good enough for my son.  Was great to go to the upper deck to see the fire-works.  Even to me the staff was great.
Manager Response: I wanted to thank you for your continued business time after time and I'm happy to hear that you enjoy the breakfast, fireworks viewing deck, location. Let me know when you are ready to come back and I'll personally help you with your reservation.  Teo Huerta Management

Summary: great,big and clean rooms with micro and fridge. well priced for how close it is to Disney. after walking all day the hotel is so close. and indoor pool and hottub. breakfast in the morning, all you need! i always stay here when visiting the happiest place on earth!
Manager Response: I wanted to thank you for your valuable feedback and for staying with us recently. I'm happy to hear that our prices were to your liking and that our amenities and breakfast were of help to your and your family. We look forward to your next visit.  Teo Huerta Manager

Summary: My daughter and I stayed at this property last week for four nights. We have stayed at the Best Western, Del Sol, and The Grand Californian but decided to give this a try. I always give at least 3 stars if it is clean and there are no creepy crawlies and it was definitely clean. It is located quite conveniently across from Disneyland and makes for seamless traveling to and from the park.   Pros:  First and foremost was one of the staff members at the registration desk by the name of Auggie.  He could not have been more accommodating or helpful. Super pleasant and went out of his way to assist us. Due to a tendon injury I needed a rental scooter and had contacted One Stop Mobility because we used them last time. They were very expensive this time and Auggie immediately suggested
Manager Response: Thank you for your amazing feedback about your stay and thank you for giving us a chance to host your Disney vacation. I have shared your review with Auggie and he very much appreciates your kind words as well. We apologize for any inconvenience you might have encountered while we repaired our property staircases. Thank you again and we hope to see you again in the near future.  Teo Huerta Manager

Summary: Clean hotel located a skip away from the front gate of Disneyland. They do charge to store your luggage if you are there to early and want to go play in the park. They offer a complimentary breakfast and pool. The rooms are clean and well kept. Would most definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great location and staff; terrible breakfast
Summary: I've stayed here multiple times and have liked it each time.  The staff is great; they upgraded my room at no cost, checked me in quickly, were very pleasant.  We arrived several hours before check-in and they held the larger bags that we had behind the counter while also offering lockers for the smaller bags we had.  That gave us freedom to go to the park or to Downtown Disney without having to lug everything with us.  The room was very clean and tidy.  Every day we were impressed that the cleaning staff was able to successfully clean a room that held 4 adults and 3 children under the age of 6!  They always provided a lot of towels, toilettries, and toilet paper.  Location can't be beat; 5 minutes walking distance to the entrance of either park.  A God sent considering all the
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for 11 nights in September. Being a long way from home alone with my 3 kids, we were extremely well looked after by the staff. I was feeling extremely unwell upon arrival but super early (way before check-in), however, the manager organised a room for us by 12pm. Until then we were welcome to use the lobby couch to relax on. After asking about a local doctor, he rang back to check on me and to see if I needed anything more. The rooms were clean and serviced at a time when we were out in Disneyland :) Free breakfast was enough to start the day. The Parlour Suite with the extra couch and TV area was great. We could even see some of the fireworks from our rear window. So close to the park a short stroll, great for daytime rests. Air conditioning worked great and the
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stay here everytime we visit disneyland. Its a short walk away from the park and the rooms are clean. the beds and pillows are a bit hard but you barely notice after a long day at disney! The breakfast is perfect to grab a snack on the way to the park. I would reccomend this place to anyone.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Just fine for the price and LOCATION!!
Summary: This place was very clean and nice. The FREE breakfast was not much but its FREE!!! No trash can liners not sure if it was missed or they dont use them? The hotel was full we had no trouble with noise
Manager Response: none

Summary: I had low expectations, but I was pleased with our time at the Anaheim Desert Inn. The location can't be beat. The check-in process was one of the smoothest and quickest we've ever had. I appreciated the appearance of the lobby; it appears to be recently updated. The hot tub was broken the first night, but was operational a few days later. Our room was clean and was cleaned well each day of our stay. We had plenty of fresh, clean towels. There was enough room for all of us in the suite. Perhaps my only complaint was that the room wasn't more soundproof. Each night, there were several minutes of noise outside our room and from the room above us. Pack earplugs! The free breakfast was nothing remarkable, but it wasn't awful. We were happy to have the toast or muffins or bagels,
Manager Response: none

Summary: For price and nearness to park this worked out extremely well. Firework viewing from roof was great, uncrowded and with adequate seating. We had a small problem with a wet rug from leaking air conditioner when we arrived. I called the desk and they sent someone up and within 40 minutes we had a brand new air conditioning unit installed and a fan set up to dry the floor during the day when we were at park. We were offered the option to switch rooms but chose to stay put. Our two room parlor suite worked out well for the three of us. Older property yes and not luxurious, but certainly clean and a good value especially considering location. Free breakfast not so great. We would stay here again.
Manager Response: Hello Diane C,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that you enjoyed our property and we hope to see you when you come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary: We have stayed at this hotel many times and highly reccomend it for families. The staff is friendly and helpful!! The rooms are clean and spacious and you can't beat it's close proximity to Disneyland.  The indoor pool and spa and fun for the kids during the winter months.
Manager Response: Hello Disneygirl1931,  Thank you so much for the excellent review. We work hard to provide a home away from home to all of our guests. Thank you for being such loyal customer and we hope to see you in the near future.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary: We really liked the family suite where we could be together yet separate. The rooms were clean and nice. The hot tub was under repair the first two days and the stairs and elevator were also under repair during our stay. The staff was very nice and helpful. The breakfast is the usual continental type.This hotel is very close to the entrance to Disneyland and there are several restraunts within a very short walking distance. We also viewed the fireworks from our room!
Manager Response: Hello Peggy M,  We do appreciate your feedback and are really happy to hear that you and your family enjoyed the nice clean rooms. We look forward to be of service again in the near future. Thank you for choosing the Anaheim Desert Inn & Suites.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary: I have been coming to Desert Inn since 1998. It was a great value then and still the best value now. Rooms are spacious and updated. The mattresses were comfortable and good quality which is important when you have been at Disneyland all day. You are surrounded with Denny's IHOP Tony Roma's and across the street pizza delivery ad good Chinese food a few blocks away, and walking distance from Disney just across the street.  I will always recommend this place to anyone for price service and comfort. So many places look great or are located in a great location but the mattress sucks. Without a good nights sleep nothin else happens.
Manager Response: Hello Csrqueenb,  We appreciate you taking the time to complete a survey regarding your recent stay with us. On behalf of our entire staff here at the Desert Inn & Suites we would like to thank you for staying with us and for giving us high scores on tripadvisor. We are happy to hear that you and your family enjoyed the spacious updated rooms with the comfortable mattresses. We appreciate you recommending our hotel to everyone. Once again, thank you and we hope to see you soon.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary: Fabulous location for Disneyland Parks and Downtown Disney, literally across the road. About 45 mins from LAX. We caught a bus right outside Disneyland to Orange County Outlets, only cost a few dollars.  Restaurants within walking distance. Breakfast provided at hotel is VERY basic, cold boiled eggs, bagels, toast, jam, juice, muffins. Coffee facilities provided in room are also very basic, with a drip filter coffee machine (one sachet of coffee provided and no tea), so for many overseas travellers, like us, we had to use the drip filter coffee machine (without coffee sachet of course), any time we wanted hot water for tea (or noodles for my grand daughter), as there is no kettle. Room was very compact for 3 people, (two adults, one child), we had a studio room, but it was
Manager Response: Hello Catherine M,  Thank you for taking the time to review the Anaheim Desert Inn & Suites, we apologize that your stay was anything less than great. We will use your review to help us provide a better experience for our future guests. Thank you and I sure hope that you would give us another opportunity to serve you.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary: I have be coming to Desert Inn and Suites for years. We have stayed at just about every hotel near Disneyland. There is no other place I would stay. Over the years Carlos the manager and other employees here have treated us like family. The service is excellent, rooms are comfortable, the hotel is just steps away from Disneylands entrance. Like I tell everyone going to LA, Desert Inn and Suites is the place to stay.
Manager Response: Hello djortiz235,  Thank you for the excellent review. We are extremely happy to hear that your stay was great. We are not perfect but we work very hard at providing great customer service and a clean and comfortable place to stay. Will see you soon.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary: The only reason we booked this hotel was due to the location. It is literally across the street from the hotel. However, our room was gross and dirty. We ended up buying clorox wipes to wipe down our entire room. The pillows and mattresses were very stiff. The grosses thing was twice when I went to use a fresh clean towel after showering, it had a long dark hair on it! (YUCK!) Nothing worse! Also the maids are very loud, pushing their carts up and down the hall to clean the room, it sounds like kids are skateboarding ALL. DAY. LONG. The walls are so thin, you could hear peoples conversations as they walked by your room. So there you have it, dirty, uncomfortable, and very loud! Oh and make sure you bring tipping money since many times, we were unable to park our car ourselves
Manager Response: Hello Julie O,  On behalf of our entire staff, we would like to apologize for the concerns you and your family encountered at our hotel. We appreciate the feedback and we will use it to fine tune our operations in the hope that you would give us another opportunity to serve you and hope to meet or exceed your expectations.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary: Great place to stay.  Location and price is great.  Staff was very helpful.  Will stay here again.  Do wish the breakfast selection was better.  Our room location was horrible but we booked last minute and were glad to get it.  You could see nothing but the wall from our window.
Manager Response: Hello Linda D,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that you gave us an excellent score on Value, Cleanliness and service. We hope to see you again when you come back to the Disneyland Resort.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary: First of all I have to say the location is great.  This place is right next to the crosswalk on S. Harbor Blvd. which leads to the main entrance to disneyland.  My biggest complaint is the resort tax.  This is not a resort its a hotel but I guess everyone charges for it.  Second was the nice 9% anaheim tax fee which was ridiculous but I have not control on that.  Parking was $9 a day which all of this is not included in the total price given on the internet.  My overall biggest complaint is that we are all trying to budget for trips and when you get hit with another $100 or $150 in fees it screws everything up.  The continental breakfast speaks for itself not a whole lot there but its there.  The spa was out of service but being repaired.  The place overall is clean and the
Manager Response: Hello Mike P,  On behalf of our entire staff, we would like to apologize for the concerns you had about our hotel. We appreciate your feedback and we hope to see you soon.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary: I wish there were more breakfast options, wish there was there are more elevators with access to 3rd Floor. The keys kept on deactivating. I wish there were more channel options, a movie channel option would be nice.  The boiled eggs were cold wish they were kept warm. Great location though!
Manager Response: Hello lgarcia-duque,  We appreciate you taking the time to complete a survey regarding your recent stay with us. On behalf of our entire staff here at the Anaheim Desert Inn & Suites we would like to apologize for the concerns you had at our hotel.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary: The hotel is great. Right by entrance to Disney parks. Clean and well priced!! I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again! Only thing was the channel selection on the TV for kids. Could be better to allow kids some downtime!!
Manager Response: Hello Spitzer73,  Thank you for your feedback, we are happy to hear that you taught our hotel was great and clean. It is our pleasure to be of service and we look forward to future visits.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary: Great location, price & service... all you can ask. Rooftop fireworks viewing. Right across the street from Disneyland, literally just steps away from the entrance access. also the best prices for shuttles,etc.
Manager Response: Hello jazzer1951,  Thank you so much for your kind words. We work hard to provide a home away from home to all of our guests. On behalf of all our team members we would like to say thank you.   Sincerely,   Carlos Padilla

Summary: This place is so close to Disneyland it only takes a few minutes to walk. You can also catch the buses at the Disneyland park to other places. The staff are really nice and helpful. We stayed in their two room apartment with two bathrooms as there was seven of us. The rooms were nice and clean and comfortable. You also get a free continental breakfast. There are also a lot of eating places close by. Would stay there again.
Manager Response: Hello joyandal,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that your stay was great. We appreciate the high scores on Value, Cleanliness and Service. We hope to see you when you come again to the Disneyland Resort.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary: This Hotel is really great for the money, their family suite, consists of three rooms four queen size beds, a queen pull out couch, three t'v's, two full bathrooms, and two coffee pot. and ample room to add a blow up bed if needed.
Manager Response: Hello PatrickD251,  Thank you for your feedback, it was our pleasure to be of service and we look forward to future visits.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary: We spent 28 days of our vacation at this Hotel and would do it again. We were on the 3rd floor towards the back, not too far from the elevator. Staff were excellent, respecting our privacy  when we had a 'rest day'. Cleaning- excellent though made difficult with all our cases. We had a problem  with our safe and a workman was there to fix within 10 minutes. Indoor pool was too warm during the heat wave and the spa was hot. Office staff were all courteous and helpful. Viewing area on the roof was undergoing renovations as was the breakfast room for three of the four weeks we were there, though didn't pose a problem. Breakfast was basic and what we expected. Laundry was clean and tidy. $2.to wash and $2 to dry. Quarters available from the office My only gripe was Tea drinking
Manager Response: Hello Sue P,  We appreciate you taking the time to complete a survey regarding your recent stay with us. On behalf of our entire staff here at the Anaheim Desert Inn & Suites we would like to thank you for choosing our hotel and hope to see you again.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary Heading: Store Luggage for a Day- Disneyland
Summary: If you are looking for a place to store your luggage on your first of last day at Disney, you can store your bags here for $1.50! We fit a carry-on, mid-sized luggage, along with a purse and tote bag! The staff was very helpful and made us feel like hotel guests. They also have a large bathroom to change and freshen up.  What a great find right across the street from Disney.
Manager Response: Hello Plbanuelos,  Thank you for your feedback and for giving us such high marks, it was our pleasure to be of service and we look forward to future visits.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary: *Amazing location, so convenient * Upon check-in we had a broken hair dryer and broken TV. Since we had a suite, we had another of each to use, but I feel like that should have been fixed before we entered the room since both were already broken.  Told the front desk staff and they just said okay, didn't really seemed to care or apologetic. *breakfast like most said left a lot to be desired.  I get continental breakfast, but this was by far the most skimped continental breakfast I've ever seen.  They didn't even have bagels 2 out of the 3 days that we were there. * Didnt even have a soap tray for the hand soap, had to just leave it on the counter *house keeping staff did a great job cleaning our room each day.  Knew because of the price we weren't staying at the Ritz, but did
Manager Response: Hello Linsay D,  We are extremely sorry about your unsatisfactory experience and issues you had with the room. Your feedback is really appreciated so as to ensure that this type of incident does not take place again.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary: I can honestly say that I have never had a bad experience at the Desert Inn and Suites.  I try to stay there whenever I come to the Disneyland Resort.  The front desk staff is always willing to help when you have a question or concern and the housekeeping staff if great.  My daughter and I stayed the end of September thru the 1st of October and found our room to be very quiet and the beds very comfortable. It is such a short walk into the parks and that is wonderful if you have small children or are just tired from a full day of riding and walking. Will always try this hotel first (and hope there is a room available).  Thanks for a great stay!
Manager Response: Hello KerrySpokaneValley,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that all your experiences at our hotel have been great. We appreciate the excellent review and for being a loyal guest. We hope to see you soon.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary: The location was awesome!  Closer than the Disneyland Hotels to the parks.  We had a Parlor suite and enjoyed the space- there were 4 adults and 2 kids and plenty of room.  Beds were pretty comfy- I wish we got the 2 full bath instead of 1 1/2  so we could coordinate showers better.  The pool was nice in the afternoon when it got too hot to be at the park.  Not much to the breakfast but certainly good enough to get us going in the morning. Plus we all wanted a snack at Disney by late morning anyway.  I would stay again definitely.
Manager Response: Hello sunflowerval,  Thank you for your feedback, it was our pleasure to be of service and we were very happy to hear that you enjoyed the space in your suite and the comfy beds. We look forward to your future visits.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary: We stayed here for 26 nights.  What a great place to stay.  When we arrived the breakfast room and observation deck were under renovation.  By the last week of our stay both places had opened.  The service and staff have been fantastic.  An indoor pool and spa prevented us from getting sunburnt which was great.  The front desk staff were able to provide us with great information.  The hotel is just across the street from Disneyland Resorts and there are numerous places to eat.  I would highly recommend Anaheim Desert Inn and Suites to anybody.  I love this place and will be back again in two years time. Thank you for your services!!!
Manager Response: Hello Angela P,  Thank you so much for your kind words and for giving us high scores. We work hard to provide a home away from home to all of our guests. Thank you and we hope to see you in a couple of years.   Sincerely,   Carlos Padilla

Summary: I have been there for 3 days. I am very happy because everything was great.  The location is amazing. You just have to cross the setreet to go to Disneyland.  There are may places to go shopping and dining.  A very nice place to stay.
Manager Response: Hello jestench,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and thank you for the excellent review. We all hope to see you soon when you come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary: Originally I wanted to give this place more stars, but after I got my final bill with lots of hidden fees upon checkout, I decided against it. Here is the real deal about this hotel: you are paying for location, not comfort.  I'm surprised people on here think this is a cheap hotel. It's not cheap at all! I'm a deal seeker and I've gotten three Anaheim hotel nights for under $70 in the recent past. This place costs and arm and a leg, but regardless of that, the location is pretty darn prime being right across the street from the Disneyland entrance.  The first day we were dead tired from driving from Phoenix and wanted to nap for a few hours since my boyfriend had not slept in over 24 hours. We quickly realized that our room on the fifth floor was located right underneath a
Manager Response: Hello azlisa86,  Thank you for taking the time to review the Anaheim Desert Inn & Suites, we apologize that your stay was anything less than great. We will use your review to help us provide a better experience for our future guests. Thank you and I sure hope that you would give us another opportunity to serve you.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary: We just got back from staying here for our Disneyland trip! We travel pretty often, Disneyland 2-3 times a year with our annual passes! The past year I have been trying out new and different places. The desert inn was perfect for us this trip because we needed a suite. We got the A Parlor that has two queens and then a room with a sofa bed. This was perfect! The hotel is nice and it's right across the street from the park! The only things I didn't like were 1. There were no closets, kind of felt like limited space to put our things with 5 people in a room. They do have a hanging rack to hang clothes and small dressers. 2. When I called I was told they don't do AAA, might have been a misunderstanding of what I was asking cause when I got there I saw they do in fact do AAA. 3. The
Manager Response: Hello Mperez4,  On behalf of our entire staff, we would like to apologize for the concerns you had about your experience at this hotel. We appreciate the feedback and will use it to fine tune our operations in  hope that upon your next visit, we can meet or exceed your expectations.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary: All the reviews I read were favorable except the breakfast which I have to agree with.   We had 20 people in two suites which worked well.  We had young kids which we walked back in the middle of the day for naps.  Because of its access to the park entrance that was accomplished without much of a problem or wasted time. The rooms were clean and in pretty good repair. My reason for very good instead of excellent  was for the most part the breakfast. I would stay at this property again.
Manager Response: Hello bigsmoot,  Thank you for your review and for giving us such high marks for cleanliness and service. Management will look into our continental breakfast to see what can be done. Otherwise, I thank you for staying with us and hope to see you soon.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary: The Good Points:  Location Location Location!!!! Good value for money. The Breakfast was fine to get us started for the day before hitting the Parks. Room was spacious. Kids enjoyed the Pool. Clean. We were on the top floor (level 5) towards the front & had a great view of the fireworks & found the room to be quite quiet.  Now for what let it down for us....  On an extremely hot day & after a very long flight with two young children we were there 2 hours prior to the official check in time, the staff member on the desk proceeded to check us in but didn't actually tell me we wouldn't be able to have the key for another few hours??? Maybe she could have explained that she was just taking care of the paperwork but instead barely said a word to us & was very unwelcoming. When I
Manager Response: Hello Kelly D,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with Trip Advisor travelers. I assure you that quality and service is of utmost importance to us. Please accept my apologies for the experience you and your family encountered that was anything less than exceptional.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary: Location, location, location! Right across from the main entrance to the Parks. Clean room, friendly staff. Decent basic breakfast included if you get there before the crowd. Denny's next door, IHOP and McDonalds short walk, among others. Unfortunately, observation deck (fireworks) closed for renovations. Not luxurious but very fairly priced given the location. We were on the top floor, so no noise issues. Would stay there again.
Manager Response: Hello Cary E,  Thank you for staying with us and we do appreciate your kind comments regarding our clean room and friendly staff. We value our guests feedback and this helps us in making operational modifications and service enhancements.   Kind regards,  Carlos Padilla

Summary: Great location. Be advised they put a hold on your bank/credit card for the first night 2 days before you stay, they are very upfront about that, however when you check in they put a hold on your entire stay cost until you check out. This may not be a problem for some but we planned on paying cash for our stay and were splitting the cost with family members. We stayed at the Desert for 5 nights checking in on Monday and out on Saturday. Eight in our party. Our room was midway in the hotel on the second floor. Room was nice and super clean, maid service did a great job of keeping it that way and we made that tough.  Elevator was SUPER SLOW. Our only complaint was a wonky toilet that over flowed the morning we were checking out.
Manager Response: Hello Pam B,  On behalf of our entire staff we would like to thank you for giving us such high marks in value, sleep quality and service. We are excited to hear that you enjoyed the nice clean room and the excellent maid service you got from our room attendants. We all hope to see you again when your travel brings you back to the area.  Thank you,   Carlos Padilla

Summary: the first face you see are the front desk staff and they are friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and are very spacious. For the Disney experience the hotel is across the road from the entrance so you can't get better than that. It is also surrounded by eateries and shops, brilliant location.
Manager Response: Hello Jimbot961,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that your rooms were very clean and spacious and that you had a great stay. We hope to see you when you come back again to the Disneyland Resort.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary Heading: Wonderful location, but a few annoyances
Summary: Firstly, this place is right across the road from the entrance to Disneyland, so top marks for location.  However, bearing in mind that guests are likely Disneyland visitors (young families), it would be a good idea to have better soundproofing between floors.  We were unfortunate enough to have a ground floor room.  For the first couple of days (week days) it was fine - there was no-one above us.  So, we were all settled in our room when a family of elephants moved in upstairs for the weekend!!  Also, if your guests are young families, why would you allow the pool to remain open until 11pm, when everywhere else we have stayed closes the pool at 10pm?  Like the noise from the room above us, we also got the noise of everyone leaving the pool after 11pm.  An earlier start for
Manager Response: Hello NZTiberius,  Thank you for taking the time to review the Anaheim Desert Inn & Suites, we apologize that your stay was anything less than great. We will use your review to help us provide a better experience for our future guests. Thank you and I sure hope that you would give us another opportunity to serve you.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary: Since most of the kids were going to school in Southern California, thought it would be good idea to visit them and take them to Disneyland for the weekend.  We walked to Disneyland and agreed to meet up for dinner.  The kids loved the indoor heated pool.  In the morning, we all ate the complimentary continental breakfast.  After a few days of fun, it was time to send the kids back to school and we fly back home, as well.  Bye, Mickey et al.
Manager Response: Hello Flounder B,  Thank you for your feedback, it was our pleasure to be of service and we look forward to future visits.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary: We picked this property for room type and close to Disneyland. We arrived a little early and they stored our luggage while we went to grocery store. Room was ready at 3pm( no early check in). We were given a room in far back corner of property, didn't quite like it with 2 teen girls with me. The room itself was a good size, beds were okay and bathroom quite large. Wi-fi was unstable and constantly signing us out and very slow when it did connect. Very disappointed the roof deck was closed, would have been nice if hotel put there construction info on site - may not have chosen this hotel, but front desk staff at check in should have advised roof deck closed for construction and breakfast room under construction( it was re-located to small area). Bread was stale, boiled eggs were
Manager Response: Hello eyeluvdisney,  We appreciate you taking the time to complete a survey regarding your recent stay with us. On behalf of our entire staff here at the Anaheim Desert Inn & Suites we would like to apologize for the experience you and your family encountered at our hotel.    Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary: If you book early you can get a great deal. Check in was easy, everyone was very friendly. Our room was cleaned very well every day. Had a great view of California adventure. I enjoyed having the parlour suit so we could separate us from the kids after they went to bed. It took a day for the fridge to cool down enough to keep our food cold, we kept getting kicked off the WiFi and had to re sign in so often the we just gave up and used our phones. As a lot of people have said breakfast was seriously lacking, it was nothing but carbs and sugar. It was not enough to even get us to lunch. Other than that, our stay was great, and we will consider the desert inn the next time we visit Disneyland!
Manager Response: Hello Kris D,  Thank you for taking your time to write a comment about your stay at the Anaheim Desert Inn & Suites, it is a pleasure to know that you really enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for your patronage and we hope to see you in the near future.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary: This was my first stay at the Anaheim Desert Inn and Suites, but it won't be my last.  This is so close to the main gate of Disneyland that it is fantastic.  I found this hotel on one of the vacation websites, but when I went on their own site I received an even better deal.  I only live 50 miles from Disneyland, but would rather stay a night than to travel back and forth two days in a row.  This place was clean, friendly and so convenient.  Thank you for helping make our most recent trip our best one yet!
Manager Response: Hello val2222222222,  On behalf of our entire team members we would like to thank you for your kind words and hope to see you again. Your patronage is valued here at the Anaheim Desert Inn & Suites and we would love to make many more memorable experiences like your most recent one.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary: 3 nights spent here for our Disneyland visit. Location couldn't have been better - right across the road from the main park entrance, so we were through the gates in 5 minutes. We stayed in a suite with 2 double beds in each room - loads of room for 2 couples. The suites were clean and appeared to have been fairly recently renovated so we felt very comfortable. Breakfast is basic; pastries, bagels, cereals etc. but more than met our needs and a complimentary breakfast was a welcome bonus given the very reasonable room price
Manager Response: Hello PBremner,  Thank you for taking the time to complete the survey. We are ecstatic to hear that you felt very comfortable and enjoyed the 2 bedrooms suite. Nothing is more important to us than the comfort and relation with our guests. We thank you for your review and we cannot wait for your next stay!  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary: I have stayed in a couple of hotels in this area and will go back to this one. The location is PERFECT! The room was less expensive than others in the area and parking was reasonable (9$ a night).   They are doing renos which are a bit loud but most people are at the park all day! Pool is indoor (We spend our time at Disney not at a pool!!). Our room was freshly renovated and very comfortable. We did not try breakfast but it looked like the standard fare all hotels in this area provide (muffins, cereal, bananas etc.). There are restaurants a couple min drive away for some off Disney meals and plenty of local stores to buy refreshments (providing you have a car).  Staff was good. Rooms not available until 4pm. Do not try to get your room before this time, it will not be ready but
Manager Response: Hello 217heatherd,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and that you enjoyed our freshly renovated comfortable room. We hope to see you when you come again to the Disneyland Resort.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary: Great location if you are visiting Disneyland Parks and excellent breakfast option. Room always clean. You just need to offer 24 hours laundry. Parking is OK since you have the valet option when full.
Manager Response: Hello Alfredo C,  Thank you for your feedback and for the excellent marks for value, sleep quality and service. As always it is our pleasure to be of service and we look forward to future visits.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary: The hotel is in a great location for a good value. Unfortunately their breakfast is severely lacking. They alwaysed seemed to be running out of  plates. Their orange juice or apple juice was either super concentrated or really watered down. They didn't offer any water to drink, and it took finding 4 slices of moldy bread before they would open up a new bag. Only things offered were hard boild eggs, bread for toast, plain cherios, plain Kellogg flake cereal, either bagels or muffins/danish, apple and orange juice, and coffee. Oh and plain quick oats you could add hot water to, to make oat meal. But unfortunately they only offered brown sugar to sweeten/flavor it. We wish we would have brought things for breakfast.
Manager Response: Hello Lorette T,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel, we apologize that your stay was anything less than great. We will use your review to help us provide a better experience for our future guests. Thank you and I sure hope that you would give us another opportunity to serve you.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary: I picked this hotel as the reviews were above average, but did not find this to be the case.  Yes it is close to Disneyland and you can walk across the street with no problem.  The $9 to park at hotel is a savings over the now $17 charge at Disneyland and many of the other hotels.  I paid the lowest price for our stay as we did not need a large room for just 2 of us.  We were placed in a room right by the elevator, so people talking in the early AM was hard to ignore.  Don't fault the hotel for that but the room next to us had a large fan drying out something and when I called down about it got not much of a response.  Yes someone did come look at it and said it would not run all night but that's it.  So forget the nap before a night at DLand.  The window coving did a poor job
Manager Response: Hello MGD828,  We appreciate you taking the time to complete a survey regarding your recent stay with us. On behalf of our entire staff here at the Anaheim Desert Inn & Suites we would like to apologize for the experience you and your family encountered.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary: Clean, quiet, and very close to Disneyland. Wish the beds were a little softer, but not that bad. Wish breakfast offerings were a little better, would pay more for that. Stayed here 3 times in the last 12 months and will likely do so on the next trip to DL as well.
Manager Response: Hello ElkGroveChris,  Thank you for your kind words. We work hard to provide a home away from home to all of our guests. Thank you for being a loyal customer.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary: This is exactly what you expect (in a good way).  Clean, perfectly located and no frills.  As of last week they are still working on the roof deck but we could see the fireworks from our room.  All employees we encountered were friendly and efficient.  The room was clean and well laid out.  We did have three things that did not work (safe, TV and phone) so do check everything before you unpack. The microwave worked well and the fridge was nice and cold, unlike some hotel fridges. The hotel was very responsive and sent people to take care of the issues right away, so no problem.  We didn't use the indoor pool but it looked appealing.  The free breakfast is pretty lackluster but we're not breakfast eaters so we didn't really care.  Wish the coffee had been better though. After the
Manager Response: Hello Adventures0fAandL,  Thank you for your review. We are happy that your stay was great and the service and housekeeping were very good. We work very hard at providing great customer service and a clean and comfortable place to stay. We hope to see you soon.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary: I am a young adult (22) and stayed here with my two best friends when we came to southern California for a concert and Disneyland. The room was very nice and the pull-out bed in the couch meant that we all got our own place to sleep. I have stayed here before with my family and good experiences in the past are what made me choose this hotel for this trip. The next time I am staying in the area, I will definitely be staying at this hotel.
Manager Response: Hello Jessica L,  On behalf of our entire staff we would like to thank you for your kind words and loyalty. We hope to see you again when your travel brings you back with your friends or family.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary: We love the location the room had been updated and we loved the size of the rooms. We had 10 people. We all stayed very comfortably. This is our third time staying here and we will stay there in the future
Manager Response: Hello Diyayoung,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that this is your 3rd time staying with us and that you noticed our updated rooms. It is a pleasure to know that your family of 10 were very comfortable. Nothing is more important to us than our relationship with our guests. Again, we thank you for your review and we cannot wait for your next stay.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla  .

Summary: The biggest plus to this hotel is that it's right across the street from Disneyland. The next best thing is the hotel will accomodate larger parties without having to get multiple rooms. It's also not a terrible place to stay. It's the kind of place you might say to yourself "We're not going to be spending that much time in the room anyway". So it's an OK place to sleep and take a shower and be ready for a day in the park. The price is relativley inexpensive considering the area. It has a heavily used indoor pool, a 5th floor observation deck, contenental breakfast (the property is in between an IHOP and a Denny's if you want more than toast and muffins), and decent parking. The staff is helpful enough. Don't stay here if you're expecting the service and accomodations of the
Manager Response: Hello Joedisney P,  We appreciate you taking the time to complete a survey regarding your recent stay with us. On behalf of our entire staff here at the Anaheim Desert Inn & Suites we would like to thank you for staying at our hotel.       Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary Heading: Good location and that's about it
Summary: Don't stay here if you are expecting anything resembling good customer service.  My family and I have been staying here for the last few years when we would come to Disneyland but that will not be the case anymore. We are done trying to convince ourselves that it's a nice little place.  This last time we stayed here in Anaheim they were having a heat wave, the first night we got here the room was an oven but you can hardly blame them for that but either way the room didn't become livable until about 2 in the morning. The next day we left  the A/c on when we left and I put the do not disturb tag on the door.  When we got back that nigh the room was an oven again. The maids had come in and turned off the A/C. When we called the front desk they were very dismissive and basically
Manager Response: Hello Joseph D,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. I assure you that quality and service is of utmost importance to us. Please accept my apologies for the incidents you encountered. Your comments have been forward to our management team for review. Your patronage is valued here at the Anaheim Desert Inn & Suites and should you decide to stay with us, we would take that opportunity to be of better service to you and your family.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary: we thoroughly enjoyed our stay in the family suite for 10 and have no complaints what so ever! continental breakfast was handy, the rooms were very clean, location was spot on and we loved that we could all stay together in the same room for a very reasonable price! we would absolutely recommend and stay again if we ever get a chance to return.
Manager Response: Hello ashnizz,  Thank you for your feedback. We appreciate your kind comments and your observations. On behalf of the Anaheim Desert Inn & Suites we would like to thank you and hope to see you when you come back to the Disneyland Resort.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary: We were an entire family of 29 staying here for four nights to just do Disneyland and California Adventure Park.  This hotel is perfect for families!  The checkin was extremely efficient for this many people, and they were very accommodating in giving us two rooms early so that we could stow luggage and swim while the rest of the rooms were being readied.  The continental breakfast was adequate--perhaps one more protein item would add to its variety.  The new breakfast room will be great when it is finished.  Laundry facilities were nice to have on-site, and the location overall was its best feature.  A few steps to the crosswalk and over to the parks.  We would have liked to utilize the viewing deck but will do that on our next visit.  It was under repair as was one of the
Manager Response: Dear IdahoGrandma,  Thank you for taking your time to complete the survey. We appreciate you giving us such high marks on our rooms, cleanliness and service. We are excited to know that we did a great job at making your entire family of 29 a memorable one. The Anaheim Desert Inn & Suites Team Members would like to thank you for your patronage and we hope to see you in the near future.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary Heading: Family suite 10 people and not crowded
Summary: We had the family suite that slept 10. A living room with a closing door so those resting could rest. Two bedrooms with 2 queen size beds and a full bathroom in each. Quiet, clean, continental breakfast. We're able to walk to disneyland and not even break a sweat it was so close. Love this place. Was our second stay and will be back. Thank you
Manager Response: Hello Tete N,  Thank you for your feedback. We are happy to hear that you love this place and will be back. It was a pleasure to be of service and we look forward to your future visit.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary: I stayed here for 4 nights with my parents and husband for the RunDisney marathon weekend.  Cost - I booked this hotel nearly a year in advance at about $160 per night for a 2 bedroom 2 bathroom suite (the price was different for weeknights and weekends). I thought the price was very good for 4 people.  Service - This was severely lacking the whole time. My mother checked us in and was informed that because there had been a problem with my credit card a couple of days beforehand, we actually no longer held a reservation. Thank goodness they hadn't re-booked our suite! All other interactions with staff were brief and to the point.  Rooms - The suite was spacious and clean. There was a slight discrepancy with the layout compared to the room plans on the website. The room plan
Manager Response: Hello zanzibar138,  We are extremely sorry about your unsatisfactory experience. Your feedback is really appreciated, on behalf of our entire staff here at the Anaheim Desert Inn & Suites we would like to apologize for the inconvenience you and your family experienced.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla

Summary Heading: Always Satisfied Here - Runners! Good place to stay.
Summary: We have stayed at the Desert Inn a few times.   It is a excellent value and a great location to Disneyland. Especially if you have kids and want to avoid waiting for a hotel that buses you back and forth. This is about as close as you will get to the parks unless you can afford one of the in park hotels. For our family we have found Desert Inn to be a reasonable distance to walk back to for a mid-day rest.   Our recent stay was for the Disney half marathon and I found the walk to the starting line in the morning wasn't as bad as I thought it might be as it is at the very end of the Disney Walk for those whom are familiar.
