Summary: Our family has stayed across from the Disneyland parks 2 other times at 2 others hotels.....we have found that they are all great in their own way. We first choose the Desert Inn because our Family Trip was to be a big group but in the end part of our group could not come. I was going to cancel our rooms here and go with a smaller less expensive room from one of the other hotels next door....but when I called to cancel the reservation desk the asked if I just wants to downsize our room at a very good rate (comparable to next doors rate!) The staff at Desert Inn was friendly, helpful and our overall feeling of this place is we will keep this hotel on our list of go to hotel's for Disneyland!
Manager Response: Hi Princesssarah372014,  Thank you for staying with us, I'm glad that we were able to assist with your booking and that you enjoyed your stay while at the Desert Inn & Suites. We hope that you'll come back to us when your travels bring you back to the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Loved the location, view, staff!!  Staff helpful when finding us shuttles, answering questions and just being friendly. Breakfast was great too! Pool nice but noisy at times but that's because it's indoors and kids are loud. Will stay here next time!!
Manager Response: Hello Dana W,  Thank you for staying at the Desert Inn. We appreciate your kind words and we are glad that everything met  your expectations. Let us know when you are ready to come back to our hotel.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We're a Melbourne family of four - our boys are eleven and nine.  I did a lot of research on where to stay and decided on this hotel - was a good choice.  Fors - location location location - you are not going to get much closer than this to Disneyland.  It's across the road from the harbour boulevard entrance.  Still a walk into the gates but so much closer than every other hotel.  Also extremely close to the hotel is an ihop (diner) and denny's plus other restaurants - there is a coin operated laundry - there is an indoor pool - we never had time to use it - our room had two queens and plenty of floor space as well.  There was a coffee maker - everything was very modern and clean.  No mattress issues.  Against - average wifi - but usable - the breakfast room?  tiny and chaotic
Manager Response: Hello Fiona B,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us and for staying at the Desert Inn. Our breakfast room can get a little busy at times and that is why we will be expanding our breakfast area in the near future. Give us a call directly so that we can assist you with your bookings.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We just got back from Disneyland and decided to try the Desert Inn.  We were pleasantly surprised with basically a new upgraded room.  Very clean and comfortable. The only thing I was not happy with was the mattress.  It appears to be something like Memory Foam.  I would wake up in the morning with my back all clammy from sleeping on the foam mattress.  The bed itself was very comfortable though so this may not be an issue for some.  (BEWARE) the parking is a nightmare. There is not enough parking for everyone and that is due to the fact when a suite is booked two cars are allowed for same party traveling together, thus cutting back on parking.  So you have to use complimentary Valet Parking. It was difficult as our van ended up down below ground two cars deep with no way to
Manager Response: none

Summary: I recently stayed here with my family and we absolutely LOVED it. We are pass holders for Disneyland and we go quite often and have stayed at many hotels but this is by far the BEST one we have stayed at. It was nice and up to date. The beds were sooooo comfy and soft, unlike other hotels. And parking was so awesome. I would totally recommend the valet parking. It was so hassle free, easy and worth the money.  We will definitely be staying here on our next trip to Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had a great stay at the Anaheim Desert Inn last year in October! The room was clean, large and comfortable! The service at front desk was great, very polite and helpful! We stored our luggage in the lockers provided prior to check-in so we could go over to the park and have some fun…but one suitcase only JUST fit! Think we used a total of 3 lockers to store all our stuff. They should provide guests with secure luggage storage. The walls must be a bit thin because you could hear the excited screams early every morning of children making their way over to the parks…but i suppose that's to be expected! But you are seriously across the road from disneyland at a reasonable price per night you can't go wrong! After walking around the parks all day it was nice to only have to walk a
Manager Response: Hello CATHY_1368,  Thank you for staying with us and I appreciate your valuable feedback. I'm glad that our services met your expectations and that our proximity to the parks was of big help after a long day at the Disneyland Resort.   Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Fine Choice As Long As You Don't Want to Sleep In
Summary: The Desert Inn and Suites could not be more conveniently located to Disneyland main entrance. Rooms are clean and comfortable.  Price is consistent with the quality of the property.    Please note:  Walls are paper thin.  Kids are very excited at 6am when they know they are headed to the Happiest Place on Earth. The walls are so thin here that you can even hear the parent trying to hush the child, if the parent isn't just as excited themselves.    Also note:  The pool and hot tub are located inside and so chlorinated that the smell of chlorine can be whiffed from 10' away on the as one is walking by outside.  Not an awesome choice for whom a trip to California is supposed to involve fun in the sun by the pool.      Lastly, they are not too keen on storing your bags for you.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Took a quick trip to Disneyland with my sister. Only stayed 3 nights with 2 1/2 days in the Parks. Our room was towards the back of the hotel in the courtyard...3rd floor.   Some may think this isn't a prime spot...but the room was very quiet and comfortable and only problem was the extra distance when legs and feet were weary from being in the parks all day (and even that was not a real problem). Since the parks didn't open until 10:00 AM we were able to sleep in each morning and didn't get to sample the continental breakfast...but that was OK as there are plenty of places to catch a late breakfast close by. I have stayed at the Desert Inn and Suites many times and have found that I enjoy it more each time.  It is so close to the parks that a 5 minute walk gets you back to your
Manager Response: none

Summary: The staff was great from the time we made the reservation to when we checked out . The rooms were great, plenty of room for my family of eight. We had six adults and two childen  We drove in and parked and were able to walk anywhere we wanted to go.It was great to just walk to your room after a long day in the park. There were plenty of TV's when we went to the rooms at night. We will definitely try to stay here on our next visit
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not the Ritz but good for the price
Summary: My family of 7 just returned from our trip to Disney - we stayed from May 6th - 11th. The location of the hotel is it's biggest perk. It is directly across the street from the gates. The rates are excellent - especially when you have a large group like we do and you need more rooms/bathrooms. The rooms are not fancy - but they are clean. On the first day the built in hair dryer died and a person came right away to install a new one. While he was there we mentioned the door to the bathroom was really loud and needed oiled - that was fixed by the time we got back to the room after being in the parks. Beds were comfortable and everything else in the rooms worked properly. Breakfast was average type of food - but there was always enough. You really can't beat this place for the
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is the second time we have stayed...The price is unbeatable. ..The location is perfect...The rooms are clean and room service is always done in a timely manner!!! will definitely stay there again
Manager Response: Hello usanamom,  I'm glad that you've staying with us twice and thank you for your continued patronage. Our housekeeping are big on making sure the rooms are spotless and I'm happy to hear that everything was great during your stay. We'll see you again when you visit the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: I cannot emphasize enough of the great location! And I find their prices great too.   My family of 5 stayed in the connecting room (they call it family suite). 4 double beds were enough for all of us. The rooms are clean and beds were comfortable. They have a fridge which is larger than what you find in most hotels, and a microwave.   Our rooms were located on the 3rd floor right above the breakfast place, and the elevator/stairs near our doorstep. Since the elevator only serve 3 floors, we didn't get much people walking along our corridors. But when we do, the noise travels through the room quite badly.   Breakfast was included, nothing fancy but enough to keep us going and we appreciate it.   Parking was tight but the valet parking people are there to help. Definitely able to
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed for the first time last week for our second Disney trip with our family of five.  Besides having the benefit of being right across from the Disneyland gates when you have children and sore feet, the rooms were spacious and very clean and the beds quite comfortable.  You can't beat the price for the convenience of being so close.  Our floor was very quiet.  We were able to see the fireworks at Disney right from our balcony.  The staff was always courteous and helpful.  Despite reading negative reviews about this hotel before our trip, some - pointing out problems with parking and valet service, I found the parking, adequate with the help of the very efficient valet staff.  We were not always at the Disney resort and left the hotel parking lot on numerous occasions.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a great hotel for families.  The staff are friendly and helpful, the rooms are roomy and clean.  The hotel is well located for easy access to Disneyland and restaurants.  The hotel is in close proximity to the Orange County Outlet shops too which makes for some great shopping.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Location can't be beat, everything else is ok
Summary: The location is great! It's about as close to the Disneyland main entrance as you can get, perfect for taking kids back mid-day for a nap.  The rest is adequate.  The rooms are clean, the beds are comfortable, the staff is ok.  We didn't use the pool so I can't comment.    The negative is the walls are paper thin.  You can hear everything.  We had to keep the air on high to drown out some of the noise.    I booked 5 months in advance so I got a pretty good price.  I may stay here again but if I can find a better deal I may stay some place else.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great location, friendly staff and quiet room.
Summary: My family shared a room at this hotel and it was perfect. There was 5 of us in the executive suite and we all slept comfortably. The breakfast in the morning was great to start the morning off. The staff at the breakfast were very helpful - even after the breakfast had closed and my son dropped his breakfast sandwich he had painstakingly made (5yr old) they were kind enough to dig out the needed ingredients for him to make it again. Thank you! I do wish the check in was a bit earlier than 3pm but we knew that when we booked. We had a wonderful stay and was pleasantly surprised that our room wasn't overlooking a parking lot but a little interior garden. =) Thanks for the great stay! We'd be happy to stay there again on any future trips to Disneyland/ Knott's Berry Farm or the
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: First trip to disneyland in 8 years
Summary: First experience staying near disneyland.  Loved the location, the rooms were great and service very adequate. Price very reasonable for the accommodations available.  We stayed in a suite for 10 people. The 2 full baths were so great. We will stay again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: You are paying for the location.
Summary: The hotel is less than a10 minute walk to the front gates, which is it's best feature. The rooms were adequate, although the walls are paper thin and the beds are not very comfortable. The staff were all very friendly. The kids enjoyed the pool although the water was pretty cold so they didn't last long. The breakfast was what you would expect and it worked for us. If you're looking for somewhere to stay near the park for reasonable prices this would be a good pick.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have been coming here for over 30 years and i come back over and over again cause we love the different types of rooms depending on how many are with us when we went...Will be back again and again..Thanks all of you for once again a great stay..
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was our second time staying here. The rooms are large and clean and the beds are comfy! Easy quick (5 minutes) walking distance to Disneyland and CA adventure.  It's great to have a refrigerator and microwave in the room. Overall a great stay, we will be back!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I recently stayed in a family suite with my wife and two children. The room was large enough for four of us and the extra lounge room was a great addition with the fold out sofa bed.  We had a kitchenette and a large bathroom with shower and bath and there are two TVs. The beds are large and comfy. The rooms were clean and the daily room service was excellent as we were always given fresh towels and toiletries and the beds were made daily and the room was alway cleaned. There is a coin operated laundry which was a great help as well.   The service of the staff was great, friendly and helpful. The valet boys are also very polite and if the carpark was full they would complimentary valet your car.  The hotel although rather large in size was pretty quiet and you never heard much
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Location, location, location plus clean, quiet, and reasonably priced.
Summary: We go to Disneyland every year with our children.  Now, mind you, the children are now 25 and 31 years of age.  So we wanted two rooms and two bathrooms.  Anaheim Desert Inn offers roomy suites at very reasonable prices.  The rooms (really two adjoining queen rooms with sitting areas and bathrooms) were clean, everything worked, and there was plenty of room to move around.  The Inn is directly across the street from the Disneyland entrance.  The only reason they don't get 5 stars is the decor, landscaping etc. is pretty basic.  No frills.  But, on the other hand, they have everything you need.  We didn't eat the continental breakfast. It takes a lot of energy to walk all over the park for 16 hours straight so we opted for a full breakfast at the Denny's next door. That ls
Manager Response: none

Summary: Awesome location, friendly staff and great value. It was good to have a separate lounge room. We will definitely stay here next time we go to Disneyland! The coin operated laundry was an added bonus helping to save money for us
Manager Response: Hello CraigKiwi,  Thank you for sharing your experience while staying at the Desert Inn. I'm glad that our accommodations and services met your expectations and let us know when you are ready to come back to our hotel.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Although the room was a little "dated," the location couldn't be better.  It is right across the street from the Disneyland entrance.  The room was clean.  Complimentary breakfast adequate.  Would return.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good hotel overall, but needs some staff re-training.
Summary: Everything was good, except the valet staff. There was a gentleman that was very rude and unaccommodating. I have been staying here for the last few years (at least a few times per year) and have never had a bad experience with any staff member until now. The other members of the valet staff acted as if they could not approach us until we were there waiting for at least 15 min. Then they approached us and provided us with help. Very disappointing. I have never had a bad experience with the valet staff, no matter what time I have arrived. With small children we travel at odd hours and the front desk staff is always accommodating and pleasant and until now so was the valet staff. Overall, my family and I have enjoyed our stays and I hope the valet staff doesn't ruin it for us in
Manager Response: Hello Snuglyemt,  Thank you for staying with us and for your continued patronage. I do apologize about the inconvenience encountered while your recent stay and would like personally speak with you about this matter so that we can avoid this type of issue in the future. Thank you again and we look forward to your future visits.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We booked the family suite for 6 nights.   It's an average hotel for a decent price.  Continental breakfast was nice to have.  There was 7 of us and the fridge and microwave came in handy for snacks and cold drinks.  Didn't get to see fireworks from roof but it seemed like a decent view.  I have nothing bad to say overall it is what it is.
Manager Response: HI Lilhank,  Thank you for staying with us while visiting the Disneyland Resort. I'm happy to hear that our        in-room amenities were of help to you and your family. Thank you again and we hope to see you in the near future.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We visit Disneyland often and have stayed at most of the hotels on Harbor Boulevard. This was our first time at the Anaheim Desert Inn and Suites and we will stay here from now on- hands down. The hotel and rooms are great for a family. We had more than enough room for a family of four- and two televisions!  When the kids fell asleep we were able to stay up and watch tv in a separate room. Everything was clean, and the front desk staff was very professional. Our complimentary breakfast was great. The rooftop was amazing, not to mention the location- RIGHT ACROSS THE STREET! The price cannot be beat for what you get. We recommend this hotel and cannot wait to return. Thank you to all of the staff of the Anaheim Desert Inn and Suites!  You made our vacation one we will never
Manager Response: Hello Steven H,  Thank you for choosing the Desert Inn & Suites as your host for your Disneyland Vacation. I'm glad that we've met your expectations, give us a call when you're ready for your next trip and we'll gladly assist you with your booking.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We had a great experience. The rooms were nice and clean. The staff was friendly and professional. Great location, right across the street from Disneyland. We were able to just walk back and forth. I would stay here again
Manager Response: Hello SoniaAvalos,  We appreciate your kind words and it would be our pleasure to have you stay with us again.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: This hotel is great! It is extremely affordable when you consider that it is right across the street from Disneyland! We have stayed at a good majority of the hotels around Disneyland and this is one I will definitely book again. The complementary breakfast was nothing special but the fact that there is one offered is nice. Parking is convenient too. The only thing my family was not as happy with is the water pressure in the shower. It is very weak! However that is a minor issue and the comfort, cleanliness, service, and location more than make up for it!
Manager Response: HI SEDL1,  Thank you for staying with us and sharing your feedback with the TripAdvisor community.  I'm happy to hear that your stay was awesome and sure hope to see you in the future so that we can assist in providing a memorable vacation.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: The hotel Its great you just cross the streeth and Its Disney, the rooms aré  clean and with all you need. The breakfast Its very convinient, we will return. But next timé we do the reservation by internet.
Manager Response: Hi TGPMCHTAGC,  Thank you for staying with us and for sharing your experience. I'm happy to hear that you enjoyed staying at the Desert Inn and do not hesitate to give us a call so that we can help your booking any future Disneyland trips.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We had a wonderful stay over spring break. The beds were surprisingly comfortable and the staff was wonderful, not to mention the great prices.   The pool smelled very strongly of chlorine and we could hear some sort of shutting of doors during the night. But for the price and location (SOOOOOO close to Disneyland) you really can't go wrong staying here.
Manager Response: Hello apartmentshopper,  Thank you for staying with us and for sharing your experience with us. I'm glad that you enjoyed your stay and it seems that the chlorine levels were a bit high, however our staff was able to remediate the issue promptly. We hope to have you stay with us again in the near future.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Great hotel, just wish you could pick your neighbors!
Summary: We have stayed here many times. Love the lay out of the room (Parlor Suite A) Staff was helpful and friendly and you can't beat the location. There is one BIG problem. Their walls are paper thin! We had neighbors with young kids and they would scream, cry, yell and throw things against the connecting door. This would occur at all time of the day and morning. The parent apparently had absolutely no regard for others around them. I finally called down to the front desk to complain and asked to be moved. Was told that there weren't any other available rooms, but they did offer to call the noisy room and ask them to quiet down. They only remained quiet for a very short time, and for the rest of our stay (4 nights total) we had to put up with the noise. I have children so I know how
Manager Response: Hello Johnson189,  Thank you for staying at the Desert Inn and I apologize about the noise levels from your neighbors room. Our guests are normally pretty good at keeping their noise levels down and I am sorry that this went on for more than one day. Please give me a call directly so that I can assist you on any future stays.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Great hotel, lots of room options and RIGHT ACROSS THE STREET from Disneyland.
Summary: We have stayed at this hotel a few times now.  Check in is always a breeze. Parking is a little tight bit still manageable. There are lots of room options for couples/families. Food options very close by. And did I mention, directly across the street from Disneyland!  Literally a 5 minute walk to Mickeys front gate.
Manager Response: Hello shivos,  Thank you for staying with us once again, we appreciate your continued patronage. I agree with you, parking might get a little busy but we do have our valet personnel that will assist your with any parking needs. Thank you again and we'll see you again soon.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We had a great trip. Our room was clean, the staff friendly and the location was amazing. We didn't drive anywhere for our entire trip. The parking was a little cramped and the breakfast room crowded. We appreciate being able to park earlier than check-in and later on check-out.
Manager Response: Hello Amy G,  We are glad that your stay with us was enjoyable and that early parking was of help. Give us a call when you're ready for your next Disneyland Resort vacation.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Great location, good value for money.
Summary: We loved the location , just a short stroll across the road to Disneyland . Lots of places to eat all within walking distance. Plenty of room for our family of 5. Kids used the indoor pool everyday and loved the spa.
Manager Response: Hello venesser r,  I'm happy to hear that you and your family enjoyed our indoor head pool and spa. Thank you for your visit and we hope to see you soon.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: I have stayed here with my family of four and one additional teen friend for three years now (that's a total of 3 teens and one husband).  We always get the C2 Family Suite during Spring Break.  It works nicely for our size group.  In the past I have stayed a few times at the Disneyland Hotel and Grand Californian....but quite honestly, I seem to prefer this place.  Not only are you saving a lot of money, but the location can't be beat since it's right across the street from the main crosswalk entering Disney.  The rooms are always very clean, lots of towels, cups, nice roof-top deck, small pool great for kids (although really strong chlorine smell kept my teens away from it this year).  I gave the hotel 3 stars this time because 1) maids kept wanting to clean our room too early
Manager Response: Hi MomLovesDisney,  Thank you for staying with us and for proving such helpful feedback. I will share your concerns with the appropriate departments so that we'll avoid these occurrences in the future. We appreciate your patronage and we'll see you in the near future.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: I booked this hotel for 09/28/2014 to 10/03/2014. This review is on how my reservations went. After a few weeks of comparing hotels I found this one had more positive review than negative. I also liked the idea of walking across the street to Disneyland, free breakfast and indoor pool.   The rate for the hotel is $97 per night(last 3 days of September where $89 and then two days in October where $103. So average was $97) Not bad for being so close to Disneyland. They charge $9 plus tax per night for parking. If you don't have a car they take that off when you check in (according to an employee I spoke with on 4/06)   They also charge a "resort fee" which is $6 + tax per night. This I find a little ridiculous. This is not a 5 star hotel. Its not one of the Disney Resort hotels.
Manager Response: Hello Hannah H,  Thank you for booking with us and for giving our staff positive ratings. We will do our best to make your stay memorable and we hope that your upcoming review will reflect this.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We stayed here for six nights. The C1 room was great for a family of six. It exceeded our expectations. Everything was well maintained and clean. If you need plenty of room and a convenient walk to Disneyland, I would look no further. We will be back. We have stayed in other hotels here, but this is now our favorite.
Manager Response: Hello Danielsweek,  Thank you for your continued business and for giving us such an awesome review. I'm glad that we've exceeded your expectations and do hope that you'll make the Desert Inn & Suites your home away from home.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: This was our first time staying at this hotel. We stayed for  5 nights. Great location just across the street from Disneyland.  The rate for the room per night was decently priced. The room was clean, the front desk was friendly. The breakfast was very good. Yogurt and pancake would be great addition for breakfast.  They have a huge locker to store our luggages before we can check in so we can look around the area or go straight to Disneyland without carrying our luggage. We were very happy with our stay last week. As long as they maintain their current standard, we will continue to stay at this hotel for our annual Family Disney Trip. .
Manager Response: Hello Christine B,  Thank you for staying with us while visiting The Happiest Place on Earth. I'm glad that we met your expectations and look forward to any future visits.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: This hotel is right across the street from the entrance to Disneyland. It is a shorter walk than using the Disney parking areas.  We stayed 4 nights and had only positive experiences with the hotel staff. Our room was clean and comfortable. This hotel was a good value for the location and comfort. We had two teenagers that were able to come and go on their own as the park was so close. The room we stayed in had a seperate sitting area with a pullout couch bed. This was great to have some privacy from the kids while staying in the same accomodation. If your looking for a location close to Disneyland this is a great place.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Staff very friendly, great location, across the road from Disneyland.  Next door to Denny's and IHOP.  Room was clean and a good size. Check in and check out was easy.  Self laundry was easy to use and good value.    Great location all round.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The staff & customer service was great! The rooms & entire facility was very clean. The firework observations deck and swimming pool were nice for relaxing after hard days of play. Breakfast was very good too. We were very happy with our experience!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is truly right across the street from one of the main entrances to Disneyland and California Adventure. It is located next to a 24 hr Denny's and IHOP as well as a Cold Stone Creamery, Tony Roma's are McDonald's are just a few blocks away as well. I was hoping for a convenience store close by but did not see one within walking distance but did not ask if one was close by in order to purchase groceries.  The rooms are adequate for relaxing and sleeping since you'll spend most of your time in the parks. My one warning is for those taller than 5'5", the shower heads are not meant to accommodate tall persons so be prepared to adjust for this. The breakfast is adequate, simple with hard boiled eggs, small muffins and pastries, bread/bagels for toast, apples/oranges, oats
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is not fancy but the location cannot be beat. We were 2 adults and 4 children and  stayed in one of the 2 bed 2 bath suites. It was clean and the beds were comfortable but there are NO FRILLS. To us this was perfect - we left the rooms at 9 and didn't return until 10 or 11 pm except one day when we cam back for nap and swim. The pool was indoors and smells strongly of chlorine but of course the kids loved it anyway. We had to switch rooms at one point in our stay and the folks at the front desk were as nice as could be. I wouldn't stay here if I was having an exciting, once-in-a-lifetime get-away, but as a launchpad into the parks it was exactly what we were looking for. I'll rate it excellent not because it is fancy but because it is perfect for what it is.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is our second time staying here and will return again. Very convenient location to Disneyland Park and places to eat on both sides of the hotel. Very roomy..had the Family Parlor Suite which has three rooms, 5 beds and 2 bathrooms.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Super convenient location to the Disneyland Park entrance. Plus breakfast and ice cream eateries jut steps away from the hotel. They have a viewing deck on the roof to enjoy the Disneyland fireworks! And our room was positioned so we could see them from the back window! Awesome! We stayed in a parlor suite which was perfect for the 4 of us. Would definitely come again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: It had been several years since I stayed at the Anaheim Desert Inn and Suites.  This is right across the street from Disneyland.  The rooms were even better than I remembered.  Great for friends and families.  The staff at the front desk were great and so was the maid serves.  Very friendly.  I would stay again.
Manager Response: Hello Garnette M,  Thank you for staying with us again, I'm glad that we exceeded your expectations and will look forward to your next visit.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We almost always stay here while visiting Disneyland.  It's an ideal spot immediately between a Denny's and an IHOP and is right across the street from the entrance to the parks.  The price is reasonable for the location and the staff is helpful and courteous.    This latest visit we were a little disappointed in the quality of the beds and the breakfast.  Considering the high volume of guests that appear to stay here we thought adding a waffle bar and an omelette chef might go a long way toward improving reviews.
Manager Response: HI Ron S,  Thank you for staying with us, we will take your suggestions into consideration and we hope to see you in the near future.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Awesome location across the street fron the entrance of disneyland, we hade a great stay at this hotel we had a group that consisted on 4 adults and 5 kids ( 12,11,9,5 & 4 year old) so we had the family suite which was perfect for us we had 4 queen bed and a sofa bed, we were very pleased with the hotel staff, front desk, housekeeping , valet parking & breakfast attendant. The room & premises were clean and safe, the kids love the indoor pool & the adults enjoyed the spa after a long day of walking, we will stay the again.
Manager Response: Hello JudithBu,  Thank you for staying with us and for giving us such high ratings. I'm glad that our hotel met your expectations and we hope to see you in the near future.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: First impressions told the story here, from parking attendants to front desk staff, no one was truly pleasant. Don't get me wrong, no one was rude or discourteous, but I didn't feel like a "guest." Please know that the majority of the "hotels" across the street from Disneyland -- while ultra-convenient -- are merely refurbished motels with exterior corridors. We had neighbors who constantly smoked outside of our room and their second-hand smoke always seemed to enter our room either via the window-mounted air conditioning unit or underneath the door. It made it very uncomfortable to sleep and we did so without any ventilation! We would have been miserable if the weather was warmer! When we contacted the front desk, they said that they could only request the smokers move away
Manager Response: Hi sharks90,  Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to give us your feedback. I will take your concerns and share them with the proper departments so that we can improve on any weaknesses that we might have. Thank you and we hope that you'll give us a second chance in the future.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Nice, basic place ... clean, well tended, pleasant.
Summary: Location is super, across from the entry to Disneyland. The employees were very helpful, the rooms clean and well stocked, a decent 'continental breakfast' selection, indoor swimming pool, and a sundeck on the roof where you can see the fireworks from Disneyland. The downside is it's a little noisy..... floors creak overhead, and there is an abundance of families with small children (and, sometimes, inconsiderate adults).  Very good value for the price, though, and we would stay there again.
Manager Response: Hello CalFam2014,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us.  We will definitely look into the squeak noise issue and will resolve it without delay. Thank you for staying with us and we'll see you in the near future.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: I stayed at this hotel 12 years ago and was NOT impressed with the condition of the rooms; however, I'm glad we gave it another chance.  My family of 5 stayed in the C2 suite (we each had our own bed) and the rooms were VERY clean and staff was more than helpful.  We had no issues whatsoever.  We stayed 6 days and ate most meals out of our room thanks to the fridge and microwave that was provided.  This allowed us to save almost $800 on meals alone.  The location (directly across the strees from Disneyland) cannot be beat.  It allowed us to save on parking all week and it was close enough to return to the room each afternoon for lunch, naps, and a swim before heading back to the parks until closing.  Valets were outstanding.
Manager Response: Hello lnoble76,  Thank you for staying with us and giving us a second chance. I'm glad that we met your expectations and that you enjoyed your stay with us. We hope to see you back when you return to the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Great place to rest while visiting Disneyland
Summary: Location was important to us.  The hotel is so close to the entrance to Disneyland that it allows us to enjoy every minute of time in the park without any worry about getting back to the hotel after closing.  The breakfast helped us to get a good start on the day.  Nearby restaurants offer a variety. Hotel staff were friendly, the room was clean, comfortable and quiet.  We'll be back!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Extremely close to Disneyland entrance. Will stay again, price is right for what you get. Breakfast is minimal, hard boiled eggs, toast, danishes and cereal. Beds are VERY firm, so are pillows. No real blankets, just sheets and a thin blanket on top.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great location right next to Disneyland. Showers had long lasting hot water. Beds were very uncomfortable but worth it because if the location. Rooms were clean. Their breakfast could use some work. Not enough parking but glad not to have to pay the fee of parking at Disneyland. Staff was helpful
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed there twice now on our trips to Disneyland.  This is not a 5 star hotel, it is more of a budget hotel, but great deal for the price and location.  It is convenitently right across the street from Disneyland.  This comes in handy so you don't need to deal with the shuttles. It's a clean and comfortable place.  The parking is a little tight, especially the lower parking area. Employees are always nice and as I said before it is a clean room in a great location.  Would definitely recommend staying here.  I've been there twice and will return again this year.
Manager Response: Hello KauaiHITraveler,  Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to give us your feedback. We are happy to hear that our hotel met your expectations and let me know if I can assist you on a future date.   Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: This hotel is in a perfect location to Disney. Rooms are nice, Grounds are nice. only issue was parking. other then that, can't say enough about the hotel and the employees. Always there to help out. A place to stay again
Manager Response: Hi Cormanaz,  Thank you for staying at the Desert Inn while visiting the Disneyland Resort. Our parking lot could get a little busy at times, however we do have our valet staff and they are always happy to assist. Thank you and we'll see you in the near future.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: I really like the location right across the street and the room was decent. I wish the room had central air with better air circulation. We had the parlor suite and would fit 6 comfortably. Also the pool area wasn't that great, it's hot and humid in the room, it would be better if it was an outside pool.
Manager Response: Hello bdevin6400,  Thank you for your feedback. We are well known for our indoor pool, while some guests don't like the idea of it, most of our return guests have loved the fact that it's indoor and that it is heated. We hope that you'll stay with us again and thank you for your feedback.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: No hotel is perfect and you get what you pay for. This is not a five star hotel and I don't know why people compare it to one. I've been here three times and I'll be back. It's clean overall, the location is awesome and the it serves its purpose. I'm only in here to sleep and shower so that's what matters. It's literally 5 minutes from Disney's entrance. There are a bunch of places to eat within walking distance and theres a roof viewing area to view the fireworks at night.  I've read complaints about unclean towels...never encountered them. In fact, they use a bit more bleach that I like, but the towels are clean. I've never had anything taken from my room from the staff and the maids are very friendly. They always smile and wave when I wish them a good morning. The maids clean
Manager Response: Hi J K,  Thank you for trying our hotel and for your feedback. We are definetely not the Grand Californian, but we do provide comfortable accommodations and provide excellent customer service. thank you again and we hope to see you back in the near future.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Our check in was easy, the valet was awesome and all staff we have encountered have been a delight. The room was nice and clean, and the noise was not that bad. The location is awesome considering we're right across the street from the main entrance. I would recommend this place to everyone and I would definitely stay here again!!!
Manager Response: Hello Mlarot82,  Our staff thanks you for your comments and we all hope that you'll stay with us while visiting the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We had a great stay.  The only thing we wished was we could have had our rooms closer together.  We had 6 rooms and was all over the hotel.  We made our reservation a year in advance.  The location to Disneyland was perfect for having 28 people to go back and forth.  The breakfast wasn't much but it worked for the kids.  The rooms were clean and the staff was friendly.
Manager Response: Hi Staceym336,  Thank you for staying with us and for sharing your experience with us. I apologize for not having all of your rooms close together, but it is a bit hard to do this when you have different room types. I hope that you will stay with us soon so that we can again meet your expectations.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: the beds and pillows are hard and uncomfortable... there are only wooden blinds, so ALL the light comes into the room to wake you up... walls are paper thin, so could hear everything the next room was saying, and the staff would turn off the ac everyday, so the room was very hot when we would come back from disneyland at the end of a hot day.  Location is good... but other than that not much nice to say...   I will be splurging for a disney brand hotel next time i visit the parks.
Manager Response: Hello famof02-02,  Thank you for taking the time to give us some feedback about your recent stay at the Desert Inn. I apologize if your stay was anything less than great. Our hotel is definetely not a luxury hotel, but we do provide comfortable accommodations and good customer service. Thank you for staying with us and we hope that  you'll give us a second chance in the future.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Excellent budget hotel close to Disneyland
Summary: Our family of 6 stayed here February 16-20th.  Pros -   Directly across the street from entrance to Disneyland. Many hotels say they are but they arent.  Desert Inn was literally a 5 min walk to the main gate.  So close it was easy to come back and forth to hotel room when kids got tired and needed a break.  Price was very reasonable 143. one night and 89 the other 3 nights.  Housekeeping was quick to bring us extra pillows, towels,  and blankets. Very quick and friendly service.  Beds were very comfortable.  Felt safe.  Efficient and friendly employees.  Indoor pool and hot tub for those visiting during colder months (i.e us in February.  Kids loved the pool and hot tub).  Close to great restaurants outside of the park.  (TRY THE PIZZA PRESS IN THE 1500 BLOCK - AMAZING PIZZA
Manager Response: Hello olystacy,  I thank you for staying at the Desert Inn and Suites and for giving us some feedback. We work hard to provide optimal sleeping accommodations and awesome customer service and it pleases us to know we are doing a great job. We hope to see you back in the near future.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Location could not be better & price was pretty great!
Summary: We got a family suite which was basically 2 basic rooms for our stay in Anaheim so we could go to Disney. We stayed 2 nights (Feb 10&11). I was surprised how many people you could have in there... there was 2 queen beds and a sofa bed in each side so room for 12 people - these were a great option for families! There was tons of room for us as we only at 4 people in the 2 rooms. Each room had it's own fridge, microwave, table & 2 chairs and the sofa. We liked that the sink was outside of the bathroom with a large counter so someone could be getting ready, while someone was in the bathroom.    The rooms were dated and they were doing construction down the hall but we didn't hear them till we left our room; weren't there to sleep late anyway... it was Disney time. We loved just
Manager Response: Hello Denise Y,  Thank you for your awesome review. We are very happy to hear that your stay was great and that we met your expectations. We hope to see you soon when you come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Great little Hotel Close to Disneyland
Summary: This hotel is great for both location and price. We booked a spa suite last August and got a really good deal on the suite.  The only disappointment was when we got there the spa tubs were removed from the rooms but they did give me a credit for this.  We had a joining room with my mother in law and found that very convenient. There was 5 of us in our room, our 17yr old slept in the entryway room with the pullout couch and tv, our 11 and 9yr old slept in one queen bed and we slept in the other.  Our 15yr old son slept in grandma's entry room with the pull out couch and tv.  We had lots of room and for the time you stay in your room it is perfect. The kids went to the pool lots and said it was good.  The best part is the quick walk back to your room after a long day of walking.
Manager Response: Hello CarmenPAlberta,  I'm glad that you enjoyed the convenience of our location and that our services and accommodations met all of your needs. We hope to have you comeback to our hotel and exceed your expectations. Thank you and we'll see you soon.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: I gave this hotel a 4 star review because of one thing. We got a two room suite and it only had 1 shower. That was difficult for 8 people to get ready in the morning. Other than that every thing was great. I'm definitely staying there again.
Manager Response: Hi Misame,  Two showers is definetely a plus when you sare staying with family, we recommend booking one of our Family Suites and you'll enjoy two full bathrooms. Thank you for staying with us and we'll see you in the near future.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We couldn't believe how affordable it was to stay in a motel so close to Disneyland. It was nice to have such a short walk to the Park. This is one of the first motels we stayed at in Anaheim that had a free continental breakfast. That saved us quite a bit of money. The staff was very nice and helpful, and even joked around with us a bit. There were plenty of pillows in the room (I am a big pillow person; I have to have a lot of them). The room was clean when we got there and was just as clean each day when we returned from the Park. We look forward to staying there again.
Manager Response: Hello Pamela H,  I'm glad that you decided to stay with us and that you enjoyed your stay and hope to see you when you again come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Love this place for it's location right across the street from Disneyland and it's cleanliness etc.  Being able to save another 1/2 mile in walking after 14 hours of walking in Disneyland is worth it to me.  The staff was friendly.  The room for complimentary breakfast is kind of tiny so either get there early or maybe take it up to your room.  Overall I would recommend just for proximity alone.
Manager Response: Hello Zekesgirl,  Thank you for staying with us and sharing your experience with us. We are happy to hear that our hotel met your expectations and that you found our location to be specially convenient. We hope to see you soon when you visit the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: This was the second time we have stayed here.  You can't get any closer and more convenient than this.  The rooms were clean and comfortable ( your not there very much though!)  the park is right across the street, Denny's and mcdonalds close by. Staff were cheerful and accommodating.  Would definitely stay here a third time!
Manager Response: Hello Selena T,  Thank you for staying with us and for being a loyal guest. Our location is definitely prime and we also work very hard to provide comfortable accommodations and good customer service, thank you for your feedback and I hope to have you comeback to the Desert Inn in the near future.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: affordable price and short walking distance to the parks.
Summary: room is very clean, elevator to room was very close, breakfast was decent, and family only had to walk across the street to reach the park. price is affordable except on certain days, but still cheaper overall compared to other 3 -4 star hotels.
Manager Response: Hi 247disney,  I'm glad that you enjoyed our convenient location and that our hotel met your expectations. The Desert Inn offers affordable rates while providing the best possible customer service. Thank you again and we'll see you again soon.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Great place for a big group
Summary: We stayed in the large suite with 10 people for the second time in four years, and were very happy!  The rooms had doors, so some could sleep in, and the location couldn't be beat for Disneyland!  Also, the breakfast options included hard boiled eggs, and being able to get protein in the kids to start the day was a nice surprise.  Although we had to pay for parking, having the valet service worked well, and our cars were ready and waiting on the day of departure.  We would highly recommend this location for big groups looking for an informal, comfortable stay.
Manager Response: Hello TucsonMomof2  I'm happy to hear that our hard boiled egg addition was of your liking and that you enjoyed your stay at the Desert Inn. We are looking to improve our breakfast selection even more in the near future and we hope that you'll stay with us again soon.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Great location and pricing for large groups/families
Summary: This is our place to stay when visiting Disneyland. We have 6 people and can get connecting room or suites at reasonable pricing.  Continental breakfast is offered.  Located between Denny's and IHOP. There is now a resort fee of $4 and car parking of $8-daily but well worth the cost.  We never move our car once we are here.  Parks are righta across the street.  We even bought our admission here this time so there was no lines. Usually we purchase on line but just waited on this trip. The web site has pictures of the rooms. Refrigerator & microwave.  This is probably  at least our 6th annual visit at this hotel.
Manager Response: Hi BLPPEP,  Thank you for staying with us and for your continued patronage. I am glad that we are able to meet and exceed your expectations when you stay with us. A big thank you from the staff of the Desert Inn and we'll see you soon.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: It was a last minute decision. Booked on line for a Saturday night. When we arrived to hotel to my surprise we where upgraded to a mini suite. My boys loved it. Its in a perfect location. Across the street to the entrance of Disneyland and less than a mile walk to great restaurants.
Manager Response: Hi Nora M,  I am happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and that you were upgraded to a suite. We do offer a big selection of rooms and suites, thank you for giving us your feedback and we hope that you'll come back to us in the near future.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: There were 5 in our group, myself, my husband and 2 kids and a friend. We reserved the room I want to say last July 2013. We were coming for 5 nights for the Tinkerbell half marathon. When we arrived around 1pm our room was ready and we were given the key. The room did smell a touch musty when we first went in, but we opened everything up and had no issues after that. There was defiitely some work going on around the hotel, but really we aren't sleeping our days away lounging in the room so it didn't make any difference to us. All the staff were friendly and helpful.  The good: Fantastic location, can't beat it. Free breakfast, exactly as I would expect, eggs and toast with some fruit. The room was a good size, we had the 2 queens with the pull out sofa, great for a family with
Manager Response: Hello TracyLF,  Thank you for staying with us and we apologize for any inconvenience you may have encountered while a guest at the Desert Inn. We will use your comments to better our facility and service in hopes that upon your return, we meet your expectations. Thank you and we'll see you soon.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We thought long and hard about where to stay for our 5 day trip to Disneyland and read countless reviews of places. We had previously stayed at the Howard Johnson but decided to go for the Anaheim Desert Inn this time, mainly because of location. The Pro's Its location really can’t be beat, in many cases it is closer to Disneyland than the Disneyland hotels and is the closest hotel to Disneyland. We found this really important after being at the parks for 12 hours with a family and carrying a tired toddler back. It also enabled us to come back to the room for a rest during the day The rooms are huge, we luckily got an upgrade and overlooked the park, but had 3 good sized rooms, with lots of sleeping space, this meant one or two people could sleep during the day and the others
Manager Response: Hello springynz,  We appreciate you staying with us and sharing your experience with the TripAdvisor community. We do work hard at providing exceptional service and a clean and comfortable room for you to relax after a long day at Disneyland. We do hope that you'll book with us in the future so that we can host your stay.   Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Just across the street from the Disneyland west entrance. In the same block you can also find a Denys and iHop for a good breakfast and the other meals you can go across the street to Downtown Disney where you can find multiple restaurants. We made the reservations directly from their website, and when we got there they upgrade us to a larger room with 2 queen size beds and kind of a lounge room with a sofa-bed, with fridge and microwave. This was the second time we stay there and defenetly go back.
Manager Response: Hi Karla G,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and that you like your upgrade. We hope to see you when you again come back to the Disneyland Resort and we can meet or exceed your expectations once again.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: A friend recommended the Desert Inn and Suites. We were thrilled with the location. Traveling with 5 kids under 5 (one an infant) had us looking for a spot that was walking distance to Disneyland--no shuttles for us. This was perfect. Don't miss the fireworks from the roof observation deck. A much better choice than the crowds in Disneyland. I wish we had found it sooner.
Manager Response: Hello Reve T,  Thank you for yoru review, we are happy to hear that you enjoyed staying with us while visiting the Disneyland Resort. You know what they say, better late than never. Thank you for sharing your feedbacka and can't wait to have you come back to the Desert Inn while visiting Anaheim in the near future.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Gotta give a shout out to the amazing staff and manager Teo! Weve stayed at several hotels across the park and all agree Anaheim Desert Inn and Suites is def our favorite! Staff, room, amenities and location was awesome! Staff and manager Teo was helpful from the get go! Our rooms were cleaned everyday of our stay despite our inconveniencing the cleaners with our sleeping in. Thank u to the ladies! Breakfast was basic but all we needed' toastt,  fruits, cereal and juice kept us satisfied til lunch. Best was the rooftop viewing area yay!! We will definitely stay here on our next visit!
Manager Response: Hi lori a,  You are very welcome and thank you for staying with us. We are glad that we met your expectations and we look forward to future visits.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: This is our 3rd time staying at the Desert Inn and it is our go to place for Disneyland vacations. The location is amazing and is even closer to the park than some Disney hotels. We have never had an issue sleeping. The beds are firm, but comfortable.  Long before our arrival, we had requested a room with a king sized bed in a quiet location. While my hubby could sleep through an explosion, I tend to be a bit sensitive to noise and always bring my earplugs. Well, we checked in and they pull out our guest card, which had a bright pink post it on it that said "quiet area." I was happy.  Well, we got to our room and were a bit confused. Our room was on the end, which meant that just outside our wall was the elevator and stair case. I also noticed that they were doing renovations in
Manager Response: Hello mmb616,  We appreciate you taking the time to complete a survey regarding your recent stay with us. On behalf of our entire staff here at the Desert Inn & Suite we apologize for the concerns you have about your experience at this hotel. We hope to have you come back to the Desert Inn so that we can exceed your expectations again and gain back your loyalty.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: CANCEL MY RESERVATION ON MY ARRIVAL DAY W/O NOTICE
Summary: We planned a trip to disneyland about six months ago. We looked at reviews of hotels within walking distance to the Disney main entrance and this seemed like a good fit for my family. It seemed to have pretty good reviews so we reserved our rooms.. all four families that went with us..about 22 people. Let me begin with when we arrived..We walk in the main office and a guy is in there yelling at the counter person because his room was not what he reserved 9 months earlier.. He reserved a room with a jacuzzi  and they had removed them at some point since he reserved and no one contacted him to let him know the rooms had changed and was not told when he checked in. The desk clerk told him he could help him ...he would have to speak to the manager when he checks out because he
Manager Response: Hello Alysa P,  I apologize about the inconvenience you encountered while trying to stay at the Desert Inn, however we do follow a strict process in handling non-guaranteed reservations and this was not the exception. A reservation is cancelled only after we make several attempts to get a hold of the guest in a two day time frame. We pride ourselves on great customer service and as evidenced by most of our reviews we do offer fantastic accommodations, service and rates. Please feel free to contact me should you have any further questions or concerns.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We booked this room several months in advance for the off season in January during the week. and feel like the price we got for this hotel was an excellent deal.  We had the two room suite with two queen beds and a pull out sofa.   The husband was a little disappointed when he first saw the room because he didn't think it looked like the pictures (but do they ever?).  The room also had a slight musty/mildew smell when you first walk in to the living area & our friend's room next door had the same smell (we bought an air freshener when we were at the store).  Overall, the room was pretty clean.   We loved having two tv's.  We had trouble with the safe and called the front desk for help.  He gave us some instructions and after they didn't work, he came right up and fixed it for
Manager Response: Hello pescas,  Thank you for staying with us and for giving us some feedback. I'm happy that we met your expectations, however I hope that we can exceed them upon your next stay. Have a great day and we'll see you in the near future.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: This is a fantastic location to the park entrance. We had a 2 room suite, which was perfect for our family. The front desk staff were very helpful and the housekeeping service was great. Our rooms were cleaned and nicely kept every day.  The breakfast was adequate, they could use a few more items like yogurt and bananas, and the breakfast room is very small, but really everything else worked so well for our family.  It was wonderful to be so close to the gate, with the little ones, there was no waiting on shuttles it was a 5 min walk to home and they enjoyed the indoor pool. Close to restaurants. I love the suite set-ups, we could be together, but still have the privacy we needed.  I wouldn't consider staying anywhere else.
Manager Response: Hello Sharon D,  Thank you for taking the time to post some feedback about your recent stay at the Desert Inn. We do have a breakfast room update scheduled soon and this will include expanding our breakfast room sitting capabilities. Again, we thank you for your review and we cannot wait for your next stay!  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We were very pleased with our choice to stay at the Desert Inn.  We stayed there a couple of years back and it was desperately in need of updating, they are obviously finishing up renovations as our room was much better than our last visit.  We had a Parlor Suite which was very helpful in blocking out the noise of the hallway and parking lot (it puts the bedroom portion back behind a living room portion).  I agree with previous posters about the very thin walls, you can hear everything!  Startled awake at night by the neighbor flushing a toilet or taking a random middle of the night shower.  But thankful that we didn't hear anything from the parking lot and only the very loud people in the hallway thanks to the separation in the room.  I think we would have been unhappy with a
Manager Response: Hello DisneyMom2014,  The staff and management at the Desert Inn thanks you for your review and kind words. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and hope to see you when you again come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Didn't spend much time in the room but the room was fine.   Very convenient location.  < 5 minute walk to the park entrance.  Had a 2 room parlor suite with 4 queen beds.  Breakfast is just OK but if you want to be close to Disneyland or California Adventure, it's tough to beat.
Manager Response: Hello Joe B,  Thank you for your feedback, we are happy to hear that our hotel met your expectations and we hope that you'll stay with us on any future Disneyland Trips.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We typically stay at the Doubletree but wanted to try something closer to the parks.  I was very happy with the Desert Inn.  There were definitely a few issues but location and price did win us over.  Also our room was extremely clean and the housekeeping was great.  We stayed in a Parlour Suite Type A.  Never had breakfast at the hotel.  Pro: Location  Price Cleanliness  Con: Bathroom was in the same room as sleeping area which was tough with a toddler who goes to bed relatively early. Walls weren't paper thin but you can hear everything through the front door and connecting doors if you have bad neighbors. Wife said the pillows were rock hard.  All in all we had a great trip and would stay at the hotel again for the right deal.
Manager Response: Hello Jason W,  Thank you for staying with us for giving us your much appreciated feedback, it was our pleasure to be of service and we look forward to future visits.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We have stayed at several hotels near this one but thought we'd try out the Desert Inn because we had a large group and were looking to share a suite.  This worked perfectly.  We had the largest suite that holds up to 10 people.  It was great to all be close but still have some privacy when needed.  The continental breakfast wasn't more than snack, but they did provide hard boiled eggs, which was great.  Denny's is right next to the hotel and they have great food, prices, and service. The staff was very friendly and helpful and you can't get much closer to the entrance to Disneyland.  We would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: HI Michelle V,  Thank you for your review. Our goal is to provide great customer service and a clean and comfortable place to stay and are very pleased to hear that your stay was great. Thank you again and we'll see you on your next visit to the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: I want to start by saying that we would probably come back to this hotel if we are going back to Disneyland, because of the location and price. We were looking for the closest hotel to the park that would be affordable and provide some kind of separate sleeping and sitting area. Anaheim Desert Inn and Suites fit the bill perfectly. It also had a roof top patio, offering perfect viewing for the fireworks.  With this said, keep in mind this is budget hotel. It is a motel with paper-thin walls, basic beds and decor. Our room (419) smelled very bad both days and the safe was broken. We could however see the park from our small window.  Pros: • one of the closest hotels to Disneyland • separate bedroom with small sitting area • microwave and fridge in the room • parking is
Manager Response: Hi tiziSD,  Thank you for taking the time to review the Desert Inn. We are definetely working on expanding our breakfast room area to accomodate our guests and also looking into the possibility of additing new channels to our cable service. Thank you for the feedback and we look forward to having you stay with us.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Only downside is the parking is terrible.  Too crammed and tight and hard to get in and out of.  Only other suggestion would be adding something little to the breakfast.  Either hot chocolate, another kind of cereal for more selection, bagels, or even little peanut butter packets for protein.  We loved the breakfast lady that was in charge.  She was dressed clean and nice and was very kind and helpful!  We wished there was a fitness center.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I arranged a family vacation for a party of six to include my wife                                             and my daughter's family. We spent ten (10) nights) from                                                01/19/13 thru 01/29/13.in a C-2 Parlor Family Suite (Rm 310)                                                near the elevator.  The room was nearly perfect with two bathrooms, four queen beds, and a parlor with three 32" TV's,                                           microwave,refrigerator and appropriate furniture.. Maid service                                             was good and special requests (ie) extra towels was delivered                                        promptly. We parked our rental van in the underground lot.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I bring a group of students to Disney every year and through that process, have stayed at a number of budget hotels.  This one is the best yet.  When I booked our group to stay I was a little concerned after reading some of the reviews. However, I really don't get how people have a legit complaint about this place.  If you want to compare this place to a high-end hotel, yes it's lacking.  But comparing it to other budget hotels, it stands heads and tails above the others.  It is clean, comfortable, and CLOSE!!   As for the continental breakfast, it's limited (fruits - apples&oranges, hard-boiled eggs, Danishes, toast, porridge, cereal, coffee, and juices.   If you want more, go out and BUY your breakfast.... don't expect a high-end buffet from a budget hotel.  I also found the
Manager Response: none

Summary: We just left from a 5 night stay with my family of 6 and couldn't have been more pleased. We chose Desert Inn because of the prime location, right across the street from the Disneyland walkway, but also because of the INDOOR pool!! You have to walk outside to get to the pool but it is the ONLY hotel with the great location and an indoor pool. It meant that even when the January temps dropped to 50-60 in the pm, my kids could still swim. Also, nice little breakfast with cereal, sweet rolls, fresh fruit, oatmeal, and my kids favorite TOAST!! The rooms were clean, everything was working, nice tvs,etc. If you want a bigger breakfast, you are right between the IHOP and the Denny's. Last but not least, the staff was super friendly and very accommodating. We usually don't have maid
Manager Response: none

Summary: The best place to stay!!!!!!!! We go twice a year to disneyland and have stayed in many different hotels. This was the best!!!!!!!  So close and the top veiwing of the fire works was icing on the cake!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Lets start with the great. It has been said before, but this hotel is in the perfect location. Literally steps onto the Disney property. The staff seemed very friendly and professional. The rooms were very clean and the price was very good for the location of the hotel.   Now some not so great. We arrived at the hotel a few hours before check-in. We were told that we had to make change in order to rent a locker to store our luggage until check-in. Now this may just be me, but this seems crazy. I have never had to pay to store my own luggage on the day I am supposed to check into the hotel.   Then we got into our "suite." Again, very clean. But it was real small. The Parlor A suite seems to be a normal sized hotel room that had a wall added to create a second "room" that fits
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Another great visit to Desert Inn and Suites!
Summary: First and foremost, you go to this motel because of the extremely close proximity to Disneyland and the price.  But,  I was very pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness of the property as well as the great attitude of the staff.   We knew going into the stay that the breakfast was going to be less than appealing but were still surprised by the very limited options and the space available.  A girl at the front desk did tell me they are expanding the breakfast room but did not say anything about the menu.   One other area of concern was the mattress.  We've always been the "we're only here to sleep" type Disney travelers but sleep was difficult on the mattress.   With that said,  however,  I don't think you will find a closer property at a lower price (actually closer to the park
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hi the rooms was great and the stay was just as great, I would like a better check in time just seems so late on the check in time. If the room is available then I don't think you should have to wait till 3pm to check in and as far as that goes you pay a lot of money for a room, you should be able to have the room till at least noon the next day especially if you can't check in till 3pm. Over all the rooms are clean and comfortable.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have booked here for over 10 years and are never disappointed.  If you want luxury and can afford it, go for it.  If you don't mind a basic room since you will be gone most of the time in Disneyland, book here.  You can enjoy the indoor pool & hot tub any time of the year.  You literally walk across the street to the parks.  The only place closer might be the Grand Californian (for 400+% more!).  You can get a 2 room "suite" which offers more space if you have kids.  They didn't used to charge for parking, which was nice.  Currently it's $8/day which is about half the finer hotels.  There is a Denny's next door and the hotel had a 10% off coupon for us.  I like that it's clean, friendly, inexpensive, and most of all....I don't need to wait for shuttles or buses to start my
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was so happy to find the family suites here! Our family of 7 was very comfortable in the B-Family Suite with 4 queen beds, plus 2 pull-out couches, 2 full bathrooms, 2 mini-fridges and 2 large TVs! We stayed 5 nights and then decided to stay one extra night at the last minute. The staff was great about helping us find an open room (a slightly smaller family suite) last minute and they even moved all of our luggage to the new room for our last night.  We will definitely stay here again when we come back to Disneyland!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had 5 adults and 3 kids, reserved the 2 room suite and it was perfect.  Great location, Disneyland is right across the street, we couldn't have gotten closer if we paid for parking!  And the price was 1/2 of what we would have paid if we had to get 2 rooms at the other hotels around the area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Lets be honest, if you are coming here you are coming for the disney experience - the price of this location was perfect you get disney resort proximity without the high cost - you have a clean comfortable bed to sleep in and a basic breakfast in the morning. We stayed 2 nights so as to be able to experience the whole day from open until close at both the parks. A less than 10min walk at a brisk pace from the hotel to the main park gates. The parking space was a little far from our room, but this was no problem for us - with all the USA food indulgence we could use the extra few meters of walking!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The room was clean and freshly painted. The maid service was up to standards daily. The self parking can be troublesome however the facility offers valet parking. We arrived early and were able to park and go to the park and return later to finish checking into room. Continental breakfast was basic with pastries, cereal and fruit. The walk to Disneyland was excellent. Denny's, IHOP and other restaurants are close.
Manager Response: Hello Dana K,  Thank you for staying with us and for giving feedback about your stay. We are happy that you had a great time and we hope that you'll stay with us so that we can make your stay even more memorable.   Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Have stayed at the DI&S 3 times, and each time I've been very satisfied! They are professional and courteous -- both the desk staff and the valet guys.   The location cannot be beat -- unless you want to pay a gajillion dollars and stay at the Grand Californian!   The continental breakfast is super basic but we enjoyed hard boiled eggs from the egg pile (you'll see what I mean). There is also oatmeal, cereal, toast, coffee.
Manager Response: HI effie3,  Thank you for staying at the Desert Inn and for your kind words. We are very happy to hear that you always have been very satisfied with our hotel. Thank you for your continued patronage and we hope to see you soon again.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Rented 2 rooms a basic room and a Mini suite.Basic room at back of complex was clean quiet and basic.Proximity to Parks is great. Mini suite layout is strange. Sofa couch in mini room 1st then basic room with bathroom in very back.Sink and mirror in room with two beds. Small shower and toilet in separate room in back.Curious set up.The real disappointment was remodel taking place on floor above us.Power tools till after 6:00 at night and again with very loud pounding starting at 7:00 a.m. After repeated contact with front desk finally decided to go through room move. and received inadequate compensation. Last stay here.
Manager Response: Hello Brian B,  I apologize for the inconvenience and understand that compensation was inadequate. As per my email to you earlier, we have processed further compensation as per your request. Thank you for giving us a second chance and we'll see you in the near future.   Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: There were 7 of us in a C suite.  None of us had any complaints.  It was nice to have basically 2 separate rooms when we wanted privacy.  Having read previous reviews about the breakfast we did bring our own, going down for milk and juice.  We did not notice any more noise than any other hotel.  This was our closest stay to Disneyland yet and I am pretty sure that all 7 of us would stay here again.
Manager Response: Hello betsyross62040,  Thank you for staying at the Desert Inn while visiting the Disneyland Resort. We are more than glad that you have a great stay. Thank you for giving us a chance and we'll see you when you come back to Disneyland.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Good: The walk to Disneyland was literally 5 minutes from our room to the main gate. We choose to down grade in hotels in order to save on distance. We wanted to be able to come back to the hotel for lunch/nap without waiting for a shuttle. Valet drivers and housekeeping staff were very helpful and friendly. Our room was out dated but clean. We choose a room on the fourth floor near the back after reading several reviews on here. I was glad we did. We did not hear any noise from the front of the hotel.   Bad: However, we could hear entire conversations from the room next to us. I would have to agree with another review that the walls are "paper thin". We were not able to fall asleep until they settled down at 2 am. They are also doing some maintenance on some furniture which was
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good, clean and easy access to Disneyland
Summary: This hotel was picked due to availability to house a large group of girls for a Disneyland trip.  The rooms are basically two hotel rooms attached with a very small entrance couch bed area.  The rooms are older but clean and neat.  The walk to Disneyland is the best perk, 5-8 minutes and you are in the parks!
