Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: So close to Disney and great value
Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights with 4 kids - aged 7,6,2 and 6m. We had prebooked the Disneyland resort hotel for the following 2 nights, but honestly, this hotel is closer! The room was big enough for the 6 of us and the bath, well, it was bigger than our whole bathroom at home!!! The free breakfast was awesome, nothing flash, but plenty of it, fresh and a god choice. The Disneyland hotel was so pricey in comparison and you're spending all day at the park anyway so I would def choose this hotel. It's so close, my eldest daughter and I popped back to the park in the evening once the smaller ones were in bed to do the faster rides. Dennys right next door, Tony Romas a 2 min walk. Fab location! Friendly staff, oh and a great indoor pool & spa.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I found this hotel on Trip advisor.  Noticed the reviews were favorable so we went for it.   Love that it was just across from the main gate which gave us the opportunity to go back our hotel for a break during the day.  Our room looked like it had recently been updated.  We had a problem with our in room safe and it was taken care of early the next morning prior to us leaving for the park.  Great location and service.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed in the parlor suite A on the 4th floor and will try to stay here again in the future.  The room was very clean.  Tile, grout, and tub in the bathroom looked good, no mildew.  The shower curtains looked brand new.  The room smelled and looked clean. We had 2 adults and 3 teens and had plenty of room to sprawl out and not get on each others nerves.  The 2 televisions made it nice too.  For the price, you cannot beat this place! The only thing that would make it a better stay would be for the breakfast to have a little more variety. We will be staying here again in the future.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Good:  Yes, this place is right across the street from the entry to Disneyland.  So close it was very convenient!  Parking was a plus!  Valet parking for $8!  The valet's were super nice and accommodating. Front desk staff very helpful and polite and helpful.  Denny's is on one side and IHOP on the other.   With McDonald's, Subway and other dining options just a short walk away.  The family suite was great.  We had 9 people all together. the rooms were spacious, the two bathrooms were great.  All three rooms had their own TV. Wi-Fi worked great.  Indoor pool perfect for winter use.  Spa was good sized and nice and warm.  The Bad:  The rooms were not very clean!  The carpet didn't look like it had been vacuumed, lots of debris along the walls, and edges of furniture.  The
Manager Response: none

Summary: Right across the street from Disneyland and near restaurants that had good variety (not world class food but good).  Thought it was strange that we had to check our luggage into lockers because they were not "big" bags.  We got there before our room was ready and were told that they didn't check smaller bags at bell desk (not what I was told when I called in advance).  Instead we paid for lockers (single use).  Quality of TV reception was something out of the 1950's (after a day at Disney, the family wanted to relax and watch TV.)
Manager Response: none

Summary: I loved my stay.  Literally across the road from Disneyland.  the staff are so helpful.   my room was clean and perfect! couldnt have asked for a better experience.  you can see the fireworks from the hotel! buses close by to go shopping!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Convenient, clean and close.  The breakfast is plain, but does the job. They should have water available at breakfast, not sure why they don't.  Beds hard, but ended up being comfortable.  Pool very small. Would stay here again if I needed the space.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We've stayed at this hotel before and it seems like there have been some recent renovations.  The rooms were clean and the beds were decent. One of the doors was squeaky so we called maintenance and they were there in minutes to fix it.  When we asked for the room to be cleaned early, it was done.  The rooms are basic and not 4 star by any means, but when we go to Disneyland we spend all our time there.  Really, the best and biggest reason to stay at this hotel is the location (proximity to Disneyland entrance).  When you've had a long day at the park or need a nap and don't want to deal with a long walk or waiting for a shuttle, this is a great option.  Walk back and forth to Disneyland in minutes.  Also, it's very close to a Tony Roma's, Denny's, and IHOP.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good value and walkable to Disneyland
Summary: We have been staying here for years. Very decent rooms for the cost in this area. Disneyland is right across the street, so it is very convenient for visiting the parks. Not a five star hotel, but a great value. It even includes a small breakfast.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Got here with my wife for our anniversary at 12pm. No early check in, went to Disneyland came back at 2pm still no early check in. No just sitting in the car and waiting. We will see how this goes I haven't even stayed here yet. Should of just went to what I know and stayed at my regular hotel desert palms, which are great. Wanted to see what else is out there for my family and friends who come to Disneyland 5 times a year. Going to check in soon so we'll see what else can go wrong.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is located within very close walking distance to the Disneyland entrance. That part was GREAT. However, the rooms are not very nice. The beds are hard and had me aching in the morning. Noise from outside the room was LOUD. The elevator near our rooms was broken for a few days of our stay. And the outdoor areas of the property seemed to always reek of hot garbage, even though our visit was in November. The rooms did not smell, thankfully.  The price wasn't bad for the area. On the whole, I was left wondering if the other hotels that are just as near the Disney entrance were any nicer, because this one left a lot to be desired. I am very unlikely to stay here ever again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: good value/affordable. nice clean rooms,comfortable beds, all working appliances. the walk back to our room after a day at Disneyland resort was a major perk.  enjoyed watching the fireworks from the sun deck. will be staying here again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Two rooms.  Got there early..had to air until 3 since it was a very busy day.  the rooms were clean and appeared to have been recently redone a bit.  Enjoyed the stay and the few steps it took to get to Disneyland.  We would stay again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I traveled to Disneyland for our anniversary. We arrived on a Sunday morning around 1030 am and asked if we could get an early check in. The response was a no we don’t allow them and the earliest you will be able to check in is 230 pm. Because they have late check-out til 2pm.   Although we were allowed to leave our car parked there and go to Disneyland and return at 230 – 3 pm they were just rude in the way they talked to you. We returned back at 230 and asked to get a room and it took another 30 mins. When we got to our room the maid was still cleaning the room. We asked if there was internet in the room and they said wifi only.  We went to our room unpacked and went back to the park for the night. When we got back to the room the wifi was not working since it
Manager Response: Hello Tkdnancyw,  Thank you for taking the time to review the Desert Inn, we apologize that your stay was anything less than great. We will use your review to help us provide a better experience for our future guests. Thank you and I sure hope that you would give us another opportunity to serve you.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Pros: Located directly across the street from Disneyland, suites had room for parents and 2 teenagers, mini-fridge, microwave and coffee maker in room.  Cons: Not very well insulated (could hear lots of noise from outside room), smell of chlorine from pool below burned our eyes, shower drained slowly so we ended up in ankle deep water by the end of a shower, few choices in free breakfast. Half of the channels on the TV were snowy.  I called maintenance, they came and changed the splitter which didn't work.  The maintenance worker said he'd have to call the cable company.  We never heard from them again, and the TV was never fixed.  The rug was filthy.  After I walked around the room in my white socks they were BLACK on the bottom.  If we go to Anaheim again, I would choose a
Manager Response: Hello jags224,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. I apologize that you didn’t find our hotel to be acceptable and that you had a less than satisfactory stay. We pride ourselves on great customer service and as evidenced by most of our reviews we do offer fantastic accommodations, service and rates. Your comments were related to the proper department head and the issues have been resolved. Thank you for bringing this to my attention, if you do decide to give us a second chance, please contact me as I'll do my best to accomodate you.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: I definitely recommend this hotel, rooms very clean, friendly staff, excellent location just infront Disney's entrance so you can go walking. Restaurants around. I will definitely stay at this hotel in my next visit. Thanks
Manager Response: none

Summary: Being that we are Disney Annual Pass holders, we travel down quite often. In an attempt to save money, we were directed to try Anaheim Desert Inn and Suites. We have never been disappointed and have stayed often in the last year, close to 5 times. On one visit, we were surprised with a suite upgrade. They have worked with me on mistakes that I have made when booking and they are always friendly when we speak to them. The valet service is nice for parking but we never seem to have a problem finding a spot ourselves. It is conveniently located right across the street from the main entrance which beats taking a shuttle. There is an IHOP and coldstone in the same parking lots and a McDonalds down the street. The hotel is always clean when we show up. Guest laundry onsite for the
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had another hotel that we had "bug" issues with. We walked to the Desert Inn and asked if they had any rooms. They were able to accommodate us at last minute without any problems. It was a nice room at a great price. We will definitely make this our place to stay for all of our future Disneyland visits. The staff was wonderful as well.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was such an amazing stay. The room was really nice with a nice bathroom tile. It was very comfy and a home like feeling. I will definitely consider staying here again. The location was also the best part. It was right across from Disneyland with lots of restaurants around and at a great price. Thanks
Manager Response: none

Summary: I found the staff of the Desert Inn and Suites are very friendly and helpful to their guests. The facilities were very adequate along with the spa room we were in and the location to Disney's front gate was very close.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My sister & I brought our 2 young granddaughters to Disneyland in December. Stayed at this hotel, NOTHING to complain about. Service was very friendly & fast at check-in, rooms were exactly as described. Clean, roomy, everything worked. Disneyland right across the street, Denny's next door. Excellent value. Definitely will be staying there again!
Manager Response: Hi Lorraine H,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and hope to see you when you again come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: The place to stay when at Disneyland , period !
Summary: Directly across the street from the main gate ,have stayed there more than ten times in three years.They have a pool spa and video games but no fitness center. But if you are doing Disneyland  you have already had your workout

Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Great location across the street from Disneyland
Summary: We planned a family reunion trip to Disneyland and needed a room large enough for 10 people. No problem: the hotel room (type C2) was spacious and clean with plenty of amenities. We had 4 queen beds, 2 full baths, a pull-out hide-a-bed, table and 2 chairs, fridge, micro, 3 LCD TVs and the walk was only three minutes from Disney gates.   It was a HUGE relief to us when the hotel allowed half of our party to check-in, and their name wasn't even on the reservation. I called one day before we were due to arrive & explained that we were stuck at origin due to weather and asked if half our party could check-in without us.  They said it would be no problem and even allowed the other half to check-in a little early as they had flown all night.  When my sister-in-law needed to rent a
Manager Response: Hello akdisneylandfreak,  Thank you for your kind words and for giving us a try. We sure are glad that you have found your new favorite place to stay while visiting the Disneyland Resort. Thank you again and we'll see you in the near future.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: This was by far the best small hotel I have ever stayed at! The staff extremely helpful and friendly. The rooms very clean. I had 3 adults and 3 children and they loved it. Walking distances to food, marts and of course Disneyland.  Thank you! This is now the place we will stay every time!
Manager Response: Hi danielle r,  Thank you for staying at the Desert Inn and for such high ratings. We appreciate you staying with us and we will be happy to host any future Disneyland vacations in the future. Thank you and have a great day.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We stayed in the largest suite with 6 adults and 3 small children. It was great that we could all stay together and more economical than 3 separate rooms. The location is great, short walking distance to Disneyland. The hotel is not fancy, but was actually nicer than I thought it would be. We were all very happy with our stay and have no complaints. Will definitely stay again on our next Disney vacation!
Manager Response: Hi Lori F,  I'm very happy to hear that we exceeded your expectations and that you enjoyed your stay very much. Thank you for giving us a try and we hope to see you when you comeback to the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: My friend and I go to Disneyland more than a few times a year, and we always stay at the Desert Inn. It is right across the street from the parks. The rooms are very comfortable and roomy. We love staying here.....I highly recommend staying here.
Manager Response: Hello Debbie D,  We appreciate your patronage and for taking the time to give us some feedback. Our entire staff thanks you for yoru continued support and we'll see you soon.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We stayed at this hotel the first week of December. It was exactly what I expected, an older property, but it was clean and being that close to Disney was very convenient with three young children. The breakfast isn't fancy, but it was fine and they've added hard boiled eggs so there's a little protein. I had also read that the middle elevator took forever, but I think they might have fixed that because we had no problems with it. I'm sure we will stay here again when we make it back out there, you just can't beat the location!
Manager Response: HI Jen H,  Thank you for staying with us and for sharing your feedback.  I'm glad that you found our accomodations to your satisfaction and we invite you to consider the Desert Inn your home, away from home. Thank you and we'll see you soon.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Highly recommend for Disney travelers who don't require all the frills.
Summary: I have stayed here many times and have always had good experiences. Please keep in mind this hotel is a very basic place with clean rooms, basic continental breakfast, and standard pool. However, the staff are friendly and attentive, we had a problem with our room and the maintenance staff were there promptly to resolve the issue with professionalism. The biggest draw for the hotel is the location. If you are planning a trip to Disney it is worth stepping down from a more frills hotel down the road a ways. The hotel entrance is right across the street from the resort making getting into the parks take only minutes. A lot of the other hotels require buses to get to the resort because of their distance. All in all it is very basic but clean and a huge value for your dollar paid.
Manager Response: Hello justjr92,  Thank you for staying with us and for being a loyal guest throughout the years. It was our pleasure to be of service and we look forward to your next visit.   Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Spent 5 nights at the Desert Inn and was pleasantly surprised, based on some mixed reviews. Definitely the best location if you intend on spending a lot of time at Disneyland and it has great views of the fireworks if you do not want to brave the crowds. Rooms were great (had the Parlor suite) and it was perfectly sized. were given a top floor, but asked for a lower floor as we have a young chid and our request was met immediately without fuss. Rooms were clean and hot water was always flowing.  The hotel is not the newest or cheapest out there but if you want a great location and plenty of room then you will be pleased.  On site parking was ok the valet would park your car for free if there were no spaces and were great always running and would help in any way of they could -
Manager Response: HI Shakaka,  We appreciate  your kind remarks about our hotel and appreciate you staying with us recently. Our breakfast does tend to get crowded at times, however this will be resolved very soon. Thank you for your feedback and we hope to see you in the near future.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Stayed for 5 nights in a double queen room.  Loved the location.  Normally we never leave the park for the day, but because of the location, we returned to our room each afternoon for a quick nap and to get our jackets,  Used the fridge only for our water bottles, did not use microwave. In-room safe was nice to have.  Breakfast was so-so, nothing to look forward to.  Room was clean and adequate to meet our needs, a place to sleep.  Looked like the bathroom shower had been updated.  Water temp stayed consistent, toilet was a Toto and easily handled anything we had to offer.  The beds were comfortable enough, my hips were sore by morning, but I don't expect to find the same bed I have at home.  We were on the third floor and had no problem with interior noise.  A/C worked great.
Manager Response: Helloo Utahman0,  I'm glad that you found our accomodations adequate, however we hope to exceed your expectations in a future date when you visit us again. Thank you and have a great day.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay.  We have been before and you just can't beat the location.  Our suite was perfect for what we needed and the staff was friendly, room clean and used valet parking because all spots were full for self-parking. Only suggestion is to improve the contenential breakfast some - very crowded, limited seating and would of liked a healthier menu.  We skipped it and ate at a nearby restaurant.  My overall rating is 'very good' for this property.
Manager Response: Hello Arizona026,  Thank you for staying with us and taking the taking to review our hotel. We are about to expand our breakfast room area and add additional sitting. Thank you for your recommendation and we hope to see you when you come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: I stayed here for 3 nights and it is what I expected from reviews I had read. Check in was easy, less than 5 minutes.  Pros: Location, location, location! Directly in front of the crosswalk that takes you to Disney's entrance. We were just a couple minutes walk from the gates to our room. I have stayed a little farther down the block before and after a day in the park the short trip back to Desert Inn was great. I will never stay farther away than this again. The extra you pay compared to hotels down the block is so worth it! Good size fridge in the room, microwave was nice to have. Room was clean, but furniture a little dated, which for me is fine. I don't need fancy - just a clean room with a comfortable bed which we had. All staff was friendly and helpful. A little store is
Manager Response: Hello Dani2409,  Thank you for taking the time to review the Desert Inn, we apologize that your stay was anything less than great. We will use your review to help us provide a better experience for our future guests. We will also be adding sitting space to our breakfast area so that our guest can have a little more space. Thank you and I sure hope that you would give us another opportunity to serve you in the near future.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Exactly what I wanted and expected!!!
Summary: This was a great stay, sorry it was only for one night. We arrived Sunday after noon, parked out car and when right over to the park. The room was clean, very large, and quite. We checked out the rooftop viewing area which was very nice. I have walked past the hotel on many occasion and I'm very happy to have had such a wonderful stay. Everyone that we dealt with was very nice. I'm looking forward to our next stay in May.
Manager Response: Hello centervilleGreg,  Thank you for your review. We are happy to hear that your stay was great. We are not perfect but we work very hard at providing great customer service and a clean and comfortable place to stay. We hope to see you soon.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We had a great stay at the Desert Inn and Suits, the location was second to none. The hotel is literally across the street from the entrance. The rooms are quite spacious, albeit a little tired, but clean and comfortable. The breakfast is nice but very basic. Staff were friendly - we were actually staying while some of the hotel was undergoing renovation, and our room was right beside the construction site, which was quite disruptive. However, when we asked to be moved, there was no problem at all, and we were upgraded to a suite. I would absolutely stay here again. Very good value.
Manager Response: Dear Stephler19,  Thank you for your kind words and for staying with us recently. We appreciate your understanding and look forward to your next visit. Thank you and we'll see you soon.  Carlos Padilla Operations Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Awesome location, needs renovation in areas
Summary: Walking across to Disneyland was super easy, so location is just awesome.  Rooms are a good size with microwave etc, suited well for families.  The building is dated at this point and elevators, lobby etc need fixing up.
Manager Response: Hello MohitInSeattle,  We thank you for your feedback and for staying with us. We appreciate your comments and will use them to fine tune our operations in the hope that upon your next visit, we can meet or exceed your expectations.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: If your looking for a good place to stay with the perfect location without the Disney hotels price tag then this is it. The rooms are basic but very clean with honest and helpful staff. The breakfast is very basic and could be expanded with a better variety and the staff could do with more local knowledge to help out the tourist eg: where is the best place to shop etc... This was the second time we stayed here within 18 months and if returning to Disneyland we would stay here again, we had 2 adults and 3 kids in the room and they were comfy and spacious enough for our 10 day stay. But the staff could not be more friendly or helpful. And the indoor pool is great for a swim any time of year
Manager Response: Hello Craig R,  We do aspire to deliver a quality product and exceptional friendly service to each and every guest that stays with us. I will definetely bring this suggestion to my staff , we look forward to having you stay with us again and thank you in advance for being a repeat guest. Kind regards!  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Love how close it is to Disneyland
Summary: We always stay here. Close to Disneyland. Plenty of room in suites. Love it!!!  The suites could use another small dresser though. Lots of space for another one. Aldo a hook on bathroom door for toiletries would b perfect!!!
Manager Response: Hello Valerie9116,  Thank you so much for your kind words. We work hard to provide a home away from home to all of our guests. Thank you for being a loyal customer and see you again soon.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Yes, the location is awesome. But we loved the comfort of our room, and the staff couldn't have been nicer. Going back to Disney in April, and we'll be staying here for that and future trips as well. (we actually stayed last in September 2012)
Manager Response: Hello Bryan L,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and hope to see you when you again come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Dessert Inn and Suites has the best location! We always come here with the kids. Housekeeping does a great job at keeping up with the kids messes. The hotel is physically closer to the entrance of Disneyland than the Disneyland hotel. We have been here a half dozen times and will always come back.
Manager Response: Hello therealmilojane,  It is always a pleasure having you with us at the Desert Inn, thank you for your kind words and for taking the time to give us some feedback. We work hard to provide a home away from home to all of our guests. Thank you for being a loyal customer and see you again soon.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: this place is right by the crossing to the main gates of Disneyland, you can not get closer. The rooms are a wee bit tired but still comfortable. The inside pool is great after a day at the park and the spa is perfect to relax in. The roof top terrace gives you a great view of the fireworks. The only complaint is the free breakfast. we did it once and then went elsewhere and paid for breakfast. There is not enough seating and the food is not good at all. BUT you can overlook this as the closeness to the park is just the best. We went early to the park then came home for a rest in the afternoon had a swim then went back at night.
Manager Response: Hello sandy22NewZealand,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that your stay was great, we are in the works of adding sitting space to our brekfast room and also make a breakfast item addition. We hope to see you again when you visit the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: The best thing about this property is the Location.  Literally across the street from the Disneyland entrance, it makes playing at the parks very easy. We've stayed here at least three times over the past several years.  The close proximity also makes it a breeze to come back in the mis afternoon and take a nap (A must with little kids) then back to the parks for the rest of the day and into the night.  The rooms are nice, and the have a parlor suite that is affordable and great for the larger families. They have cheep furniture, but are comfortable and clean.  We've used the indoor pool a couple times (when the parks closed early), and it's OK.  The last time we went, they had an included breakfast that included toast and danishes and fruit.  We brought our own cereal to round
Manager Response: Hello iamquestar,  Thank you for sharing your expecience with the TripAdvisor community and for being a loyal guest to the Desert Inn. You had mentioned that you have outgrown our suites, however we do have suites that accomodate up to ten guests. Thank you for staying with us and let me know if I can be of further assistance on any future reservations.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: This hotel is in an incredible location and has tremendous value.  It's almost directly in front of the entrance to disneyland.  We rented a suite since there was 9 of us and it was incredibly spacious.  The beds were on the firmer side but still very comfortable.  And we booked 6 months in advance and you couldn't beat the deal.  The staff was very friendly and our rooms were very clean.  The only thing that could be improved upon is the breakfast but it served it's purpose.  (There is a Denny's right there if need be) It made it so easy  to take my 3 year old back to the room when she needed to while the rest of our group stayed at Disneyland.  Overall the trip was a great success and we can't wait to come back!
Manager Response: Hi Stacey S,  Thank you for taking the time to give us some feedback about your recent stay with us. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and hope to see you when you again come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: You can't get a better location expecially with the room configurations. It works so well with kids and the multiple rooms we can get that are attached. Rooms are always clean. Breakfast needs to have a little larger room (hint to management: cut down the wall to the next room that used to be a store and use it). Also breakfast could have a little more selection. We've stayed multiple times and will continue to stay here. We refer our friends and not one has disagreed on the location and cleanliness. The indoor pool is great for the kids.
Manager Response: Hello Kathy K,  Thank you for being a loyal guest and for staying with us recently. You've actually hit the spot, we have closed our gift shop to expand our breakfast area, we are hoping to have it done at the beggining of next year. Thank you and we hope to see you again soon.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Spent a week at the Desert Inn and Suites from November 3rd through the 10th.  Since our family group was arriving on different days, we requested a Deluxe room for 2 nights and a suite for 4 nights.  Staff was amazing and moved our luggage to the suite on the 3rd day.  Unfortunately, they were doing construction on the rooms above us and we were awaken at 6:00 AM to hammering, sawing and drilling.  We spoke to the staff member at the front desk and they apologized and upgraded us to a different suite.  They were extremely accommodating and apologetic. I would have rated the stay lower had there been a problem changing rooms.  I have stayed here numerous times and will definitely stay again. Short walk to the parks and surrounded by decent restaurants if you don't want to eat in
Manager Response: Hi KerrySpokaneValley,  Thank you for taking the taking to review our hotel on your recent stay. We are not perfect, however our staff does try to accomodate and/or aliviate any issues while a guest at the Desert Inn. We thank you for giving us such great marks on the ratings and we hope to have you back in the near future while visiting the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We have stayed here before and we know not to expect much; our total purpose in staying there is to be close to the front gate of Disneyland.  At the end of a long day, we are so happy that this was our hotel choice.  The breakfast hasn't changed in years and includes danish, fruit (usually apples or oranges), toast, cereal, juice, and what my husband described as "the worst coffee I've ever had."  After one day, no one was excited to return to the breakfast room.  The one change that we find quite annoying is the resort fee, which is charged purely because they can.  This is not a resort. This is a basic, mostly clean hotel in a prime location.  We never use their pool or hot tub, which always look less than clean and these are the only amenities that they can possibly label
Manager Response: Dear laul0005,  We are extremely sorry about your unsatisfactory experience, rest assure that these issues will be handled by the corresponding departments. We appreciate the feedback and will use it to fine tune our operations in the hope that upon your next visit, we can meet or exceed your expectations.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Great location, very clean and comfortable. Staff were friendly and helpful. Would stay again. So close to Disneyland Resort and heaps of places to eat around. Parking at the property if needed. Breakfast was basic but convenient.
Manager Response: Hello Sarah R,  Thank you for your feedback, it was our pleasure to be of service and we look forward to future visits.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We really enjoyed our stay.  The room was fresh as it had been recently renovated.  Even the shower curtain was brand new.  Our housekeeping service was prime.  Clean fresh sheets every night.  We had the suite A and it was perfect for lounging, catching up on business and niece's college paper while my husband slept in the next room.  I loved the 2 TV's and the autonomy of having enough room without impeding on my family.  The convenience of having Disneyland across the street was such a blessing because great for my older daughters who get bored fast because they were able to independently walk to the park.  I wish they had a weight room to balance out the walking all day at the park.
Manager Response: Hello D K,  We thank you very much for your feedback and for choosing the Desert Inn as your host hotel while visiting Disneyland. We sure hope that you'll repeat the experience in the near future. Again, thank you and we'll see you soon.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We picked this hotel because of the location & we weren't disappointed.  It is right across the street from the main gate of Disneyland.  2 years ago we stayed at Paradise Pier & the walk home after a day in the park was just too far.  So this was perfect!  We were a party of 12, 6 adults & 6 kids aged 10, 7, 6, 5, 4 & 1½...so you know how tired of walking the younger ones were after 10 hours in the park!  We'd come home, change to bathing suits & hit the pool & spa!  The rooms were clean & comfortable.  Having connecting rooms made it easy for the younger ones to visit grandma when ever they wanted. The breakfast could have offered a little more variety, & they definitely could use more space to sit.  But after a few days we wised up & went down, loaded a tray & brought it back
Manager Response: Hello Casabear26,  We are very happy that you chose the Desert Inn and that we meet your expectations. We are definetely adding more sitting stapce to our breakfast room and possibly make additions to our breakfast selection. Thank you for your feedback and we do hope to see you in the near future.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: good value - great location - helpful staff
Summary: We just stayed there for a Disney and BlizzCon 2013 trip and spent five nights here. The room was clean, and sufficient to meet our needs. We never planned on staying in the rooms much - just needed a place to crash at night. The staff was helpful and friendly - from the front desk to the parking service. When the regular parking was full, they gave us complimentary valet parking.   The breakfast buffet is somewhat limited - but again we knew what is was when we reserved there - and there are plenty of other options nearby if you want more (Denny's and IHOP are neighbors - or have ice cream for breakfast at Coldstone Creamery).   The best thing is the location! Directly across from Disneyland, and an easy walk to the Anaheim Convention Center. We will stay at this hotel again in
Manager Response: Hello TylorTravels,  Thank you for staying with us while attending BlizzCon 2013. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and we hope to see you next year for the annual BlizzCon Convention.   Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Return visit as good as before
Summary: We've stayed at the Desert Inn several times and it's always been good.  We get the two bedroom suite with the "parlor" which provides lots of room for four ladies at a price that can't be beat.  The room this time looked like it had been redone not too long ago. Everything was clean and shining.  The morning breakfast includes fruit, packaged danish, toast, cereal, oatmeal and juice and is good enough to get us started even though the coffee is pretty awful.  The location is perfect -- right across from the main gate.  This made it easy to take a mid-day break to rest our feet.    We've stayed in many of the motels around Disneyland over the years and it's nice to have found one that we can rely on for quality, convenience and pleasant, helpful staff.  We'll be back.
Manager Response: Hello MV Gal,  Thank you for your review. We are happy that your stay was great and that you are a loyal guest at the Desert Inn. We are not perfect but we work very hard at providing great customer service and a clean and comfortable place to stay. We hope to see you soon.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Essentially right across the street from Disneyland.  The place is somewhat older but certainly well kept.  The staff were fantastic and unlike others, I have no complaints about the continental breakfast.
Manager Response: HI EMSurfdoc,  Thank you for staying with us, we are glad that we met all of your expectations. On behalf of our entire staff we would like to thank you for your kind words and hope to see you again when your travels bring you back to the area.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: My room clean and I really liked that it was recently renovated. I loved having oatmeal for breakfast as that is how I tend to start my day back at home. Check in clerks were pleasant as were the valets. We had an oversized vehicle, but they had no problems getting it out quickly for us.
Manager Response: Hello lowsushi,  Thank you for giving us feedback about your recent stay at the Desert Inn. It was our pleasure to be of service to you and your family once again. We hope that you'll say with us on future dates when you comeback to the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: My family stayed here at the begging of October for four nights, one being Disneyland's Mickey's Halloween Party.  The hotel was completely booked because of the event.    Room: The hotel is a bit on the older side (no more then any of the other hotels in the area) but they are in the middle of a remodel.  We headed out everyday as soon as the park opened and came back close to / if not when the park closed.  There was no noise from the remodel whenever we were in the hotel.  The hotel staff come every day to clean the room and bring fresh towels.  Location: It could not be better!  You are right across the street from the entrance to Disneyland / California adventures.    Parking: There is parking on site, but they charge a daily fee.  Yes, parking does fill up on Friday and
Manager Response: HI Shannon878,  We are glad that you had a wonderful time at the Desert Inn. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and hope to see you when you again come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We have stayed at the Desert Inn several times and are happy with the service we receive every time. The staff responds to requests and issues quickly keeping us comfortable and happy. While the price has risen considerably since the first time we stayed it's still one of the best prices near Disneyland. We find the rooms comfortable and clean. It amazes me when people complain about the included breakfast. When we're on vacation we try to eat minimally and find toast, fruit and coffee does us well. I would like to see peanut butter included but we have learned to bring our own. While there are signs up saying it's a non smoking facility there are ashtrays around and we walked past smokers several times. It would be nice to see it enforced. We are hoping to do another family
Manager Response: Hello katfowler,  Thank you for your review and for being a loyal guest to the Desert Inn & Suites. We are happy that your stay was great as usual. We are not perfect but we work very hard at providing great customer service and a clean and comfortable place to stay. We hope to see you soon.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: The room was decent and clean.  The maid service was quick and efficient.   The fridge was a good size for storing food to cook in our room.    My only complaint and room for improvement is the breakfast.   There is toast, danish, cold cereal, oatmeal, apple/banana, and juices.  Not much variety for 5 mornings.   But I did come prepared and brought bacon/eggs and other breakfast foods to supplement with the microwave and waffle maker we brought for our room.   As everyone says, the location is excellent and for a family of 8, the parlor suite was a great option and a reasonable price.       The parking/valet service was excellent.  They always helped us find the best spot for our large vehicle and if there wasn't a spot they would reserve one for us to move to as soon as someone
Manager Response: Hello Donalee B,  Thank you for staying with us and for your feedback. It is our goal to make every guest experience memorable and take pride in our work. Again, we thank you for your review and we cannot wait for your next stay!  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We checked in last weekend to a C-1 room for a weeks stay.  The C-1 size was perfect.  Rooms were clean and quiet.  The in-room safe is a nice plus.  The beds were so comfortable.  Kids used the free Wi-Fi for their handheld devices and said it worked fine.  I loved the location, an easy walk to the parks.  Restaurants close by for a full meal, before or after a day in the parks.  I really appreciated the front desk staff's assistance with a last minute reservation change.  It made the stay so much more enjoyable.  Juan S. @ DI&S Thanks !! We have stayed here before and will stay here on future trips to Disneyland!!   D.B. and family
Manager Response: Hello D.B. and family,  We always enjoy having you and your family at the DI&S when you visit the Disneyland Resort. I have passed your kind words to Juan and he's very thankful for your comments. it was our pleasure to be of service and we look forward to future visits.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: The motel is in a great position across the road from Disneyland, the beds are a bit uncomfortable and the wifi wasn't good as you could only get it if you sat near the door and even that wasn't guaranteed.
Manager Response: Hi Jane H,  Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to give us some feedback about your experience. We currently upgrading of WiFi hardware and will soon eliminate any issues that you might have encountered in the past. We hope to see you back when you travel again to the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Convenient stay and the staff makes things so easy.
Summary: Love staying at Desert Inn & Suites. Very conveniently located across from Disneyland and the staff makes checking in/out so simple. Rooms are always neat. Kids love staying in the suite beside they have their own bed and TV.
Manager Response: Hi stacz1,  Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback about your recent stay at the Desert Inn. I am glad that we met your expectations and hope that you will visit us on your next trip to the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: A nice, clean economical hotel conveniently located near everything.   Great place for large families or groups traveling together.   Loved the easy walk to Disneyland. There are also several restaurants within walking distances, as well as convenient stores.   The only complaint is that there is very limited parking. Not enough parking spots for the amount of rooms that are checked out when at full capacity.
Manager Response: Hello KTNeneSM,  Thank you for your feedback and for your kind words, it was our pleasure to be of service and we look forward to future visits.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Beds are really hard and pillows are horrible
Summary: I have stayed at this property before and do like the extra large rooms, and big refrigerator.  I love that our room had two tv's but I was disappointed that the only shows playing were the free over the air cable.  Makes it hard to find something to watch when there are only like 10 channels.   What I really don't understand is why the owners don't provide a 2 inch mattress topper and real pillows to provide their guests a comfortable night's sleep.  On this trip we stayed at a motel 6 and a Best Western as well and both of those hotels had very comfortable beds with mattress toppers and good pillows.  The pillows here feel like they took a bunch of lint from the dryers and stuffed it in a sack.   The good news is this time the pool was heated.  My kids really enjoyed swimming
Manager Response: Hello AngelaT1029,  Thank you for taking the time to give feedback about your recent stay at the Desert Inn. I apologize if our beds were to hard, however we have gotten a lot of compliments about our mattresses and pillows, we've even had guests purchase the same matresses because of their comfort. Unfortunately, there are certain things that we cannot predict but please be assured that all of your comments have been taken seriously and addressed accordingly.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager

Summary Heading: Very convenient, very clean, but needs updating.
Summary: We have been staying at the Desert Inn for years.  You can't beat the location and the suites (there aren't any better suites this close to Disneyland).  The staff is always very nice and the maid service is excellent--the rooms are spotless.  The rooms, however, are showing their age--they really need to be updated:  the toilet was running all the time, the hairdryer seemed like it was about to die, the furniture is pretty bunged up.  And, the breakfast really needs to be better.  Though we know what to expect, and we bring some of our own food to make up for it, it is hard to see the hotel people next to us eating their bacon and eggs outside our bedroom window while we are just getting all bread items (and an apple/orange).  Come on Desert Inn, are you going to make us stay
Manager Response: Hi Annie E,  Thank you for coming back to the Desert Inn and we appreciate your feedback. We will definetely make additions to our breakfast selection in the near future. Nothing is more important to us than our relationship with our guests. Again, we thank you for your review and we cannot wait for your next stay!  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: At least it is close to the park
Summary: Good:   I'd give this a lower rating but the location is what makes it prime. That might be why they are so passive about a concerns that guests bring up.   The walk to the park is very short which is great for tired feet and tired people. The parking isn't too bad at this hotel either.   They have above and below ground parking. They will even let you come and park even if you are way ahead of check in time.   There is also cheap food within feet of the hotel so you can save meal money inside the park.   Bad.   The A/C is simply blowing in outside air. The only way it is chilled is if you are standing right on top of it. Might as well just fan yourself with a magazine.  Feel like winding down after some fun at Disneyland? Hope you weren't planning a variety of channels on tv.
Manager Response: Hello Niko P,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your stay. I sincerely apologize about your experience. I understand that renovations could be anything but relaxing and we are sorry about the inconvenience. Our team has high expectations to provide quality service and value. If your experience tainted your overall opinion of us, I would like to see what can be done to regain your loyalty. Please let me know the best way to communicate with you as you are a valued guest.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: I love staying at the Desert Inn when we go to Disneyland. It is very close to the main entrance and perfect for returning to the room and giving the children naps or changing clothes for the evening. Rooms are clean and standard room is plenty spacious for a family of four. Staff was friendly. If I were to complain about anything it would be that the continental breakfast is pretty limited.
Manager Response: Hello MelMM2013,  Thank you for staying with us and for the feedback. I"m glad that you have been a loyal guest at the Desert Inn and I appreciate that. As far as the breakfast goes, we will probably add a couple of items to our breakfast selection in the near future, we are also planning on adding additinal sitting space. We hope to see you when you come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Room was nice and hotel was quiet. However it was more expensive than other properties nearby where we've stayed before. Did not have complimentary tootbrush or lotion, which is surprising for a Best Western hotel. The most disappointing thing was the breakfast.  Area was too small and one morning, all of the tables were dirty.  I asked the attendant to wipe down the tables but she dried the trays instead, even though there were plenty of trays and people were waiting for a clean table. My daughter thought it might be a language problem but after the woman finished the trays, she wiped down the tables.  We ate at a restaurant the next two mornings to avoid the hassle. Also, there was construction going on near our room that we weren't warned about when we made our reservation or
Manager Response: Hi Randy1102,  We appreciate you taking the time to complete a survey regarding your recent stay with us. On behalf of our entire staff here at the Desert Inn & Suite we apologize for the concerns you have about your experience at this hotel. We hope that you'll stay with us again when you come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: The Desert Inn, was our first port of call on our three week tour of the US.  With a family of six, we needed to book two rooms everywhere we went.  The desert inn recognized this and booked us adjoining room, which was great.  The room were clean and comfortable.  The free WiFi worked well.  It's all about location with this hotel.  We were within easy walking distance to the Disney parks, and there is a wide selection of restaurants within 10 minutes walk.  There's a 7/11 down the road.  We even took the 12 minute walk to Bubba Gumps for something a bit different.  The staff are helpful and friendly.  We turned up before the check in time, and the staff were happy to store our luggage until our rooms were ready.
Manager Response: Hello Hunter R,  Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to review your visit. We are glad that we met your expectations and hope to see you in the near future so that we can make your stay memorable.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Aloha, our family of 8 stayed recently and we couldn't have had a more pleasant experience!!!  We double booked hotels and originally checked in at a hotel down the road... It was a horrible, unwelcoming, and uncomfortable experience. The Desert inn saved us!  Mary, at the front desk called and asked if we were still interested in our reservation! Phew!  Within minutes we were checked in and felt at home!  The hotel is very clean, the staff is friendly, and during our visit there were several other guest from Hawai'i!  Rates are incredible and the proximity to the park is awesome.  We've stayed at the Disnelyand Hotel and we are also DVC owners, we are more than pleased with our stay at the Anaheim Desert Inn!  Mahalo!!!
Manager Response: Hi Alaaloha808,  We are excited to hear that you loved your stay at the Desert Inn.  I hope that you'll continue to stay with us while visiting Disneyland and make Desert Inn your home away from home. Thank you for giving us chance and we'll see you soon.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Stayed Oct.21-24.  Hotel was perfect for our time at Disneyland. Walked across the street and we were in the Happiest Place on Earth for 2 days. Family Suite C1 great for 7 of us. Beds felt delicious at end of each day. Swam and relaxed in pool/spa.  negatives would be continental breakfast,coffee, and internet connection.
Manager Response: Hello Cora S,  Thank you for your feedback and for staying with us while visiting Disneyland. We are happy to hear that we met your expectations and will work on improving in the above mentioned areas. We hope to see you again when you come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: The location is great it would be nice if they changed up the early breakfast with a little different items. The hours for it are 730 starting does not work for when park opens at 8 . The rooms are kept clean
Manager Response: Hello Smilesbrooklyn,  Thank you for staying with us, we will adjust the breakfast time and possibly make an addition to our breakfast selection in the near future. I do hope you will stay with us again when you come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Everything a family could want. I do not think there is any hotel that has a shorter walk to the front gate of Disneyland.  Quiet, clean, comfortable hotel with large rooms. We had four double beds for for people and the rates are very reasonable.
Manager Response: Hi 2painfull,  Thank you for your kind words and for staying with us. I hope to see you when you come back to the Disneyland Resort in the future.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights specifically to visit disneyland.  You could not ask for a better location.  Clean, modern room, bar fridge, lounge area, very spacious and we could even see the Disney fireworks from our room window.  The pool was clean and lovely.  Check in was easy and parking was suitable for a family van.  All staff were friendly and helpful.  In house laundry was clean and accessible.  The rooftop for viewing fireworks was a great little area.  Breakfast was simple, fruit, coffee, cereal, fresh juice, but suited us just fine.  All in all a wonderful experience.  I would definitely recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Hello Karen G,  Thank you for staying with us while visiting the Disneyland Resort. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and hope to see you when you again come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Stayed October 14th-18th 2013 We have always had a great stay, clean rooms, friendly and helpful staff.  We have recommedend this place many times over and no one has been dissapointed.    Beds are very comfortable plenty of nice size bath towels.  Yes there are kids running around crazy but they are excited and some parents DON'T even try to control their kids so again stay somewhere where they don't allow kids.  But~Hello its Disneyland!   In regards to a review:  Impossible to be over a mile one way from waayyyy in the back.  People really stretch the truth. I had no problem getting a print out of the bill this visit or on any of the other 7 visits.  Then the complaint about the continental breakfast.  You know your kids so bring their favorite cereal, the main things are
Manager Response: Hello hermieyellow,  Thank you for your feedback and for your continued support. We appreciate your kind words and are glad that we are able to meet all of your expectations while a guest at the Desert Inn.   Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We stayed here in Sept 2013 and we have stayed at other hotels and this by far was the best. There was some renovations going on but since Sept is the slower season for Disneyland, I understand why the renos were happening. It is nice to see a place doing renos to keep it fresh. The continental breakfast oatmeal, cereal, toast, danish, milk, juice, fruit and coffee was just what we needed if you want more there is an IHOP next door. There are some restaurants close by for lunch or supper, Tony Romas, McDonalds, IHOP and a Subway down the road. We had booked a two room 1 ½ bath suite and were upgraded to a 2 bath suite, with a 17 yr old daughter and a 13 yr old son this was nice, THANK YOU. This hotel is right across the street from Disneyland and you cannot get any closer other
Manager Response: Hello Rod B,  You are very welcome for the upgrade and thank you for being so understanding during our renovations. I'm glad that we met your needs and we hope to see you when you come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: The suite we had was very clean, modern and provided plenty of space for our family of 5.  The one and a half bathrooms were so helpful, especially with 3 daughters.  The location of this hotel makes it extremely convenient to stroll to Disneyland Maingate.  The drawback is that there are so many people and hotels crammed onto this busy strip of Harbor Blvd, that there is always noise.  I can't understand how parents let their kids run, jump and scream in the walkways and parking lots at any hour of the day.  But, I guess management can't or won't do much about that.  The continental breakfast was skimpy, and the coffee was just insipid.  I threw it out.  In-room coffee maker didn't work, either!  We had to pay for a real breakfast at IHOP our second morning there.  Bottom line:
Manager Response: Hello Ree G,  We appreciate you taking the time to complete a survey regarding your recent stay with us. On behalf of our entire staff here at the Desert Inn & Suites, we apologize for the concerns you have about your experience at this hotel. We do try to control noise in our property but we can only do so much if it's not reported immediately. I hope that you give us a second chance and stay with us when you come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: good location and still a long walk
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for the first time. We had a group of 7 so we rented a suite. The suite was nothing more than two rooms that happened to have a door way between them. We reserved a room with an extra living room but were given a room with out so people had to share a bed that would normally sleep alone, not a big issue.   The hotel was right across the street from Disneyland and California adventures but because we got a suite which was WAAAAAAYYYYY in the back of the hotel which is set deep and narrow instead of long along the road, we still had over a mile walk each way to and from the gate.  The heated pool is cold and the hot tub was not warm enough for my taste though I tend to take very hot baths. that being said I felt like I was taking a cold shower even though I
Manager Response: Hello jennolli,  Thank you for staying with us and I appreciate your kind comments and your observations. I believe that the suite that you stayed in is the actual suite that you booked online. We are located right at the main gate of Disneyland's Main Entrance and are one of the few hotels that are this close to the park, normally it would take you about four minute walk go get into the park itself. We do listen to our guests and their valuable feedback assists us in making operational modifications and service enhancements. Kind regards!  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: The Anaheim Desert Inn & Suites were very comfortable and clean. We were very pleased with our rooms and service. The only thing that we did not like was the continental breakfast as it did not offer a lot of options for breakfast. We only ate there once and after that went elsewhere. Other than that we would definitely stay there again in the future!
Manager Response: Hello Darlene F,  We appreciate the feedback and will use it to fine tune our operations in the hope that upon your next visit, we can meet or exceed your expectations.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We always stay here when we go to Disneyland. This was our fourth stay in eight years. It is in the perfect location which is right next to the intersection to cross leading to Disneyland's entrance! Many places to eat nearby too!
Manager Response: Hello CarsLuig,  Thank you for taking the ticket to give us feedback and for your continued patronage. It was our pleasure to be of service and we look forward to future visits.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We stayed and the Anaheim Desert Inn & Suites in late Sept 2013 and found the experience to be satisfactory and in line with expectations.  We had 4 children and 2 adults of the same family so co-ordinating rooms was not easy.  We arrived around 1:45pm with a hope that we would be able to check in early as one of our kids was unwell from travel sickness. We enquired whether we could check in and the fellow on the front desk made up some story (policy) about not receiving that night's room listing as yet (we had booked 2 x adjoining double queen rooms some 4 months earlier). This seemed unlikely and when he saw that there really was an issue he would see what he could do and suggested we come back in the next 30 mins.  We came back and managed to access the room about 45 mins
Manager Response: Hello CraigH3,  Thank you for staying with us and for sharing your feedback. I'm glad that our facilities met your  needs, however we hope that you'll give us a second chance so that we can exceed your expectations. Thank you and we'll see you soon.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We stay here every time we go to Disneyland with a large group. GREAT option for the price. The beds were comfy and the rooms were a great size. As there were 6 of us, the youngest being 16, we really appreciated the open bathrooms available in the car port. The staff was friendly and did not up sell at all. We did get the spa room so we also had the luxury of a HUGE jacuzzi tub. Nice after a long day in the park.
Manager Response: Hi Karen E,  It is our goal deliver a quality product and exceptional service to each and every guest that stays at the Desert Inn. Thank you for being a loyal guest and we look forward to having you stay with us again.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: They could have told me beforehand.....
Summary: I booked a C1 Family suite about 4 months ago (I stayed in Sept 19/22 2013) which has 2 rooms(interconnections), 2 x 2 double beds and 1 and a half baths - I have had this room twice before. When I got there to check in at approx 2pm I was asked if I wanted an upgrade, they said they could give us two rooms with a king bed in each (there was only 2 of us travelling - sisters), I asked if it was interconnecting and he said no, so I said no I booked a C1 I would like a C1, the then asked if we wanted 2 interconnecting rooms (2 x 2 double beds), again I said no, now I am getting worried  - are they trying to sell my C1 room to someone else for more than I paid? The person at the front went away, spoke to someone in another room, came back and said okay come back after 3 for the
Manager Response: Hello Lisa N,  I would like to deeply apologize about the inconvenience encountered while at the Desert Inn. It is not part of the Desert Inn Culture to change reservations at last minute, however renovations do take a tall on the hotel. Thank you for staying with us and we hope that you give us a second chance in the future.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: 2 stays were had by our family as the suites were conveniently close to Disneyland and many shops and restaurants. The rooms were clean, bed comfy and staff pleasant. Reception were helpful to degree but could do with some improvement regarding guests needs. Parking was an issue as we had a large car and couldn't always get near our room. Breakfast room was very warm in the morning and a bit overcrowded but we only ate there once.  All in all, the price was satisfactory for what we received and as we were from Australia we were just happy to be on holidays and get a good night sleep.  Yes, I would recommend staying at the Desert Inn and Suites.
Manager Response: Hi KatheirneF,  Thank you for your review and thank you for trying our hotel! We are happy to hear you found your room pleasant and that most of our amenities were to your satisfaction. We do have valet service available for our guest at no additional cost that you can use.  We are also in the planning stages of expanding our breakfast room area and add additional sitting. Nothing is more important to us than our relationship with our guests. Again, we thank you for your review and we cannot wait for your next stay!  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: This is the loudest hotel. I'm aware its full of families, but should I really be able to hear my neighbors unzipping their luggage? I've also gotten quite a few parenting tips as I've also heard the obligatory lecturing that goes on after a day in the park.  One star for how close it is to Disney. Negative stars for their jailhouse Continental breakfast & paper mache walls.
Manager Response: Hello MeganLAM,  I apologize if your stay was anything but perfect. Unfortunately, there are certain things that we cannot predict but please be assured that all of your comments have been taken seriously and addressed accordingly. Thank you for giving us a chance to host your stay and I hope that you'll give us a second chance when you come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Brought my Grandson who is 4 years old to Disney for first time.   Three families came and all stayed in one room with 2 bathrooms, with 4 beds and a sofa bed in a small living room.  Had doors if wanted privacy.  Also had frig and microwave.    Very clean.  Just walked across the street to Disney.  Was perfect!  Will stay there again.
Manager Response: Hi clark1902,  Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to write a review about the Desert Inn & Suites. We do aspire to deliver a quality product and exceptional friendly service to each and every guest that stays with us. We look forward to having you stay with us again and thank you in advance for being a repeat guest. Kind regards!  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: The hotel is in an excellent location.  My family and I had 2 rooms which both had a lounge which we found very useful.  The bathroom was excellent and we made great use of the free wifi.  The complimentary breakfast set us up for the day and the staffing of the breakfast area was very efficient.     I would definitely recommend to family and friends and will stay here again the next time I visit Anaheim.
Manager Response: Hello bored0144,  Thank you for giving us a chance and staying with us, I'm glad that our facility and amenities were to your satisfaction. Thank you for recommending us and we look forward to your next visit.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Wonderful stay at Anaheim Desert Inn
Summary: We are a family of 7 looking for good budget accommodation and the Anaheim Desert Inn fits the bill.  Rooms spacious and very clean, just across the road from Disneyland so after spending a full day on our feet we only had a short walk.  There is a bus stop just outside the hotel which can take you anywhere you need to go, target, big 5 sporting goods, Vons, knots berry farm, orange outlets and more.  Would highly recommend it for the budget family traveller   We travelled in early September good time crowds down very low had a chance to go on many rides in Disneyland several times. enjoy your stay we cant wait to go back again Miller Family Sydney Australia
Manager Response: Hello Allison M,  Thank you for your feedback and for sharing your experience with fellow TripAdvisor members. We couldn't be happier to hear such honoring comments about our hotel, our entire Desert Inn team thanks  you for such kind words and invite to be come back to our hotel when you come back to the Disneyland Reslrt.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We recently stayed here in a parlor suite a. This hotel has many wonderful qualities. Location is prime, room was very clean and spacious. Parking was plenty (we did go during off season), staff was very kind, helpful and courteous. Wi-fi was a tad slow but we didn't use it much, we were too busy having fun at Disneyland so it wasn't a big deal for us. We brought our own breakfast since I knew we would need more than "continental". The only reason I didn't give this place 5 stars was because the "beds". Those were NOT beds. They were hard foam pads in the shape of beds. I even looked because I could not believe how HARD they were. They had no give at all. It was like laying on the floor, no exaggeration. I'm not a picky person but these beds were a joke. We even left 1 day early
Manager Response: Hello aksharp1,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience while staying at the Desert Inn. I'm glad that most of our amenities and services met your expectations. It is also a surprise that our beds were too hard, normally we get compliments on our beds as a number of our guests purchase the same product for their homes. I do thank you for staying with us and I hope that you will stay with us in the future while visiting Disneyland Parks.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager

Summary Heading: Convenient and decent hotel to spend your vacation.
Summary: Our vacation was enjoyable and memorable.  We really appreciate clean rooms and excellent service.  I would recommend all my family and friends to stay here.  We look forward to staying here in the future.
Manager Response: Hello Daveymarie,  I appreciate you staying with us and qualifying us with such high marks. We are ecstatic to hear we exceeded your expectations and hope that you'll stay with us while visiting the Disneyland Resort in the future.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Currently being renovated. Middle lift wasn't working, which made it a long walk to room.  Resort fee of $4, what the... Room was comfortable and clean and service was good.  Nice breakfast. I like the place.
Manager Response: Hello KevfromSA,  Thank you for your staying with us and for your kind comments. Our lift has been fully updated is up and running and yes, we are still under renovations, however renovations do not affect the hotel operations in any shape or form. It was our pleasure to be of service and we look forward to future visits.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Expected much better for this price!!
Summary: Spent four nights here in September 2013. Since we wanted a full day at Disneyland I emailed ahead to make sure parking our car and storing our luggage at the bell desk was available at 8am. They said yes, but upon arrival we were told we had to use outdoor paid lockers for our luggage. We chose to put the luggage back in the trunk, and because of the cramped parking we used valet and had to get the car back and then valet again. Front desk promised to call us when our room was ready, which they did not, and neither the morning clerk or afternoon clerk were  friendly or helpful. Our family "suite" was very outdated. The beds and linens were horrible, the carpet was filthy, the shutters did not block out the light, and the fan to push cool air from the bedroom into the living
Manager Response: Hello Brian G,  Genuine efforts were made to provide you exceptional service and accommodate all of your requests. Unfortunately, there are certain things that we cannot predict but please be assured that all of your comments have been taken seriously and addressed accordingly. At this point we are still under renovations, which does not affect our overall service. Your experience was unique and does not reflect the overall quality of the Desert Inn and would like to invite you to stay with us in the future so that we can meet and exceed your expectations.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Anaheim Desert Inn is a gem... The room are clean and big and the price can't be beat.  It is across the street from Disneyland and is very handy for those "breaks".... The linens smelled fresh and the bed was very comfortable.  The room we had was recently renovated and it was a nice break from dingy rooms.  The wifi worked fine after we finally got it going.  We will be returning to the Desert Inn in October and November.  Thanks for a great stay!
Manager Response: HI Jean C,  We are glad that you enjoyed your stay, we hope that all of our rooms will be fully renovated. We are not perfect but we work very hard at providing great customer service and a clean and comfortable place to stay. We hope to see you soon.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager

Summary: This was the best place we could have stayed at for our trip to Disneyland.  In total there were 7 of us and there was plenty of space for everyone in the room.  We got the Parlour suite with 4 queen beds and the pull out sofa.  The room service was excellent, our room was always spotless when we came back.  The continental breakfast was perfect for the kids, cereal, toast, danishes, juice, and coffee for the adults, it was all the fuel we needed in the mornings. The kids loved having the option of either an indoor or outdoor pool and the distance to the gates was the best.  At the end of the day when you're exhausted and walking back to your hotel, it's great that it's the closest on the strip.  This hotel far exceeded my expectations and we will definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: Hello jhassett,  Thank you for staying with us, I'm glad that we exceeded  your expectations and that you loved your stay with us. Nothing is more important to us than our relationship with our guests. Again, we thank you for your review and we cannot wait for your next stay!  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: this is ideal for visiting at Disneyland-literally right across the street and the most convenient place to stay-just outside the Disneyland gate. this is your average, run of the mill motel-no frills, breakfast simple and not that good, so don't count on it. our AC unit did not work on our arrival, but they had it fixed in 20minutes and kept the room plenty cool during this very warm spell with high temps in the 90's. did not check out the pool. parking is adequate. try to get under the structure to keep car out of the sun. rooms basic, but clean enough. they were remodeling several rooms nearby. at this time the elevator did not go to 5th floor (best views) but must walk up two flights of stairs with luggage. plenty of nearby restaurants to eat nearby...with Cold Stone
Manager Response: Hello Gerald H,  Thank you for staying with us and pardon our dust during renovations. Our elevator is functional now and we'll look into the room you stayed in to resolve the springs issue, thank you for letting me know about this and I hope that you'll say with us in the future while visiting the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: A great location, and the staff are all very friendly and helpful, right from the front desk to the maintenance staff. Great roof top viewing area to see fireworks and rooms are quite spacious and clean.
Manager Response: Hi Scott C,  I appreciate you taking the time to provide some feedback about your recent stay with us. I'm glad that our location and room quality met your expectations and we hope to have you stay with us when you come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Large, clean suite in motel directly across from Disneyland
Summary: We just got back from 5 nights at the DI&S. I knew going in it was going to be an old motel and nothing like the luxurious Marriott we'd stayed in the night before so I was a little nervous going in. Here are my notes on our stay:  We were 4 people (2 adults, 2 kids ages 10 and 13) in a C-1 Suite on the second floor in the middle of the motel, close to the elevator. We stayed in late August, 2013 during an unusually hot and humid heat wave (temps in 90s every day and even got up to 100 the last day).  PROS * Location. I counted 53 steps from the end of the crosswalk on Harbor to the hotel. So easy to go back and forth to Disneyland. This was a HIGE PLUS! * Beautiful rose garden at entrance (even though our view was a brick wall and parking lot we started off with a little
Manager Response: Hello Chabelita545,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience and in such detail. I apologize about the areas where we are lacking and will definitely be discussed in our next management meeting, on a positive note our elevator that was down during your stay has been renovated and is working at full capacity.   We pride ourselves on great customer service and as evidenced by most of our reviews we do offer fantastic accommodations, service and rates. Thank you for staying with us and sure hope to see you in the near future.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Room was clean and very spacious. Our family of 6 had plenty of room to move around. The beds were great. The maid service was exceptional. We enjoyed the convenience of breakfast, the late hours of the swimming pool and the rooftop deck for viewing fireworks. Also the close proximity to Disneyland. We will definitely stay here again if we are in town.
Manager Response: Hello Vickie,  Thank you for staying with us, we hope that you have found your future home away from home while visiting Disneyland and California Adventure. I'll forward your kind comments to our housekeeping department as I'm sure they'll be happy to hear your feedback, thank you and we hope to see you in the near future.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn
