Summary: Stayed here for a second time and would definitely go back again. Staff here are great and it makes a difference when even the maintenance and cleaning staff are engaging, not just the reception staff. At the last minute our party changed from 4 to 5, but it was no trouble to organise a fold away bed for an extra $5 a night - bargain! Also found the parking great value for $8 a night (read previous review about not being aware of charge but this was all upfront when we booked and well worth paying for convenience and security).  Arrived mid afternoon and went shopping at a nearby Vons supermarket to get supplies (breakfast was fine for adults but kids did not touch so had to get alternatives for them), only 5 minutes away by car, followed by an afternoon at downtown disney and
Manager Response: Hello scottnleigh,  Thank you for staying with while visiting the Disneyland Resort, I'm glad that our amenities and services met your needs. I apologize on behalf of Levi and James' parents about the early wake up calls. We hope that you'll stay with us on your next Disney Vacation.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: great hotel, close to disney entrance
Summary: we stay at this hotel every year, the staff are all very friendly and willing to make your stay great. We get the same suite every year and its perfect for all our needs. we haven't been sorry yet. we would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone, and we have to our family, friends and also co-workers. this hotel is great for budget wise travelers also. great bargain for your money. its also close to the main entrance to Disneyland, also a plus.
Manager Response: Hi donandreastark,  Thank you for giving us such high marks all across the board..Our team has high expectations to provide quality service and value and as evidenced by your review we are doing a good job. We are one of the hotels that are right by the main entrance to Disneyland and we are glad that our guests have that privilege. Thank you for staying with us and we'll see you in the near future.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: I asked for a low floor due to mobility issues and they put us on the 4th floor before we left they called to say the elevator wasn't working past the 3rd floor and did I want a queen room or the suite and walk 2 flights. I kept the suite  when we arrived they put us on the 5th floor and I had to walk 4 flights of stairs. The staff changed it for us the next day they were very helpful and we were put on the 2nd floor. Alot of construction was going on, new elevator. One reason also I choose this hotel besides the rate and photos was free parking while reading the bill traveling home we were charged $8 a day and also on the bill was my name but the address was a foreign country. So tomorrow I'm checking at my bank to make sure they didn't overbill us. Even though we wouldn't stay
Manager Response: Hello Vicki T,  I do sincerely apologize about your experience. Easytobook has been contacted so that we can resolve this issue, we have been charging for parking for about three years now and have made several attempts for third party booking sites to reflect and make future guests aware of all of our fees but they have not come up with a solution. All of our fees are also mentioned once again upon check in. We don't charge for in-house calls, however I believe that you dialed our local phone number which would incur a .75 cent charge.  If your experience tainted your overall opinion of us, I would like to see what can be done to regain your loyalty. Please let me know the best way to communicate with you as you are a valued guest.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: You can't really get any further to Disney than this hotel.  In fact you are probably closer to the Disney entrance than the on-site Disney hotels.  Check-in was very friendly and we were given the option of 2 rooms, one being on a low floor but near the lift and one on a high floor (as requested) but choice was given due to the liftbtonthe 4 th floor being out of order and havingtowalk up a flight of stairs as well. We chose the room in the high floor as we thought it would be quieter and it was quiet and gave a good view of the Disney parks.  The room was surpringly (for the price paid) very roomy with a separate lounge area. It was clean and we found no complaints with it.  For us though it really was just for sleeping in as we left around 7:30am each day and didn't return
Manager Response: Hello CKBM,  I appreciate your kind words and thank you for giving the Desert Inn a chance while visiting the Disneyland Resort. We are ecstatic to hear we exceeded your expectations! Nothing is more important to us than our relationship with our guests. Again, we thank you for your review and we cannot wait for your next stay!  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Great place to stay extremely close to Disneyland
Summary: I've stayed at many of the hotels along Harbor, as well as the Disneyland hotels.  This one is a great mix of quality for the price.  The room was clean and very quiet, and it is straight across the street from the park entrance.  Has a light continental breakfast that includes pastries, fruit, cereal and oatmeal.  Beds were great.  Water pressure was really strong.  Air conditioner could make the place an ice box in less than half an hour.  No complaints at all.
Manager Response: Hello Joseph C,   We are ecstatic to hear we exceeded your expectations! Nothing is more important to us than our relationship with our guests. Again, we thank you for your review and we cannot wait for your next stay!  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Well what can I say, across the road from main entrance to Disneyland, stayed here five years ago, and they have updated the rooms since I was last here.  I stayed in a lovely room, was a suite, so good.  Close to Dennys and Ihop, I enjoyed Dennys, as I was travelling on my own, and was next door.  Staff were very helpful, and after walking around Disneyland all day and most of night was good to just walk across road, and just lay in the nice big beds. Close to Angel Stadium train station $5.00 in taxi, so if you need to travel anywhere from here not far away. I would like to thank Anaheim Desert Inn for my stay here, as everyone was so helpful. Even had a lounge area in Suite....
Manager Response: Hello indenda,  I really appreciate your feedback and I'm also glad that you have met your expectations. Our hotel is conveniently located right at the main gate of Disneyland and this makes us one of the preferred hotels to stay while visiting the Disneyland Resort. Thank you for giving us a chance to host your vacation and we hope to have you stay with us for the years to come.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: This has been our default standby hotel for every visit to Disneyland over the last 20 years. We have tried a few others in the interim and found the Anaheim Desert Inn & Suites was best suited to our needs as a family of five, or when we were there with extended family, one of whom required a wheelchair. Being able to leave the car on the property on arrival and departure dates was also a plus. Our only disappointment this time was that we were never able to successfully negotiate the wi-fi login with any of our MacBooks, iPads, or iPhones. Also, we have recently come in need of a gluten-free diet and the breakfast does not offer much in that regard, but hopefully this is something the hotel will take into consideration in the future.
Manager Response: HI business-pleasure123,  Thank you for your review and thank you for your continued support. I apologize about the WiFi connections, we are currently working in  upgrading all of our room connections and will have it fixed 100% very soon, we will also review our breakfast selections and possibly change a couple of items. Thank you for staying with us and we'll see you in the near future.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Location is great - truly only one hotel is closer.  The rooms have plenty of space to move around, nice-sized fridge, microwave and outstanding water pressure in the shower.  Breakfast is inadequate - bread, donuts, cold cereal, milk and coffee.  No choice of milk, and they ran out one morning!  No proteins at all.  As for noise, the only issue we had was unsupervised children running around early in the morning in the courtyard, and that's not the hotel's problem.  Parents, please recognize that this is a temporary residence for hundreds of people who don't necessarily love your kids.  Our car had to be valet parked because they just don't have enough spaces.  I needed to get into the car, so the valet gave me the keys & let me walk down into the garage alone to get what I
Manager Response: Hello JulieVA,  We appreciate you taking the time to complete a survey regarding your recent stay with us. On behalf of our entire staff here at the Desert Inn & Suite we apologize for the concerns you have about your experience at this hotel. Thank you for your high marks and we invite you to stay with us in the near future so that we can meet your expectations.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: For an overnight trip,  this place was great!  We were placed in a clean room,it was a very easy check in,  and a very quick and easy walk to Disneyland.  Our son loved the rooftop sundeck where we were able to watch the fireworks at night.  We would stay here again.
Manager Response: Hello Jeremy K,  Thank you for your feedback, it was our pleasure to be of service and we look forward to future visits.   Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Nice for the price and very close to the parks!
Summary: I go to Disneyland with my whole family every other year for a week and we always stay at one of the Disney resort hotels, but this was a quick 2-day trip with friends in between my family trips. We didn't want to spend the $$$ on a Disney hotel, but wanted to be close to the park. I had stayed here back in 1999 and remembered it was a great location, so we went for it.  Booked a Family Suite and it was perfect. It looked like the decor had been upgraded and it was much nicer than I remembered. We had rooms 328 and 329 at the back of the hotel near the courtyard of palm trees that are really pretty!  It got noisy in the morning from people leaving to go to the park -- doors slamming and kids spazzing out from excitement -- but this happens at the resort hotels too, and you
Manager Response: Hello effie3,  I am happy to hear that you loved your recent stay with the Desert Inn. We work hard to provide a home away from home to all of our guests. Thank you for being a loyal customer and see you on your next Disneyland Resort visit.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: For a large family on a budget, this is an excellent option
Summary: If you're expecting a luxury hotel, this isn't for you.  If you have a large family, or two families who can share a suite and are trying to stretch your Disneyland dollars (and who isn't, with those highway robbery park ticket prices) then this is a good option. The continental breakfast is basic toast, cereal and boxed danish pasteurizes, along with coffee, juice and milk.  The pool is indoors and isn't anything special.  The outside hallways are very narrow (just wide enough for my double stroller) as are the elevators.  The last time we were there the room we stayed in had rather dirty carpet that made the bottoms of our socks dark.  OK, that's the poor part, but here's why we have stayed here three times already, with a fourth trip planned for this winter: price, location
Manager Response: Hello OregonMum14,  Thank you for your feedback, our rooms and suites are able to accommodate any family due to the multiple room configurations. I'm glad to hear that we were able to meet your needs and invite you to stay with us on any future visits to the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Clean hotel, so close to the entrance and friendly staff. Fridge worked well. Plenty of hot water (shower). I liked watching the Disney fireworks from the roof of the hotel. The staff was friendly and gave me some tips about surviving Disney.  We stayed on the 5th floor. The price of the hotel was very good for a small suite. The best part is how close we were to Disney - 5 minute walk.  I would definitely stay here again and refer my friends too.
Manager Response: Hello Doug B,  Thank you for giving us such high marks in sleep quality, rooms, and cleanliness. We are ecstatic to hear we exceeded your expectations! Nothing is more important to us than our relationship with our guests. Again, we thank you for your review and we cannot wait for your next stay!  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We were told of this hotel by friends & it fit our needs almost perfectly.  The family suite worked well with our large family and was priced well, the location for Disneyland & CA Adventures was perfect, the amenities were great. Quiet, clean, and valet parking was nice. Only complaint is a scanty breakfast selection, which management says they'll address at their next meeting.  You get a discount at Denny's restaurant also :)
Manager Response: Hello mtbergmom,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know our hotel met all of your needs and that was able to meet your expectations, thank you and hope to see you when you again come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: This has been probably one of the better Hotels I have stayed at location was a 5 min walk to Disney and California Adventure rooms were clean and service is great I will stay there for all future vacations to Anaheim
Manager Response: Hi jeffk86442,  Thank you for staying with us and for giving us a chance to make your visit to the Disneyland Resort memorable. I'm happy to hear that we met your expectations and invite you to stay with us and become part of the Desert Inn family.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Great value across the street from Disneyland
Summary: We have stayed at Anaheim Desert Inn & Suites many times through the years, and will continue to do so. Here's why: - Always clean, comfortable and reasonably priced. They have several configurations of rooms for a variety of families.. - Courteous staff and free breakfast! - location, location, location! We love being able to walk across Harbor Blvd very easily and be at Disneyland in 5 minutes.
Manager Response: Hello Sherrie S,  Thank you for giving us such high marks all across the board, we are glad that you loved our hotel. A big thank you on behalf of our entire staff, they appreciate your feedback and makes them feel that they are doing an excellent job. We all hope that you'll make the Desert Inn your home away from home. Again, thank you and we'll see you soon.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: The location of this was perfect for Disney, just over the road. Good size room and always cleaned well. Average continental breakfast. Parking was always available and if there were no spaces the attendants valet parked it for you. The road was very busy but we didn't hear much noise on the 5th floor. Its had an indoor pool but it would have been nice to have an outdoor one. Iwould love to go back there
Manager Response: Hello chris11223344,  We would love to have you back soon as well. I can not thank you enough for providing feedback about your recent stay. I will share your kind words with our staff, as they always love hearing compliments about their hard work. We hope to see you in the near future.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Perfect location to Disneyland. Very family friendly.
Summary: Loved this hotel. You can't get much closer. It felt closer to Disney main gate than the actual Disney hotel. Stayed here for a week and it was awesome.  The room with the small living area seperate from the beds was perfect. The fridge was nice and thankfully bigger than your regular mini fridge. It certainly helps to make a quick stop at Walmart or Target to pick up food.  Run back and forth from Disneyland and save yourself some money.   Kids loved the pool and the rooftop viewing deck for the fireworks. We arrived right in time to go up to the roof and see them. What a treat for the kids!  Self parking was never an issue for us. Housekeeping was great. My only complain was the soap they use on their linens. Leaves a lingering smell and the sheets were a bit on the rough
Manager Response: Hello vanbaby,  I'm happy to hear that our location and rooms met your needs. Thank you for your kind words, I will share them with my staff and I'm sure that they take joy on your comments. Thank you for staying with us and we hope to have you come back to the Desert Inn on your next visit to the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager

Summary: Our stay here was great! A quick weekend to Disneyland from Northern California so we wanted to stay close to the park so that we could walk back and forth. It was so much easier than waiting 20 minutes for a shuttle to pick us up and drive us to another hotel. The rooms were clean and very comfortable. We will definitely stay at the Anaheim Desert Inn & Suites again!!
Manager Response: Hello Mike-n-Angel,  I'm glad that our hotel met your expectations and thank you for staying with us while visiting the Disneyland Resort. We value the feedback from our guests as it is very important that each guest has a positive experience when they stay with us. We pride ourselves in offering a great value as there are many choices out there. We hope to have you back again soon.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Stayed at this hotel in June 2013. This hotel is value for money. Right opposite to Disneyland. Considering the amount you pay for the hotel, the breakfast is really a bonus. The rooms were very clean and serviced daily. Reception staff were very helpful. We used the laundry service downstairs. If you are on a budget you can't get better than this.
Manager Response: Hello AltheaCMelbourne,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and hope to see you when you again come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: I stayed in the two bedroom suite at this property in mid July. Overall, my stay was fine. The good thing was that it was right across the street from Disneyland's main gates so it significantly decreased the walking you had to do. Also, I thought the price of the room was great. All 7 of my family members were able to stay in the same room for a low rate. Also, if you like strong water pressure then this is your hotel. The water pressure was so hard that it hurt to stand in the stream for to long!!  I was super excited about the breakfast and the indoor heated pool. Don't be fooled. The pool was dirty and our swimsuits smelt horrible after we used it. We hand washed them in the bathtub the next day because it smelt so bad. The hot tub was luke warm at best and really small. The
Manager Response: Hello Kristen G,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. I apologize that you didn’t find our hotel to be acceptable and that you had a less than satisfactory stay. We pride ourselves on great customer service and as evidenced by most of our reviews we do offer fantastic accommodations, service and rates. Should you decide to stay with us again, we would take that opportunity to be of better service to you and your family.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: The Desert Inn was a good hotel to stay at for your Disneyland trip.  Very close to everything in town and just right across the street from the walk to the main entrance.  The free breakfast is not that great but hey its free and better than nothing.  Save you money on breakfast!  The wifi is way to slow or not even there in the rooms but I got an email stating they were in the process of upgrading.   Should be done by the end of the year 2013.  Also they are putting in wired connections, awesome.  Overall good hotel we had the big suite with the two rooms and living room area very spacious even with 11 of us.  Worth it!
Manager Response: Hi Casey C,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and hope to see you when you again come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We chose this hotel because of its proximity to Disneyland...10 minute walk, and you are in the park! The hotel itself is clean and quiet, and the staff is friendly and helpful. The breakfast selection isn't that varied, and is only available for a short time, so if you plan on early park touring, you might want to bring your own supplies.
Manager Response: Hello Atomicgirl27,  On behalf of our entire staff we would like to thank you for your kind words and hope to see you again when your travels bring you back to the area.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: One day trip to the Happiest Place on Earth
Summary: The room was clean and comfortable so we slept well in fact we slept in.....It was reasonable priced!  We didn't make it to the indoor pool but it look inviting.  Plus this place was very close to Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I went to Disneyland with my girlfriends in June and stayed at the Desert Palms for the second time and I still loved it. I had gone with my family the year before and the hotel has a variety of rooms for families. The beds were comfortable overall, but not the best i've slept in. Some rooms overlook the back of California Adventure Park. The continental breakfast in the morning gives the day an easy start. Location is perfect since all you have to do is walk past California Adventure and you can purchase a shuttle ticket for 5 dollars per day.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were a family of 8.  We had 2 adjoining rooms on the bottom floor.  My grandson had a blast at the pool.  My hsuband and I enjoyed the fireworks from the roof top deck.  Laundry room was very useful.  We never took advantage of the continental breakfast, but at check in, we received a 10% off coupon for Denny"s, which is right next door. We will surely reserve a room again at Anahein Desert Inn and suites.  The location was great. especially after a long day at Disneyland and California Adventures.  The parking was a hassle. It seeems there are more rooms than parking spots. Be aware there is a daily parking fee. Yet most of the time we had to have our car parked by the valets, because of lack of parking. Make sure you have cash to tip the valets. The giftshop has disney
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Pleasant and so close to Disney!
Summary: The staff and room were above average, for an inexpensive rate you just can't ask for more.  The front desk staff was very kind and accommodating, even stored medication for me that needed refrigeration until our room was ready.  The room was very clean, and the beds comfortable.  Air conditioning worked great and was nice after a long day in the Disney parks.  The breakfast that is offered is not special, but decent continental and of good quality and variety.  This isn't a resort, but is great as a landing place for exploring Disney.  Only about a 10 minute walk to the front gates if that long.  Nice place, and I'd stay again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I wrote a review for 2012 and once again we visited (2013) Disneyland and visited this hotel again since we enjoyed it the last time. As I said before the location of the hotel is perfect especially with little ones. The walk is about a 2 minute walk to Disneyland entrance and walking back with little ones is even better as the distance is very little. We checked in early got our room quickly with no problems. As a matter of fact I was an hour late because of appointments I had made for the salon in Disneyland for my children. I told the hotel my situation and they told me  I could check in later, and they immediately took my car and parked it for us. I went straight into Disneyland and came back where they checked me in. The rooms were bigger, it was clean, the beds are
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Room to Spread Out with a View of the Fireworks
Summary: Traveling with my family of 6, the Family parlor suite C had plenty of room for us to get a good night sleep.  The location of this hotel is its best feature.  I was able to see the Disneyland fireworks from the rear window.(3rd floor)  There is a viewing deck on the roof, but we never got back in time to use it.  The unit was very clean.  My wife likes to cook on our family trips to save on eating out.  I told her there was not a real kitchen, just a microwave and a fridge, but they did offer a continental breakfast downstairs.  We gave the free breakfast a try the first morning, but it was very limited and we would rather get an early start to the parks than a free subpar breakfast.  We had a car, so we popped over to Target and grabbed some frozen breakfast sandwiches to nuke
Manager Response: none

Summary: All is good but the final price was very superior to the contracted with easytobook.com (486 $ contacted, 624 $ paid). The best is the location near the entry to the Disneyland parks and they speak Spanish in the Lobby of the hotel
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: We are Done with Desert Inn & Suites
Summary: We have stayed here at least 6 times now over the last couple of years.  My previous review was “worn but decent”.  However our last stay during the first week in July will be our last.  We are done with Desert Inn & Suites.   My updated review by categories:  Rooms: We reserved a B Suites which in reality is just 2 adjoining queen rooms.  Now having stayed here at least 5 times before I would have expected them to provide us with the most decent rooms available, but instead we were giving 2 of the crappiest rooms I have ever seen.  It was like entering a dungeon.   Soiled carpet, peeling paint, broken security latches, and 1,000 year old beds completed the medieval like atmosphere.  The circa 1990 AC squeaked and rattled all night and left a puddle of water outside our room
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great place to stay. Friendly front desk, parking attendants and maids.  This stay was our fifth times in 10 years. The location is great. We went to Disneyland nights and Universal Studio and Legoland during days.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have stayed at just about all of the hotels on Harbor Blvd near the crosswalk entrance.  We are a family of 5 and found many of the hotel rooms on this street too small.  We booked a Parlor Suite A room on the top floor.  One of the reasons I was excited to try this place out is that the parlor room has a sofa bed with tv room right when you walk in the door.  My husband likes to have a glass of wine and stay up an hour or two later than the kids and I.  This room was perfect for that!  He shut the door and stayed up as late as he wanted and we were all able to fall asleep.  The room is very large as well and we were very happy with the generous space.  We found the beds to be firm...and the pillows were a little flat and hard.  If you are sensitive to a certain pillow size it
Manager Response: none

Summary: item was taken from our room, maids are not in rooms but doors are left open during the cleaning process. IPOD was stolen out of public bathroom on 1st level. Hot tub was dirty, suds indicate bacteria
Manager Response: none

Summary: rooms were well maintained, maid service was excellent, closer than the Disneyland hotel, right next door to a dennys and a ihop we only ate at dennys service and food was excellent. only bad thing was lack of parking. was hard to come and go. other than the parking it was a great experience and will stay here for every visit. we decided to stay another day, our room was booked so we had to move to another room instead of making us move our stuff the staff said pack it up leave it and they would move it. so we got another full day at Disney.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Across the street from Disney! No kidding!
Summary: The hotel is like any other hotel, it does not have any extra amenities but it is located across the street from the Disney main entrance. It is between Denny's and Ihop 24hrs. restaurants. The room was clean and everything worked well and they let you keep your car in their until 2pm even though the check out time is at 11am. I would stay here again just because its location, it is the closes hotel to Disney.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Anaheim Desert Inn and Suites is located across from the main entrance to Disneyland, there is a Denny's, IHOP, Cold Stone and Captain Kidd Buffet surrounding within a few feet, not to mention numerous other eating places.  The hotel can accommodate large families, there is a pool, hot tub, roof top access to sit and relax to watch the fireworks over Disneyland.  There is a continental breakfast in the morning to get you started for the day, or with Denny's and IHOP 24 hours you have breakfast choices.  I love the convenience of this hotel, no fussing with the car, walk to and from the park with no shuttle or tram hassles.  The staff was very helpful and friendly, I would not hesitate to stay here at any time while in Anaheim, the convenience is well worth it.  The only
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the Desert Inn and Suites because of its prime location across the Disneyland entrance and for its fairly decent rate. I would not stay there again.  Besides its convenient location there was not much else that was positive about the place. The exterior was run down; there was no one to help with the luggage - you even had to hunt down  your own dolly for the bags; the desk help were unfriendly and very wishy washy; breakfast was a joke! The room was clean but our shower kept backing up even after I called to request they take a look at it after our first night.  The furniture was old and beaten up. They totally take advantage of the fact that they are right across the street from the park and have made absolutely no attempt to upkeep their facility. I would never
Manager Response: none

Summary: My friend and I stayed here June 25th to June 28th for our trip to Disneyland. I picked this hotel specifically for the location. It is just a 5 minute walk to the DIsneyland gates. The room was nice enough. Beds were comfortable. We stayed in a jacuzzi suite so it was nice to have the hot tub after a long day in the parks. The room was clean. I had issues with the front desk during check in and check out. During check in, the front desk guy tried to charge me $75 dollars more than what I was quoted when I made the initial reservations. Luckily, I had my confirmation email on hand to show him the price. I ended up talking to the manager and he resolved the issue. During check-out, the employee at the front desk printed out someone elses bill for me to sign. Again, I noticed it
Manager Response: none

Summary: Enjoyed our 6 night stay here.  Location was perfect for Disneyland.  Rooms clean.  Staff very helpful.  Valet staff friendly and welcoming.  Breakfast was fine for a continental breakfast.  If you wanted a bigger breakfast, Denny's was next door.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The family decided to venture from our norm on this trip and stay here. The location can not be better...with that said that's all this place has going it for it.  I felt dirty. I actually went to the store and bought cleaning supplies and cleaned it myself and even after that I still didn't like it.  Needs to be remodeled!  Needs to be clean...  Never staying again
Manager Response: Hello Ayresfam,  I sincerely apologize if our rooms were not to your standards, I have personally spoken to our housekeeping staff to remind them the importance of cleanliness as that is one of our major assets at the Desert Inn as evidenced by previous . If you have a moment and are willing to share any specifics on these items it would greatly increase my ability to better assess and attempt to remedy these concerns.  However, regardless of your response to my request I want to make sure that you feel your comments were heard.   Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We've just returned from a 9 night vacation at this hotel.  We chose it because of its proximity to the Disneyland Parks.  You walk out of the hotel entrance and directly across the road is the Disney entrance gate.  We are also a family of 5 and wanted a separate room for our kids aged 11, 9 and 7.  Our room (C1) was clean, comfy beds and a great price.  We liked the fact that there is one door to the suite from the outside.  One bathroom was manageable although we had two toilets and vanity sinks were outside bathroom which was a plus.  The buffet breakfast was disappointing and the room VERY small.  Weekends were extremely busy.  We ended up having our own cereals and milk and getting bowls, spoons, toast etc and eating in our room.  IHOP and Denny's are on either side of
Manager Response: Hello mandmwa,  Thank you for your review. We are happy that your stay was great. We are not perfect but we work very hard at providing great customer service and a clean and comfortable place to stay. Also, we will be expanding our breakfast room soon so that our breakfast area does not get too crowded, it was our pleasure to be of service and we look forward to future visits.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Great stay!   From June 12 to June 16th.
Summary: We stayed 3 days and got the c1 room. Total of us were 7 to 10 and it was Great for all of us to stay together in 1 room...Everything was so convenient for us,Disneyland right across the street,Denny's,I hop right next door. Very easy if you have children and hungry adults.Even Targets was down the road to go and buy few things for snack in our room..  Love the beds in our room and the bath and a half was great to have for all of us . At least we didn't have to grumble and rush the other person to hurry up.. The hotel staff were Great,especially Teo who was a front desk manager. From when I made our reservations over the phone to when we check in, he awesome. It was my pleasure to meet him and the rest of staff.   Mohamed and the rest of the Valet guys were Great too.they are
Manager Response: Aloha Hawaii0613,  I'm very happy to hear that you found our location ideal and that our rooms met your family needs. I also appreciate your kind words and will definitely pass your comments to our parking staff. Thank you for staying with us and will definitely look forward to future visits while  you visit the Disneyland Resort.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We just got back from a five nights stay. We liked the location! It was great. However if you want any other amenities I would choose another hotel. It's just okay! Our room was clean but not perfect clean, my baby's knees and feet were filthy after crawling around on the floor, our bathroom had dark hair in the tub,we do not have dark hair. The breakfast is horrible and it's not even served until 7:30 and Disneyland opens at 8:00 so really there is no time for their horrible breakfast. While the location is good so are the other hotels in the area and we have stayed at others and have left being happier.
Manager Response: Hello Mbjcmj,  We appreciate you taking the time to complete a survey regarding your recent stay with us. On behalf of our entire staff here at the Desert Inn & Suite we apologize for the concerns you have about your experience at this hotel. We appreciate the feedback and will use it to fine tune our operations in the hope that upon your next visit, we can meet or exceed your expectations.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Just came back from a 3 night stay in the C2 suite and the room was perfect.  Beds were comfortable, we weren't bothered by any outside noises, the staff we saw around the hotel was always nice and friendly and the proximity to Disneyland is amazing.  It was easy for us to leave the park and rest up.  Only the Best Western and Park Vue are closer but the price of this hotel is really unbeatable.  We also like the setup of this room.  I was worried about the parking but once we parked we didn't have to move out cars.  Danny's is right next door and Ihop is close too. I highly recommend this hotel and we will definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Hi realgc,  We are glad that you find our hotel accommodating and that our rooms meet your needs. Thank you for recommending our hotel and will see you soon in the near future.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: This is our favorite place to stay when we visit Disneyland. It's in easy walking distance, just across the street from the entrance. The free breakfast is a time and money saver. The rooms are also large enough to hold our family of 7 comfortably.
Manager Response: Hello szenz86,  I appreciate your feedback and I'm glad that you have chosen the Desert Inn as your home away from home when you visit the Disneyland Resort. Thank you again and we'll see you in the near future.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Our second stay was just as pleasant as the first. Our beds were a little less firm than last time (a complaint of some people) so they might have just loosened up over the course of a year. We stayed further back this time, back in the courtyard. It was really pretty back there and it was nice to be on the ground floor (avoiding the horrific elevator/stroller issue!) The maids did an amazing job yet again and were very respectful of our stuff. The valets were very quick and careful and always said hi when we walked by.  Don't be afraid of the parking, I was super terrified the first time but it was great, this time was just as wonderful.   Only complaint...the hot tub. It was like luke warm bath water and DIRTY. *gag* Don't bother with the hot tub!   Location beats all, stay
Manager Response: Hi lunacherubim,  Thank you for your loyal patronage, your continued business says that we are doing a great job. I know that we had an issue with the pool at one occasion, however we did resolve it in a timely manner. Again, thank you for your kind words and we'll see you in the near future.  Teo  Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary Heading: Good place, not great, but good.
Summary: Good stuff, location location location, price, cleanliness.  Beds were ok, check in was smooth and people were friendly.  Not good stuff, wifi(don't bother), breakfast(don't bother) parking(very glad we didn't have a car).  Overall I would stay there again for the location and price.  It probably deserves three and a half stars because of those two things alone.  Nice little store behind check in. Water and a few snacks. Stayed in a parlor suite, 4 beds two rooms 1 and half baths.
Manager Response: Hello Scott J,  Thank you for your review,we are happy that your stay was good, although our mission is to turn stays into great stays. We are not perfect but we work very hard at providing great customer service and a clean and comfortable place to stay. We will use your feedback to fine tune our operations in the hope that upon your next visit, we can meet or exceed your expectations.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We stayed at the Anaheim Desert Inn and Suites for 3 nights. The rooms were clean. The staff was friendly. We were within walking distance of Disneyland. This would have been the perfect place to stay if it were not for the screaming kid in the room next to ours. The first night we did not call security. After all we were at Disneyland. We did tell the front desk in the morning that the screaming kid kept us up until 2:00 AM. The second night we called security about 1:00 AM, we had enough of this kid. The noise stopped no too long after we call. The third night the kid was still screaming. Security promised that they would make the people leave if they received another report. We left so we do not know if the kid quit screaming or not.
Manager Response: Hello Brian C,  We appreciate you taking the time to complete a survey regarding your recent stay with us. On behalf of our entire staff here at the Desert Inn & Suites we apologize for the concerns you have about your experience at this hotel. Although a screaming kid is something that we cannot control, we do our best to try and minimize noise levels when it's reported to us. Thank you for staying with us, it was our pleasure to be of service and we look forward to future visits.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights in May. The rooms were large and clean. Not a lot of outside light where we were, so a little difficult to see when you are putting make up on. We had 2 issues that were fixed right away, 1. heater not working, replaced. 2. blow dryer not working, replaced. This happened in separate rooms. Front desk check in was great! Valet, Great!! Cannot say enough how great Valet was. We did not have breakfast or use pool/hot tub. Will stay again, hopefully soon! You cannot beat the price, especially being so close to Disneyland, easy trip back to hotel for breaks. Manager: Please say thank you to Valet again for us! Our truck was parked at their station and they were so kind and professional!!
Manager Response: Hello Carrie C,  Thank you for giving us such high marks all across the board, I'm happy to hear that you had a memorable stay with us. I will gladly pass your comments on to our valet staff. We appreciate you staying with us and sure hope that this will be one our of many stays to come.   All the best,  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager

Summary: We had an excellent time at your hotel.  We will definitely stay there again.  The beds were comfortable and the location was great, we loved being able to walk straight to Disneyland each day.  And the price was unbeatable for the comfort and location.  Thanks for making this trip great.
Manager Response: Hello Megan V,  Thank you for your review, I am very happy to hear that you had an excellent stay and that you loved our beds and our convenient location. Again, thank you on behalf of our entire staff and we hope to see you back at the Desert Inn in the near future.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager

Summary: When we go back to Disneyland, we willl be staying here again.  We have tried many different hotels "across the street" from Disneyland, but this is the best and will never go anywhere else again.  The rooms are nice and the breakfast is decent, but the location is worth every penny!
Manager Response: Hello val2323,  I appreciate your outstanding review, I am glad that you found our location ideal and that you had a great time while you stayed at the Desert Inn. Thank you for your pledged loyalty and we will do our best to make every stay enjoyable for you and your family.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Desert Inn & Suites

Summary: Most of the other reviewers have already said what I would say!  Our room was a value both in price and location.  I wouldn't consider staying anywhere else.  As a WDW vet the very idea of walking to the main gate was foreign to me but it was sooo nice to not have to rely on transportation other than my feet!  We didn't hear any noise and the room was spotless.  I would say to folks who are arriving early they will hold your bag but they also have a bank of lockers near the pool and they are only a $1.00 (the small Disney lockers were $7.00).  I liked the idea of my stuff locked up versus in an office somewhere off the front desk.  Staff was super friendly.  I cannot wait to go back!
Manager Response: Hello Thiabelle,  Thanks a million for the Super Review that you have given the Desert Inn, we are ecstatic to hear we exceeded your expectations and that you found our location ideal. Our lockers are definitely of great assistance when you need to have luggage or valuables stored while you wait for your room or after you checkout. Thank you for your review and we cannot wait to have you back at the Desert Inn & Suites.  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: We stayed for six nights at the end of February.  The location was perfect, we didn't use the car once during our stay.  Walking distance to Disney parks and local restaurants.  Our rooms (we got the largest suite for our large family) were wonderful, clean, fresh, comfortable and perfectly furnished.  The housekeeping services were excellent each day.  We did not try the breakfast as we went elsewhere with our large group.  Reasonably priced items in the gift shop.  The pool was open late enough to use after going to the parks.  We enjoyed watching fireworks from the rooftop patio.  Very fairly priced.
Manager Response: Thank you adair_j99,  I appreciate the high marks you have given us on this fabulous site, I will definitely share your remarks with our housekeeping staff as i'm sure they'll be happy to hear that their work is well appreciated. Nothing is more important to us than our relationship with our guests and I do hope that this will be one out of many stays.  Again, we thank you for your review and we cannot wait for your next stay!  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager Anaheim Desert Inn

Summary: Probably the best location outside of the park--Just a 5 minute walk to the entrance of Disney and DCA.  Plenty of eating options within a 10 minute walk.   Rooms and bathrooms are immaculate, beds very comfortable.  Very good value for the money.  Roof top terrace is an excellent spot for watching the firework displays from the park if your little ones are tired from a full day. Pool is located indoors and is ok. The adjacent bathrooms were being remodeled during our stay. Continental breakfast unremarkable. Would stay here again.
Manager Response: Hello Jeannie C,  Thank you for the high marks that you've given the Desert Inn, we pride ourselves on great customer service and as evidenced by most of our reviews we do offer fantastic accommodations, service and rates. It was our pleasure to be of service and we look forward to future visits.

Summary Heading: Warning! Your chrome Mickey ears sticker will disapear!
Summary: Great place to stay, so close to Disneyland entrance. Friendly staff. However if you have a chrome Mickey ears sticker..beware. I parked in the underground parking and my Mickey ears were stolen between 7am and 5pm. When I stayed here before about a year and a half ago, my first chrome Mickey ears were stolen overnight (underground parking too). When  I reported the incident (both times) the staff reaction was "wow". Very sad.
Manager Response: Hello M_WD13,  Thank you for taking the time to review the Desert Inn, we apologize that your stay was anything less than great. We will use your review to help us provide a better experience for our future guests. I'm sorry to hear about your Chrome Mickey Mouse Ears, we have never had incidents like this in our property and I will personally look into this matter. Your patronage is valued here at the Desert Inn and I would love the opportunity to make a more memorable experience upon your next visit.

Summary: We booked a family parlor suite.  It had 3 separate rooms and was on the 3rd floor.  The rooms were worn and needed updating, but they were clean and a good value at $149 a night.  The beds for comfortable.  Only soap and shampoo were provided in the rooms. We had a great view from our room of the fire works.  The breakfast was okay (stale cereal), but the danishes were good and it's nice to have the option of a free breakfast - although I wished they opened before 7:30 on days the park opens at 8am.  The staff were friendly - front desk, maintenance and house keeping  The wi-fi needed improvement. We didn't use the pool but it looked small and there were always people using it.  We were advised not to use one of the elevators because people kept getting stuck in it.  Parking
Manager Response: Hello Ginger S,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review and we appreciate your high marks on regards to value and location. I apologize that we are lacking in other areas and will definitely look into those issues so that upon your next visit we'll meet your expectations.   All The Best,  Teo Huerta Front Office Manager

Summary: Just got back from a 5 night stay at this hotel.  Location cannot be beat, it is located almost directly across from the entrance to Disneyland.  Check-in was a breeze.  We arrived at noon, and our room was ready for us, which was great since check-in was supposed to be 3pm.  We stayed in a C2 Parlor Family Suite Room #307 because our group was 9 family members travelling together.  It was good to have a separate bedroom with a door so that we could put the younger children to bed earlier and still stay up and visit.  Two bathrooms were very handy as well.  Very clean and the room had been recently renovated.  We never stayed in the park to watch the fireworks, because the parks were crazy busy at night, so the rooftop deck was awesome to have.  There was a problem with the pool
Manager Response: Hello h00ked0nvegas,  Thank you for giving us such high marks in value, rooms, and cleanliness. I apologize for the pool inconvenience and I'm glad that we resolved this issue in a timely manner, I'm also glad that you found our location very convenient as we are located at the main gate of Disneyland.  Our team has high expectations to provide quality service and value and this goes to show that we are in the right path, I again thank you for your review and can't wait to see you in the near future.

Summary Heading: GREAT location for walking to Disneyland!
Summary: We stayed here based on the good reviews for this hotel and also because of it's estimated walking distance to Disneyland.  Some people said five minutes, some said ten minutes, some said twenty minutes.  We are a couple in our mid-20's, and even staying all the way at the back of the hotel property it only took us five minutes to get from our hotel room door to the Disneyland gates.  Based on this alone, I give it five stars.  It saved us time, money, and the aggravation of riding a shared resort bus to get to the parks each day.  Downtown Disney is located here as well, in the same location as the two parks.  We loved being able to easily walk to the Disney resort area in the morning and then at the end of a long day at the parks walk back with limited distance and no wait.
Manager Response: Hello peppermintblood,  We appreciate you taking the time to post this awesome review, guest noise is indeed something that we cannot control, however we do try to minimize it as much as possible.  Thank you for staying with us and we hope that this is one out of many future stays.

Summary: There were 10 of us that traveled to Disneyland last week from Texas and we could NOT have been happier with our stay.  Staff was friendly, room was spotless and hotel was very quiet...despite the fact that it is a Disney destination hotel.  We didn't have the problems others did with thin walls at all!  Beds were pretty firm, but we were happy with that.  The only issue is parking...but if the lots were full, they would valet with no additional charges.  GREAT value for the price!
Manager Response: Hello Jamie A,  I'm glad to hear that our hotel met your expectations and that you had a perfect stay. Our entire staff thanks you for staying with us and for taking the time to write this review. We hope that you'll continue to stay with us and we'll work hard to make each and every one of those stays perfect as well.

Summary Heading: Best Good Neighbor Hotel for price and location!
Summary: I've stayed at the Desert Inn and Suites 4 times now and each time gives me another good reason to come back.   Location wise, this hotel is as close as walking to one of the 3 Disney Hotels. It takes maybe 5 minutes once you've left the park.   It's also surrounded by a Denny's and ihop if you're searching for a cheaper breakfast location. Not to mention plenty of other restaurants within a 2 minute walk.  Price wise, I can typically get a 2 Queen for around $79 a night. That's a great deal considering its location. The rooms are very standard, nothing special. They do the trick for those people who just go, go, go at Disneyland. Plus if you need a nap or rest mid day, walk 7-8 min and you're at your hotel room.  The service here has always been good. The one thing I've always
Manager Response: Hello DeanGibbons,  I want to personally thank you for your continued business and I'm happy to hear that our service keeps you coming back. We are always striving for excellence and reviews like yours tell me that we are in the right path. I again thank you and hope that you'll keep coming back to us for the years to come.

Summary: Hi all i would like to start of with that we checked in on the 3rd of May till the 7th of May. We stayed in room 509 top floor front end of the hotel. It was nice and quiet and so so so close to Disneyland Resort that you could almost roll out of bed and you're there. Now for us in room 509 we had instant hot water was so awesome so i don't know why others are saying they had issues with their water. The room with the spa which cost a little extra was so worth it after being on your feet all day and night at Disneyland Resort. The free breakfast was ok for some juice milk and rolls. I would have liked to see some eggs but good thing we had Denny's and IHOP next door on either side :). For dinner I recommend going to Outback Steak House (yummy!), which is right down the street.
Manager Response: Hello Bret F,  I appreciate you feedback, it makes our staff feel proud of the quality of service that we offer. We are not a fancy hotel, but we do provide excellent customer service. A big thank you on behalf of the entire Desert Inn Staff and we'll see you soon.

Summary: The location of this hotel is perfect- right across from the entrance to the park! And the rooms are absolutely spotlessly clean. However, among the less pleasant parts of our stay were the fact that the beds were incredibly uncomfortable; the walls are very thin- you could hear a different baby crying every night from various directions; and the breakfast is appallingly bad. Watching a staff person dump a tray of costco pastries onto a tray in front of you? Really not appetizing. If all you want is a place to put your body after an exhausting day at Disney, you cant beat the location, but I can't particularly rave about its comfort level.
Manager Response: Hi deb r,  We appreciate you taking the time to complete a survey regarding your recent stay with us. On behalf of our entire staff here at the Desert Inn & Suite we apologize for the concerns you have about your experience at this hotel. We have received multiple compliments about our beds and we've had guests purchase the same bed because of its comfort, however we do understand that everybody is different. Should you decide to stay with us again, we would take that opportunity to be of better service to you and your family.

Summary Heading: Internet Did not Work in Guest Room
Summary: There are so many things that I loved about this hotel.  It was clean and close to Disneyland.  We had a parlor A suite with spa.  I was not bothered by any outside noise.  The spa is a very large jetted bathtub.  Our party of 2 adults and 2 small kids fit just fine in the tub, and it was nice way to relax after the park.  However, the wireless internet did not work at all from our room on the 5th floor.  We called the front desk several times, and were told that they would "look into it"  or "reset it" but I felt that our complaints were largely ignored.  I needed to be able to get some work done after my kids went to sleep, but I obviously can't leave 2 sleeping children in a hotel room and go downstairs to the lobby to use the Internet.  We offered to even change rooms if the
Manager Response: Hello Sara J,  Thank you for taking the time to review the Desert Inn, I apologize that your stay was anything less than great and I will personally look into this issue, we will use your review to help us provide a better experience for our future guests. Thank you and I sure hope that you would give us another opportunity to serve you.

Summary: Clean, comfortable, and, most importantly, close to the entrance of DLR.  It is not a 4 star resort, but for the price it is beyond compare.  The pool and the continental breakfast are not much, but the price more than makes up for that.  (and who wants to pay for a nice pool when you are that close to Disneyland?)  Other reviewers have complained about the beds, but I think they are very comfortable. -This is not our first stay and we have never had a complaint about the beds.  Maybe they are firmer than average, I'm really not sure why others thought they are anything less than perfect.  One sink is a little cramped when you have 4 in a room.
Manager Response: Hello Deby W,  Thank you for your review. We are happy that your stay was great and that you have made our hotel your home away from home. We are not perfect but we work very hard at providing great customer service and a clean and comfortable place to stay. Thank you for your patronage and we hope to see you soon.

Summary: we just got back from our 11 days/nights stay at this hotel.  I must say that the service was top-notch, the location to Disney couldn't have been better and they were very accommodating.  We asked for a nice quiet corner somewhere on the top floor and we got just that as we heard nothing outside the room. the room was very simply decorated but who cares?! everything was there that we needed and everything worked as it should have. my only knock on the place is there needed to be a towel rack by the tub/shower (it was over the toilet at the other end of the room) and there needed to be a couple more power outlets to accommodate all of our electronics.  but, those were VERY minor knocks. I WILL be staying here again!!  Thank you all Desert Inn staff, you were awesome!
Manager Response: Hello TNT_9,  We appreciate you taking the time to complete this survey regarding your recent stay with us and we hope that this is the first out of many stays. At the Desert Inn, we try to accommodate all of our guests requests knowing that this will make your stay even more tremendous. Thank you and we look forward to many more awesome Disney Vacations.

Summary: My wife and I were very happy with this hotel great location 5 min walk to the entrance of DL ,very clean,room's were good size compared to other hotels I've visited in the same area,staff and parking attendants were very nice and helpful! There's an indoor heated pool and they offer free continental breakfast parking lot is small but if they run out of parking they will valet it for free!There's also restaurant's open 24 hour's a day right next door(IHOP and Denny's)! The only bad thing is they wont let you check in early not even for a fee!
Manager Response: Hi joshkamalo,  A big thank you to you and your family for staying with us while visiting the Happiest Place on Earth. Due to our location an early check-in is not possible most of the time due to our staff always making sure that all rooms cleaned and serviced to meet our standards, it was our pleasure to be of service and we look forward to future visits.

Summary: We stayed at the Anaheim Desert Inn and Suites April 23rd and 24th. My sister and I came for a two day visit to the Disney parks. We have stayed at this hotel before (in one of their suites) and had a great experience so decided to stay here again.  We had a Deluxe room with 2 Queen beds and it was spacious and clean. The beds were very comfortable and we didn't notice outside noise at all.  The staff is wonderful and always willing to help with anything we would ask of them. Will always try this hotel first when planning a Disney vacation...
Manager Response: Hello KerrySpokaneValley,  It is a great honor that we are your first choice when making Disney Vacation plans and appreciate your kind words. We work hard to provide a home away from home to all of our guests, we are happy that you are pleased with our accommodations and service. Thank you for being a loyal customer and see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Great location for Disneyland and nice place to stay.
Summary: I read reviews before booking this hotel.  We went to Disneyland for my Grandson's 5th birthday.  The employees were very nicel  The facility is old but so is the Disney Hotel.  Had 4th floor towards front of hotel.  Only real noise was when people were returning after Disneyland closed. The breakfast they have was great.  They had cereal, toast, danish, coffee etc.  I will stay here again.  Thanks for a good visit!
Manager Response: Hi Diane H,  I'm glad that you found our hotel to your satisfaction and that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you and I sure hope that you'll stay with us so that we can make your Disney Vacations memorable.

Summary Heading: Our favorite hotel within walking distance of Disneyland
Summary: I am definitely conflicted as I write this review...we regularly stay at this hotel on our family trips to Disneyland, and it can sometimes be difficult to get a reservation.  I don't want to speak too highly of them, for fear that even MORE people will want to stay at the Desert Inn, thus making it more difficult on myself in the future.  I will simply say this: - One of the closest hotels to the Disneyland main entrance. - Rooms are spacious.  GREAT for large families or groups.   - Beds are just OK.  Not horrible, but definitely not pillow-top. - Good value, price. - Some of the rooms on lower floors, or near the stairs, can be very noisy with people coming and going from Disneyland...both early and late - Don't count on their "continental breakfast" to tide you over, unless
Manager Response: Hello RocketWest,  I thank you for your kind review of the Desert Inn & Suites and appreciate your continuous patronage. We are by far perfect but we do try to constantly improve. A big thank you on behalf of the entire staff of Desert Inn and we will see you in the near future.

Summary: If you're reading this review, then chances are you're looking to take a trip to Disneyland. I just got back from taking my family for a couple days and we stayed at the Desert Inn and Suites. This property is located right across the street from the main entrance, which was ideal. This was our 3rd trip to DL in the past few years and we've stayed at a different hotel each time. All 3 hotels have actually been nice, but we chose this one this time for the prime location.   The hotel is nice, not the fanciest but not a dive either. Everyone of the staff that we encountered was friendly and helpful. We stayed in a Parlor Suite, and the room was average, but we were able to see the Disneyland Fireworks from our window (they have a viewing deck as well). Parking is very limited for
Manager Response: Hello mswguitar,  Thank you for your feedback, i'm happy to hear that our hotel met your expectations. We understand that our breakfast room can get a little crowded at time and this is why we are expanding our square footage and addting more sitting space, thank you for choosing us and we llook forward to be of service again in the near future

Summary: Our stay in Anaheim was very pleasant and it was in great part thanks to the benefits of staying at DI&S hotel. The room was very nice and spacious, the front desk employees very friendly and helpful and in general the hotel is an excellent value for visiting Disneyland Resort. Great location. I think for the price it can't be beat
Manager Response: Hello Alejandro V,  Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback about your recent stay with us. We'll share your kind words to our front desk and with the rest our our staff as well. Thank you for your patronage and we hope to see you in the near future.

Summary: This hotel couldn't be in a better spot.  You literally walk across the street to Disneyland.  Our stay was comfortable, clean and hospitality was helpful.  We booked the largest suite for 8 adults and 4 children.  They gave us 2 parking spots (with a small parking charge, just plan for that).  Based on other reviews I had read, it sounded like the continental breakfast wasn't the greatest so I got some bagels, muffins  to eat in our room as we got ready.  Hubby would run down with some of the older kids each morning and bring us back crescents while the rest of us were getting ready.  One couple slept on the pull out couch bed and said it was extremely uncomfortable.  We put kids on that bed the next night & they seemed to do fine.  We planned our vacation the 3rd week of
Manager Response: Hi Brooke M,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that our suites fitted your needs and your expectations, we hope to see you when you again come back to the Disneyland Resort.

Summary: This was our second stay here.  We enjoyed it - it is comfortable and very close to Disneyland.  We were able to get the spa room upgrade for $10 more at check in and it was a nice amenity.  We would definitely stay here again and have recommended it to our friends and family who are looking for a good value hotel for Disneyland trips, especially for larger sized groups or families who would like to share a room or suite together.
Manager Response: Hello Chereya,  Thank you for staying with us for the second time, It is of great satisfaction to hear great comments like yours sure hope that you'll continue to stay with us for years to come.

Summary Heading: Very pleased. Large clean rooms. Location and price can't be beat.
Summary: We had a "B" Family Suite. Which is 2 adjoining rooms priced as one. We had 4 queen beds, 2 TVs, 2 full bathrooms, 2 microwaves, and 2 small refrigerators.  Looking at the room layout, I assumed that the rooms had previously been adjoining rooms, but had been remodeled into a Suite. I was expecting a single room number and a regular door between the rooms. Not because anyone had led me to believe that, it was just an assumption on my part. But, that wasn't the case. It's just adjoining rooms. Both rooms had a separate room number, each had it's own key cards, and the door between the rooms was the typical adjoining room doors where there are two doors and each can be locked from the inside, so both parties must unlock their doors to allow entry between the two sides. This didn't
Manager Response: Hello lsulindy,  Thank you for your review. We are happy that your stay was great and that our rooms met your standards.  We are not perfect but we work very hard at providing great customer service and a clean and comfortable place to stay. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: This Hotel is definately the place to stay if you are planning a trip to Disneyland!  We have stayed in several of the area hotels on previous trips but the Anaheim Desert Inn has been the best, hands down.  Courteous and knowledgable staff.  Great room rate that was less than other hotels in the area with a much larger room.   We are a family of 5 with three teenagers and the room "suite" style (2 room layout with sofa bed in front room) was perfect! The bathroom/shower was fabulous.  Sad we didn't have time to take advantage of the jacuzi tub!  We also were able to pay for an extra day of parking at a lower cost than other local lots.  That allowed us to enjoy the park on our second day without having to relocate our car. At the conclusion of our trip, the desk attendant
Manager Response: Hello George D,  We are glad that you had a great time while staying with us during your Disneyland Trip. A lot of our guets love our in-room jacuzzi tubs and are a real treat after a long day at Disney, it was our pleasure to be of service and we look forward to future visits.

Summary: What a great location! Just a few minutes walk to the front gates of Disney. The different floor plans offered make it easy whether you are a couple, small family, large family, or multiple families travelling together. Free continental breakfast was a great way to start the day and even offered hot oatmeal in addition to fresh fruit, cereal, juice, coffee, toast and Danish. When we arrived early, our room was not ready so we were given a different room with a slightly different floor plan which we were well compensated for.The suite (102) had a beautiful view of Disney Parks and a lot of floor space but only offered 1 private sleeping area and one large room with a sofa and 2 queens. Will definitely stay again.
Manager Response: Hello travelerAZ2,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to hear that suite 102 met your standards, it is a very unique suite and is normally given as an upgrade to our Parlor Family C2, 99% of our guests that stay there make it their favorite family suite for future stays. Thank you for being a loyal customer and see you again soon

Summary: What a great hotel for families!  With the option of lots of bedding configurations, this place is an oasis when travelling with children.  Our family of five stayed in a 2 bedroom suite which also had 2 bathrooms and a small kitchenette area.  We had our two girls sleep in one bedroom, our son was on a fold-out sofa bed in a sitting room and we had our own bedroom with sitting area.  It gave us all some much needed space near the end of a five week vacation sharing very small spaces. Breakfast was included in the tariff, available in a small kitchen area next to the indoor heated pool and spa. Situated opposite the main entrance to Disneyland, and surrounded by cheap (but not nasty) places to eat, the position of the hotel is fantastic.  Car parking is included, too. Perhaps
Manager Response: Hi Kuuipo08,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that you found a suite that met your comfort requirements. Please know that your compliments are well taken and will be shared with the entire staff. I'm glad that your stay was great and hope to see you when you again come back to the Disneyland Resort.

Summary: If location is what you want when you go to Disneyland...you cannot beat this place as fall as being close to the entrance where you can walk back and forth without relying on a shuttle or parking your park.  The rooms are spacious and average at best..but if you get the newer section in the back it might be quieter. To park your car might be an issue if you come and go with your car.  Plan it out if you think you might need to drive off property because you might not get a spot when you get back and have to valet the car. Breakfast is free but it will be crowded...cereals, toast, fruit and sweet rolls.  You are next store to a Dennys. Ihop and Tony Romas Ribs is a couple of doors down.  You will like the fact that you can walk to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Hi GolfDave123,  I appreciate your review about your recent stay at the Desert Inn and i thank you for giving us a chance to host your vacation while visiting the Disneyland Resort. We will be expanding our breakfast room area to add more sitting space so that it won't get as crowded in the future for our guest. Thank you, it was our pleasure to be of service and we look forward to future visits.

Summary: This location is perfect if you are planning on coming to Disneyland. When we can not get a room at the Disneyland hotel we stay here!! Our family are season passholders and we travel here quite often. Love the front desk staff! They are always willing to help. Not only do they have a great basic breakfast to get you started (fruit, cereal, pasteries, coffee, juice, milk) but the little shop has basically anything you need, don't let the size of the gift shop fool you...The rooms are nice, basic, and comfy. Showers are nice, water pressure perfect. Over all we love this place. And if you are handicap they accomadate your needs (my sister could charge the scooter we rented in the lobby) It was wonderful and we plan on going back again several times this year as well!!! Thank you
Manager Response: Hello Shelly M,  On behalf of our entire staff we would like to thank you for your kind words, we are delighted that our services and quality met all of your expectations. Thank you for taking the time to write a review on TripAdvisor and and hope to see you again when your travels bring you back to the area.

Summary: This was the second time we  have stayed here. The 1st time we never were in room and really didn't care to much but did have a lose of disney due to a failed safe in room which took them all day to open. It was just a place to sleep and right acrossed from disneyland that is why it gets a 2 star didn't learn our lesson. This time we had to have room change cause the sink smelt as if the sewer was backing up and the filter in the air conditioning was completely blocked with dirt. Next room the sink actually would not drain and was leaking. They actually asked if we wanted to wait till morning to get fixed (Terrible). They had to take the pipe off and it was backed with a solid buildup of sludge all the way to wall.... disgusting.  Breakfast... no breakfast just some treatsThe
Manager Response: Hello Krista D,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. I apologize that you didn’t find our hotel to be acceptable and that you had a less than satisfactory stay. We pride ourselves on great customer service and as evidenced by most of our reviews we do offer fantastic accommodations, service and rates.  If you have a moment and are willing to share any specifics on these items it would greatly increase my ability to better assess and attempt to remedy these concerns.  However, regardless of your response to my request I want to make sure that you feel your comments were heard and should you decide to stay with us again, we would take that opportunity to be of better service to you and your family.

Summary: The location is truly right across the street to Disneyland. Very easy walk to the park! Rooms are clean and basic - nothing fancy, but clean is quite nice. The breakfast room was perhaps why I didn't give this a 5-star...the room is tiny and crowded, and not enough seating. The food was fine (fruit, toast, cereal, pastries, coffee and juice), but the area to eat is a joke.We took our food all the way back to our room. Our kids loved the indoor pool and hot tub. Great pool hours - we even swam at 8:30am before checking out. Overall, great location, great prices and clean! We would stay here again for sure!
Manager Response: Hello Nodwas_10,  Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback and also wanted to let you know that we are expanding our breakfast area and additing more sitting space so. I'm glad that you enjoyed and took advantage of our indoor pool and spa. We all thank you for staying with us and hope to see you back in the near future.

Summary: This hotel is bare bones simple. There are no bells or whistles (or artwork on the walls in our room weirdly enough). But it is clean and the location is the closest you can get to Disneyland off-property. Considering that we spent two hours awake in the room during a three night stay, we did not want to spend a lot for a place to sleep and shower (great water pressure btw). Pool area looked small to me, especially crowded with people. We did not eat the included breakfast because it started too late and seemed very crowded as well.
Manager Response: Hello jillsousa,  Thank you for your feedback, it was our pleasure to be of service and we look forward to future visits. Thank you for staying with us and have a great day.

Summary: We go to Disneyland several times a year and like to stay at different hotels on South Harbor Blvd. This one was very close to Disneyland and very pleasant. It was a 4-5 Min walk to Disneyland. You get a discount at Denny's (located in the hotel parking lot) and the hotel staff was very efficient and courteous. Parking was fine (if you find a spot in time). The breakfast room was SO crowded we never really made it inside... it is normal pastries and cereal... pool was indoors, it was humid and loud; but nice and warm. It was nice having the extra sofa area in the room for parking our stroller and keeping our luggage. We also had a Jacuzzi tub which was great to get off our soar feet. Overall nothing to complain about.
Manager Response: Hello Brodysmama,  We appreciate you taking the time to complete a survey regarding your recent stay with us. On behalf of our entire staff here at the Desert Inn & Suite we thank you for your kind words and hope to see you in the near future while visiting the Disneyland Resort.

Summary: The best part of the motel is it's directly across from Disneyland. The rooms are clean and it is full of families, but not a problem as it is "across from Disneyland". The pool could be larger as it gets very busy in the afternoon. The best part is you can take a break in the middle of your Disneyland adventure.
Manager Response: Hello Chevydad,  I'm glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay at the Desert Inn while you visited the Happiest Place on Earth. I thank you for giving us a chance to host your vacation and surely hope that you will stay with us on your next trip to Anaheim.

Summary: The location is second to none, and the front desk staff are always very helpful. It is great to watch the fireworks from the roof top viewing deck. I really like that they added oatmeal to the breakfast.
Manager Response: Hello lowsushi,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and hope to see you when you again come back to the Disneyland Resort.

Summary Heading: Always a Consistently Great Place for Our Disney Adventures
Summary: We've stayed here for many years.  Can't beat the location.  Even when we stayed at Paradise Pier one year-the walk was just too far when you're tired.  This location is so ideal too b/c you have IHOP, Denny's, Tony Roma's, etc. as other food options.  Tony Romas was great service and quick for us as well as loved the food.  Hands down can't beat the location.  Service is great when you arrive they take care of you as well as cleaning.  I think it helped that when we left our room, we put the ready for cleaning sign on b/c we when came back like around 12 our room was already cleaned.  Whereas other rooms we saw were still being serviced.  This just made our return trip to rest up for more Disney at night easier.  I think they have the best room rates if you plan. We've stayed
Manager Response: Hello stargazer668,  I'm glad that you have enjoyed staying at the Desert Inn throughout the years, our entire staff appreciates you for making our hotel your home away from home. We are not perfect but we work very hard at providing great customer service and a clean and comfortable place to stay.
