Summary: This is a very heavily used property and as such, I was very impressed with the courtesy, cleanliness and overall room experience.  Spring Break is extraordinarily busy and one must remember that the staff is working at full tilt.  This is my family's second visit here.  The room was exceptionally clean, the beds were very comfortable and the small fridge and microwave is a great service.  I booked the Parlour A suite which has an small additional t.v. room with a pull-out sofa bed; this is worth its weight in gold for a teenager.   It also allowed us to stretch out a bit more, provided an extra dresser and allowed for us to bring up our breakfast trays.  Maid service was impeccable.  We did not have any issues with hot water and with the spa option, the massive shower was a
Manager Response: Hello Moms-The-Word,  Thank you so much for your kind words. We work hard to provide a home away from home to all of our guests and it fills us with joy to hear that you enjoyed our hotel and that we met all of your expectations. Thank you for being a loyal customer and see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, very close to Disneyland
Summary: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel while we visited Disneyland. We stayed in the two adjoining rooms which slept 4 adults and 5 children very well. The breakfast was nice. It was great to have something before we went to the park each morning. The location is awesome. With five small children, I didn't want to be very far from the main entrance. The walk to the main gate was very short. Great value for this hotel. We couldn't have been happier.
Manager Response: Hello Baicrce,  I'm glad that you enjoyed your stayat the Desert Inn while visiting The Happiest Place on Earth. Our Family Suites are some of our most popular suites for big families due to their size and ammenities. We invite you to return to our hotel and let us make any future stays memorable to you and your family.

Summary Heading: CLEAN!! Great Value!  Unbeatable location for Disneyland Resort
Summary: My wife and I just stayed here this week and were very satisfied with our room. The most important thing for us is a clean bathroom, and this one was, with one exception. On the second night, I noticed a strange noise coming from the bathroom, which turned out to be the bathtub drain backing up and water flowing into the tub from the drain, along with some black gunk and hair. My wife was totally grossed out and fortunately, we had already showered for the night. The tub backed up for about ten minutes, so my guess is that the occupants in the room above us had filled their tub and were draining it, which overwhlemed the drain trap in our tub. Otherwise the entire room was clean, and there were no bedbugs (we check everywhere we go). The bed was very firm, much firmer than we
Manager Response: Hello Erik W,  Thank you for giving us your feedback about your recent stay at the Desert Inn. As you know bed bugs could be a big problem for hotels with big flows of guest, however we keep very strick cleaning policies and bed bug prevention program so that our guest can have memorable experiences without bug issues. Our entire staff thanks you for your patronage and sure hope that you will return to our hotel on any future Disneyland trips.

Summary: No hot water for 3 days only to be told each time to keep it running and it will eventually get hot!  Never did.  Breakfast was disgusting and barely anything to choose from.  Wifi almost never worked.  Valet was only thing helpful.  Never again.  Stay next door at park vue inn - much better.
Manager Response: Hello Seb2503,  We appreciate you taking the time to complete a survey regarding your recent stay with us. On behalf of our entire staff here at the Desert Inn & Suite we apologize for the concerns you have about your experience at this hotel. Please contact me direclty as I would like to address your concerns personally to try and remedy your experience with us.

Summary: We stay here all the time and I have never had a complaint until now! We were stuck all the way in the back of the hotel like stepchildren , the beds are SO UNCOMFORTABLE and every morning it was the same cold shower deal......The room in itself was passable for myself and husband and 2 boys....but when the floor sounds more inticing then the bed I may have to rethink another future stay!!!!
Manager Response: Hello Marisa S,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. I apologize that you didn’t find our hotel to be acceptable and that you had a less than satisfactory stay. We pride ourselves on great customer service and as evidenced by most of our reviews we do offer fantastic accommodations, service and rates. Should you decide to stay with us again, we would take that opportunity to be of better service to you and your family.

Summary Heading: Best location for the best price!
Summary: Love the location and the price! We live an hour away but when we want to stay the night, we stay here. The staff is friendly and the rooms are perfect for a quick night stay or a long vacation. I look forward to staying here more often.
Manager Response: Hello katiealyse,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel, we are delighted to know that your stay was great and hope to see you when you again come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Please receive a  big thank you on behalf of the entire Desert Inn & Suites staff.

Summary: The location is unbeatable - across the street from the shuttle entrance so it's a quick walk right into the park.  That was the main reason we chose this hotel.  The other reason was the price - more affordable than the others along this road, especially with the suite we needed.  Our suite was basically 2 adjoining rooms.  The front desk staff was friendly.  When we checked in they had upgraded us to a bigger suite which we appreciated. The floor plans in the brochure make the rooms seem bigger than they are.  Space was tight around the beds with the fridge, TV, etc.  We had a little sitting room that the adults used after the kids went to bed. Wi-fi was a nice convenience though it was slow.  Continental breakfast was passable.  Pool was nice - I like indoor pools.  The hot
Manager Response: Hello rebatig,  Thank you for taking the time to review the Desert Inn, we apologize that your stay was anything less than great. We will use your review to help us further train our housekeeping staff to make sure this does not happen to any future guests. If you have a moment and are willing to share any specifics on these items it would greatly increase my ability to better assess and attempt to remedy these concerns.  However, regardless of your response to my request I want to make sure that you feel your comments were heard.

Summary Heading: Best place to stay near Disneyland
Summary: Once again the Desert Inn & Suites made our stay affordable, and comfortable. It is our place to stay when in Anaheim, close to shopping, restaurants, and of course Disneyland Resort. Best price and super service all around. Keep up the good work.
Manager Response: Hello Duane H,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and hope to see you when you again come back to the Disneyland Resort.

Summary: Very accommodating Inn got Disney tickets parked there they are across from Disney and California Adventure you walk right across the street really convenient we liked the closeness to everything it also had a great tv and wifi connection for the computer
Manager Response: Hello Lou O,  Thank you for taking the time to review our property during your rescent stay, it was a pleasure being of service to you and your family and we are glad that we met all your expectations. A big thank you from all of our staff and we hope to have you stay with us when you visit the Disneyland Resort in the future.

Summary Heading: Good economy hotel steps away from Disneyland Resort
Summary: If you are headed to Disneyland and want a decent hotel that won't break your budget, this is a great property.  We have stayed at all three Disneyland Resort Hotels as well as many of the "good neighbor" hotels and this one has some of the friendliest staff and is one of the best values.  This is a two-star hotel so there is nothing fancy.  We were upgraded to a Parlor Suite and the separate room was great for staying up when we wanted to get the kids to bed.  The property is like a 5-story motel with the entrance to your room from an exterior hallway.  It has a small indoor pool and they provide a modest continental breakfast with store-bought pastries and fruit.  It is an older property so you may encounter noise depending on who your neighbors are.  Our room was clean, the
Manager Response: Hello JuJuTraveler,  Thank you for your review. We are happy that your stay was great. We are not a five star hotel but we work very hard at providing great customer service and a clean and comfortable place to stay. We hope to see you soon.

Summary Heading: Super-friendly staff. Always a great stay!
Summary: We always stay here when visiting Disneyland. It's right across the street; just a short walk. Staff is always friendly and super accommodating. If you're looking for a clean, reasonably priced hotel close by, this is a great option!
Manager Response: Hello Tisha O,  Thank you for your kind words and for taking the time to write this review, we are delighted to know that your stay was great and that our hotel and services met all of your needs, we hope to see you when you again come back to the Disneyland Resort.

Summary: My family has stayed here before and this time was different. The beds are horribly uncomfortable. The water would not get hot for a shower. They put us next to a room that we could hear every single word spoke by them. It's currently 930 and I have a maintenance guy in my bathroom!!   Location can't be beat.  And the suites are perfect for us. And very well priced.
Manager Response: Hello Disneyland33,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. I apologize that you didn’t find our hotel to be acceptable and that you had a less than satisfactory stay. We pride ourselves on great customer service and as evidenced by most of our reviews we do offer fantastic accommodations, service and rates. Should you decide to stay with us again, we would take that opportunity to be of better service to you and your family.

Summary: The valet staff was very friendly and helpful. Easy check in and out process. Room clean. Great value and nice walking across the street to Disneyland. Over the past 13 years have stayed here 15+ times.
Manager Response: Hello Shazamsue,  Thank you so much for your kind words and for staying with us over the years, we work hard to provide a home away from home to all of our guests and it prides us to hear that our hard work is paying off. We again thank you for being a loyal customer and look forward to your next visit.

Summary Heading: Right across the road from Disneyland, free breakfast.
Summary: This has a perfect location.  We had the Family Parlour Suite - it was two very large bedrooms with an added on separate lounge area and two full bathrooms.   We were on the top floor right at the front of the building - it was very quiet considering we were on a main road right across the road from Disneyland.    The location is amazing and we had lots of room to spread out. Breakfast is included - it's fairly basic but was enough to get us started for the day. Besides you're right next door to many other food places if you are still hungry.  No need to have a car - we just walked everywhere. So handy to Disneyland - just walk across the road - we would walk in to Disney and then back to our room for a rest after lunch, then back to Disney a few hours later, then back to the
Manager Response: Hello Will_not_camp,  I'm glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and that our rooms and services met all  of your needs while visiting the Disneyland Resort.  A big thank you on behalf of all of our staff and we hope to have you stay with us when you come visit Disneyland in the future.

Summary Heading: Great budget lodging next to Disneyland entrance
Summary: It's all about location, and this motel is one of three that are exactly across the street from the Disneyland entrance gates. You can't get closer without being in the middle of Harbor Boulevard. Even with little kids, it's a five-minute walk to the park entrance. The rooms are not elaborate but are clean, well maintained and completely adequate. Beds and bedding and linens are all fine, the family suites have a little couch/TV room. Parking on site, for an extra $8 a day--cheaper AND closer than the Disneyland parking lots. We've been here many times, as well as the neighboring Best Westerns. I think you get a little more room for your money here, although all three are just fine.
Manager Response: Hello Kervis L,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and hope to see you when you again come back to the Disneyland Resort.

Summary Heading: Great Location. Great Hotel for families after long days at Disneyland
Summary: Like everyone says the location is the best in anaheim.  We would leave in the morning with just sweaters on and then we would send our teenage boys back to the room to get our coats after supper.  They would only be gone for 10 or 15 minutes.      Hotel is  not the fanciest but it is what you pay for and what you need when at Disneyland.  If you are expecting a 5 Star hotel don't book here, you are hardly in your room so all you need is a clean room and a nice shower at the end of the day which is what you get here. The room was very clean and always made up when we got back.  The pool is small but the kids used it 2 nights and seemed to have lots of fun. Everyone at the hotel seemed freindly, even the parking guys said hi to us every morning as we walked by them to breakfast.
Manager Response: Hello CarmenPAlberta,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and hope to see you when you again come back to the Disneyland Resort, also we did look into our internet issues and our internet is currently running at 100%, thank you and we'll see you in the near future.

Summary: This month we took a family/friends trip to Disneyland.  We spent three nights there.  Universal Studios, Disneyland, and California Adventure. The Desert Inn is literally across the street from Disneyland.  Fantastic location!   The only time we drove was to Universal Studios.  The hotel is very simple, don't expect any bells or whistles.  If you are simply looking for a place to sleep after long days at Disneyland, this is your place.  All you have to do is cross the street.  The rooms are clean.  The beds are a little hard.   The parking staff was fantastic.  They offer a continental breakfast...very simple and low quality.
Manager Response: Hello drewquinones,  Thank you for your review. We are happy that your stay was great. We are not perfect but we work very hard at providing great customer service and a clean and comfortable place to stay. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: This is my second review for the Desert Inn.  Last time, I wrote that while there were some problems, it was still worth the stay.  That was before five more visits in which they refused to honor their advertised "specials."  Im pretty sure its a scam.  They advertise for less than the other hotels on the strip, just to get you in the building, and then they tell you theres been some mistake and they cant honor it.  It doesnt matter if you reserve online or call & get a confirmation number, there will always be some reason why they have to charge you $20< than you were quoted.     The hotel itself is hit and miss.  Some days you'll get a decent room, and others you'll get a room with everything falling apart, rotting, dirty, and broken.  There is always a group of rude young men
Manager Response: Hello CPLnCAL,  Thank you for taking the time to review us. Please accept my sincere apologies for the inconveniences you experienced while a guest at our hotel. Our rates, just like everybodys' rates on the advertisements do flactuate on a day to day basis, however when you book a reservation you are guaranteed the rate that you booked at, please contact me directly so that we can discuss this further and see what the specific situation was, i would also like to hear from you regarding our parking attendants since we have gotten nothing but compliments from them from all of our guests since we started with the service. I again apologize for the inconvenience and hope to hear from you soon to clarify this matter.

Summary: Across the street from walkway to the parks making it easy to go back to the room in the afternoon to charge your phone and yourself. Good in room coffee, microwave and nice big fridge in room. Never did get the Internet to work in the room and the front desk told me that they would let the manager know but didn't offer to waive the resort fee or make up for it at all. Shower temperature was hard to regulate.
Manager Response: Hello Pam L,  I appreciate your feedback about your recent stay at the Desert Inn, while visiting the Disneyland Resort. We have recently upgraded our internet service through Time Warner so that we wouldn't have any internet problems but we'll have a profesional look into this matter so that this won't be an issue to future travelers. Should you decide to stay with us again, we would take that opportunity to be of better service to you and your family.

Summary: 9 nights at Anaheim Desert Inn and Suites. Our travelling group consisted of myself and 9 yr old son, my friend and her 7 yr old daughter. We had parlour suite C2 which consisted of 2 bedrooms with 2 queen beds in each, 2 bathrooms and a sitting room which fitted our needs perfectly. Linen was clean and housekeeping always did a great job. Our airconditioner was upgraded while we were there which was great as the old one was a bit noisy. Concierge were very helpfull. We didn't use WiFi much as we were out enjoying ourselves but was ok when used. The hotel was conveniently located to the Parks with only a 10 min walk to get there - great after a full day of fun.  Very close to restaurants too.  I am planned a trip back to Anaheim in 2014 and will definiately be staying here.
Manager Response: Hello TravelBug0809,  I appreciate your kind words and i thank you for taking the time to write a review about our hotel on TripAdvisor. It is of great honor that you have once again chosen us for your future home away from home while visiting the Disneyland Resort, we again thank you and will see you soon.

Summary: You can't beat their location unless you stay in the park itself. The price is reasonable and the staff was friendly, especially the evening valet service. The rooms were ok in the clean department - mostly just old and used. The bathroom was very old with visible water damage. In checking the beds for bed-bugs, it looked as if the mattress covers hadn't been cleaned in awhile and there were a few hairs that didn't belong to any of us which grossed me out. Washing the bedding should always include the mattress covers, blankets, and bed coverings. It was cold but using the dated heaters filled the room with an unpleasant odor. We stayed three nights and the first night we called for an extra blanket for the beds, we were only given one even though our room had three beds. Each
Manager Response: Hello T From Cali f,  Thank you for taking the time to review the Desert Inn, I apologize that your stay was anything less than great and will definetely use it to help us provide a better experience for our future guests. Thank you and I sure hope that you would give us another opportunity to serve you in the near future and meet your expectations.

Summary: We had no complaints. Everything went well. The place was clean. We stayed three nights. The location is perfect because it's right across the street from our destination. We liked the indoor pool for our five year old boy.
Manager Response: Hello Stephanie H,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and hope to see you again when you come back to the Disneyland Resort.

Summary Heading: The destination is across the street, this is where you sleep.
Summary: There is absolutely nothing special about this hotel.  Clean rooms.  Perfectly comfortable beds. Extremely standard continental breakfast spread in the morning.  But you can't get much closer to Disneyland without staying (and paying) on site.  In fact, I'd be willing to wager that this hotel is closer to the parks' main gates than the Disneyland Hotel itself.  We left in the morning at 8 am and came back around 11 pm.  What do you need in between?  Clean bathroom and shower.  Check.  Comfortable beds.  Check.  Someplace to keep your stuff.  Check.  And it's close enough that you can easily trek back to the room from the park mid-day if you need to put your feet up or if you forgot something.  We didn't avail ourselves of the pool.  There's a Denny's right next door if you need
Manager Response: Hello pdxhalls,  It sure makes us happy to hear that we have met all your needs, thank you for your kind words and we'll definetely enjoy having you with us again when you visit the Disneyland Resort.

Summary: We stayed 2 nights. We had booked a family suite (4 double beds in 2 large rooms) but on arrival were informed they had upgraded us to another family suite with an extra little entrance room containing a sofa bed and tv. This proved to be very handy, as whoever stayed up late or woke early could use this room without disturbing others, so I'm rating this slightly higher than I otherwise might have out of appreciation for this thoughtfulness. Rooms were large and comfortable. Although there's free wifi it was very very slow and we mostly gave up trying to use it. Location was brilliant as the entry to downtown Disney is across the road. Staff were reasonably helpful but did seem very busy. Breakfast was adequate but served in far too small a room.
Manager Response: Hell sydbunyip,  We do appreciate your feedback and look forward to be of service again in the near future when you visit the Disneyland Resort, thank you for choosing us.

Summary Heading: Good place to stay if you're not staying there.
Summary: Spent the holiday season at the Happiest Place in the World. This wasn't our first choice in hotels but it was all that was available that fit our criteria. The goal was to get an affordable hotel that could comfortably fit 5, within walking distance to Disneyland, and had a complimentary breakfast. Well the "mini-suite" did fit the five of us with room to spread out, but I didn't like the layout of the room. When you first enter the "suite" you are in a small front room with a sofa-sleeper, dresser, mini fridge, microwave and tv. If the sleeper is closed, then there was lots of room but once you open it up, it filled the entire room and you had to scoot around it. Step through that first room and you enter the main room with 2 double beds, a "closet area", desk, dresser and tv.
Manager Response: Hello Tundraguy808,  Thank you for taking the time to review us. We really value your feedback as It helps us look at the things we excel in and the areas that need improvement. Hope to be of service in the near future.

Summary: My family of four (my husband and I and our two little boys, ages 4 and 1.5) stayed for four nights and have no complaints... except maybe crappy coffee :) But we planned for that and brought some VIA.  *It was easily in our budget, with a AAA rate of around $70/night.  *It was CLOSE to the park; we were waiting to enter the park within 5-10 minutes.   *Quiet!  This may have been due to the fact that we were on the 5th (top) floor and were there in January.   *Free breakfast, which wasn't extremely impressive, but we made ourselves happy with instant oatmeal and fruit.  If something more substantial is needed, Denny's is right next door. *Large, clean rooms.  Our room had a separate "living room" from the bedroom which made it easy for my boys to have some room to play with the
Manager Response: Hello Cristen K,  I appreciate your comments and i'm sure glad that you enjoyed your stay with us while visiting the Disneyland Resort, i hope that you will stay with us again in the near future.

Summary Heading: Dont expect much - but its close to the Park
Summary: Well after much deliberation and reading reviews on Trip Advisor we decided to stay here for almost 2 weeks. We have stayed at quite a few hotels in this area - and being summer decided to go for one a bit closer to the park... Can i say that you get what you pay for. WHATS GOOD: The staff are reasonably polite, but dont expect anything else. Its Cheap and position to the park is directly opposite the park(great for little ones) You get a safe (which works). The rooms are clean and the beds are moderately comfortable (they dont sag, but are firm) and thats about where the quality stops. WHATS BAD: Staff dont attend to you other than at the front desk. The linen is cheap(but clean). Our phone didnt work at first and took 5 days to fix. The breakfast is poor quality (often stale
Manager Response: Hello Dave S,  On behalf of our entire staff, we apologize for the concerns you have about your experience at this hotel. We appreciate the feedback and will use it to fine tune our operations in the hope that upon your next visit, we can meet or exceed your expectations.

Summary: The rooms at this hotel are exactly as you see in the pictures, clean and functional with comfortable beds.  The best part about this hotel is the location it's is directly across the road from the Disneyland entry.
Manager Response: Hello  Scot W,  Thank you for your review, we appreciate your comments and sure hope to see you back in the near future.

Summary: We had no expectations for the hotel other than it was very close to Disneyland.  We were pleasantly surprised at how wonderful it turned out to be.  We arrived at the hotel right before Disneyland opened and parked our car immediately.  It was less than a five minute walk to the entrance to the park.  We returned to check in when the park closed at 8.  We were 5 and had a suite with 2 bedrooms, 2 baths and a little "sitting room"  There were three televisions.  The rooms were very clean and we were happy that the sink area was separate from the toilet.  With two teenage girls, this made everything much easier for us.  The beds were very comfortable and we were able to regulate the heat easily.  There was an inviting indoor pool which we didn't try.  As mentioned, the breakfast
Manager Response: Hello mizlibrarian,  On behalf of our entire staff we would like to thank you for your kind words and hope to see you again when your travels bring you back to the area.

Summary: We stayed here for the fifth or sixth time last week and the hotel consistently fits our needs. Don't go here, or any motel near Disneyland, with 4 star expectations. If that is what you need, pay much more for a much smaller room at the Grand CA. This hotel offers consistently good service, clean rooms and about the closest location to Disneyland you can get. Check in staff, parking attendants and maids are always friendly.   Draw backs: You will hear people outside the rooms in the morning, but we have stayed at many hotels in the area, and it is the same or less here.   Breakfast: Don't have too high expectations. It's good for what it is: Juice, toast, cereal, danish, fruit. We drive in, so we bring our own fruit and a few Via packs. The breakfast is free, so I consider it a
Manager Response: Hello MissingCabo,  Thank you for taking the time to review us. We really value your feedback. It helps us look at the things we excel in and the areas that need improvement. Hope to be of service in the near future.

Summary: We enjoyed our stay at the Anaheim Desert Inn and Suites.  It was so convenient for my family.  We will definitely stay there again.  The rooms were very clean.  Their continental breakfast is a little skimpy, but for a fast on the go breakfast it is fine.
Manager Response: Hello Kristina B,  Thank you for your feedback, it was our pleasure to be of service and we look forward to future visits.

Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights during the week for our two day Disney trip.  Positives- Great location steps from Disney entrance, rooms aren't spectacular but above par compared to a Motel 6 , no problems parking ($8 day), continental breakfast with danishes cereal fruit juice coffee, and heated indoor pool.  We stayed in the jr suite and it fit our family of 4 well.  I stayed at the HoJo last time and while the rooms were nicer, this location with decent rooms, (and cheaper), was better overall.   Negatives- there was some trash left in my room along with a screw driver that my 2 yr old found on the floor, and the beds are not comfortable, especially after walking around all day!
Manager Response: Hello lakeside83,  I appreciate your review, i apologize for the inconvenience you experienced while at our hotel, i have spoken to our housekeeping department about the importance of cleanliness of our rooms and they have promised to go the extra mile to ensure that this does not happen again. Thank you and i hope to see you at the Desert Inn in the near future.

Summary: An old style motel with average rooms, clean but tired. Very crowded, cars and people everywhere, fee for parking. Pool was full of kids. Tiny bathroom with sink in main room. Breakfast of toast & danish. Reasonably priced - Best for families with young kids who are spending several days at Disneyland. Friendly staff.
Manager Response: Hello Suzy557,   Thank you for your feedback, it was our pleasure to be of service and we look forward to future visits.

Summary: Just completed our third stay in 10 years at the Desert Inn. Great location; good value; helpful staff; clean rooms. Sure, the breakfast is limited, but "the coffee's hot and the toast is brown" (actually, the coffee is really good). If you want a propper nosh up, have a charater breakfast at D-land. There is every chance that my family will stay there again when we nect visit CA in 2015  Perth, Australia
Manager Response: Hello Mick S,  A thank you on behalf of everyone at the Desert Inn for staying with us for the last ten yes, it means so much to us that you keep coming back year after year and it is always a pleasure to have you at our hotel.

Summary: This is right at the gate. Indoor pool n hot tub was nice. We didn't use free breakfast but nice to know it was avail. Room is average. Old but pretty clean. Fridge and microwave a plus. They charge to park but I still got a fair rate $69, totaling $94 a night. We will return to this hotel. My other place to stay is lemon tree hotel but its quite a ways away and then u pay $15 to park at the park. I enjoy that place when I need a full kitchen. I've stayed at castle inn several times the rooms r disgusting stopped staying. Also stayed next door at del sol it was average. We stayed at dolphin cove several times paid a fortune and well worth it. But we prob wont stat there again. I like desert inn. Parking people r always nice and helpful. Front desk is good and checked us in
Manager Response: Hello Loganfamilyreviews,  Thank you for staying with us and giving us a try while visiting the Disneyland Resort, we appreciate your kind words and hope that you will make us your home away from home when travels bring you back.

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland but tired and rundown
Summary: If you are going to Disneyland the location is perfect - just across the road - but that's the only up side. Our room was old and tired. No sink in bathroom - it's just outside and doubles as your 'mini kitchen'. The drain smelled of sulphur. Hotel is full of excited kids and weary mums and dads. Breakfast is included but it's a challenge with a few hundred people trying to cram into six booths and use two toasters. Planned on staying three nights but left after one and moved to a nicer hotel away from the mayhem of 'the happiest place on earth'. Front desk staff were friendly and efficient and not the least bit surprised that we were leaving.
Manager Response: Hello Spider5,  Thank you for taking the time to review the Desert Inn, we apologize that your stay was anything less than great. We will use your review to help us provide a better experience for our future guests. Thank you and I sure hope that you would give us another opportunity to serve you in the future.

Summary: Short walking distance to Disneyland. The room was great. Nice warm showers before and after a long day. The beds were very comfy after a 15 hour day. There deck to view the Disneyland fire works from is wonderful.
Manager Response: Hello GTOGirl1967,  Thank you for your feedback, it was our pleasure to be of service and we look forward to future visits.

Summary: We stayed at this motel the second half of our stay at Disneyland since it was cheaper during the week.  The staff was friendly and held our bags before our check-in and after our check-out.  Although, apparently there are large locker rentals for a small fee.  The rooms were very spacious and we had just gotten the lowest priced room. They had a fridge and microwave (always a must with our family).  The kids had a lot of room to play in the room.  We went to the pool (looks much more different than in the picture), but nevertheless, it was a great swim, and indoors. Continental breakfast was sad.  It was typical, but the other motel we were at previously had waffles and hard boiled eggs and more cereal.  It was so nice to walk right across the street to the entrance.  There is
Manager Response: Hello tsig,  Thank you so much for your kind words. We work hard to provide a home away from home to all of our guests. Thank you for staying with us and we hope to see you again in the near future.

Summary: Our recent stay in the family parlor suite was great. (three couples and five children under 9) The accommodations suited us perfectly and the location was ideal. The walk from the hotel to Disneyland was quick and easy and there are a lot of restaurant choices within a very short walk. The room, with a total of 4 queen beds and a pull out couch, worked for us and having two bathrooms, three separated rooms, a mini fridge and microwave, and a great view of the fireworks from our window was ideal.  Staff were friendly and helpful and the rooms were well cleaned.  On the down side the pullout couch was not a comfortable bed but the regular beds were very comfortable.  The swimming pool did not look clean and is open to anyone walking by which did not make us feel secure with small
Manager Response: Hello destinationplanner,  We appreciate the feedback and will use it to fine tune our operations in the hope that upon your next visit, we can meet or exceed your expectations. We are not perfect but we work very hard at providing great customer service and a clean and comfortable place to stay. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: We have stayed here about five times in the last 15 years.  We have found it to be a very good value for it's location, practically across the street from Disney entrance.  It's not fancy, but it is comfortable and relatively inexpensive for the convenience of its location.  It has a rooftop deck where you can watch Disney's fireworks.  The included breakfast is weak, but IHOP and Denny's are adjacent.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had to stay an extra night's stay while on vacation and I called to book they said they had one room left. When I arrived I heard someone else being told the same thing and they charged hidden fees! We had to wait 3 hours to check in to the room and when we did it was horrible. The room had a foul odor and the bed felt like a rock. For the money they charge the room looked like a cell block not something you would expect for $179 a night! We will never stay here again and I caution anyone to. We stayed five nights at the Ramada just a block away and it was amazing! Think again before picking the Desert INN!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The service of the front desk was good they are helpful and response to our need promptly. The distance to disneyland was a really plus points as its within 5 mins walk. Its really value for money we will stay there again
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Perfect for families going to Disney
Summary: Location, location, location! We got the Family Parlor Suite, which was really two adjoining 2-room suites. This gave us 2 bedrooms each with 2 queens, 2 living rooms (door between them and bedrooms) with hideabed sofas, and two bathrooms. We checked in and got into our rooms just in time to see the Disney fireworks out our window.  The hotel is directly across the street from the maingate of the park. You cannot stay closer without staying on property in a Disney hotel. The rooms are mediocre, but if all you're looking for is a place to sleep near to the park, this is the place!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: The best neighboring hotel in the happiest place on earth!
Summary: Hello Anaheim Desert Inn and Suites. It was such a great experience to stay in your hotel. I never regret my last minute changes I made of choosing yours with other neighboring disney hotels. I never had a hard time in making reservation thru your online site, all the infos needed were written, what you see in the photos are exactly or way better than the actual room where we stayed. They hotel even emailed me a day before our arrival just to remind us of our reservation. On the day itself, since I note it down that we'll be arriving between 7-8pm and we missed the time, they even called us of our whereabouts, how thoughtful. And checking in without any fuss, it took us only 3mins to get a key of our room, parked our car with their valet service. And whats amazing about our
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: fantastic stay for the price you pay
Summary: we have stayed at this hotel a few times and have never had any problems. i was warned about the bed bug situation. I left the kids and husband and luggage in the lobby while i checked all the beds. they were remarkably clean. breakfast is horrible but digestable. kids love that they get to eat donuts for a week! pool was clean, hot tub was clean. i also used the laundry facilties. this hotel is the closest you will get to Disneyland without paying Disneyland prices. highly recommend it.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My friend and I come out to Disneyland quite a few times a year and always stay here. We love the fact that it is right across the street from Disneyland. For the most part we haven't had any major issues with Desert Inn. We have had little things we have had to deal with, such as air conditioner not working, but it was fixed very quickly. The people that work here are all very friendly and helpful. I would certainly recommend staying here. Thanks Debbie.....Disney Fan
Manager Response: none

Summary: Rooms have really deteriorated since we stayed there in 2009. Upon entering our room this time, we were hit with a heavy mildew smell that lasted our entire stay of 4 nights. My sister's room next door also smelled the same way. It is a very basic, simple room with cheap furnishings. Beds are on the hard side, pillows are a joke, more like a piece of lumpy foam. TV's ok. Nice to have a fridge and microwave. The bathroom is decent sized, plenty of towels. We were only in the room to sleep so it was tolerable, but it's the kind of place that you don't want your luggage, clothes, or anything else touching the floors or bedspreads because you can't trust how clean it is.  Laundry facility is ok, 4 washers and dryers at $2.00 each load. They do have underground parking as well as
Manager Response: none

Summary: Room was clean, comfortable and good value. We arrived early and the reception team looked after our suitcases for us until check-in. Service was efficient and friendly. We didn't have breakfast during our stay so can't comment on that. We booked through venere.com and got a good rate, just be aware that the hotel charges a resort fee (per person) and approx 17% tax on top of the rate that you get quoted - this added nearly $100 to our initial quote from venere.com. I was expecting this so wasn't surprised. The final rate was still competitive and good vale for money.  Being right across the road from disney was fantastic. We picked this hotel over the Anaheim Marriott for the same price and were glad we did! When you leave the park at midnight the last thing you want is a long
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland, but poor housekeeping & smoking allowed
Summary: This hotel has a great location with just a couple minutes walk to the entrance of Disneyland. However, during our stay there this month, we had several "clean" towels with long, black hairs on them. If this had occurred with just one towel, no problem, but it was several, day after day. Also, while this is supposed to be a completely non-smoking hotel, there were other guests who would smoke outside their rooms, which would cause our room to end up smelling like smoke because it comes in under the door. My kids and I are very sensitive to the smell of smoke, so the fact that this is allowed at this hotel will preclude us from staying there again. Finally, I would not have writtten this review if it weren't for the failure of the front-desk employee who checked us out to even
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our stay was great, looking forward to our next visit.  The room was always clean & well maintained.  TV's and bathroom has been remodeled. Will definitely stay at this resort again   Thank you and your staff.  Glenn 2012
Manager Response: Hi GlennL145,  On behalf of our entire staff we would like to thank you for your business and hope to see you again when your travels bring you back to the area.

Summary: I love the convenience of the hotel next to my favorite place:) Disneyland. I also love the attitude of two front desk staff aggy and Peter. Great customer service. If you stay in  this location ask for their help:)
Manager Response: Hello Disneyloving,  Thank you for choosing The Desert Inn, i shared kind words with Auggie and Peter and they expressed their gratitude. We strive to provide the best customer service possible and this is proof that we are going the right direction. We hope to see you soon and thank you for your review.

Summary Heading: Great Location - but there were bed bugs
Summary: The hotel is very conveniently located and the staff is helpful, but none of that compensates for the fact that room 528 was infested with bed bugs.  When we woke up the first morning, there were several bugs on both beds, as well as blood smear stains (old and new) on the sheets.  I now have well over 100 bug bites over my body.    When we told the hotel staff about the bugs, they let us check out immediately and didn't seem very surprised by our bed bug report.
Manager Response: Hello StacyC141,  We take all pest claims very seriously at our hotel. In any allegation, we will immediately take the room off the market and call a professional pest inspection service. They will come in and not only do a thorough cleaning and inspection of the room that was claimed to have a pest, but also any adjacent/connecting rooms, as well as the housekeeping equipment. We apologize for the inconvenience that you and your family experienced during your stay and wanted to let you know that we gave you 100% refund of your stay since mere apologies won't remedy the situation.  The threat of bed bugs in hotels is a very minor and isolated problem. The number of incidents of bed bugs affects only a minute percentage of hotels guest rooms. According to research, bed bugs are brought into hotels by guests—it is not a hotel sanitation issue. We will definetely fine tune our housekeeping detection procedures since a trained and knowledgeable housekeeping staff is one of the best lines of defense, along with having a good pest control provider if a problem were to be detected.

Summary: The room was good - clean & well maintained.  The A/C was noisy, not used to it but were very tired to be bothered in the nights. Breakfast was terrible - not much choice, small  area, sitting was limited, late timings. Plus points -  Location right across disneyland resort, saved us time and parking fee. Correctly priced room considering microwave & refrigerator were available.
Manager Response: Hello anud2012,  On behalf of our entire staff we would like to thank you for your business and hope to see you again when your travels bring you back to the area. We understand that our breakfast room could get a bit crowdy at times and that selection is limited, however in the near future we do plan to expand our breakfast room and also we we are gradually adding items to our breakfast selection.

Summary: The rooms are nothing to write home about, but they are fairly clean and well maintained. Bed was comfortable. One sink in a two double bed room which was a bit of an issue! The bathroom had some peeling paint but the tub and shower curtain were very clean. The hotel is literally a 3-5 minute walk to Disneyland and California Adventure so it's hard to complain about it, and it is a bit better priced than some of the other ones right nearby, and there is a wonderful Denny's next door for late dinners! Definitely better than the Del Sol next door! The staff were pleasant. What I would like to comment on is the Valet service. It is a separate company from the hotel, but the guys working there are amazing! So friendly and helpful and accommodating. Our van battery died while we were
Manager Response: Hello srvvrcrml,  Thank you for taking the time to review us. We really value your feedback. It helps us look at the things we excel in and the areas that need improvement. Hope to be of service in the near future.

Summary: I have been staying at the Desert Inn & Suites for several years now.  The location could not be better (literally a stones throw from the Disneyland main gate), and the rooms are clean comfortable, and surprisingly spacious.  I usually go with a group of young adults, so lots of gadgets to charge, and we always find plenty of outlets, I know how important that is these days!  The in door hot tub is also wonderful after a long day of walking the parks! I'll never stay anywhere else again when planning a Disneyland vacation!
Manager Response: Hello Ryan S,  Thank you for taking the time to give us and the rest of the TripAdvisor community some feedback about our hotel. We hope that we can be of service to you and your family on your next Disneyland Resort vacation.

Summary: I thought our stay was great.  We stayed in the back on the 3rd floor. The beds were not soft or to hard just right.  The room was clean, the pool was great so my daughter says and the hot tub was great for worn out parents.  Also, past reviews have talked about it being loud and I never noticed it.  The staff was nice and very helpful.  The breakfast was nothing special but it was at least something to start the day.  I was so grateful for how close it was to Disneyland, it made the walk at the end of the day nice and for breaks in the afternoon....The lockers to store our luggage was great since we arrived at 9am and then departed at 4pm….loved the roof top for watching the fireworks!!! Thanks Desert Inn if we return again we will stay here !!!
Manager Response: HI skiingfrog,  Thank YOU for giving us a chance to make your stay memorable. As always, it gives us great joy knowing that we are doing something right, in behalf of our entire staff we thank you.

Summary: Let me start by saying that if you are going to be going to Disneyland this is the hotel for you. It is so close to the Disneyland main gates. I would say that it is a shorter walk than using the Disney parking garage.  That being said, we found the hotel to be clean and the staff friendly. We stayed in a two room suite and it was fine for 5 adults. There was one small room up front with a sleeper sofa and the main room with two queen beds. The beds were very comfortable and clean. i loved the fact that the bathroom was stocked with enough towels everyday for five people. Every night when we got back for a long day at the park our room was thoroughly cleaned and smelled great.The only complaint that I had was that the only way to cool the front room was with a small fan mounted
Manager Response: Hello Brian C,  We love hearing comments like yours, thank you for appreciating and complementing everything that we offer to our guests. Glad that we are serving our purpose and hope to see you back at our hotel in a near future.

Summary: We never have to worry when we stay here!  Always so clean and roomy!  The staff is super friendly. Perfect location, across the street from Disneyland!  Been coming for 10 years and will come for 10 more.
Manager Response: Hello Traci R,  We appreciate your comments and thank you for always staying with us, we will continue to do our best to make every stay memorable.

Summary: If you have a discount voucher....do not stay here....they do not honor the voucher....and then they put you in the crappiest room in the whole hotel.....it was more like a broom closet!!!!! This was our last night of a fabulous 4 week road trip across 9 states....and it was the most expensive and the worst room we have had.....I look at the photos and I see a whole different hotel. Our room was a disgrace .....don't dare tell them you have a discount voucher....they do not honor them.....and they stick you in the most horrible room and still charge you the same as an awesome room.... It was a very disappointing last night of a fabulous vacation. The most basic Motel 6 was far better....and half the price. If they are not going to honor the discount voucher.....don't advertise
Manager Response: Hello Sandie56,  I apologize about the inconvenience, your probably came during inseason or when we had a convention, normally when we're inseason we do not honor the rate on the Ad but we do offer a discount instead. I hope that you can try us in the future, if you can give us a call and we can advice when we have the Ad rates available.

Summary: The location could not be better for a trip to Disneyland.  I really liked the updated interiors, (compared to others across the street) and I loved how clean it was!  I stayed on the lower level in the far end of the hotel with a nice tropical courtyard in-between the rooms.  It was a great value at $63 per night!  I highly recommend!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Desert Inn & Suites is a great hotel for a family going to Disneyland. They have a great hot breakfast every morning. They are close to the parks and the staff and rates are always great. I would recommend this hotel to any family on a budget.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Immediately opposite the main entrance to Disneyland. Room was comfortable with 2 queen beds. Lifts located at convenient location as mid rise building. Continental breakfast (included) was basic but sufficient to start thte day. Only issue was very poor wi-fi reception throughout the property.
Manager Response: Hello ranch100,  Thank you for your feedback, i apologize about the WiFi connectivity, we do have a secondary WiFi signal in our lobby that works everytime eventhough when Wifi is tested in the rooms we are able to get signal. Again, thank you and hope that you will visit us again in the future.

Summary: Stayed at the Desert Inn and Suites 4 nights in October with 3 sisters over 50 years old. I found the rooms to be clean and comfortable. We stayed in the Parlor suite with the sitting room and it was more than enough room for us.  The staff was extremely helpful with any request we had.  Will definitely stay here again! We are a Disney family and visit often. Only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was that the wifi was very weak and computer in lobby was always in use so it was difficult to get online for flight info.
Manager Response: Hi KerrySpokaneValley,  We appreciate your comments, our WiFi seems to be impacted when we have a big number of guests using it, however we do also have a secondary WiFi connection in our lobby as a back up. It is still strange to hear that our WiFi is having problems as we have upgraded our lines to accomodate all of our guest, but still we will look into the matter. Again, thank you and have a great day.

Summary: We stayed here for 15 nights in September and can not recommend it highly enough! We had a 2 room suite which was was very spacious and clean. Not once during our stay were we disturbed by any noise either from rooms next door or outside. Was very quiet and we slept great every night. Breakfast is basic but it is free and enough to get you going for the day. Includes toast, cereal, fruit, danishes, tea/coffee and juice which filled us up. If you want more you can easily pay for it elsewhere. Location cant be beat, right across from the Disneyland entrance, which make it great for coming back during the day for a rest. Staff were also wonderful and very helpful. Kids loved the pool, it is indoors which is a nice relief when it is really hot outside (as it was when we were there).
Manager Response: Hello SophieT1,  We appreciate your kind words and thank you for giving us a chance to make your stay memorable. Our pool is indeed a one of a kind around the Disneyland Resort and comes handy during our summer days. Thank you again and hope to have you stay with us in the future.

Summary: We had a great stay at Desert Inn! The receptionists were very friendly and helpful, and the rooms were always clean and tidy. We also love the affordable prices for a hotel right across the street from Disneyland! It's only a very short walk from the hotel to the park. We will be staying at Desert Inn in the future.
Manager Response: Thank you for rating our hotel, we thank you for staying with us and hope that you will continue to do so. We are glad that we have met your expectations and we'll see you soon.

Summary Heading: What a super base for Disney and other places
Summary: My family and I booked here for 17 nights whilst we visited Disneyland and other theme parks as well as Los Angeles area. It was great. A super two room suite with a large family sized fridge and very comfortable beds in both rooms as well as a TV in both rooms which kept the kids queit and gave us some 'down time'. Air Conditioning was very effective, we needed it as it got to 104 degrees, not something us Brits are used to !! Staff were friendly and helpful and the swimming pool whilst small was always clean and well looked after. Breakfast is included and is limited but was always fresh and the breakfast room was kept clean even when it was busy. The rooms were always well cleaned and made up each day and the location for Disneyland was superb. A short stroll and you were in
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback, it's a pleasure to hear that we met all of your expectations. I'll be sure to share your comments with all of our employees and please, feel free to come visit us in the near future.

Summary: We have stayed here twice now. This hotel is very nice having suites and family suites which are great for our family of 4. The kids have their own room with their own TV giving us more space than a hotel room. The staff is friendly and I like that they will check you in hours before your room is ready, so you know there won't be any problems when you come back from Disneyland to get your room keys. The hotel is directly across the street from the Disneyland entrance. The walk across the street and into the park is shorter and less of a headache than parking in the Disney parking lot and waiting for trams to drive you to the entrance. The free breakfast is self serve. Pastries, toast your own bread, cereal, coffee, juice, etc. Fairly simple but not bad and enough to fill you up
Manager Response: We do appreciate your feedback and look forward to be of service again in the near future. Thank you for choosing us and have a great day.

Summary Heading: My absolute favorite place to stay at Disneyland!
Summary: I mean, I'd rather not fork over bucks for an "official" Disneyland hotel (Disney ends up with my money one way or another, anyhow!).  This hotel is actually closer to the park entrance than the Disneyland or Paradise Pier hotels and it just such a greater value. Get your reservations in advance...this place fills up quickly because their rates are so great. Just be aware of add on rates like parking (one car only, $12 per night). It still ends up being a great deal. They have bigger suites to accommodate larger groups, even with bathtub jacuzzis.   Pros: friendly staff rooftop for viewing fireworks indoor pool and hot-tub as close as you can get to the Disneyland entrance ice machines in room coffee makers microwave refrigerator in-room safe for valuables  clean rooms  TV phone
Manager Response: Hello Smudge T,  Thank you for your review, it is always a pleasure to have you stay with us. I'm glad that you love everything about our hotel  as always, thank you and we'll see you soon.

Summary: We stayed 6 nights in September and couldn't be happier!  It is a stone's throw away from DL Resort, just cross the road and you're there... PERFECT!! We were on the top floor which was great and gave us a wonderful view of the park... we could see Tower of Terror... very cool! The room was perfect, I think it was a Family Suite?!  It had a small lounge room at the front and then you went through the door to where the beds were.  Perfect because we could put our two kids to bed and then hubby and I could sit up and watch TV or have a drink without disturbing the children. The rooms were clean, tidy and quiet and the beds & pillows were comfy!  Had a few problems connecting to WiFi, but with Macca's just down the road and iHop next door we were able to use their free WiFi if
Manager Response: Hell Feliss 74,  We are indeed conveniently located right across the street from Disneyland's Maingate and we are glad that you loved our location. Thank you for your business and hope to see you again when your travels bring you back to the area.

Summary Heading: Cross the street & you're all set!
Summary: We're Disneyland regulars - and always prefer a Family Suite! Top floor for noise control (we were still woken up regularly as Families move about their own rooms) & we were all set! Breakfast is minimal, but enough to start your day! Front Lobby was friendly & all went smoothly! Could NOT get WiFi to work for me at all in our room...which is frustrating. Will definitely always consider Desert Inn when booking Anaheim!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Location is wonderful for tired families
Summary: Just stayed 3 nights and this will be our place to stay for our yearly Disneyland visit. 3 minute walk to disneyland front gate. Perfect for families to walk back and forth for a break as it is so close. Rooms very nice. Clean, quiet with very firm beds but slept like babies and woke up with no back pain. Simple continental breakfast with all you need to get started. Nice pool and hot tub. We arrived early, parked and went right to Disneyland. They helpful staff. Peter was great! By staying here verses an expensive hotel we saved enough money for all our meals and gifts in the parks. Would recommend to anyone especially families because of close proximity. Hotel is modest and 50+ years old but has everything you need for a wonderful vacation. No complaints from this family!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We just finished another great stay at Anaheim Desert Inn and Suites!    It has been the only hotel we stay at when we go to Disneyland for the past 7 years.    You can not get much closer to the main entrance of Disneyland, the rooms are always clean, and each year the front desk staff seem to smile just a little more!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Last week our family again stayed at the Desert Inn and Suites. The 2 bedroom family suites are the perfect set up for our large family when traveling to Disneyland. The location still can't be beat. Breakfast is enough carbs to get most of us started. I did bring some yogurts and different cereals to use as well. The fridge and microwave and coffee pot all came in handy. This year we were in rooms on the 3rd floor and they were nice and quiet. I seldom hear outside noise at this motel. The room was very clean which is appreciated when you have little ones. The only "ding" I can give is that some of the furniture was a little beat up but it wasn't enough to bother me. I've seen worse! The front desk staff are always pleasant and this trip was no exception. My only complaint is
Manager Response: none

Summary: My last stay was in December 2011 for my honeymoon. We had the King Spa Suite. Upon check-in the staff was friendly, and it was a quick check-in. Perfect after a 10 hour drive. The room was spacious and we appreciated the amenities (refrigerator & microwave). The spa worked great and was a good size. Our room was in the back corner of the hotel, near the elevator. So, we were anticipating a lot of noise, but it wasn't too noisy. We were surprised. The only negative part of the stay would be the bed. The king bed was very flat and rock hard. We booked a queen room for the next trip, so hopefully the queen beds are better than the king! The continental breakfast is not worth going to. A cheap pastry, small apple and coffee. Just go to Denny's or IHOP, they are next door!  Located
Manager Response: Hello AshleyC341,  We appreciate your review and thank you for staying with  us during your rescent stay at the Desert Inn, again thank you and We look forward to your future visit.

Summary: We just returned from 3 days at Disneyland, something our Family does quite often.  This was our first stay at this property.  It is literally right across the street from the Pedestrian entrance to Disneyland.  We booked on line with a 3rd party Web Site.  The price was good, considering the days & time of year.  Last minute we discovered friends were going at the same time & I recommended they book at Desert Inn.  They did (last minute) thru the Inn, and received a bigger room (Suite sleeps 6) for the same price we were paying for the regular room.  When we arrived, we asked about this and were given, also, the suite for no extra charge.  I was impressed with this.  The check in staff was very helpful !  We had Room 516. The room was small, but since we are only there to
Manager Response: Hello TravilinMom,  Thank you for your feedback, it is a pleasure to know that our rooms and suites were able to accomodate your needs and that we met your standards, again thank you and hope to have you with us on your next trip to the Disneyland Resort.

Summary: I have stayed at this hotel several times but it was my first time to have a semi-suite room and I like it very much. The sofa bed was a plus and the room was spacious and comfortable. The price was reasonable too. Besides, I was able to get my request to have a room that is closer or near the lobby.
Manager Response: Hello TeresaP340,  I thank you for taking the time to share your previous experience with the Desert Inn, i am glad that you had tried a different suite on this ocassion and that you loved it. As always, it is a pleasure to have you stay with us. Thank you and we'll see you soon.

Summary: I chose this hotel because of the great family suites that they offer at a very reasonable price.My pet peeve is hotel rooms that are not thoroughly cleaned, and I always do a room check before unpacking. I was pleasantly surprised that everything was dust (and hair) free, througout the room. When we arrived, the front desk staff was there to greet us and was very courteous and efficient at getting us checked in. and of course to top it off, we were right across the street from Disneyland!   This was our first stay at the Anaheim Desert Inn but it definitely will not be our last.
Manager Response: Hello siddann,  Thank you for your feedback, we are happy that we have met your expectations and invite you to make the Desert Inn your home away from home, again thank you and come back soon

Summary: We stayed at this hotel which is across from the Disney theme parks; great rooms for large family at very reasonable price. I would recommend this to anyone who is looking for a good place to stay, have plently of reasonable eating places close by, and can walk to the theme parks!
Manager Response: Hi PraneetS,  We do appreciate your feedback and look forward to be of service again in the near future. Thank you for choosing us.

Summary: We'be stayed here about 15 times now, and love the location and friendly staff! You can bring your own food too since all the rooms have fridge and microwave! Rooftop area to watch fireworks! Staying in the back is quieter
Manager Response: Hello Shazamsue,  Thank you for your feedback and your continued patronage, it is always a pleasure to have you with us everytime you come to the happiest place on earth, thank you and we'll see you soon.

Summary: We have stayed here before and were pleasantly surprised at the upgrades to beds and bedding.  The rooms are very clean and their housekeeping excellent.  Their suites are wonderful and as we usually travel as a group of 6 to 8, are perfect for our family and being across from the gate helps too. My usual complaint is the continental breakfast as they had toast and pastries, not even bagels so we end up eating elsewhere. (but not the incredibly dirty Denny's next door)  The management and staff is wonderful and friendly. The only other surprise was the pay parking but again I think thats the norm now and I felt safer with staff managing the parking.  I would definitely stay here again and again.  Another plus is the elevators for those of us with aging knees.  I really
Manager Response: Hello nclfrequentflyers,  Thank you for coming back to the Desert Inn, i want to let you know that we are working on upgrading our breakfast room as well as the items that we offer in it, thank you and i hope that you visit us again in the near future.

Summary: When planning a trip to Disneyland a key factor is finding a reasonable hotel. For me and my family the Grand Californian and the Disneyland hotel are far out of our price range. So in a search I happened upon the Anaheim Desert Inn. Very super close walking distance, very quaint, and most of all, AFFORDABLE! I was not impressed with there attempt at complimentary breakfast. Toast and bagels don't call my name when I need the strength to cart around children in a huge park. Luckily there neighbor is a Denny's restaurant so get up a little earlier and chow down there. The room was what you expect, clean, neat, and comfortable. Every year we go to Disneyland this is our hotel of choice.
Manager Response: HI mavkid17,  Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback, we appreciate your comments and will soon be upgrading our breakfast items, in hopes that it will meet your expecations in the future. Thank you and we'll see you soon.

Summary Heading: Fantastic location to Disneyland - perfect for going back and forward during the day.
Summary: Location - Brilliant! Rooms and pool were dated and basic but slept 6 easily - there was only 4 of us but meant my kids didnt have to fight about sharing a bed! As we were only there to sleep this was not a problem. The free breakfast was basic but was all we needed- toast, cereal and danishes. For the price we have not found any better value for money and the basement parking was very convenient, free wi-fi but the signal was extremely weak in the room - had to stand outside. The reception staff were very helpful. Would recommend to anyone looking for a cheap hotel in a great location that is only using it to sleep.
Manager Response: Hello Ceiley,  We thank you for your feedback and will hopefully see you back in the near future.

Summary: We stayed at the Dessert Inn for 2 nights. After a long , long tiring day at the Disney resort, i could bearly make it across the street to the hotel. Thank God is was just a short walk to the hotel. Yes, the hotel is kind of outdated and has an old AC, but working and we indeed have a good nights rest. If you want luxury, then the Disney hotels are it, but if your looking for a short walk to the hotel, not spend alot of money,  just to go sleep, and a nice recieving staff, then this hotel is it!  i would rather not spend that much on a high cost hotel, what the heck... we are only going to go sleep, and i cannot complain on the beds..... I HAD A WONDERFUL NIGHTS SLEEP.  The continental breakfast was not that bad, the danish were good and coffee was fine. My boys really dont eat
Manager Response: We do appreciate your feedback and look forward to be of service again in the near future. Thank you for choosing us.

Summary: Clean, dependable with morning breakfast. Others like IHOP and Denny's are close for other meals or snacks. Directly across from the entrance to Disneland at a Stoplight with crosswalk. Parking can be a little crazy, but we always seem to find a favored spot either by luck or chance. Rooms are moderate to large in size and vary by the number of people per room. We usually have a family suite and find it quite adequate. Don't look for any type of discounts, there are none at this hotel. We have stayed at least twice a year for the last 6 years and have never been offered any discounts at all, we even asked.  Other hotels in the area do offer discounts so check with them also, not always the "best" of rates, but they do offer larger than normal family suites that fit our group

Summary Heading: Main Street Disneyland at Doorstep of Retro Hotel
Summary: Staying two nights at the Desert Inn and Suites was like channeling my first trip to Disneyland  almost a half of a century before. As it was then, now I could hardly contain my excitement upon seeing the attractions off in the distance--but now it was the Hollywood House of Terror, the Matterhorn, and Radiator Springs from our hotel's reception area that came to view. Yet I was amazed to find no real improvement in the quality of accomodations from those that we had used in the late 50's. Obviously, the hotel's location on Harbor Blvd., only a 5 minute walk to Disneyland's front door, was all the incentive budget-minded families needed to book a stay at the Desert Inn and Suites. Most families were not after a luxurious overnight spot--it was all about the theme park and being
Manager Response: On behalf of our entire staff we would like to thank you for your business and hope to see you again when your travels bring you back to the area

Summary: Right over the road from Disneyland's entrance the Desert Inn is one of the best hotels outside the Disney branded trio. Great service, cheap parking and nice rooms with restaurants and shops on the doorstep it's a good place to stay. I asked the Desert Inn for a room near the one I had a year ago when my family and I last stayed and although the hotel was at capacity, they gave me the very same room -122!  After a long day at Disneyland it's a real chore (especially with kids) to walk a long distance to your hotel so the proximity to Disneyland's entrance/exit means you can easily leave the park after enjoying the morning there, have lunch, relax in your room and head back to the park for round 2.
Manager Response: Thank you for your business, it was our pleasure to be of service and look forward to your future visit when you come to the Disneyland Resort

Summary: Cant really complain.  Yes, its a moderately priced motel, but the room was clean and quiet, the staff was incredible to work with, the parking was reasonable, the breakfast was free, and its location cannot be beat outside of the Disneyland Resort hotels.  I had to move my checkin date twice, and they had no issues with the changes and didnt even charge me a higher rate.  Will definately stay there again.
Manager Response: It is our pleasure to have you with us and we'll see you in the near future.

Summary Heading: Great for a Disneyland family vacation
Summary: Stayed in a parlor suite for five days the week on August 6th.  The staff was very friendly, especially the valets.  Kudos to them.  Overall, the room was clean although it could use a bit of updating.  Obviously, don't expect anything fancy.  Instead, for its intended purpose -- a Disneyland family vacation -- the place was ideal.  It is located directly across from the Disneyland entrance; 5 mins from your door to Main Street.  Nice to have a small fridge and microwave, too.  (Forget about the Costco danish and toast breakfast provided and instead get yogurt and muffins from the nearby Von's.)  A few niggles:  First, we could never connect to the wireless internet, so don't count on getting any work done (unfortunately, work remains a reality for many of us even during
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review us. We really value your feedback. It helps us look at the things we excel in and the areas that need improvement. Hope to be of service in the near future.

Summary Heading: The desert Inn is a clean, friendly family hotel in a great location with easy access to Disneyland.
Summary: Its a great place to stay, clean, friendly, convenient, with reasonable prices.  If your goal is to spend as much  time in the park as possible, and you don't want to spend resort hotel prices, or need luxury accommodations, this is a comfortable destination.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback and sure hope that  you will visit us when your travels bring you to the Disneyland Resort.

Summary: The location was excellent, the price reasonable.  Other than that, I don't have a lot of good things to say.  The room wasn't very clean.  We went in February, so the indoor pool was a plus, except the day my little boy wanted to go swimming, the pool looked disgusting and we wouldn't let him in the water.  Later that day, there was a sign that said that pool was closed.  The breakfast room is tiny.  There wasn't enough room for that size of hotel,  so people were sitting on the stairs with their food or going back to their rooms.  The breakfast food wasn't great, just dried out pastries, bread and apples and oranges.  I will pay a little more next time and stay where they serve a more substantial breakfast.
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to complete a survey regarding your recent stay with us. On behalf of our entire staff here at the Desert Inn & Suites we apologize for the concerns you have about your experience at our hotel and hope that you will try us in the near future so that we can provide better service and a memorable Disneyland experience.

Summary: Everywhere I have stayed when traveling to Disneyland, the hotel allows you to leave your car in the morning and come back at night to check in. When I made my reservation I asked if this was ok. The booking agent told me it was "not a problem." When I arrived, I found that the li was mostly valet. The parking attendant was extraordinarily rude and told me that check in time was at 3 and I had to leave and park somewhere else. After attempting to explain to him what I was told, he told me that if I could find a spot, "park it yourself." I found a spot and did park myself. Then the attendant comes up to me yelling at me that I can't park there! I told him that he just told me I could park if I found a spot and he told me that he was oing to use it and I had to leave. Summary Heading: Great location and good price for the location and accommodations
Summary: We enjoyed our stay.  The rooms having refrigerators was a big plus.  The convenient location to Disneyland was the best.  Price is right for the accommodations.  We plan to stay there again so long as the price is not higher.  The breakfast is quick and easy, though would be nice to have waffles and more, but that would likely result in a price increase.  The rooms were fine.  Not the fanciest in the world, but very good accommodations for the price and location.  I thought it was most excellent to be able to partially check-in early and park on the property then walk to Disneyland and return that night for full check-in.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stay here all the time.  Its right across the street from Disneyland entrance and the price is reasonable.  Were always greeted with friendly and helpful staff.  Rooms are clean- they are standard rooms with microwave and fridge.  We have used the family suite and was perfect for the 6 of us-plenty of room.  The room could have slept 8-10 people easy.  The pool and hot tub are indoor.  We have never used the pool.  Simple continental breakfast if you want something to tide you over til you get somewhere else.  They carry fruit, pastries, toast and cereal, with some seating.  They do have a small store on site with the basics. However, there are many more hotels right across the street from disneyland, and I wish I had chosen another one, like the best western.   My biggest complaint is this:  The hotel allows people who aren't staying at the hotel to valet park their cars on the hotels parking lot while they spend the day at disneyland. Manager Response: none

Will I spend the extra $50 per night to stay in a hotel that has carpet I'm not afraid to walk on or a shower I'm not afraid to use?  Absolutely!  Hello Marriott!

Summary: its your basic hotel but it has all the amenities you would want, clean and comfortable also it looks like its been re equipped recently cause the A/C was running flawless, in fact the only flaw i saw was the fact that the complimentary breakfast was between 7:30-9:30 only
