Summary: First of all I want to say my thanks to Juan. He is a front desk associate that had great customer service.From that first step into the lobby was professional.He was with a customer but he found the time to greet me and tell me he would be with us soon. The rooms were outstanding.They were huge.... We had a standard with two queen beds that were so comfortable.... the rooms were so big that there was enough room for a third bed.My family had a few rooms there and everyone of those rooms were great.I stayed in room 333.The locataion of this room was futher down but it was worth taking that long walk to the elavator with those stunning looking trees.The best thing about our stay of course was that it was so close to Disneyland. We travled with kids and after that long day at the
Manager Response: Hello Venessa M,  Thank you for the feedback, i will personally tell Juan of  your kind comments. It was our pleasure to be of service and look forward to your future visit when you come to the Disneyland Resort

Summary: We stayed here from July 8th through the 13th in a spa suite.   The location is perfect.  We traveled with 3 children and I hate taking the shuttle buses to the park.  The walk to the entrance is not much further than some of the shuttle stops.    Our room was very clean.  I’m picky and can usually find something wrong with the cleanliness of a room but I didn’t with this room and every time the maids came to clean they did an excellent job.  Compared to the other hotels (Holiday inn express and Best Western Stovalls inn) that I have stayed at in the area, this was by far the cleanest.  I thought that the beds were comfortable however my husband didn’t find them as comfortable as I did.  The size of the refrigerator was nice.  The microwave worked well as did the hair dryer.
Manager Response: Hello Cecilia,  Thank you for your feedback, it fills us with pride knowing that we met all of your expectations and look forward to having you with us on the near future.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay when visiting Disneyland
Summary: This location is perfect when planning a vacation at Disneyland or California Adventure.  You're literally accross the street mear minutes from the park entrance making returning for the night or just a break easy to do.  The rates aren't bad especially when compared to the Disneyland hotels.  The facility is dated, elevators are slow, but I wasn't there to spend time in the room!
Manager Response: On behalf of our entire staff we would like to thank you for your business and hope to see you again when your travels bring you back to the area

Summary: You cannot get much closer to Disneyland: this hotel is right at the crosswalk to the main entrance to the parks.  A close location is so helpful if you do Disneyland the right way…get there early, take a break to rest at noon, then go back later in the day.  I stayed in a 5th-floor suite (2 queen beds and sitting room with a pull-out couch) to attend a conference and to visit Disneyland.  I found the room in good shape, clean and very well maintained, with good daily housekeeping.  It was great to have a refrigerator and a microwave.  This is so practical since it will save time and money in the morning.  The hotel offers a very simple continental breakfast, but it does not open until 7:30 am, which is much too late for Disney visitors during the busy seasons.  The dining space
Manager Response: Hello garyrc,  We do appreciate your feedback and look forward to be of service again in the near future. Thank you for choosing us

Summary Heading: Close to park, good for families on a budget
Summary: We stayed in a parlor suite which was spacious and worked nicely for us. Beds are comfortable. Tvs are nice. Newer tile in bathrooms. Overall, pretty comfortable. The indoor pool and hot tub are disgusting, however. Also, the elevator is ridiculously slow and there is only 1 for the whole place, so plan in waiting. The staff was pretty friendly. Don't count on being able to check in early.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review us. We really value your feedback. It helps us look at the things we excel in and the areas that need improvement. Hope to be of service in the near future.

Summary: The air conditioner broke had to install a new one,the microwave broke had to keep replacing it, they went thru 3 of them before they could find one in another room that worked, the hot tub had a part come off of it which they never fixed and the 2 farthest jets had very little air come out of them that was never fixed either, got tired of complaining nothing worked there, The elevator broke and my husband is in a wheel chair, had no way of getting down stairs 2 days of our stay for hours, the front desk employees are rude, and  wfi was bad connection!!!!!  putting fresh paint and new lite fixtures wont fix all the other problems they have there!  NEVER AGAIN  , do not stay there, do yourself a favor
Manager Response: I appreciate you taking the time to complete our customer satisfaction survey for Desert Inn & Suites. If you have a moment and are willing to share any specifics on these items it would greatly increase my ability to better assess and attempt to remedy these concerns. Thank you for your feedback and hope that you can give us a second chance to meet and exceed your expectations on the near future.

Summary: The location was perfect!  The rooms are large and clean, but older  Breakfast was not good at all. Sweet rolls and toast and old cherrios.  If they would add some yogurt, and better fruit choices, it would help.  Parking was super tight and a pain.  The pool is small and not inviting.  Overall a good stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Awesome location but rooms are just average
Summary: We stayed here for a night when we went to disneyland because we didnt want to walk far.  Perfect location as it took us about 4 min to walk to the front gate!  The staff is really friendly.  We have stayed here before and our only complaint about the place is the beds were really bad.  It was like sleeping on a board.  My wife didnt sleep very well and for about $20 more we got a better sleep down the street and walked a few more blocks.  Like I said it is great for the location and thats why we like it but the beds are no bueno!  The pool and hot tub we didnt use but it looked ok and lots of people using it.  Has a fridge, microwave, and our room had a big spa tub.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Just what we expected - and hoped for!
Summary: We enjoyed our stay very much.  The only "problem" that we experienced  was a challenge with the wifi connection - the signal was sometimes  sporadic, and was only truly accessible in one spot in our room.  Other  than that, our room was very nice, and spacious - we also appreciated  the roomy refrigerator and bathroom (have you thought about a little  table of some type in the corner of that wonderfully huge bath area?  that would be very helpful!).  We enjoyed the sun deck on our first  night there to catch the fireworks, but on our last night the door was  locked right up 'til start time of the show, so we watched from the  street in front, which wasn't as nice...  Everyone on staff was friendly  and helpful. The attraction of this hotel to us was the proximity to Disneyland,
Manager Response: none

Summary: We just concluded out 5 night stay at the Anaheim Desert Inn & Suites. I have mixed reviews about this hotel. We stayed there at the advice of family that goes to Disneyland often.  Positives -	LOCATION, Location, location. It is right across the street from the Disneyland entrance, and I do mean right across the street.  -	It is conveniently located next to Denny’s, IHOP, Coldstone, and Mc Donald’s.  -	Its cleanliness was satisfactory. -	Free Wi-Fi -	Friendly staff  Negatives -	They nickel & dime you to death -	Breakfast was little Debbie Snacks, and stale cereal, and toast. -	Pool smelled like a mix of mold and chlorine.  -	The Wi-Fi was off & on -	Narrow halls, if you have a lot of luggage, better move it before the maids get to work or you will have major issues. -	They lie
Manager Response: none

Summary: I had made 4 different reservations at 4 different hotels for our recent Disneyland vacation! After reading the most recent reviews for the Desert Inn, I kept this reservation.  Our stay was from June 13-19.  We checked in and our room was a top floor and far from the elevator just as requested! Fridge was large and there was a microwave. A plus when you order delivery food and have left overs!!  The breakfast should have much more fruit varieties and cereal varieties.  But it worked. Very small sitting are, which was fine, we just went to our room and ate.  My biggest complaint are the pillows!! Very thick are HARD! Thankfully I had tylenol for the headache I woke up with everyday.  Also, you hear a lot of the outside noise, so expect to be awake early...  Our room was not
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great location, reasonable price.  Large suites are great
Manager Response: Thank you Dbsalerno:  I've noticed that you've stayed with us numerous times and I would like to thank you for keeping the Desert Inn & Suites are your preferred home away from home.

Summary: Stayed over the Memorial day week and must say I enjoy our time here.  We have stayed at the Desert inn at least 4 to 5 other times in the past 7 years and we are never dissapointed. You can't beat being across the street from the park, Denny's and other restaurants nearby.  Our room was clean and maid service was great.  Parking was never an issue and the valet attendants were very friendly and helpful.  We arrived early morning on our check in day and had no problems being allowed to park so we could hit Disney and came back later to check in.  Microwave and Refrigerators in the room are a big plus.  Finally this stay I actually used the roof deck to view the fireworks and wish I had done this on previous stays.  I have never had any problems with Desert Inn and will continue
Manager Response: Hello jagz96,  I'm glad that you choose us everytime you come to the Disneyland Resort and i'm sure glad that we meet all your needs. Thank you for your continued support and we'll see you in summer.

Summary: We stayed in Jan 2012, so I'm late writing this review. I did a lot of research on prices, reviews ect, and finally chose this hotel. We were very happy with it. We had 3 small children so the best feature is how close to Disneyland it is. We stayed there 5 days and never used a car. The rooms were clean and well stocked. The best place to get 2 bedrooms & 2 bathrooms for the price. They are large rooms too. We didn't have any trouble with noise. The other reviews are true as well; the elevator VERY slow (we carried the stroller up the stairs instead), the breakfast Very basic (but it's free!), and the staff could have been a little friendlier, but they were not really rude. We like this hotel and lot and plan to stay if we go again this year.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review us. We really value your feedback. It helps us look at the things we excel in and the areas that need improvement. Hope to be of service in the near future.

Summary Heading: We loved our week long stay!
Summary: This place was well priced and by FAR beat the competition when it came to our suite! It had a good sized small fridge and a microwave and 4 queen beds. It was AMAZINGLY located to Disneyland. Very short walk. I was worried about parking but once we arrived it was no issue. The first time we parked, there was enough for us to self park. When we came back it was full for self parking so they did valet for us. It was no problem at all and they were all super happy and nice. The maid service was great. The hotel felt clean and I didn't notice any excess of noise from other rooms at all. The beds were super firm which was a HUGE plus for me (notsomuch for my husband haha).  The only negative things I have to say are that the maid carts are WAY too big to be left in the passageways.
Manager Response: Hello lunacherubim,  I do appreciate your feedback and look forward to be of service again in the near future. Thank you for choosing us

Summary Heading: As close as the Disneyland Hotel for a fraction of the price
Summary: We've stayed at this hotel twice, and likely will again.  Nothin' fancy, but they do a great job at providing spacious, clean, affordable and even *quiet* rooms and suites.  Housekeeping staff does a great job.  My on-line request for a particularly quiet room was honored.  Towels are not thick, but they're clean and plentiful.  Beds and even the fold-out sofa were very comfortable and we all got a good night's sleep.  Rooftop deck makes it easy to watch the nightly fireworks without fighting the crowds in the park.  The generic, basic breakfast offered doesn't appeal to us, so we bring muffins and stuff of our own, or there's a Denny's right next door with a big $4 breakfast.
Manager Response: Burroheeto,  Thank you for your business, it was our pleasure to be of service and look forward to your future visit when you come to the Disneyland Resort.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel right next to Disneyland
Summary: We loved that the hotel was just across the road from Disney.  We set of really early in the morning and came back exhausted late at night, and the fact that the hotel was literally across the road was fantastic!  The rooms are clean and the fridge and microwave were an extra plus, that really made us feel at home.  Did quite a bit of research when booking, and for the location, the rate is really good.  Would highly recommend for families with kids visiting Disney.
Manager Response: none

Summary: we arrived in May 2012 and OMG....Disneyland was across the road. the room were very nice with room for the 4 of us.you got a basic breakfast in the morning but good. the location was amazing and you can walk to Disneyland, places to eat all around and convenience stores close by.great for families and fantastic to walk across the road to Disneyland. Would recommend to friends and family and would go back any time!!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: As close as you can get to Disneyland without paying a ton of money
Summary: We stay here everytime we go to Disneyland since it is so close to the park.  The rooms are clean, they have a fridge and microwave so you can warm up food or make sandwiches and not always have to eat out.  The continental breakfast is good too. Only draw back is the new 8.00 per day cost to park at the hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review us. We really value your feedback. It helps us look at the things we excel in and the areas that need improvement. Hope to be of service in the near future

Summary: I stayed here over Memorial Day Weekend and what a great hotel.  The rooms were nice and big.  The beds were very comfortable.  They had a very wonderful rooftop deck where you could look out and see Disneyland from across the street.  How cool is that?
Manager Response: Indeed, that's very cool. We do appreciate your feedback and are glad that you enjoyed your stay with us, hopefully we'll see you again on your next visit to Disneyland.

Summary: I have stayed here more than once so obviously like it, this most recent stay i had 15 middle school kids with me and chaperones and parents, we had 3 family rooms, it was a great experience for the kids and me too.  The location is great, the rooms are very good, and it is a great bargain.  The staff was very friendly and worked with us very well.
Manager Response: It is always a pleasure to have you and your groups at our hotel, thank you and look forward to your next trip to Anaheim.

Summary: We love to stay at this hotel every time we plan a trip to Disneyland. It is there within walking distance of the parks. The rooms are nice and clean and the staff has always been friendly to us.  In our past 6 trips to Disneyland we stayed at one other hotel and that was only because of the Anaheim Desert Inn being booked. After that we decided it would be better to hold off on taking our trip if this place is not available.
Manager Response: Thank you Mmacconnell,  It is our pleasure to have served and met all of your expectations as always, thank you for your continued patronage and we'll see you soon.

Summary Heading: Convenient to Disneyland and priced well
Summary: We chose this hotel for the price and convenience.  It is located across the street from Disneyland/California Adventure, so we parked the car at the hotel for the entire time we were there.  You will have to pay for parking in addition to your hotel price.  The staff is helpful and friendly.  The pool/hot tub is pretty disgusting and near the parking lot, so we only walked by it.  Although breakfast is free, I urge you to skip it (it consists of dollar store, white bread, cheap pastries, etc.).  Overall, the price and location was satisfying.
Manager Response: Hello Acrosstheshiningsea,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and sure hope to see you in the near future.

Summary Heading: Great stay, great value, great location
Summary: Had a great experience at this hotel.  The room was clean and the staff was very helpful. I requested a room in the back of the hotel, as I had read previous reviews and was given room on 3rd floor in back of hotel. This is great location, no one on top and it is very quiet.  We never had any issues with the elevators or parking.  The complimentary breakfast was not more than basic pastries, coffee and juice and the sitting area is very, very small but other than that, the price was excellent for the location... right across from the entrance to Disneyland.  We will definately stay at the Anaheim Desert Inn and Suites again!!!
Manager Response: Hello AZ_Teddybear,  On behalf of our entire staff we would like to thank you for your business and hope to see you again when your travels bring you back to the area.

Summary: We had a great family vacation staying at your hotel. Our family regularly chooses this hotel due to the convenience of the family suites and the fact that it is right across the street from Disneyland (no waiting for shuttles).  I would especially like to thank the lost and found department (especially Tio) for assisting us with returning an item we left behind.
Manager Response: Hello NateN265,  It was a pleasure to be of service and hope to see you back at the Desert Inn on your next trip to the Disneyland Resort.

Summary Heading: Great stay at Anaheim Desert Inn and Suites
Summary: We had a fine time at this hotel, and we will stay there again.  The rooms were clean and comfortable, the staff was very friendly (we did not need to interact with them much, as everything was well cared for, but our few experiences were positive), and the property has great proximity to Disneyland.  The price is great.  The rooms are not luxurious, but the beds were quite comfortable.  The breakfast was very average, but for the amazing price of the room, anything was great.
Manager Response: Thank you NateN265 for a great review, we are glad that we met your expectations and hope to have you stay with us when you come back to Anaheim.

Summary: We Stayed at this hotel in Oct. of 2011. Our experience with the staff and manager Teo was positive, Teo was responsive and followed through. We stayed in two rooms during our stay, when we arrived we had a double suite because we had a large group, when half our group left we moved to a smaller suite both rooms were equally spacious and clean. Upon arrival I noticed the housekeeping staff putting new comforters in the rooms which I really apprecaited and was surprised about (maybe this is common practice now, I'm a novice traveler).  There are safes provided in the rooms which we used however I want to mention that once I accidentally left my Nikon DSLR sitting out in it's case with lenses while were at the parks all day, when we returned our room had been clean and my DSLR
Manager Response: Hello ErikaT750,  It was a pleasure to be of service, we thank you for a great review and we'll see you at the Desert Inn in the near future.

Summary: We have stayed at this hotel 3 times.  Each time has been great.  While the hotel is not fancy dancy, it is economical and convenient to Disneyland.  We love that they have an indoor pool and spa.  I would only like if they could maybe update the breakfast.  Maybe get one of those waffle makers.  The staff at the front desk have always been very helpful and friendly and the cleaning staff do a great job.
Manager Response: HI AnnB110,  Thank you for staying at the  Desert Inn for a second time, and sure hope that you will continue to stay with us when you travel back to Anaheim.

Summary Heading: 2nd stay there, and we were just as happy!
Summary: Arrived at the hotel at about 12:30, they wouldn't let us check in, but did allow us to park so that we could go to Disneyland.  The rooms are basic, but you have everything you need, including a refrigerator and microwave.  The beds are firm, but they are not your standard coil mattress, so they are comfortable.  The location is what makes this place.  You can't beat a 5 minute walk to the park.  We love this place and it will continue to be our first choice whenever we go to Disneyland!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Desert Inn was conveniently located across from Disney after walking around all day it was nice to get back to the room quick not having to wait for a shuttle bus. The pool and jacuzzie was great way to relax your mussels in the hot jacuzzie they stay open till 11.00 pm nice all other hotels close that at 10.00 so that was nice to enjoy. We had a suite and it was big enough for the 5 of us. Each had there own queen bed. The only thing that could have been better was hot breakfast not just fruit and toast and sweets. Eggs or waffles would have been nice that would be the only complaint. All staff was very friendly. We stayed from April 3rd - April 6th 2012
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed in a parlor A suite hopping to get better beds than there basic rooms.  The beds were better but the noise level was much greater. There was connecting doors which let all the noise from the next room in. and It was very annoying that the people in the other room kept trying to open the door that connected our rooms together.   The sofa bed was uncomfortable for adults but ok for kids as they arent as heavy and wont sink in.  There is only one elevator so if you have a small child in a stroller it gets annoying waiting every time for it.  If I would stay here again I would just save the money and go with there basic room. Unless you need the extra room.  We went in Decemeber and it was great having an indoor pool that the girls can still go swimming in even though it
Manager Response: none

Summary: We checked in to the Anaheim Desert Inn and Suites on Apr 30th and checked out on May 1st.  This hotel is less than 5 minute walk to the Disneyland gate with a stroller.  The room we were in had 4 Queen beds, fridge and microwave, 2 bathroom (only 1 had a shower).  The room was great for what we wanted which was close to Disneyland.  The breakfast is basic, but restaurants are close if you want.  We did not spend a lot of time at the hotel, but my kids did enough the inside pool.  Overall it was very good for the price.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Desert Inn was very conveniently located across from the main entrance to the Disney Parks.  A car attendent greeted us as drove in, told us where to park, we checked in, the receptionist told us room would be ready at 3 pm and proceeded to the park.  We were two adults enjoying two days at the Disney Parks and we were hoping this would not be noisy night with children running around.  We had a room in the back and it fit our needs, quiet, microwave, frig, TV.  There was a modest breakfast offered and you can pay 8 dollars to leave your car for the next day.  This hotel is easy to get to and very close to the Interstate 5 ramps.
Manager Response: On behalf of our entire staff we would like to thank you for your business and hope to see you again when your travels bring you back to the area

Summary Heading: Great location, good room, hidden fees and taxes.
Summary: Right across the pedestrian walkway from disneyland maingate.  Room was spacious with 2 double beds & clean.  We stayed at the back of the hotel on the top floor.  We have 2 kids & the room beneath complained because the kids were jumping so their is no sound proofing.  Breakfast is the same each day.  Plain cornflakes & plain cherios.  Same danish, apple & orange juice,milk, water, tea, regular & decaf coffee,  white & brown bread for toasting, butter, apple & grape jelly (jam), one day will be red apples & the next will be oranges.  Room was $99 per night but really $120 per night after they tack on the hidden fees & taxes (we had no car).  I would only stay here again if there were no extra fees & taxes.  We found out on our 3rd day that you can catch a bus from just outside
Manager Response: We do appreciate your feedback and look forward to be of service again in the near future. Thank you for choosing us

Summary: Ok yea, the walls are paper thin, and the staff can sometimes leave something to be desired.  But if youre looking for a place close to Disneyland, this is a terrific deal!  They always have a coupon in the Discount Hotel Guide.  They did refuse to honor it for us once after they said they would, but that was once out of many.  The pool & spa are really nice, especially after a day of walking the park.  The rooms are relatively clean.  I wouldnt use their valet service, and dont order take out from any of the places in their book.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review us. We really value your feedback. It helps us look at the things we excel in and the areas that need improvement. Hope to be of service in the near future

Summary Heading: Terrible place, risk to my family.
Summary: Mold around bath fan just painted over, water damage on bathroom they believe that a small  paint over wet wall is enough, but mold keeps growing under paint!. We did not check the room because it was too late after all day on Disneyland. A noisy ice maker machine right behind the wall. We call the night manager by 2:00 am and nothing happened. I was ready to sleep in my car better. Is room 228 and I have pictures to probe it. My son is asmathic and he was sick the next days, First thing in the morning we went to the front desk and this guy -agustin-  he said that the manager-Carlos- was doing some shopping!. We still waiting for him to call me, like they said. 3/30/2012 Thank you.
Manager Response: We are extremely sorry about your unsatisfactory experience. Your feedback is really appreciated so as to ensure that this type of incident does not take place again

Summary: We have stayed at the Anaheim Desert Inn and Suites many times. Our most recent visit was April 18-21. The room was very clean, the staff are friendly. Its a short walk to and from Disneyland, Dennys is right next door.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review Kathy, it is always a pleasure to have you with us. See you soon!!!

Summary: If your looking for value and a great location, this is the place to stay. Just across the street from the maingate of Disneyland. If you have kids, its great because you can come and go from the park often, with less walking. Parking is a breeze and if the lot is full, have the valet guy park your car. Rooms are kept up and the staff is great!
Manager Response: Thank you for the review Douglas, we appreciate your feedback and hope to see you soon.

Summary: I have stayed here 3 times in the past 2 years and it is a great place to stay. The rates are one of the lowest around and it is almost directly across the street from the Disneyland main entrance. The rooms are clean and the price is right. The only negative I have is the limited parking, but it is $12 cheaper to park here than Disneyland.
Manager Response: As always Nick, we appreciate your review and we are glad that we met your expectations.

Summary: I stayed here in May 2009 and loved the closer walk....it was about 5 minutes from the gates to the hotel.  We stayed in the back area called the 'courtyard' area...it was a little more quiet. The staff was nice and the stay there was fine. Everything was clean.  I didn't have the breakfast they offered as I always bring my own cereal and milk :) I will stay here again and always recommend it to my friends and family.
Manager Response: Thank you Suzy, for taking the time to give us your feedback and we hope to have you stay with us again in the near future.

Summary Heading: Great hotel right across from Disneyland!
Summary: Very nice hotel, clean, comfortable, with breakfast included and right across from Disneyland!
Manager Response: On behalf of our entire staff we would like to thank you for your business and hope to see you again when your travels bring you back to the area.

Summary: I have not yet stayed here, I'm booked to stay in September but I wanted to commend the Desert Inn & Suites on their excellent customer service. I live in Australia and relied on emails to book my stay. Every email I sent from enquiries to changing my room type was promptly replied to (sometimes in a matter of minutes). Nothing has been to much trouble for them and I would like to thank them for making the booking process a very easy and pleasant experience.  Thankyou!!
Manager Response: It was a pleasure having you with us and feel free to contact me in the future should you have any questions. Thank you.

Summary: We enjoyed our stay....comfortable room, close to parks, and dining.  The rooms have a microwave and refrigerator so you can heat up leftovers or store drinks for the park.  Sure the breakfast is sub-par, but it works and kids don't care. We will be back for another vacation.  Thank you:)
Manager Response: Thank you for your business and it was our pleasure to be of service. We look forward to your future visit.

Summary: Could not beat the location and the double room we had was great for 5 adults.  The room was clean.  However the continental breakfast was very sad.  One choice of fruit, apple one day orange the next, only toast and jam no peanut butter, no bagels, danishes and two choices of cereal; the orange juice was orange drink. So if you like high carb/sugar breakfasts you will be happy. For the size of the Inn the breakfast room had only a few seats so we took ours back to our room.  The wireless Internet was not good at all.  The best part was after a long day of walking, knowing we were extremely close to our room.
Manager Response: On behalf of our entire staff we would like to thank you for your business and hope to see you again when your travels bring you back to the area

Summary: Very good price for the size of the room.  Clean rooms and carpet.  We can see the fireworks every night from our 5th floor room.  The best thing: walking distance from the parks. Front service can definitely be better from a man's name starting with "A". He was not very helpful and actually did not seem interested in helping his customers at all. No thank you's as well.  The rest of the staff especially parking attendant provided great service.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review us. We really value your feedback. It helps us look at the things we excel in and the areas that need improvement. Hope to be of service in the near future.

Summary: My family and I have recently visited this hotel! It's been about three weeks now and I read some of the reviews and had my doubts. When I arrived at the hotel it was clean and I had no problems. The hotel is located right across the street from Disneyland which made it all the way better. The mattresses were so comfortable I was excited every night to get back and just sleep!!!! It was peaceful at night and never had any disturbances. The employees are helpful and  courteous. Denny's is right next door and the service and food is good  and served fast. Our next trip to Disneyland I will make sure reservations are made in this hotel!!!!!
Manager Response: On behalf of our entire staff we would like to thank you for your business and hope to see you again when your travels bring you back to the area.

Summary: The Anaheim Desert Inn and Suites has a great location.  Right across the street from the main entrance to Disneyland.  For the most part, they've always been very accommodating.  We arrive early (8am) and they always allow us to park our car even though rooms are obviously not ready yet.  They have an indoor heated pool, although I've never used it.  Continental breakfast is very low key.  Apples, some danish, cereal, bread, milk and juice.  We usually bring our own food and only make use of the juice and milk.  There are a number of chain restaurants in the area, so dining options are plentiful.  The rooms themselves are generally average, or slightly above.  Large flat screen tv's.  They have a refrigerator and microwave, so that's very handy.    All in all, I would highly
Manager Response: Thank you for your continuous business and it was our pleasure to be of service as usual. We look forward to your future visit.

Summary: We just got back from a 6 night stay at the Desert Inn and Suites.  Our room was located in the middle of the complex.  I thought for sure that we would have nothing but noise from outside and rooms next door.  I was very wrong.  It was so quiet and relaxing at the end of a Disney Day. The room was always clean and the carpet was really clean.  I walked on the floor with white socks and they stayed white!  This is an older motel and could use updating, but for the $$ and location to the park, it was great.  One thing that could use improvement is the complimentary breakfast area.  It was too crowded and the assortment of selections was lacking.  We never did the breakfast because of the crowds.  Other than that, the hotel was great.  The plantation shutters were a nice surprise!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have been staying at the Desert Inn & Suites for approx 12 years. Anywhere from 1 to 3 visits per year. Always loved it. Staff is usually friendly for the most part. Rooms are clean, and the location cant be beat. My latest visit however, i was trwated with their new "valet" service. This was honestly a joke. They park your car, keep your keys, you have to track down the valet EVERYTIME you want to get something from your vehicle. Upon checkout my car was buried 3 deep behind other vehicles. Actually broke the handle on my brand new suitcase trying to get to my trunk, and it took 42 minutes to have my vehicle brought up after i had checked out and recieved my bill. Not time well spent for a family with a visually impaired son. I am not sure why you added valet service, but i
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good location, Good Start, BUT BAD ending
Summary: Ok, let me start by saying this. My bf is an owner of a resort in southern california and when we decide to take my children to Disneyland, he got solid recommendations about this hotel.  So we took it.  Checking in was ok, my mom and the girls were eager to get out of the car.  We got the room and spent 2 nights enjoying ourselves.  I proceed to go check out and get my reciept for the room.  I questioned the dollar amount charged cause I always do that to ensure I am not getting overcharged for something.  Well, I just opened up my Credit card bill and this hotel has the audacity to add second charge.  Their employee told me what I was being charged for as I checked out, he gave me the reciept to show that.  WELL I never authorized any second charge that was going to be taken
Manager Response: I'm sorry to hear about your bad experience at the inn, however liability of charges does not stop at check out, Just above your signature on the registration it reads, "My signature authorizes Desert Inn & Suites to charge my credit card for any charges assessed by the hotel. I also agree to pay for any additional nights and services that i extend beyond the departure date listed above." This is specifically on there as a security measure and to ensure that hotel rooms are left in good condition and also to cover after checkout parking fees. I again, apologize for the enconvenience and have a great day.

Summary Heading: If you want a Disney hotel, this is it.
Summary: This is our 2nd stay at the Desert Inn.  First time our youngest son was only about a year old... he's 10 now.  When you stay here you really pay for the convenience of living across the street from the Disney parks.  It really saves a lot of time and aggravation especially if you want to stay late (shorter lines) and enjoy the evening attractions like the parade, fireworks, and world of color. Right next to Denny's and iHop so a late night meal is never a problem. A real no frills hotel but if all you're doing is parking yourself here for the night after a long day at the park... you really can't do much better.
Manager Response: Thank you  for your review and we hope to have you stay with us in the near future.

Summary Heading: One of the worst stays I've ever had
Summary: We stayed here on a family vacation for 10 days in May 2011. The interenet was incredibly slow, and the hotel charged in excess of 10 dollars/minute for international calls.   The rooms are clean, but everything in them is very cheap. The TVs were old CVT models, with very few channels.   Every morning we were awakened very early because of gaps in the door, and loud noise from guests.  There are several other hotels in the area I would strongly suggest looking into if you are going to be staying in Anaheim or visiting Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and i apologize for the inconvenience experienced during your stay. International Phone calls will ALWAYS be expensive at hotels, specially in the Anaheim Resort area. For any future stays here or anywhere else, we recommend you use a calling card which will be much less expensive. Thank you for your patronage and have a great day.

Summary Heading: Clean, barebones hotel for staying right at Disneyland
Summary: Its location, right in front of Disneyland, was the biggest advantage of this hotel.  When Disneyland got too tiring or hot, we could return to the hotel to rest.  We stayed in the deluxe room and its furnishings were spartan.  It reminded me of cheap college-type apartments.  However, the rooms look well-maintained and clean.  When the neighboring room was running the bath, it was very loud.  Parking is a little tight with valet marking now.  Breakfast was rather low quality danish, bread and juice. Wireless internet was free but not reliable.  The pricing is good if booked well in advance.
Manager Response: Thank you for writing a review about your rescent stay at the Anaheim Desert Inn, we are glad that our rooms met your expectations and hope that you will stay with us again on your next trip to Disneyland Resort.

Summary: We stayed in a suite, 11 of us.  From grandparents to little ones.  It was perfect, right across from disney.  Rooms were clean and roomy.  Breakfast was pastries, fruit, and cereal/toast.  It was great especially if you are trying to save.  The room was the best deal we found for the area.  We had a room towards the back of hotel, it was very quiet. Dennys is next door for those who need large breakfasts. We loved everything, only thing I would suggest is that the front desk and kitchen help SMILE and be friendly. Nothing big, it just makes you feel better.  The cleaning staff was very friendly.  And so was the man in the gift shop.  The guys parking the cars always had smiles on their faces also.  It just makes for a happier stay.   But we will stay here again, it was great.
Manager Response: We appreciate your review and will definetely use this as a training tool for our staff. Thank you and hope to have you stay with us in the near future.

Summary Heading: EXCELLENT LOCATION!!!! GREAT FIREWORKS VIEW TOO!!
Summary: I was VERY excited at the location of Desert Inn! Walk right across street into Disney main gates! Denny's, Tony Roma's, Cold Stone, Captain Kidd Buffet,I-Hop McDonald's all right next door to this hotel! Very nice people working here too, parking attendants are cool too! Room 226 was ours and it was too noisy and lighted due to ice maker , hall lights , maids servicer area and elevator right outside our door. But we were there only one night so I could deal with it all.  Showers take a good 7-10mins to warm up but they DO warm up and get very hot. Microwave & Mini fridge(good size too), TV, hair dryer, ironing board all there in your basic room to use.  The 5th floor sun & viewing deck is great for watching the fireworks over Disney... and yes you can see Tinker Bell easily! I
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our stay at Desert Inn was pleasant ... the Inn itself was clean & had comfortable beds. The room had a fridge, coffee maker but no water kettle!  Apart from the very noisy en-suite bathroom fan that was a few decibels from comfort, we had nothing to complain about. Parking is included too. The breakfast was not impressive, hardly anywhere to sit and the selection was minimal. However, what gives this place its four stars is the location! We were in Disneyland & Disney California Adventure for three whole days and this inn is literally situated across the street. Many family restaurants around the area too. We'd recommend Saga Pizza. Its situated less than 100 m past Denny's.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Service and attitude not a strong point - internet problems once again
Summary: Yes this is right across the road from the best place in town, but is is not a chain and they know it. There is no eagerness to solve problems and because the location is good, its a take it or leave it attitude. Great beds ( may even be latex mattresses ), housekeeping staff were great and the rooms presented well. Parking busy but great service. And I have to agree if you want a place to crash after a big day this is great, just not a place to spend any time. It comes back to addressing problems with the internet, or not addressing as the case may be.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Okay, what everyone has said on here is true.  We didn't use the pool so can't comment.  Loved the suite and the staff was friendly.  Best thing about it is the location and the suite size - good value!  Also had refrigerator and microwave.  Because of this, the fact that their breakfast was barely there and way too late to use if going to Disneyland during spring break didn't really bother me.  We had food in our rooms for breakfast so it wasn't a huge issue.  So we liked everything except that the internet rarely worked.  It has previously been posted on here how bad the internet service is and that situation is still bad!  My DH had several conversations with the manager on the phone and even suggested possible problems.  They would fix it briefly and then it would be down
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Can't beat the location. But not a hangout.
Summary: If you've never been to Disneyland, or haven't been for 10 years, or have been in the last 5 years but stayed in Downtown Disney, then you likely can't quite grok just how close this hotel is to the Disney main gate. The Anaheim Desert Inn is perhaps as close to the main gate as you can get (besides staying at an actual Disneyland hotel in Downtown Disney). Walk out of your room, go 20 yards to the stoplight, cross the street on the green, walk a few football fields with the masses to where you buy tickets, and you are there. And that's what this hotel offers - that's the draw of the Anaheim Desert Inn.  Are you someone who may want to leave Disneyland during the day and come back to a relaxing, plush room for a few hours? Then this hotel likely isn't for you. Mind you, it's
Manager Response: none

Summary: Right across the street from disneyland!! Such a great location, once you walk out of your hotel  you just walk across the street and right into the main entrance of disneyland! The room was clean and had a fridge and microwave in it. Great room for the price!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Closest location to Disneyland for the price!
Summary: We travelled to Disneyland with our 6 year old twins, and this hotel worked great for us! This is truly the closest hotel to the entrance of Disneyland, and we were so grateful for that at the end of the day when we had to walk home from the park! If you are looking for frills, don't stay here. The hotel is clean, and the staff is friendly, but it is a basic 5-story hotel on a slab of concrete across from Disneyland.  The rooms were clean and the beds and pillows were comfortable. The carpets were clean, too. We stayed in the back portion of the property (rooms 234 & 235), which was surrounded by palm trees (a nice California feel), and was very quiet. The front half of the hotel is above the parking lot and the main street, and could be noisy. We had a family suite with
Manager Response: Thank you for the given review about your rescent stay and hope to have you stay with us again in the near future.

Summary: After being suggested  by a co-worker a number of times  finally Booked and was pleasantly surprised ! Being a annual pass holder to the Magic Kingdom and usually  staying at the Fairfield for numerous years finally decided for a change of scenery .... The Location can't be beat...400' from the Gate on Harbor...  This place is a hidden Gem ! Clean Rooms,Viewing Deck for the Fireworks,In door Pool,Game Room, Hopper Passes available at the front Desk for the Newbies....Our Party of Six fit comfortably and confirmed  Our first  stay won't be our Last...... As Far as Suggestions...We were told we couldn't purchase Hopper passes until 7am the next Morning--(we arrived at 11:45pm)   Went to the front desk at  6:50am and then was told they couldn't be purchased until 7:15am ---so we
Manager Response: Thank you for your view, i'm glad that you loved our hotel and services. I apologize for our night person not able to sell you the Disney Tickets, however Disneyland Tickets are sold after 7am and before 10:30pm, this is done as a security measure and i again apoligize if this was an inconvenience to you. A sincere thank you and hope to have you come back to our hotel while you visit the Disneyland Resort.

Summary: Pros:    1.  You really can't get much closer to the park. 2.  From the 5th floor you can see the fireworks from your room (at least we could in ours) 3.  Observation deck on the roof was good for fireworks as well 4.  Between IHOP and Denny's 5.  Rooms were clean 6.  Fridge was handy  BIG Cons:  1.  They claim that they have free internet, but in the entire time we were there it didn't work.  I got multiple answers as to why it was down, but no solid answer as to when it would be fixed.  This was a problem for us as we needed to get some work done in the evenings after our child's bedtime, and couldn't.  I'm completely qualified to troubleshoot and resolve these types of issues (that's what pays the bills here) - this problem could have been diagnosed in 20 minutes, and fixed
Manager Response: I apologize for the inconvenience, however our WiFi has been working as far as i know. We do have a secondary access point in our lobby as well as a computer with printing capabilities. Thank you for your stay and i once again apologize for your experience while at our hotel. If you decide to stay with us in the future, please let me know and i will help you with your reservation.

Summary: Myself, husband and adult son just returned from our trip to Anaheim and this was our first time staying at the Desert Inn and Suites. We have stayed at other hotels along Harbor Blvd and chose this property for the price. When booking the hotel, I wasn't aware of the $8 parking fee but was made aware upon check-in. I checked the hotel's web site to see if it is mentioned but didn't see that information anywhere so just be aware when budgeting your trip. Parking is very limited and most nights upon returning from dinner we were told that there were no more parking spots available and  we had to use the free valet service. We booked the Parlor Suite A. The room looked exactly like the pictures and was clean and spacious. We did have a few problems though. The weather was quite
Manager Response: I am happy to hear that overall you enjoyed your stay, we understand that parking was an issue at the hotel and decided to offer valet parking so everyone will be guaranteed a parking space. Thank you for your review and hope to have you back in the near future.

Summary: We stayed at the Desert Inn and Suites for eight days and had a wonderful vacation.  We found all the staff we dealt with from reservations to maintenance to be helpful and friendly.  The proximity to Disneyland can't be beat!  Our room was newly renovated and more than adequate for our stay.  We liked that the room had a refrigerator and an in room safe.  The breakfast is the same everyday - cereal, bread, danish,  apple, milk, coffee and juice.  The pool is indoor and was always busy.  We would definitely consider staying at this hotel again our next trip to Anaheim.
Manager Response: It is always a pleasure to hear about great experiences like yours, i thank you and hope to have you with us again.

Summary: If you have kids you'll love the location of this hotel after a day in Disneyland. Its really in front of the gate! The room we stayed in was big, clean and recently renovated. Denny's on one side and IHOP on the other - Handy coin operated washing machines/dryers. Breakfast wasn't much - we think that they have so many families with kids, they really have to serv chocolate milk...
Manager Response: We greatly appreciate your review and will keep in mind your suggestion for our breakfast. At the Desert Inn we try to make everyone feel welcome and will always try our best to accomodate your needs. Hope to have you stay with us again in the near future.

Summary: I was quite surprised on arrival at The Desert Inn and Suites, I had stayed here a few years back and found the rooms adequate - nothing special and quite tired. The room we stayed in on this visit in March 2011 was very nice , big, well appointed and recently renovated it was located on the lobby level right at the end of the hotel and had a lovely tropical garden out front of our shuttered window- very relaxing and quiet. The location is the best in the Disneyland area - in front of the main gate and a very short walk to the Park and downtown Disney. There's a Denny's& Ihop right next door as well as a number of other restaurant and fast food options. Parking is no longer free, but at $8 not over the top. I would highly recommend this hotel to couples or families.
Manager Response: It is truly a pleasure to hear that you had a great stay with us and hope that this will be the first of many visits to our hotel and the Disneyland resort. Thank you.

Summary Heading: Good hotel really, really close to Disneyland Resort.
Summary: My wife and I stayed here for three nights at the beginning of March 2011 for a short trip to Disneyland for out tenth wedding anniversary.  We wanted to stay in a good hotel where we could leave our car parked and walk to the resort.  We stayed on the third floor in a standard room with a King-sized bed.  The hotel is directly across the street from the pedestrian entrance to both parks.  It is literally 400 feet from the resort.  If you want to be able to walk to the park, this is a good hotel for you.  The room seemed to have just gone through a recent remodel.  The fabrics were modern, the TV was a flat-screen, the furniture was new, and the bathroom had fresh tile.  The carpets were clean and soft.  The walls were painted in a muted gray/beige color.  The room also included
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and i do apologize for the mishaps encountered at our hotel. This will definetely serve as a training topic for our staff and I encourage you to stay with us again and have a different experience at the Anaheim Desert Inn, feel free to ask for me and  I will personaly make your reservation. Thank you and hope to hear back from you.

Summary: Good budget motel.  clean amenities, good breakfast.  located directly accross the road from Disneyland and within walking distance of some good eating venues.  We had a car and shopping centres and malls were not far away.   The staff were good.   We have no complaints.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about our hotel and i'm glad you had a good stay. Please give us a call and stay with us again so that we can better your experience at the Anaheim Desert Inn.

Summary: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in mid February.  The rooms are a bit on the small side, but they were clean.  The beds are firm, but comfortable.  We had no problem sleeping!  Including taxes, fees and parking, we got out of there for about $80 bucks a night, which is a steal given the location.  It was literally about a 7 minute walk from our hotel to the GATES of Disneyland.  It was fantastic having such a short walk "home" after long days at the park.  If you are looking for frills, you probably won't be happy with this place.  But if you want some simple, clean and comfortable, this place fits the bill!
Manager Response: The staff at the Anaheim Desert Inn would like to thank you for staying with us and welcome you to come back on your next trip to Disneyland. Thank you and hope to see you soon.

Summary: We stayed in a 2 bdrm suite which was clean and comfortable. The location was the best since we just had to walk across the street to Disneyland.This was very convenient since we had a 4yr and 10 yr old who got tired after 8 hrs. at Disney. They were able to go to the hotel with dad while I kept going with my teen. The pool and jacuzzi was okay - strong chlorine smell. Parking was kind of tight. There was open parking on the ground level and underground parking which was a little tricky. Could hear a family next door when they came back late one night but they quieted down soon. Denny's on one side and IHOP on the other and McDonald's about 100 ft away. Handy coin operated washing machines/dryers. Breakfast wasn't much - dry cereal, juices, apples, danishes-brought pancakes in
Manager Response: At the Anaheim Desert Inn, we proud ourselves in having a very good percentage of our guests be return customers. It is for this reason that I personally thank you for stay and hope to have you stay with us in the near future. Please feel free to give me a call and i will personally book your next stay at our Inn, thank you and don't be a stranger.

Summary Heading: Stay here mostly for the location.
Summary: We stay here a lot. The best thing they have going for them is their prices and their location to Disneyland. You can't get too much closer to the entrance of Disneyland. This particular visit we walked into our room and the carpet had been freshly shampooed and a big fan was going. My experience is whenever that happens, it's not good. Apparently someone had been "sick" in there and later that evening we couldn't take the smell and we finally asked to be moved to another room. So they moved us four rooms down. My question is, why did they put us in the room in the first place? We talked to the front desk several times, and I know things happen, but a simple I'm sorry or how can we help you, would have gone a long ways.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and i apologize for your inconvenience, this will definetely serve as a training topic for our staff. I again thank you for your patronage and hope to have you with us again and make things right for you.

Summary: This will be our third time staying at the Desert Inn and Suites.  We really like the family suites since we usually bring the whole family when we travel to Disneyland.  This time there were 8 of us and we easily fit in a single suite and did not feel cramped.  It's nice to have a frig for morning OJ and milk.  We've never used the microwave.  The coffee maker is also a plus but bring your own coffee.  The free coffee is not that great.  When we consider places to stay near Disneyland, the proximity to the entrance is one of the most important for us.  It makes it really quick and easy to take a mid-day nap.  The Desert Inn is one of the closest to the entrance.  No complaints about the beds really.  We all slept well.  The rooms were also quiet.  Not much else is needed.  The
Manager Response: I'm happy to hear that we have met your needs and we all thank you for the given review. Parking is a big deal because of our proximity to the maingate to Disneyland, however our valet parking guarantees you a parking space. Thank you.

Summary Heading: Great location and price, poor service and dated rooms
Summary: The location of this place is as close to Disney as you can get. Lots of restraunts right next door. But the front counter has little if any concern about being friendly or helpful.
Manager Response: We are constantly striving to provide excellent customer satisfaction as well as a unique hotel experience and this will certainly be used as a training tool for all of our staff.  We will shortly provide a customer service training review for our entire staff so your experience will not be experienced by any future guests.I surely hope that you will give us another chance in the near future and experience a deserved pleasant stay.

Summary Heading: For Disneyland and Price, its the best.
Summary: Stayed for two nights while playing at Disneyland. Right across the street and a short walk to the park. Can't beat the location and price.  Its not the best hotel but it serves its purpose. Very kid friendly.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review regarding your recent stay at the Anaheim Desert Inn and encourage you to come back and make us your regular hotel while you visit the Disneyland Resort.

Summary: Six of us (2 Grandparents, Mom & Dad and two children ages 4 & 6) went to Disneyland and area for 10 days and stayed at the Desert Inn. We chose it for three main reasons: (1) location to Disneyland (30 yards from the intersection that takes you across to the main pedestrian entrance allowing you the freedom to come-and-go as you please without the hassle of waiting for shuttle buses), (2) availability of a Parlour Family Suite (2 large rooms with 2 queen beds in each and two full bathrooms and a separate smaller TV room with hide-a-bed sofa) that was perfect for our group size and (3) a very reasonable low season room rate. The hotel looks like it went through a very recent renovation.  The outside areas modern were clean and recently painted. Our rooms were a very pleasant
Manager Response: We are happy to hear that you really enjoyed your stay at out hotel, it only fuels us to continue to do our jobs and  give the same quality of service to other guests. Thank you and hope to have you with us again in the near future.

Summary Heading: It's not the Ritz, but it's clean and across the street from Disneyland.
Summary: Stayed here with my husband for 3 nights while attending the NAMM convention.  The room was clean and everything worked.  It had a fridge and microwave, which was helpful when wanting to save some money on food.  It has an indoor pool, although we didn't get to use it due to lack of time.  It is very convenient to Disneyland and the convention center, and there are many dining options (including the Garden Walk) within walking distance.  The people at the front desk and the parking garage were very friendly and helpful (although people in CA seemed to be very nice everywhere I went.  It could just be that I'm from Philadelphia - not the friendliest city).  It's also one of the quietest hotels I've ever stayed at, even though it was filled with families with small children and
Manager Response: I do appreciate your review and hope that you will make us your preferred hotel while you are in the Disneyland Resort, on behalf of the entire staff of the Anaheim Desert Inn, a sincere thank you.

Summary: This hotel not only has a great location across form the main gate to Disneyland it also has very helpful, friendly staff and is excellent value. It is perhaps due for some renovation but it is very clean and the facilities are good.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: We won't stay anywhere else now!
Summary: We stayed at the Desert Inn for 12 nights from December 20th through to New Years Day. We are from Australia and wanted to experince a Disney Christmas, but without the Disney accommodation price tag.   "We" is myself and my husband, along with both of our mothers. We stayed in the C2 Parlour Suite, and from all of my research, it seems to be the best value room of its kind on Harbor Blvd. After our stay, I can honeslty say that I would not stay anywhere else. On previous trips we have stayed at the Fairfield Inn (which we do really like!) and Howard Johnson. The sheer closeness of the hotel to Disneyland (especially compared to Howard Johnson's!) is the sole reason I would stay here again, and luckily there are many other reasons that support this too.  I am extremely picky
Manager Response: Thank you for your great review and your loyalty. I will gladly assist you on your next trip and help make your stay memorable once again. Thank you and hope to have you with us in the near future.

Summary: You couldn't pick a better location for a visit to Disneyland.  It's right across the street, with plenty of restaurants within walking distance.  Beds were not too comfortable - woke up with a backache both days.   So glad they had a laundry room available.  It was raining both days we were there, so we were able to go back to the motel and throw our clothes in the dryer.  This is the second time I've stayed at this motel and both times, I was disappointed with the continental breakfast.  But at least there's a Denny's right next door, and an IHOP a couple of doors down.  Very good value for the location.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, we will definetely keep in mind your comment about our breakfast for any future upgrades that we might want to do. Thank you and hope to have you back in the near future.

Summary: My family of 6 stayed here after Thanksgiving. We have 4 kids (10, 13, 15, 17) and stayed in the parlor family suite C2.  It has 4 queen beds and a sofa bed.  The good:   Rooms were clean and spacious.  Front desk very friendly. Parking was free (until our last day when the new parking fees were started, but still $8/day wasn't much.) Location is fantastic.  The not so good: Check to make sure the fridge is plugged in before you put anything in it. (our mistake, not theirs) The microwave in our room did not work. When we asked for a replacement, the man who brought a different one seemed put out that we'd asked. He pulled out the table it was on, replaced it and left without testing it....it also did not work.  The third still didn't work correctly but we gave up. We had counted
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for 8 nights in October We had a family suite with two large rooms, two washrooms and 4 queen size beds(basically adjoining rooms with one entry) the rooms were very large, very clean and comfortable and well stocked with lots of towels everyday. The continental breakfast was decent with toast, cereal, danish small selection of fresh fruit, coffe tea juice. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location of this hotel can't be beat it is a few steps from the crosswalk to disneyland entrance. There is a Dennys, IHOP Tony Romas and McD's all just a short walk away. We have stayed at several hotels within walking distance to the parks and this is our new favourite, we will definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Loved this place! Has a good continental breakfast (that doesn't skimp) and that saved us money each morning of our 5 day stay while visiting Disneyland.  The room was spacious and clean. Property nice looking and well taken care of.  Also liked the underground parking.  Only complaint was location of our room, next to a service door that shut LOUDLY throughout the day and night.  But the hotel and services were wonderful.  Looking forward to staying here again.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  We appreciate your comments about your rescent stay at the Anaheim Desert Inn and are glad that our hotel met your expectations. We once again thank you and hope to have you back with us in the near feature.

Summary: Five of my friends and I went for a girl's only trip to Disneyland for five days. This place was perfect for us. It's directly across the street from the Disneyland Resort entrance on Harbour Blvd. We initially chose this hotel because it's amazingly affordable, but it turns out that it is also very clean and the beds are comfortable. The staff was great. Very helpful. We had 2 adjoining rooms w/2 queen beds in each room for about 119.00 a night. They call it the B Family Suite I think.  Housekeeping did a great job too. We did not make use of the free continental breakfast. We bought food at Costco and Trader Joe's and had breakfast in the room. Each room had a microwave and a good size fridge. Especially for the price, I don't know if there's a better chioce on Harbour Blvd.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking your time to write a comment about your stay at the Anaheim Desert Inn, it is a pleasure to know what we are did a good job at making your stay a memorable one. The Anaheim Desert Inn Staff would like to again thank you for your patronage and hopes to see you in the near future.

Summary Heading: great location to Disneyland and is walkable
Summary: This hotel was just across the street from Disneyland. Easy access to the Park. They offer a freee breakfast in the morning which included fresh waffles. The rooms are small but clean and it even has a great pool. Would stay there again.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,   The Anaheim Desert Inn Staff would like to thank you for your review and is always striving at making our guests' stay memorable, we again thank you and hope to have you with us again in the near future.

Summary Heading: Wonderful first stay at the Desert Inn
Summary: We recently returned from a 5 night stay at the Desert Inn and Suites. Having never stayed here before we were not sure what to expect but we were very pleased.  We had the largest type suite available and this worked out perfect for our group. The price was reasonable. This is a motel type property and is by no means the Hyatt but if you want a clean, quiet, comfortable place to stay then this fits the bill. The room was super clean each day when we returned to the room,  though the carpets were a bit worn in places.  Beds were all comfortable (not sure about the sofa bed as it was not slept on) and plenty of pillows were provided. The indoor pool worked well for our fall visit. The continental breakfast was small but more than enough to get us started in the morning with
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking your time to write a comment about your stay at the Anaheim Desert Inn, it is a pleasure to know what we did a good job at making your stay a memorable one, thank you and we hope to see you again in the near future.

Summary Heading: Across from Disneyland, great for BIG families!
